Reviews.Title: “Simply exquisite ! Best turkish bath”
Reviews.Author: adehhn
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel we have every stayed in, not the cheapest as we paid £500 during summer even though it was already a discounted price. We were once again upgraded to a suite room due to being a Hilton diamond member. The breakfast cost usd 100 each.but we didn't pay a penny was we were upgraded. By far, the best breakfast I have ever had, simply sumptuous, they have jams from all over the world. The choice is limitless. The Turkish bath with a cold pool trip is also v nice

Reviews.Title: “Pure Class”
Reviews.Author: Blasterchris
Reviews.Content: World class hotel with loverly rooms awesome beds and first rate food. Many comments about expensive and that is true but some things are worth paying for

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money: choose a more central location!”
Reviews.Author: mc582
Reviews.Content: Sure, the hotel is beautiful and offers all the 5-star amenities, BUT...: - it is out of town: you will need to pay a cab every time you want to go to centre (and, as a foreigner, with a big risk of being ripped off by the driver) - many amenities (e.g. swimming pool, spa) are not free for guests staying in the "standard" deluxe room, which still costs approx. 350 euro.... - internet at 9 euro per hour is a joke - if you are not willing to pay approx 100 euro extra for the city view (which I admit is amazing) you will end up in a room facing a massive cell phone tower (while still paying 350 euro) - food is ok, but nothing to write home about

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place!”
Reviews.Author: Gary G
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very convenient and comfortable and the staff was very polite and professional. The rooms were sparkling clean and the rooms have a private balcony. When you stay at this hotel, you get the usual Hilton quality. Will definitely stay here again and will recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “My dream hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nadola
Reviews.Content: This hotel is and will always be my favorite since childhood. And I recently visited it ,and it has become even better. One of the best is their beds ,like sleeping on clouds.of course this is just a fraction of it's positive sides. Don't miss .

Reviews.Title: “So many plusses; one minus”
Reviews.Author: Janeite
Reviews.Content: It is indeed beautiful and comfortable. The rooms are large for Europe and elegantly furnished. The service is amazing: A doorman saw us onto the shuttle on a rainy day, helped people with their strollers, and handed out umbrellas. It's also expensive, but that's no surprise. Our only reservation was the breakfast buffet. It's huge, but much of it is mediocre. The French toast was hard hunks of baguette. The fried eggs were rubbery and tasteless; the scrambled eggs just tasteless. The best things were the fruit, the bacon, and the baked goods. We did love the HUGE selection of honeys and jams.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RMCharlie
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 night stay at The Cavalieri where we had a wonderful time. We pre - booked a car to pick us up from the airport through the Concierge and it was a perfect way to start the holiday.Our driver was friendly and helpful pointing out restaurants not too far from the hotel and generally giving good advice. Check-in was again a pleasure with lots of information.We had mistakenly booked a 'Smoking' room and when we asked if it was possible to change they moved us with no fuss. Room was beautiful and bathroom fantastic. The Imperial rooms are definitely worth the extra in order to use the lounge.It is simply one of the best we've experienced.Food and drink delicious and regularly refreshed.Staff here and right through the hotel are exceptional, polite and hard working. We also used the shuttle and it is very useful. We had room service for breakfast and an evening meal.Both were delicious and again served beautifully. Only complaint, if it could be even called that, was the meal we had at the downstairs restaurant [L'Uvietto] It was eye wateringly expensive but not really worth it for the food.This is easily remedied by not eating there! All in all a wonderful stay and we would go back tomorrow if we could.

Reviews.Title: “Simply outstanding”
Reviews.Author: SLJ11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Rome Cavalieri for a long weekend. Before we arrived, I was wary that the hotel was not central but the location was really perfect for us! I doubt that a central hotel would have offered half of what the Rome Cavalieri offers. The frequent (free) shuttle bus is great for central locations (it can be popular at certain times). Taxis are always available too. (Vatican City is around 15 minutes away & just over €10 in a taxi, Spanish Steps about 25 minutes in traffic.) When you've done with the sites, Rome Cavalieri is a perfect retreat! All of the staff are exceptional; customer service well beyond the extra mile. Nothing is too much trouble. The hotel is stunning! We had an Alcove suite which was gorgeous. House keeping were totally respectful & there are some lovely touches; menu for pillows, menu for soaps, an appropriate sized bathrobe for our daughter. This is one hotel where you'll never have to request extra towels, pillows etc as there are ample frequently provided. The bed was very comfortable. Our suite allowed access to the Imperial Lounge where food (delicious & lots of choice) & drink are available from 7am to 11pm. The lounge also offers computers (handy for printing your boarding cards for return flights) which are free of charge for the first 15 minutes. We also had free access to the spa/pool. The indoor pool is lovely & warm! Our 9 year old daughter was treated beautifully especially at the 3 star Michelin La Pergola restaurant. (Review to follow!) We pre-booked our table (& limousine airport transfers) before arrival. The only niggle (& it is minor) is the €9 per 24 hour WiFi charge. I would have liked this to be free given the price of the suite but a tiny grumble! My best tips; request a city view room when booking, pre-book La Pergola if you want a fine dining experience & pre-book limousine airport transfers. Finally, watch out for unscrupulous taxi drivers who might try to hike the price of your journey from the centre when you tell them which hotel you want to go to!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Property & Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Steve S
Reviews.Content: This was an amazing hotel, the best Hilton I have ever stayed at and I spend 140 nights a year in hotels. It all starts with a quality check-in experience were you are made to feel special and continues throughout the stay. Every employee we interacted with spoke English and provided the excellent service you expect at a hotel of this caliber. During our 4 days and 3 nights we made use of the restaurants, spa, limo, shuttle ,arranged Vatican tour, and especially the 7th floor lounge. All were top notch; the tour guide they provided us with was very knowledgeable and the lounge was very relaxing after a day of touring. This is not a inexpensive hotel but in terms of value you get what you pay for. Try to get a city view, when you open the balcony and hear the church bells you know you are in Rome. Take advantage of the shuttle, it is reliable and drops you at a good central location. Cabs are always available too and the doorman gives very good instructions to the drivers. Some folks have mentioned the distance from the main tourist areas make this hotel inconvenient but by using the shuttle and a few cab rides we did not share that opinion. All in all it was everything we hoped for in a luxury hotel and more.

Reviews.Title: “Best view of Rome Anywhere”
Reviews.Author: ooonor
Reviews.Content: Look for Hilton's "any weekend anywhere" rates, and get an Imperial room. If it does not come with a view, no worries: the Imperial lounge has the best views of Rome anywhere in city. Our room was 245 Euro, which isn't cheap, but considering what we got, including one of the best breakfast buffets, evening appetizers and free drinks, it was a bargain. I imagine the normal rates are steep. Concierge was particularly helpful, and I wish we'd remembered his name, but definitely pay a visit to his desk, get free maps and good advice on how to walk to the Vatican, catch buses and trains, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel Surpassed our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: VistaSalderson
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rome Cavalieri for 5 nights in April. My only regret is that we did not have the time to take advantage of the amenities at the resort. The pool looked lovely and the class schedule in the spa was flexible with classes that I would have loved to take. Our room was wonderful with a city view and towel warmers in the shower. By American standards the room was large. The buffet breakfast has a fabulous assortment of food, fried eggs, scrambled, tons of pastries, wonderful bread, fresh fruit, and beverages. The staff were helpful, and more that willing to go out of their way to assist us. As Diamond members we have access to the executive lounge. At this hotel it is called, The Imperial Room, and this is a tremendous perk, open all day and serving food and drinks from 7:00 am until 10:30 pm. There is a shuttle bus from the hotel to the city. the one drawback is that you need to be at the shuttle return stop at least a half hour before the shuttle stops in the city to pick you up, because if it is full, you need to wait for an hour or take a taxi. I would recommend this hotel with out any hesitation. My husband and I are in our late 50's and since we are not interested in late night dancing, the location was perfect. If we re ever in Rome we would be glad to stay their again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay....”
Reviews.Author: Sarah6969pink
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my Mum for a long weekend and in general had a wonderful stay. The hotel is just stunning, like a museum in itself. Service was also great. First warning I have has nothing to do with the hotel – but feel I should prepare people visiting, we were conned to get into a private car at the airport. We went into the taxi queue and were led by the ‘supervisor’ with ID into a car, we felt it was more upmarket car than the taxis we were expecting and queried the charge, we were reassured it was the standard charge. However upon arriving at our hotel we realised things were amiss as the taxi refused to pull up directly out front, he then demanded 180 Euros from us, we refused and after arguing left him the standard 50 and walked off. We were quite shaken up by this, so thought I should just warn any travellers. We travel a lot and were surprised we fell for this, but we are used to taxi queue supervisors in the UK. Back to the hotel, we had a lovely twin imperial room – as others have said, lovely large rooms with huge balconies’. We had a city view which was just stunning. Only complaint about the room would be not being able to have access to an iron, having to use an ironing room felt a little more holiday inn than Waldorf!! The room was also very hot, there is not air con out of peak season so we had to sleep with balcony doors open. The beds were so comfy though...I had the best nights sleep! Use of the imperial lounge was great, one of the best lounges I have visited with a great selection of food and drink throughout the day. Only complaint about this would be needing to ask for a key to use the toilet!! Felt like I was at school having to ask for permission!! I would not expect this in such in hotel. Other complaint would be the clear signs stating you could not take drinks and then staff turning a blind eye to people taking full bottles of beer and water out and glasses of wine. When the lounge shut the one evening my mother had a third of a bottle of water left and went to take it out but we were stopped. I understand this is the rule, but it was annoying that it was clearly overlooked for some and then enforced with others, additionally we had been sat in the lounge all night and were taking a half consumed drink of water, rather than others who blatantly came in, selected a number of bottles and left!! We used the shuttle bus which was great. It was not very regular on Sundays though, so something to keep in mind if you visit on a weekend. We also used the pool, unfortunately most of the spa facilitates were shut, but the pool was lovely as were the changing rooms. Overall would love to return, recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rayenj
Reviews.Content: I was really excited to go to this hotel, after reading all of the great reviews. Don’t get me wrong this is a really great hotel, but not the best I stayed in. The taxi ride from Leonardo da Vinci airport to the hotel is about EUR 50,- on the way back we had to pay extra for our luggage……The check in went smoothly. We were travelling with two young children and the got a few crayons and book for colouring, nice gesture. Everyone working in the hotel is very polite. The rooms were nice, I got a 50% discount on the second room for the children. Breakfast is good with a lot of choices. We used the indoor swimming pool almost every day, the water is nice and warm. The outdoor pool was open already (April 2012) , but we didn’t use it as it was too cold outside. Be aware, u have to pay extra if you want to use the pools. We went to the city a couple of times by taxi, the taxi ride was about € 15,- to and from the hotel. Rome is beautiful, but the sites were very busy. All in all good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with amazing views of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Chezzabear
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Cavalieri Hotel for nearly a week for a mixture of pleasure and work. Location of the hotel is amazing with lovely views over Rome. Rooms are very large with your own balcony ( i was lucky with view of the city ) Good bus service into the city so you do not to have worry about large taxi bills.with one of the most varied breakfasts I have experienced (Hotel Arts in Bacelona is stiff competition!) with nice view over the pool. On the conference side the Hotel was very accommodating and dealt very well with over 150 people from our company and our requirements. An expensive hotel but very much worth the extra you pay.. Only downpoint is that they wouldn't let you swim before 9am in the outside pool.... but the massage i treated myself to made up for that!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible views, great service”
Reviews.Author: Mands D
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 5 night break at the Cavalieri. Rome was packed with Easter visitors so it was lovely to be away from it all on the side of the hill with breathtaking views of the city. If you want to be able to walk to the sites this definitely isn't the hotel for you but there is a complimentary hourly shuttle to take you into the heart of the City and a cab ride is 10 minutes and under 10 Euros. We got a good rate on the room and then upgraded to the Imperial floor which gives you access to a beautiful lounge with gorgeous views, serving a variety of light food and drinks (including wine and beer) from 7am to 11pm for 120 Euros a night. That might sound a lot but is DEFINITELY worth it when you see what they charge elsewhere in the hotel! Residents even pay for use of the pool and with juice at 15 Euros a pop the bill could mount up very quickly! By the time you've had a swim and a couple of drinks the Imperial surcharge has paid for itself. We spent many happy hours at various times of day taking in the view and enjoying some excellent wine and food. Breakfast was good but not great. The buffet really needs a station for eggs made to order as the omelettes and scrambled eggs were either tough or soggy and the fried eggs raw or over done. Good choice of other breakfast items though. Generally the service was excellent, particularly in the lounge and the standard of cleanliness and housekeeping was second-to-none. Overall a very good stay which we all thoroughly enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic honeymoon made better by this hotel and its staff”
Reviews.Author: Nath P
Reviews.Content: We decided to visit Rome for our honeymoon and thought we'd stay at the Cavalieri to treat ourselves. Before we even arrived the concierge and duty manager were being incredibly helpful over email to arrange transfers from the airport and even a complimentary bottle of bubbly and chocolates on arrival. We met the duty manager Nicola on arrival and he personally checked us in, gave us a quick tour and took us to our room. He not only treated us in a very professional manner but also like we were people. He was genuinely interested in who we were and what we wanted to see and do in Rome. The room was fantastic and the view over Rome was beautiful. Very spacious and the sound proof door was a great touch. On the first night we were later arriving than expected and as the hotel is a way from Rome itself (Which is made very clear from the website and dealings with the hotel. You can't possibly be under the impression you could stroll into Rome so you can't hold that against them), the hotel happily phoned up the restaurant we were meant to me going to and altered our reservations for us. We ordered from the room service menu instead and although you are paying a premium for the room service you can't fault the service. The food was excellent and the staff incredibly helpful and friendly. Adriano on the concierge desk was so incredibly helpful in recommending restaurants that offered good vegetarian food, he also helped with Colosseum tickets, Vatican entry, maps and directions, good advice for sights to see, etc. He was a star and definitely made the trip easier and more relaxing for us. The imperial lounge was an excellent addition. If you were on the 7th/8th floors you could walk into the lounge, grab a drink and a nibble and sit and chill out. Whilst we were having a beer a few days into our trip, Nicola was walking past. He stopped in and just chatted with us as people. Asked us how we were enjoying Rome and again made us feel like guests not customers. We made good use of the shuttle service and spent our days sightseeing in Rome, catching the last bus back. If you miss it, then you're looking at 20euros for a taxi. Not too bad. Personally the distance the hotel is from the centre is well worth the added peace, quiet and gorgeous views you get from being on the hill. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful -- Improves the Waldorf Astoria brand”
Reviews.Author: SouvenirGal
Reviews.Content: I gave the Rome Cavalieri review this title because we stayed at the NYC Waldorf Astoria two years ago and experienced a property that seemed to be living off its reputation. Our family spent 3 great nights at the Rome Cavalieri last week for our kids' spring break. My husband travels ALOT for work so we made use of his "points" and Diamond status to reserve 2 rooms for 3 nights. Both rooms had 2 beds that are larger than American twin beds but smaller than full-size or queen size. The beds were comfortable, the sheets were lovely, and the pillows worked for all of us. The balconies overlooking the City of Rome were an added bonus. The weather was beautiful and we left the balcony doors open for the fresh air (the A/C was not turned on yet). About the service: The management clearly promotes customer service as we were treated courteously and promptly by staff at the front desk, concierge, housekeeping, and the restaurant. I especially appreciated that we were not treated as "less important" guests because we used points instead of cash for our stay (that is not the case everywhere). The Concierge staff provided helpful suggestions when we decided to change our touring plans over a couple of days. We appreciated the shuttle service the hotel provides its guests. The shuttle ran every 30 minutes and takes you into the heart of Rome (near the seashell fountain -- see photo). You could also get a lift home from the drop-off spot in the late afternoons. A note: All the taxi drivers referred to the Cavalieri as "the Hilton." The Waldorf Astoria brand has not been widely acknowledged yet. I printed out the hotel name, address, and telephone number and gave it to all family members. We handed the taxi drivers the paper and did not worry that our mispronunciation could lead us to an unintended destination. :) The breakfast buffet at L'Uliveto was impressive as seemingly every palate was contemplated: along with many dry cereals were 7 types of milk (cow, goat, soy, almond, rice, & two others), yogurts, smoothies, hot food items, wide variety of in season fruits, breads and danish, cheeses, cured meats, and Japanese breakfast items. I particularly liked the French green beens w/tomatoes - yes, for breakfast! The wait staff were quite busy removing plates and replenishing coffee and fresh orange juice, yet they were all friendly. We had access to the Imperial Club on the 7th floor because of my husband's Hilton status and it was a wonderful spot to drop in for a beverage and snack after walking for miles. For our last night, the kids (teens) wanted pizza but we didn't want to take a taxi back into the heart of the city. The concierge told us of a local restaurant within walking distance of the hotel. He called them and alerted them to our impending arrival and we set off on foot with a map. It was less than 10 minute walk through a neighborhood. The place was empty when we entered, and the staff did not appear to speak any English (and menu is in Italian only). Within 5 minutes, the place was packed with multi-generation families, a few couples, and a group of guys to watch the Milan v. Barcelona match. We were the only tourists. The food was great and the other diners were friendly to us. We spotted a local Gelateria and enjoyed it so much we went back the next day just before heading to the airport. Did I mention their art collection? It seems like all the wall decor has a rich story. It creates an environment that is luxurious yet livable. The view of the city and the luxury and comfort of the hotel more than offset the short "commute" to the many piazzas and fontanas.

Reviews.Title: “Spoil yourself...you deserve it :)”
Reviews.Author: Paul S
Reviews.Content: On site in late Q1 12...service in all key hotel "ops" were 10's. Friendly staff as many spoke 2 or 3 languages. Room-spacious and decorated in a carefully tasteful decorum. Balcony view...memorable and positively affixed in my mind for life! Food...fine options as staff was flexible with the menu. Concierage-creative with their suggestions who really look to go above and beyond to support their clients.

Reviews.Title: “Family's favourite hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gita02
Reviews.Content: We had been looking forward to staying here for months now and when we did, we were not disappointed. Everywhere in this hotel smacks of excellent style and taste. We booked an imperial club room in the upper floor and got upgraded to a room with a spectacular view of the city with the Vatican lit up! During check-in late during our first night, there was a glitch in the Hilton Honors reservations we placed and the front desk person calmly fixed the problem, although we were very tired and hungry while we were waiting for the problem to be fixed. Luckily they had their dining room still open at past 9pm and we managed to grab a tasty dinner before going up to our room. Our room in the Imperial floor was just luxurious. We had Prosecco and chocolates to welcome us, as we were celebrating our wedding anniversary. A fresh bouquet of yellow roses was also in the room! We loved hanging out at the Imperial Club (the executive club) after our days activities in Rome, as we had tea and dainty sandwiches for afternoon snack and then soup and nice breads for light dinner. There is always some food and drink at this executive lounge all day till 11pm. For the four nights we stayed here, we felt like just chilling in this hotel! You could almost say this hotel IS the destination. Our daughter got sick and run a fever on our 3rd night and the concierge was very helpful in advising my husband on where he could get fever reducing medicines nearby. They even offered to pick it up for her. The executive lounge was also nice in allowing us to bring in some of their very delicious pea soup for her from their serving tables. Needless to say, my daughter got well the very next day. She is only nine years old and she fell in love with your hotel, saying the people working there were so nice. And we agree with her 100%. The breakfast buffet downstairs is unbelievable. The waitress was not kidding when she told us on our first night that we should brace ourselves for a 2-hour breakfast buffet as we move from the first room to the second room full of all sorts of food -- fresh breads, such a wide variety of fresh fruits, fruit juices, jellies, cheeses, eggs, Japanese miso soup, rice and fish, smoked salmon, eel, tomatoes, etc. There were tables for vegan and special diet breakfasts as well!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service, not within walking distance”
Reviews.Author: momandkids4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had terrible service. The hotel manager was rude to us because I requested an iron for my Easter dress. When we arrived at the hotel, the restaurant would not service us even though it was empty and tables were available. This hotel is run down and not nice at all. It is also not within walking distance to any sites. The pictures on the web site are misleading. You have to take a taxi or bus, which is very inconveient. Also the front desk would not change large amounts of money into euro only about $100, which is about $57. That will barely cover a taxi to amd from sites. I will never stay here again. The hotel staff made this trip very unpleasant. Please find another hotel so this does not happen to you. By the way, I just came from Paris and the Ritz is the most friendly and pleasant hotel in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Barbara F
Reviews.Content: We visited for a week at the end of March 2012. As my husband is a Hilton Diamond Member we've visited many high-end Hilton properties, but the Rome Cavalieri topped them all. The room was exquisite, with a balcony overlooking the Vatican Dome and the City of Rome. We were treated extremely well. The Imperial Club was a welcome location to visit during day or night, with a wonderful selection of food and beverages. Service throughout the hotel was superb, the concierge staff top-drawer. We asked about opera tickets for the following evening, and the concierge had them picked up for us within hours. The artwork throughout is an added bonus, the pools and spa make it a complete resort vacation. We would not only recommend this hotel, but intend to return as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “A luxurious way to experience Rome”
Reviews.Author: Jill S
Reviews.Content: A good friend of mine had told me that the Cavalieri was one of his favorite hotels in the world, so when I was selecting a hotel for our family's recent trip to Rome I knew that I wanted to stay there. We couldn't have been happier! The hotel is exquisite, the service was wonderful, and the views of Rome unparalleled! This was my 10 year old son's first trip to Europe and I wanted his trip to be memorable. Staying at the Cavalieri exceeded our expectations and contributed substantially to an outstanding trip to Rome! The only problem I have now is that my son thinks that all hotels in Europe are like the Cavalieri (I'm not sure how to break it to him that most hotels are not nearly as luxurious as the Cavalieri). The view from our room was phenomenal: Rome was laid out at our feet! My son loved the Imperial Lounge and delighted in the culinary treats that he could help himself to. The original artwork throughout the hotel is amazing: we downloaded podcasts from the Cavalieri website and enjoyed a self guided tour of the art pieces which was educational and a lot of fun. The pools are amazing, especially the Olympic sized one, and we enjoyed taking a dip after a day of touring. We also enjoyed walking around the expansive grounds--it's really like a wonderful park. Because the hotel is outside the city center and atop a hill, we relied predominantly on taxis to get into town. A few times we took the hotel's shuttle service which was fine, but generally we took taxis so that we weren't tied to the shuttle schedule. One really nice thing was that while we were there the Cavalieri participated in Earth Hour. On March 31st, from 8:30 - 9:30 p.m. the hotel turned off all non-essential lights and equipment. It was nice to know that they participated in this world-wide environmental event. The hotel spa was voted the best in all of Europe in 2011, and I enjoyed a wonderful massage there. Not only was the spa treatment itself lovely, the spa facilities are absolutely gorgeous! I can't recommend the Cavalieri highly enough. When we return to Rome I hope we'll be able to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A nice getaway after a long walking tour day in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Bala B
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on the hill, away from the city but it provides the guests with transportation few times a day. It is nice to get away after a long walking day, and spend quiet evenings on the territory of the hotel. The view from the hotel is stunning, you can locate the borders of Vatican city and other monuments of Rome. If you chose to stay in the city for a late night dinner, you will have to opt out for a cab, that are not too expensive. (10euros max) The interior of the hotel is what you expect one of the most luxurious hotels in Rome to be, goldish furniture, shiny wood surfaces, soft lagre beds, Roman baroque. However, we had to ask to change our first room because it smelled like cigarettes, and it had some garbage left by the housekeeping in the table drawers. We loved the pool! It is huge and deep at places!!! So, you could dive in and play around without bothering others! It is certainly a very nice hotel to stay at while in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “fantastico”
Reviews.Author: chety
Reviews.Content: after much hinting off my husband we decided to treat ourselves to a short break in rome and as he is a hilton honors member we opted for the rome cavalieri. Unlike myself my husband had not looked at the hotels website and it was good to watch his face on entering the lobby of the hotel; the wonderful art and view over the city was amazing. The receiptionist was very friendly and told us as diamond members we were entitiled to use the imperial club which offered a everchanging selection of food and drinks at no charge. We were also given a city view room which was fantastic; we could see the whole of rome. The room was lovely and had a very comfortable bed...much appreciated after busy days walking miles to see everything rome had to offer. The breakfast offered so much choice with bacon and eggs to strawberry cake and everything inbetween! And the selection of preserves WOW. All the staff we met were friendly and all seemed happy; and who wouldnt to be working in such an amazing place. Would we go back? Tomorrow!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Timothy N
Reviews.Content: If you do not have a superb time at this hotel then it is your own fault. Service was first rate. And the food was phenominal. The Imperial Lounge is the best lounge I have ever experienced. We highly recommend Rome Cavalieri and would definitely return if in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A special hotel - for special occasions”
Reviews.Author: Sean0001
Reviews.Content: Decided to celebrate a 'special birthday' in Rome, and stayed at the Cavalieri for 3 nights. From the VIP welcome, we were assured of a quality stay. Although it has a modern 'concrete fascade from the outside (its modern 60s exterior belies what awaits you as you enter the hotel. I can echo the comments of other reviewers - the place is like a museum, with some very fine works of art, sculptures adoring the walls and floors. We had the opportunity of an upgrade to a corner suite, located on the 5th floor, which was the size of small apartment - one of the nicest rooms we have had . Excellent views across Rome, with the Vatican and the dome of St Peters, to the Vittorio Emmanule in the distance. We also had the opportunity of taking dinner in the infamous Michelin starred restaurant 'a top' of the hotel called La Pergola. We had a truly memorable dinner there which culminated an excellent few days in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: johnk317
Reviews.Content: Sitting on the hills surrounding Rome, not too far from the Vatican, is the Rome Cavalieri Hotel. The hotel lobby and public areas looks like a museum and bueatiful paintings and sculptures scattered all over the hotel. The views from one side of the hotel are spectacular. The rooms are fantastic by European standards both in terms of size and amenities. The bathrooms are large and spacious except what is it with Europeans and the half shower doors? There is a free suttle that takes you to the center of Rome which is a nice touch. The Concierge was very knowledgeable and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “''GG''”
Reviews.Author: Gerassimos G
Reviews.Content: Fantasticproperty! All the team members of the hotel are very friendly and treat every guest with proffessionalism but also with a lot of friendliness.Very nice food in the executive lounge and really really nice food & service from Room service! Keep up the good work

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: The Traveling Commander
Reviews.Content: Fantastic place, with unmatched views of Rome from your balcony. Shop around for a good deal. Total luxury...with a price. The only downside is the location. Not good if you want to be near the city center. It was 15 to 20 euro taxi ride to/from the city.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, Great Dining and Location”
Reviews.Author: LadyGaladriel17
Reviews.Content: Although other hotels in this vicinity seem to rate higher in terms of location, but do not be fooled. The Cavalieri offers a great location to access Rome's historic sights and it also offers a stunning view of the city. The hotel itself and the rooms are luxuriant, gorgeous, extremely comfortable, clean, and an absolute delight to stay in. We spent most of our 3-day stay there touring Rome, but we had wonderful mornings, evenings and nights' rest there. The beds are offer exceptional comfort. if you want to dine at La Pergola, you had better book it months in advance. We were unable to book that far ahead. Nonetheless, the meals we ate there were second to none. There was in particular a pasta dish with a creamed lobster sauce I ate there at one of the tables outdoors overlooking the pool, that I will never forget as long as I live. It was definitely the best pasta and cream sauce I have ever had the pleasure of enjoying in my life. A similar dish at one of the finest restaurants in Venice that I ordered did not approach it in exquisiteness. The wines that were recommended were very fine choices. The staff are very courteous and professional as well. This means that our entire stay there was seamless from the moment you of arrival to the moment of departure. We had a wonderful, memorable and romantic stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Rome Cavalieri Waldorf Astoria”
Reviews.Author: FreddyVB
Reviews.Content: Being a very frequent traveler and staying in upscale hotels always, this hotel was the best I have ever had untill now. The rooms were simply fantastic as was the service. Everybody was extremely friendly and helpfull. We had dinner at the Pergola, a 3-star Michelin restaurant on the topfloor and it was absolutely super. I can highly recommend this hotel to everyone visiting Rome

Reviews.Title: “They milk you too much!”
Reviews.Author: BusinessBay
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is wonderful and the service great. The only problem with this hotel is they milk you way too much. A classic room is already expensive and yet with it you cannot use the swimming pool and gym of the hotel without paying an extra 18 euros! In addition, if you stay in an Imperial room, the room sizes are exactly the same! All it includes extra is access to the Imperial lounge which doesn't offer more than canapes and light drinks. In the Imperial room or suites you are still charged exorbitant rates for the internet and you are finally allowed to use the hotel pool and gym! This is ridiculous for a 5-star hotel. The pool and gym should be clearly stated to be free for ALL guests, especially when the rooms are so expensive despite this hotel being so out of town!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Guy T
Reviews.Content: amazing hotel. very luxuries.! i proposed to my girlfriend in this hotel on the balcony of my room it was very romantic and made the moment extra special... the staff was great! very polite and helpful. prior to my trip i talked with the concierge and told him my intentions and he help me with all of my questions and even sent me a complementary champagne to the room :) overall the hotel is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Beyond your wildest dreams”
Reviews.Author: Lacuacera
Reviews.Content: Rome Cavalieri is the best Waldorf Astoria I've ever visited. The location gives a certain mystery and excitement to any guest who would stay here for the first time, as it is not located near the city center. A 'hidden gem in the forest" type. The shuttle bus is very helpful to connect again to the city. The driver was very helpful and smiling. The hotel is a museum in itself with many artworks hanging on the walls, however it was a splendid experience, I felt excused to walk around with my mouth and eyes wide open. The gems within a gem in the hidden forest are the staff working there. Everybody was corteous. Nothing was a bother at all. Receptionists and housekeeping team were willing to help and solve our problems. We stayed at the Imperial Floor with the help of the receptionist who found an available room. Breakfast was a delighful exprerience with so many selections and helpful waiters. I super love the hot chocolate drink when it became so creamy. So I suggest you try the breakfast at a later time of the morning. The bed was so soft that the minute you lay down you can sleep quickly. Mabled bathrooms fit only for kings and queens and celebs! I stayed with my brother last June 2010 and we are coming back on July this year. As we were excitded to see the history of Rome last time, we were out of the hotel the whole day.

Reviews.Title: “Business and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: lenaDubai
Reviews.Content: Most rooms have lovely views, this enormous hotel is out of town which made it perfect for business and although id prefer to be more central for a holiday,it can work as there is a shuttle bus. The spa is great and not at all costly considering the location. The decor is a bit ornate with many statues and gilded furniture, not for the modern decor lover

Reviews.Title: “Hill Top Splendor”
Reviews.Author: Noneofyourbiz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little out of the way, but its views and rooms are spectacular. In addition, the hotel offers a free shuttle service that runs on the hour to take hotel guests to Piazza Barberini (near Spanish Steps & Trevi Fountain). This is an excellent value. Additionally, I think this hotel has the BEST executive lounge area/service that I've ever experienced. The lounge has intimate open terraces (seating for 3 to 4) throughout the lounge which overlooks Rome & the Vatican City. It runs a full service (food & bar) all day. The breakfast accommodates the dietary needs of most cultures. The gym and pool are amazing and not to be missed. There's enough equipment to accommodate more than the usual 5 patrons at a time. Comes with steam rooms and turkish bath. The pool is a full size lap pool. The hotel was aware that it was my husband's birthday and sent up a bottle of complientary Prosecco (nice touch). Beware: Hotel has a Hertz location, but we were not told that they close at 1 pm. As a result, we had to leave the key with the hotel, and are hoping for the best.

Reviews.Title: “First Trip to Roma”
Reviews.Author: Lancer52LV
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Rome Cavalieri. Although the hotel was not located in the center of Rome, we enjoyed our daily walk into and from the city to walk off the extraordinary breakfast from L'uliveto Restaurant. The hotel, room and staff were all top-notch and made the stay very pleasant indeed. The hotel has an impressive art collection that is worth touring. If you do not wish to walk into the city, there is a free shuttle service and taxis are always available. I highly recommend this hotel and plan on staying there the next time we travel to Rome. Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Perhaps the best hotel I've stayed at”
Reviews.Author: SavannahLady2010
Reviews.Content: I travel like a crazy person - easily 200 days per year. I spent 3 nights at the Rome Cavalieri hotel and it is probably the nicest place I have ever rested my weary bones. The views are breath-taking from the balcony. The restaurant is wonderful, and oh, my the spa. Now, don't get a pedicure - not the greatest for the money, but if you like spa treatments, facials, wraps, you should indulge yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: pennywestofscotland
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in Rome before, in the city centre, this was a treasure to find and we will be back. The purpose of this stay was for the international rugby at Stadio Olimpico which is a very short taxi ride away. Rooms are spacious and beautiful. Beds huge and so comfortable. Views spectacular. A courtesy bus goes to the city and back hourly. Fantastic pool area. We only stayed 2 nights but will definitely return to this location as an oasis away from the moise and busy streets in the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MerilynNg
Reviews.Content: Good spread of breakfast , nice room and quiet location

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Skynet13
Reviews.Content: Service was exceptional from the moment we arrived, though we did get there too early to check in. We wandered around the hotel while we waited, exploring their magnificent art collection and took a stroll through the grounds, which were full of interesting trees - some growing olives! We stayed on the Excecutive levels, and the room was by far the nicest I have ever been lucky enough to stay in. Our view wasn't on the Vatican side, but it was still quite pretty and even though we could see the notorious radio tower it wasn't at all as bad as some make it out to be. Who spends enough time in their room in Rome to worry about the view anyway?! The bed and bathroom were exceptional and the Executive Lounge was well worth it just to keep from starting out the day with a rumbling stomach. We went in every morning for a very small snack and drink. Location is away from the city center, but we took the hotel shuttle every day and it was extremely convenient! It ran quite often enough for us! If we ever stayed in the city past the last shuttle we just took a taxi back to the hotel and it was not very pricey at all. Also, before traveling to Italy, we had tickets for a Lazio game mailed to the hotel and the envelope was waiting for us at Concierge when we arrived - awesome service.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous views, wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NewEnglandRedRider
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hilton Cavalieri last month with our two daughters ages 10 and 12. Our rooms were comfortable and stylish, and afforded the most amazing views of Rome. We worried about the location being too far outside of the city center, but the views and extra space were worth it for us. The food at the imperial lounge far exceeded are expectations, and we loved the breakfast buffet as well. We used many of the amenities found throughout this hotel (pool, gym, spa, breakfast, shuttle, concierge, etc) and we had positive experiences all around. The staff was very courteous and went out of their way to accomodate us at every turn. Our girls loved the pillow menu, and turn down chocolates! The only negative experience we had during our stay was that our daughter burned her hand on one of the reading lights next to the bed. She barely touched the outside rim of the lamp and ended up with a good sized blister (it looked like she had touched a hot stove). The reading lights in both rooms looked like they were supposed to be adjustable, but were way too hot to touch. The front desk apologized immediately and sent up some burn cream. Not really a big deal, but something to keep in mind if you plan on traveling with children (or want to read in bed).

Reviews.Title: “Diamond Status meant nothing at this Hilton 5 Star Hotel .”
Reviews.Author: TRWGlobal
Reviews.Content: except free internet. Let me start out by saying that I am just a hard working guy from Florida that travels 200 days a year and normally would not stay at a 5 Star hotel that is $550.00 per night or more and I have only complained once during my entire time as Diamond status over 5 years. After 5 years of saving, a business associate and I used points that are from spending $214,000.00 on Amxp so our expectations were very high. The Cavalieri Hotel is very beautiful but very disappointing for us and definitely not worth the 81k points per night or equivalent of $550.00 per night, I researched on the internet (trip Advisor) and I reserved with a live Hilton reservationist the very best deluxe room, on the Imperial floor with the obvious recommended choice “A deluxe room with Rome View” but got the front of the hotel “i.e. The Garden View” (see photos) because they do not show many accurate pictures of that side on their web site. This Garden View is on a main road looking at the largest communication tower I have ever seen and the hotel entrance is noisy all night long. After 10 minutes in the room I complained about the a/c not working and I was told sorry with a laugh that “Sir it is in season only”. I have lived in Florida for 30 years and use air conditioning every day, spoiled I guess. Unlike what the amenities posted on the web site which says “air conditioning, climate control”. The room was consistently warm. The management told me to leave the sliding door open and climate control was a cheap noisy Wal-Mart type fan. Unfortunately either way we got limited sleep. If we had a Rome view you could open sliding door without the noise but I never got that chance. Rome was unseasonably warm and beautiful to visit the Vatican, we even were lucky to be part of the crowd the Pope gave a blessing to in Vatican Square on Sunday. As a loyal Hilton Diamond member I made it clear to several employees at check in and the follow up call that I was not happy about not getting the room I reserved and it was hard for me to believe that I had no chance of an upgrade. I asked them to please let his manager know I was not satisfied, I never heard from anybody but they said at the desk that the hotel is sold out but every other employee I asked said 50-60% occupancy, I guess it is possible that all but 5% were looking at Rome 24/7 because they were not in the lounge, the pool or the lobby. The hotel was almost empty the entire 4 days and not sold out according all staff asked except front desk, I guess they could all have been wrong. My belief is that because we used the points and were not paying in Euro they denied an upgrade of any type. I am sure the Management will say that this is not so but I have stayed in many sold out hotels and this was empty. I want to compliment all the service staff they were excellent, but the front desk and management failed to even try to make this Diamond member happy on probably what will be once in a lifetime trip to Rome. If you do stay here confirm in writing a “A deluxe room with Rome View” or you will be very disappointed. I would look closer to the city we saw some magnificent hotels, The Majestic, St. Regis (see Trip Advisor) and stay away from The Cavalieri. I also would save your Hilton points for a Hotel that respects them and I will send same letter to Hilton Honors for a response. I think Trip Advisor was spot on and always use them; this was a Hilton Honors issue Good luck, TRW

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: asia5100
Reviews.Content: Great. Hotel, Very stylish. We had a room with the view of Rome and Vatican. The room and bathroom was good size, very clean. We had a room service, 5stars, great food, service excellent. Spa facilities very good, very clean. Nice area to have a glass of wine or coffee outside. All the staff was great, from concierge, front desk, barman, breakfast staff. Breakfast was excellent, great variety, good service. We had an amazing stay. God shuttle service to centre.

Reviews.Title: “Amazin experience”
Reviews.Author: dhilswat
Reviews.Content: very good hotel.. with such friendly staff and d view frm our room ws breathtaking.... i luvd the quality f breakfast served....

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! It was heart breaking to leave”
Reviews.Author: kpetee
Reviews.Content: We arrived a few hours before check in but with a couple phone calls they found a room that was ready for us. The front desk service was outstanding! My husband is a HHonors Diamond member so they gave us access to the Imerial lounge. Which was incredible. It was so nice to grab a quick drink and snack when we got back to the hotel after a long day in the city. The room: Amazing! It was clean, very large, and the amenities were very nice. The best part of the room was the view! Every morning the first thing I'd do is go take a picture of the city, and another one at sun set. Get a room with a view (we were in room 657- odd numbers have a city view). Other reviewers complained about noise, but we didn't have any problems. We could hear our upstairs neighbors every once in a while (especially out on the balcony) but nothing ever really bothered us. We even quit using the sound proof door on the second night. The shuttle: what a great service! Always on time (the 8:30am shuttle takes longer because of traffice, so we started to go on the 9:30 one). We stayed the first night at the Rome Hilton Airport and took their free shuttle to the city, walked about 20 mins to the Cavalieri's shuttle bus. Thanks to other reviewers we looked for the "The Big Shell" on the corner. It was very easy to find and the shuttle bus picks up just steps from the shell fountain (there were always a few cars or scooters parked right there). Make sure you plan around the lunch break... You have to catch it at 1 or not again until 4. Breakfast: Incredible. If you can't find something you like you're in trouble. The fresh fruit, muffins, and fresh bread with all sorts of fun jam flavors were my favorites. Pool: As other reviewers have mentioned it is a clean pool. You have to shower before getting in and wear a swim cap. It's a beautiful pool, but it wasnt quite warm enough for my liking, so we only went once. Getting around: The only money we spent on transportation was our taxi ride to the airport. We did everything with the hotel shuttle and walked EVERYWHERE! I'd fully planned on using the metro, but we had so much fun walking through the small back streets there was no need for the metro or taxis. This is the most amazing hotel, incredible staff, and the BEST view in all of Rome! I dream of the day I get to return!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in the eternal city”
Reviews.Author: HeavyTravel
Reviews.Content: Visited this fantastic hotel with my parents and family for the first time in 2004. Since then my parents have wanted to go back to see if it would be as good as the first time. I have been back in the Cavalieri every year between 2004 and 2011, and consider my self a regular guest. I usually stay at the Imperial Floor, because of the excellent quiet lounge with very nice staff. This time we stayed in a suite, and my parents loved everything from the extremely comfortable bed in the bedroom to the elegant marble bathroom. We had more than enough space for 3 persons, I had an extra bed in the living room. But I would prefer a higher floor than 3rd to have a better view from the balconies. The art galleries in the hotel are really impressive and we spent hours admiring the lovely paintings and other pieces. We enjoyed the huge breakfast buffet in l’Ulvieto Restaurant and some tasty bites in the Imperial Lounge. For dinner we went to the local restaurant “da Luiciano” in the neighbourhood. The owner and his family provides good Italian food and wine, and the 10 minutes walk to the restaurant and back gives some fresh air before a night cup in the Imperial lounge by the end of the day. All members of staff are really nice and provide the best service. The first night we asked the duty manager for help, because my parents prefer the duvet cover “German style” which means two separate covers in the king bed. Everything was sorted out to our greatest satisfaction and Mr. Khaled was very accommodating and showed the greatest hospitality. Overall the hotel services and facilities exceeded our expectations, and my parents hope they will be able to return to Cavalieri and Rome one more time. I myself will go back with some friends soon, the best hotel in the eternal city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico”
Reviews.Author: Michelle L
Reviews.Content: Another fantastic stay at the Cavalieri. We have stayed many times now everything is wonderful from the surroundings,to the staff ,to the rooms, to the food ,especially in La Pergola on the 9th floor, the service , the pools and spa and much much more. To stay in this hotel is sheer luxury it should be on everybody's bucket list !

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, Poor Location, Average Service, Average Rooms”
Reviews.Author: halleybopp
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because my travel companion is very loyal to the Waldorf brand. While I had no major problems (aside from the shower being broken which was fixed on the 3rd day of our stay) I also have nothing special to say about this hotel. If you want a nice quiet hotel that's a fifteen minute taxi to the city, charges 9 euro for a bottled water, and gives you average, slow service, than go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel staff supportive after bad experience with pickpockets”
Reviews.Author: AlunWatkins
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at around 13:30 after I had my wallet stolen on the crowded Rome Metro. Fortunately we had just enough change to pay for the taxi to the hotel – around 13 Euros and were warmly welcomed by the reception staff (Aurelio, Francesca and Lora) who were wonderful in helping to block my credit cards and providing the use of a phone to order new cards. American Express arranged for a new card to be printed and replacement cash to be available for collection at their office in Piazza Di Spania. While I dealt with the theft Aurelio checked my wife in and after a coffee and snack in the Imperial Club Aurelio escorted us as translator to the local Police station where a pleasant police officer took down the details of the theft and provided the necessary insurance form. This behind us we looked forward to 4 days in Rome. We had a room on the 4th floor with a beautiful view of the hotel pools and Rome where you could make out in the distance the Coliseum, the Pantheon and St Peters Basilica etc. This must be one of the world’s best hotel views. The bathroom is luxuriously appointed if not large and has nice Salvatore Ferragamo toiletries. As a Hhonors Diamond member and booked via American Express Fine Hotels and Resort Program we had free access to the Imperial Club and the Spa, free breakfast for two, free wifi, 4pm late check-out, and 85 Euros food and beverage credit (the hotel said this has now changed to a Spa credit but as American Express said it was food and beverage the hotel obligingly accepted this). The hotel is beautiful and lives up to the photo’s on the website. It is immaculately presented and cleanliness and hygiene are obvious. The indoor pool is warm and hygiene is strictly while pleasantly enforced. The sauna, steam room and Jacuzzi are great after a day of sightseeing. The hotel bus takes about 20 minutes to get to Piazza Barberini which is quite close to the Spanish Steps and the Trevi fountain. In fact the sights of Rome are all easily walkable. We could choose to take breakfast in the Imperial Club or the L'Uliveto restaurant. Although we could get everything we wanted in the Imperial club we chose to eat breakfast in the restaurant which had a tremendous range of high quality and extremely tasty food although no live cooking station. The Imperial Club is the best executive lounge we have visited with complimentary light lunches, afternoon tea, evening snacks and a wide selection of alcoholic and non alcoholic drinks. While we could easily have managed to eat only at the Imperial Club we forced ourselves to take dinner at L'Uliveto restaurant. Luckily we chose to take only one course as the steaks were huge and while we waited we were served bread and olive oil and a chef’s taster followed by a selection of mini deserts. The staff throughout the hotel are excellent – friendly and efficient and they added greatly to a fantastic city break. We checked out in the Imperial Lounge at 4pm and after a last cappuccino we took a 46 Euro taxi ride to Rome Fiumicino airport.

Reviews.Title: “A nice end to a holiday... but very American”
Reviews.Author: GreyKeys
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for my last night before flying back to Australia. I was greeted by very friendly staff you organised a room for me early as I had had a terrible time flying in from Catania and was exhausted! The room was beautiful and I had a phenomenal view of Rome from the western hills where the hotel sits. It was a crisp winter day and I could see right to the eastern mountains. Idyllic! The breakfast spread the next morning, too, was beyond compare, one of the best Hilton breakfast's I've ever had. My only quibble with the hotel is the, perhaps, assumption that I was American. I am Australian. A large aspect of the hotel seems to be to present things in an American style not an Italian one. After arriving I ordered a vegetable focaccia, what arrived was more akin to a McDonald's hamburger, complete with fries and Heinz sauce! I was quite offended, it was not a focaccia at all, and to be honest the fries would have been better at a McDonalds... The next morning when I ordered a coffee with breakfast the assumption was I wanted an American latte, no! I had just spent 3 weeks ordering coffee and getting exactly what I wanted, short black ristretti. Not this American milky stuff! I understand it is an American chain of hotels, but I wonder if I would have received the same things if I was Italian. Come for the view but skip the room service

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but very out of the way to the downtown”
Reviews.Author: grazipat
Reviews.Content: S;pent four nights here for a business conference--I do not think I would choose this hotel if I was visiting Rome on my own--however, an argument could be made that if you are visiting in the summer heat having a pool is a very nice indulgence and maybe worth a day or two visit. It is set high on a hill above Rome in a very nice neighborhood but it is at least a fifteen to twenty minute drive into downtown. There are no convenient metro stops either. I found the service to be overwhelmed by our large conference group, the food mediocre though we did not eat in the Le Pergola restaurant which is supposedly the best in Rome. The views from the top were beautiful though--outside of Le Pergola--all of Rome laid out before you. Our room was facing the front of the hotel where there was no view--I do know that the rooms at the back over the 3rd floor had inspiring views. As far as cleanliness--the carpet in our room had stains and that bothered me. The beds were comfortable though the sheets were linen and very scratchy--while I am sure they were high quality--they were not condusive to sleep. The toilet had very little flushing power and it was annoying too. All the common areas were beautiful, the grounds lovely, the clay tennis courts immaculate. Would I stay here again--no--I like Rome too much to not be able to amble out of my room for a fifteen minute stroll to be in the middle of everything!

Reviews.Title: “Rome with a view”
Reviews.Author: sap0602
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights on Hilton points in October 2011 and booked a Rome view, which I highly recommend. My husband is a HIlton diamond, and we received private check-in, an upgraded room, free wi-fi, and access to the pools and spa. These would've cost extra per day if not complimentary, but I found the cost to be no different than other hotels of its caliber. I would recommend winding down in the sauna and Turkish baths after a day of walking around the city. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The breakfast each morning was expansive and we were able to eat on the patio by the outside pool. Taxis were readily available, but their prices varied. The most expensive taxi we caught was when we had to go the least distance - from the Vatican up the hill to the hotel (around $20). Otherwise, it ranged from $7 - $15. The shuttle into the city was helpful in alleviating costs and dropped off a short walk from the top of the Spanish steps. The only con is the location, but we knew that it was outside the city center by doing research ahead of time and this didn't bother us. However, there aren't many restaurants around the hotel so you will need to either eat at the hotel, which can be pricey, or take a taxi down the hill if you are looking for a larger selection. There are a couple restaurants about a 10 minute walk from the hotel that the concierge recommended. We tried one out and I had some excellent bucatini all'amatriciana.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Rowdy27
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for several nights with my daughter and we were both mightily impressed. The views from our room over the city at night were stunning. The breakfast buffet each morning was spectacular. The quality of the staff was excellent. Some helpful tips: 1. There is a Hertz car rental return location across the street - hidden away in a garage under a building. 2. There are several nice restaurants a few minutes; walk down the road. 3. Do not get into a taxi unless you can see the meter and registration on the exterior of the car.

Reviews.Title: “Made our trip”
Reviews.Author: Truthtel
Reviews.Content: They would do anything to make you happy. Yes food and hotel pricy well worth it. Treated very well so respectful just a amazing hotel do stay. Location was a bit of a pain but they have a shuttle. I promise you won't regret your stay

Reviews.Title: “Away from the center - Amazing service”
Reviews.Author: Sablatzky A
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I have stayed in Italy. A bit expensive, but it worth. Many travelers will agree that in some places it is better to pay more and get much more. Rooms – luxury,spacious and comfort with a great view of the city. Location – Hotel is not centrally located, but shuttle facilities are available – on time. Staff - Just as incredible as the city itself. Since my arrival, the bellboys and concierges was completely polite. Younger guys are eager to please the guest, with an international flair that is lacking in many european hotels. Restaurants – I only took the breakfast. International, magnificent, and very assorted cuisine. Spa - The spa facilities are approaching to the hotel category. Lluxurious treatments and exceptional service. AAA+

Reviews.Title: “Nice get-away just outside central Rome”
Reviews.Author: Peripatetic12
Reviews.Content: I had a beautiful and spacious suite overlooking Rome. The suite was nicely appointed and very comfortable. The concierge floor had superb hospitality throughout the day and into the evening. I also enjoyed the antiques and paintings which were all the property of the original owners of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wow hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chang R
Reviews.Content: What a excellent and beautiful property are from room to rest room,,,any places in property. I took more than 200 pictures !! but average for service, location,

Reviews.Title: “The staff went out of there way to make us feel at home.”
Reviews.Author: Lisakoellner
Reviews.Content: This was a little slice of heaven for us. We stayed for 3 nights and upgraded to the Imperial Room. It was well worth it. We started everyday with cappuccino's and hot chocolate for the kids. There was always something fresh to eat in the lounge. We used the pool everyday. We felt like royalty. The staff was incredibly kind and made us feel right at home. We hope to return!

Reviews.Title: “marvelous hotel & great location”
Reviews.Author: aramfx
Reviews.Content: The rooms are a good size, the bathrooms are wonderful and over-sized. Food was really delicious. Hotel is situated on a hill from which is an amazing view of Rome. The staff is all very polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maz1503
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel around the middle of February with my partner, my sister and brother in law. This hotel is truly amaizing and from the moment I stepped through the door I was lost for words. The artwork and decor is exactly just breathtaking. The rooms over looking the city are fantastic and be during the day or at night, these views will not disappoint. The staff within the hotel were extremely helpful and polite and were there to assist with any queries ot questions that you had. On two mornings at breakfast one of the head waiters presented my sister and I with the most wonderful waffles that I think that I have ever tasted. This was due to us asking for pancakes on one of the mornings. The gardens surrounding this hotel are a must and I am quite sure that during the summer months that the evenings in these gardens will be an experience. There are little paths and secluded areas that will be so tranquil and relaxed. This hotel is out of the city by around 25 minutes, however, there is a free shuttle bus that is provided. Even the distance would not deter me from staying here again. It truly was the most luxurious hotel I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Service, great view.”
Reviews.Author: Elk555
Reviews.Content: Great service. Awesome view. Turkish spa is fantastic. If you want dinner on the top floor of hotel overlooking Rome, you need to reserve at least a few weeks in advance(did not know that at the time!). Cant go wrong. its so close to everything, they have a shuttle to downtown a few times a day.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: AlexTheMen
Reviews.Content: We stayed using points and were expecting to have some problems due to other reviews we read about everything costing extra. Maybe because we were on the lookout, we were actually pleasantly surprised. Our stay is not over yet but I can't imagine anything going wrong. Loved the rooms which are big. It is in a lovely, if somewhat remote, area, which we knew about and was ok with us. Care to details. Recommend as first class experience!

Reviews.Title: “Defines what 5 Stars really means. The Prefect Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TomL_Philadelphia
Reviews.Content: OK, the one negative (maybe) a cab ride to most places in Rome is expensive. Considering the price of a room here, I doubt most guests think twice about it. Otherwise, perfect. Maybe the best hotel staff I have ever experienced. The Concierge (all of them, no one person in particular) were the best. It was a real pleasure to tip them when I left. We were there in the biggest snow storm Rome has had in about 50 years. I can't think of any place better to be stranded. We got to stay here using the Hilton Honors Half points plan to make it affordable. Worth every point and dollar. Hard to believe at these prices I can call it a real value, but it was. The Spa is terrific. You could stay a week or more here and never be ready to move on. We would love to return someday. This Hotel was the highlight of our trip to Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone STILL calls it the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: ROBRTW
Reviews.Content: The reviews of the Cavalieri Roma on Trip Adviser seem to me to be completely accurate, both good and bad. The staff is wonderful - from the Doormen in Uniform through to Reception, banqueting, and even housekeeping. High on a hill overlooking St. Peter's and the rest of Rome, it's worth the splurge on a view room. The concierge level offers value if you're hanging out at the hotel and can take advantage of the extensive food and beverage offerings, but they make sure it's never quite enough for a full meal. Sure, the hotel is a removed from the center of the city, and you can spend quite a bit on taxis if you miss the free coach service to and from Barberini and Via Veneto. The tradeoff is a spectacular view - which you won't really get to enjoy if you don't get one of the view rooms. The restaurants are expensive (near the pool and downstairs, with $30 hamburgers) and ungodly expensive (Le Pergola, upstairs - figure $200 per person, and you'll be lucky to get in!) I doubt anyone at any income level would consider either restaurant to be a "value." The pool and spa are only complimentary for high level Hilton Honors frequent stay guests - if I read correctly, a poolsied lounge chair in-season must be reserved a significant cost. But then, you don't come to a five-star hotel in Rome looking for value, do you? Come to the Cavalieri. It's still a wonderful place, even 25 years after my first visit. But bring your Amex!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel away from the hustle and bustle of the city”
Reviews.Author: Nora S
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. My husband surprised me with a trip to Rome and we chose the Waldorf Astoria to stay at. The foyer is gorgeous and it is filled with artwork. The receptionist and bell boy was extremely polite despite the fact that we arrived after 10pm. The management knew that it was my birthday and a bottle of chilled champagne was waiting for us in the room with a lovely birthday card. Very thoughtful and delicious! The room was a perfect size with a king-size bed, office desk, couch with a coffee table. The decoration is a bit old but still elegant and decorative. The full marble bathroom was impressive with a separate vanity area. Our balcony – I believe that all rooms have one – wasn’t a city view but it was looking at the garden which was very pretty. On our first night it was a bit late to go out for dinner so we opted for room service. The spinach and ricotta ravioli was lovely and the prosciutto and artichoke pizza was thin and crispy. The table was decorated with fresh orchids and the dessert taster (pastry with blueberries) was a nice touch. Best room service I had so far. The breakfast was included in the room price and we so glad that it was. It had the widest selection I have seen (fruits, meats, eggs, pancakes, pastries, Japanese breakfast, omelette… it filled up literally two rooms). You have the option to eat the breakfast by the pool and you should not miss it. There is a great view at the city and the garden of the hotel is beautiful. The hotel is on one of the hills in Rome, so it is not centrally located, but you can take the complimentary shuttle to the city centre or the taxi would cost you around 8 EUROs. Definitely worth getting away from the hustle and bustle of the very busy and sometimes dirty Rome. It is expensive but if you can splurge a little, you should stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Rome Cavalieri-One of the Finest!”
Reviews.Author: Jen S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently had the excellent fortune of staying at the Rome Cavalieri hotel. We were confused at first, because we thought it was a higher-end Hilton, and we felt lucky we were able to use points for what appeared to be a much nicer than usual Hilton hotel. We soon found this is a Waldorf-Astoria (also a Hilton brand) hotel, and, as the brand would suggest, it did not disappoint. Everything about the Rome Cavalieri was exceptional--the rooms, the service, the food, and the design and layout of the grounds. Despite being "stuck" in the hotel one night due to a once-in-thirty years snow storm, we were more than thrilled to sit and have a lovely, quiet dinner and watch the snow fall from our table by the massive, picturesque windows. The hotel staff, especially the concierge, were lovely, and extremely helpful. I cannot emphasize enough--this is a really, really exceptional hotel experience. It's not the most conveniently located hotel, but the short 10 Euro cab ride that it took to get us down into the city was not a hindrance at all. In fact, the hotel is so peaceful, if we were to go there during the summer (which seems like an incredible time to be there), I don't know if we'd leave the hotel. I could go on and on...it's just very special! This is NOT an inexpensive hotel, and we used points to stay there. But I always feel that you get what you pay for, and if you are staying at Rome Cavalieri, you'll pay handsomely, but you'll receive just as handsomely. The service is truly impeccable!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: Pete F
Reviews.Content: The nicest hotel experience of my life... period. It is out of the way, which some consider a drawback. However, views from the balconies within the concierge lounge are so fantastic and relaxing that the location "negative" turns into a huge "positive". Once you are done exploring Rome for the day, escaping to the western hillsides is glorious. There's something that feel so right about it. The hotel offers a round-trip shuttle into Rome's city center. Additionally, a short and beautiful walk from the hotel places you on the bus route to Ottaviano metro stop near the Vatican. If you cannot gain access to the concierge level (from either Hilton status or the almighty $), stay somewhere else. The lounge completes the experience. I can't contemplate not having access. The whole trip would be different. Lastly, dinner at La Pergola on the roof requires a 6 month advanced booking and very, very, very deep pockets. It was exceptional... until the bill came. Oof! Seeing Rome from the outskirts at night is phenomenal. Google this hotel and check out pictures of St. Peter's Basilica at night. You'll understand what I am saying.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Hilton Experiences we've had”
Reviews.Author: Marianne M
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Cavalieri was just as incredible as Rome itself. From our initial greeting, to the concierge, front desk personnel, and housekeeping, everything we wanted or needed was available to us. Although the shuttle/cab rides into town are not as convenient as staying in the city, the hotel, the wonderful views of Rome and especially Vatican City, the spa and restaurant LaPergola, are all experiences that I do not believe a traveler to Rome can experienced from another hotel. Although recommended as a business hotel in travel books, that should not stop anyone from considering the Rome Cavalieri for personal travel. I can just imagine how beautiful and grounds and views are in spring and summer. Although we experienced the first snow in 25 years, the staff was ready with suggestions that did not stop our sightseeing or Rome experience!! The hotel will be difficult for other HiltonHotels to top!! Cudos to a particular hotel manager that made us feel special - I'm sure she treats all guests in the same manner.

Reviews.Title: “magical views at not such magical prices”
Reviews.Author: AnniebelleLondon
Reviews.Content: wonderful view of St Peter's and a very pleasant stay all round. But we felt the B+B prices were a little steep for what was on offer. It was the first time Rome had snow in decades, but nevertheless, our room and corridor was freezing because refurbishment was taking place and windows were left open. We pointed this out and were offered a small room heater , but it did not remove the chill factor.We ate at the Pergola a 3 michelin star restaurant on the terrace at the top and were disappointed in the quality and variety of the food on offer. The dessert was beautifully presented but the service to that point was very laissez-faire.Overall could recommend other places to stay ahead of this in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is situated on a hill from which is an amazing view of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Iwan89
Reviews.Content: This is undoubtedly one of the most beautiful hotels in which I had the pleasure to stay. Hotel is situated on a hill from which is an amazing view of Rome, is not never met with a hotel of such an amazing place. The hotel used the spa and tennis resort, I would recommend. Hotel rooms are something indescribable, pictures do not reflect the class itself. The service is amazing, kind and helpful, I highly recommend. The only downside here is paid online, but at the price of a hotel of this class is not large.

Reviews.Title: “Georgeous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fotz
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Cavalieri in September. It was beautiful. It isn't in the heart of Rome, but they have a shuttle or you can take a cab into town. We were on the Imperial floor. The Imperial room has amazing views of the eterenal city. I just wish we were there longer so we could have taken advantage of the beautiful pools and grounds. We will definitely stay there again when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tom0521
Reviews.Content: My family of three stayed at the Cavalieri and loved everything about it. We stayed on HHonors points stay and were upgraded to the Imperial level. The Imperial room was wonderful, a great spread for breakfast each day and snacks and wine throughout the day and evening. The room was beautiful and the staff was helpful throughout our stay. The shuttle into the city center was convenient and ran on time every time we used it. I would not hesitate to book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, fantastic large rooms, great grounds and location.”
Reviews.Author: JamesE339
Reviews.Content: Atop a hill, behind the Vatican.....overlooking Rome, my room was incredible. I love this hotel, and have stayed here several times. When i return to Rome, this is where i will be! Great service, great rooms, great club....its all here!

Reviews.Title: “2nd experience was EXCELLENT!”
Reviews.Author: ottleydesign
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon and last year we returned for our 1st year anniversary; while we awaited our 7 night Yachts of Seabourn cruise. We had a wonderful stay and spent time enjoying the hotel and the many luxurious amenities. The hotel is simply beautiful, grounds are well kept, the pool, spa and breakfast are excellent. I'm looking forward to visting this hotel again during Summer 2012. I would recommend this hotel to someone who desires to relax and enjoys life.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if you can afford it!”
Reviews.Author: Alexandria21
Reviews.Content: We went here for a week during our honeymoon. The view from the balcony of Rome is unbelievable and our room was very nice. They had champagne on ice waiting for us when we got there. There is a free shuttle into downtown Rome everyday which was convenient in the mornings.
