My only issue was that the last shuttle back to the hotel is early evening so you can't go to dinner in Rome and then get the shuttle back, you have to cab it. Overall, very very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Cavalieri staff treated me like a king!”
Reviews.Author: JasonPSU23
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, I cannot comment on the value as I accompanied a friend who was on a trip for work and was invited to tag along so I did not have to pay :-). This was my second trip to Rome and probably, by far one of the most fabulous hotels I've stayed at in Europe. The staff at this hotel is so attentive and welcoming (The only other place I've ever received this type of service was in the Hawaiian Islands). Polite, professional and willing to assist you with just about any request. Our room was tastefully decorated, an excellent size and the room was cleaned on a prompt and daily basis (Turn down service is always a nice touch). We stayed on the Imperial Floor which comes with its own express elevator service and the fabulous Imperial Club that offers an array of beverages, snacks and other delicacies (Staying on the Imperial floor grants you daily access to the spa and gym. I highly reccomend the hot stone massage. It's worth the 120 euros). Another nice touch is the shuttle service which will drop you off close to the Vatican Museum (five minute walk) or at Piazza Barberini which is close to the Spanish Steps. The shuttle only runs until 8pm and is great especially since the hotel is quite far off the beaten track and is not close to a metro (Depending on the day and where you are going, a cab can be expensive and nothing is in walking distance). Finally, you MUST dine at La Pergola, it is truly an experience (Gentlemen, make sure you wear a jacket!). The ONLY criticism I have is that the hotel is a touch too overdone and ornate for my tastes but who cares. It's a great hotel with a PHENOMENAL staff. Brava Rome Cavalieri!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Justtravels988
Reviews.Content: I have traveled the world and love hotels. This property is magnificent. Splurge for the Imperial Lounge- you will not regret it. And you'll see celebrities and actual royals like we did. The food presentations are outstanding and its a major savings in the overall f/b portion of your trip to do the club. Its on the outskirts, but the views are stunning, the rooms are enormous and the outdoor pool area is literally..."to. die. for." Do not miss the Cavaleri. You'll find yourself not even wanting to go into Rome bc you'll be so relaxed and pampered here. I'm going back in July and cannot wait.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best location, but an awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: Robert D
Reviews.Content: Even though the hotel isn't centrally located to where most tourists would want to be when visiting Rome, it is a fabulous hotel. Plus, there is a regularly scheduled shuttle that runs from the hotel to the city throughout the day. We used Hilton Honors points here for 4 nights and everything about the hotel was great. Our rate included breakfast, which was the largest breakfast buffet I have ever seen. It had foods to accommodate people from all over the world. There was even a table with Gluten Free foods. We also had access to their sauna/Turkish baths in the basement level. It made for the perfect end of each long day sightseeing in Rome to relax in a hot tub and Turkish bath. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but extortionate charges for everything”
Reviews.Author: Simon C
Reviews.Content: The reviews here are accurate in so far as the hotel is very luxurious but you will pay for the luxury as the rates match the decor. However, beware that you will be obliged to pay again and again and......: if you want to go online, €27; if you want to use the pool, €31 (for a swim!!!); and room service: if you want a club sandwich and a soft drink for one person: €26 for a sandwich, €10 for a soft drink and an extra €5 if you want the room service in your room!! - yes that's right: if you want the room service brought to your room then that's extra! It gets worse: one bowl of cornflakes, €17, that is €12 for the cornflakes and €5 if you want the room service in your actual room! It is not clear whether a spoon and milk was extra; one boiled egg, €17, plus the extra €5 for having the room service in your room - €22 for a boiled egg; I think you can buy a hen in some places for this price; the rip-off culture in this hotel was endless and I certainly won't be staying again. If you go here check in your wallet and brains at reception. One reason the hotel might charge such ridiculous prices is that it is far from anywhere, there are no local restaurants of note, and Rome proper is at least a 30 minute walk. Avoid if at all possible.

Reviews.Title: “Great property”
Reviews.Author: hiflya
Reviews.Content: I have been able to stay at this property on 3 occasions and it never disappoints. As a Hilton Diamond member, having lounge access is a big plus as it helps to cut down on the expensive breakfast cost and i like the free drinks in the evening. We also found a nice place for dinner nearby. I can't remember the name of it, but if you exit the property, turn left and walk toward a little square, there, you will find some decent places to eat that are nowhere near the expense you will find at the Cavalieri

Reviews.Title: “Total luxury”
Reviews.Author: short_scuba_diver
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel - really luxurious! Hotel staff very polite and friendly and food was delicious. The rooms are huge and attention has been paid to every detail. The only slight irritation if there was one was the wi fi struggled a bit at peak times. Other than that, I would thoroughly recommend this hotel. I stayed as part of a business trip but I would definitely love to go back for a holiday or short break.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms and amenities for all, feels far from city center”
Reviews.Author: Parkinsummer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roma cavalieri for 5 days with our 2 year old son. While my husband attended a conference, my son and I saw the sights in the mornings and returned to nap and eat in the afternoon. First things first- the big advantage to the hotel is that it has large and modern rooms and is a purpose built hotel. If you do not enjoy charming European hotels that have been creatively carved from houses and have quirky layouts like bathrooms you have to climb stairs to reach or closets whose doors need to be closed to access the bed, then this place will suit you. Rooms are spacious (500+ sq ft) with a desk and a small sitting area as well as a balcony. There was plenty of room for my son's crib and room for him to play. The bathrooms are also large and modern. The rooms were also soundproof which was nice. The hotel is located on a hill to the west of central Rome- it was about a 15-20 min taxi ride to attractions such as the Spanish steps and pantheon and a 10-15 min taxi ride to the Vatican. For some visitors, the point of their trip is to immerse themselves in the culture and stay in central Rome, but as a repeat visitor with a toddler, it was glorious to see the sights in the mornings and then return to a large comfortable room with room service, gardens and paths to run around on, and a quiet place to nap. The grounds of the hotel are beautiful and include 2 outdoor pools, a large garden with running path, huge stone lions that my son loved, as well as a roof terrace with great views. There is also a weekend kids activity room with bouncy castle that my son was a bit too young for. Service was friendly and prompt- I often preordered room service lunch before I left in the mornings so that it would be there right as we returned and the staff were happy to oblige. Dining options were plentiful and they also catered to dietary restrictions. Overall, this is a great base for families with young children to stay while seeing Rome. Having travelled frequently with our young child, we have found that we spend far more time at our hotel than we would otherwise, so we like to find places with more amenities and service and travel further to the sights. For families with older childrens or couples on a getaway, I would advise them to stay closer to attractions and at a place with more character and charm.

Reviews.Title: “Why so expensive extras?”
Reviews.Author: sommo_vate
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location (but far from downtown), large rooms with balcony, very comfortable beds, everything really luxurious... But, as in Hilton Milan, if you need internet connection you must pay an extra, and goods in the room are very expensive: 8 Euros for a coke or juice fruit, 12 euros for salad nuts... This is disappointing, since arriving in the night you have no choice for a little hunger (the hotel is non at a walking distance from the town, so any alternative requires a taxi). Moreover, I was attending a meeting, and at the wardrobe each piece was charged 2 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest form of luxury in the Eternal City”
Reviews.Author: Keox
Reviews.Content: Flew from Hawaii for our honeymoon and was amazed to find such an affordable and refined since of luxury in Rome. Truly a special place my wife and I will never forget. The service and special touches they provided is a perfect example of Waldorf Astoria in europe. Thank you for making this life changing dream come true. Mahalo nui loa me ka haahaa from Maui. Keaka and Angel Arensberg Sardine.

Reviews.Title: “A great splurge for those with points and status with Hilton properties”
Reviews.Author: Tigerman67
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here while visiting Rome in the fall. It was a great splurge for us since we got to stay on points. With her diamond level status, they treated us exceptionally well and gave us a huge suite to die for, with a commanding view of Rome that was just stunning. Since this hotel sits on a hill on the west side of rome, it has some beutiful views of downtown Rome and the Vatican / St Peters in particular. I will admit this is probably nicer than most places that we stay when we are picking up the bill ourselves. While over the top nice in many areas, I am not sure I would stay here if I was picking up the bill, for several reasons including costs and a few of the downsides that I will mention later. I do have to give you the caveat on our fantastic room, that not all the room are going to have that great view, and certainly not all of them are two room suites. We were all the way at the end of the hallway on one side, and that was probably the best view in the hotel, except for any rooms above it. I have seen others reviews that have stayed here on points that have a view of nothing but the huge antenna that is next to the hotel, or a look into the residental neighborhood that this is located in. I think you would have to have a room on one of the upper floors (probably 3 or above) (I believe we were on 5th floor [6th floor to americans]) to be able to see over the trees to get that great view of Rome even if you have one that points in the correct direction. Another plus for those with status in Hilton properties is the Executive Lounge access where they have (complimentary) available various wines, Prosecco, soft drinks, coffee and light snacks. Also a nice place to get to know the other people in the hotel if you are feeling social, we had some interesting conversations with some of the other guests and found all but one were staying there on points as well (the one only had enough points for one night and had to pay for the remaining). We had the breakfast buffet included in our room and it was nice to be able to eat there for free. The buffet was a bit over the top with all the things that were available, so feel free to make yourself an american style breakfast, or an asian style breakfast, or a European style breakfast it was all there. But its still a buffet, so that means runny scrambled eggs every morning as well. I heard the buffet was actually outrageously expensive (like 35Euro?) and if it wasn't included in the room, I would have caught the shuttle into town and found a nice local place instead. While this place was over the top fabulous in many ways, I also have to mention the downsides as well. It is located on a hill in a residential area of Rome, it isn't really within walking distance of anything significant although I did see a few people that did manage to find a resteraunt or two resteraunts within walking distance although they must have really had to search that out and get directions since nothing was obvious from where I stood. They have a shuttle that will pick up you when you arrive in rome if you take the subway to a particular stop. Although you have to know what corner to be on, as thier direction said there would be a sign there, and there isn't (Tip: Its the corner with the huge sea shell, you will see it when you get there). The shuttle has a big gap in the afternoon when it doesn't run, and only runs to about 8pm. So the shuttle was nice to ride into town in the morning, and we would sometimes catch it back in the evening, and then head back out on one of the last shuttle to do things around Rome, and count on having to pay for a taxi back that evening. The shuttle driver was very accomidating and allowed us to hope off the shuttle when we were close to something we wanted to see, or one time we jumped off when traffic was too messed up due to a protest parade ahead of us. You would have to be a masochist to want to drive your own car while staying in Rome if you are not from there. Tip for riding in taxis, look out the side windows and enjoy the tour. Don't look forward, you will probably see things that you really don't want to see, and raise your blood pressure. Also at night most of the cab drivers will want a negotiated fare rather than run the meter. Agree before you get in the cab. If you are concerned that they are going to try to rip you off, check with the concier for approximate rates of what it should cost you to get from place to place in the taxi. Keep in mind they have different rates if its at night or you have luggage, or a bunch of people. Also the hotel is west-north-west of most of the attractions, except the vatican which it is about due south from the hotel, but because of the hill there isn't exactly a straight shot. The shuttle drops you off sort of north and east of most of the attractions, and the subway doesn't have particularly good coverage in rome (they are adding a new line that will help in a couple of years). So we ended up walking alot which we enjoy, and also taking alot more taxi's than we were use to, so be sure to budget for taking a taxi ride or two just about every day even if you use the shuttle and subway. Normally I would prefer to stay in something a bit more in the center of things and wouldn't have minded not having the luxury that you get here. Although I must admit, the tourist sites of rome are very spread out, and many of them don't have hotels near them. So I think you will end up walking more than usual, and using more taxis reguardless of where you stay. But this hotel is very isolated, if you get stuck here at night and don't want to grab a taxi to head down into town and back and eat at the resteraunt, it think one of the cheapest items on the menu is a cheeseburger at 28 Euro. I don't mind spending money on a nice dinner, but I'd rather be spending it in town at a resteraunt rather than the one in the hotel. It was probably also a shame that we didn't spend much time in the hotel, as we were trying to see as much of Rome as we could, and other than some nice time in the executive lounge, we didn't really get a chance to really take advantage of the spa and other nice things in the hotel. We meet one couple who was going to take a day off and just spend it in the spa while we were there, which we couldn't understand at the time, as you can spend time in a spa back home. Although this was somewhat early in our Italian trip, and after a few weeks, that taking a day off and being pampered in the spa started to look like a nice option. In the end, a fabulous stay, and we will probably be back but its because of points and status, if we were picking up the check, this place probably would have been above what we wanted to spend.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Hotel”
Reviews.Author: samsneer
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, a bit expensive for restaurant food. Far out of city, shuttle bus needs to run until 11 pm, Spa was very good and worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice if in Rome”
Reviews.Author: oregongirl62
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! We had a long weekend at the WA Cavalieri and we got pampered. We received a nice upgrade and had access to the lounge on floor 7. One of the better lounges I've been to, gourgeous view over the eternal city and very nice enviroment. Staff was great, freindly and courteous. The spa was like a dream with so many nice choices. It didnt bother us one bit that it was a little outside the city, very serene and quiet. And the shuttlebus took us down in 15 minutes or so. Looking forward to my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury on a grand scale”
Reviews.Author: PhillipaFog
Reviews.Content: Grand and opulent with great spa facilities the Rome Cavalleri is wonderful for a romantic break. The room was huge with a comfy bed as wide as it was long. The real draw though is La Pergola, the Michelin starred restaurant on the top floor with sweeping views of Vatican city. I've been lucky enough to eat in a few michelin starred restaurant but none as innovative and delicious as this. The food is to die for right down to the peppery olive oil they serve with bread between courses. The service was great too, staff were friendly and helpful and basically did everything they could to make this a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “No comment”
Reviews.Author: SolTabet
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at this hotel in 1997 but i was too young.last july i stayed for two weeks. 14 days were more than great. The hotel is like a museum with hundreds of paintings and pieces of art. From the outside it looks old but once you step inside you understand what i mean. The only disadvantage (for some it is an advantage) is its location 15 min far from the city. Great gym, spa and swiming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great view of Rome, good service...but not walking distance from anything”
Reviews.Author: cmarieleahy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights, and were upgarded to a lovely corner suite (gotta love Hilton Honors!). The hotel is beautiful - no denying it. Views...fabulous. If you can - do get up to the club area - even better views of the city. We also went to the spa and has massages...top notch. We went through the concierge and had pre-arranged an 8 hour private tour of Rome with a driver and a tour guide. It wasn't cheap, but it was worth every penny - the driver and guide worked seamlessly together, we saw so much - never would have seen as much as we did and learned as much as we did any other way...it was probably one of the top two or three things we did during an amazing trip overall. The only con is that it is a 20-30 minute walk downhill to the city, BUT...there is a shuttle, and we did take advantage of that a couple times...but for the most part we just hopped in cab...wasn't too bad cost wise.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but the worst ripoff conceivable”
Reviews.Author: aeharbom
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here at the end of a month long trip to Europe. Firstly, I would definitely spring for a city view room, as the "garden view" is actually a view of a massive cell phone tower. Additionally, the mattress in our room was hard as a rock and I ended up with pain in my back. I ordered room service on three different occasions. The first time, the food was delicious and great, but the second time (I ordered the same meal) it was completely different, and tasted bad. I had to complain repeatedly to get them to do anything about it. The hotel is undoubtedly beautiful, but after paying top dollar for a room, I found it frustrating that I then had to pay 15 Euro's for a gin and tonic at the pool bar and something like 8 Euro's to lay by the pool. As far as I am concerned, when you pay to stay at a hotel, having the right to lay by the pool is not something you ought to be asked to pay extra for. It wasn't even pleasant spending time in the hotel due to the incredibly snobbish atmosphere. My understanding is that most people stay here using Hilton reward points, and so I suppose if that is what you are doing, it is worth it, but otherwise I would say, don't bother with this hotel. All-in-all I would not stay here again and would certainly spend my money staying in the city itself.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, but pricey services”
Reviews.Author: deirdjames
Reviews.Content: Stunning hotel for Rome with big rooms and friendly staff. Hotel offered a free shuttle bus to the centre of town which was good as you are quite far out. The services offered are amazing but very expensive, mini bar is overpriced (9 euro for Pringles...) however they are an exclusive hotel and worth the experience.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis for families.”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth B
Reviews.Content: We brought our four children here last summer. We booked early and pre-paid, securing ourselves a huge discount on their Imperial Club floor. By doing so, we had complimentary breakfast at their terraced restaurant with access throughout the day for beverages and took advantage of their exquisite complimentary tea service. This was wonderful for our kids 8-17. We would go out in the morning, come back in the afternoon, take tea and enjoy the lovely pool and resort (also complimentary with our room). It's not inexpensive to stay there, but we made the most of it and during the summer in Rome, having access to all their amenities took the experience to a whole other level. The shuttle is brilliant, we did have to use taxis a few times, but it was totally worth it. We did not feel we were missing anything by not being in the city center. Was it the true italian experience? No.. it's a huge hotel. But there are very few places like this in the world, where you can relax in a tranquil paradise 10 minutes car ride away from the most exciting cities in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lori C
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4-night stay at the hotel. It was absolutely fabulous. Wonderful staff, nice accommodations, and great food and alcohol selections in the lounges. Location is a bit inconvenient for direct city access, but the shuttle was a nice and well used feature. If ever in Rome again, we will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Come for the view, stay for the beautiful grounds & an amazing breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: married∈love
Reviews.Content: This stay was our second in Rome and what a great choice we made. This Waldorf sits in a wooded area (amazingly, I didn't know one existed here) where on a clear day, from a superior room, you can see all of Roma. From the roof top, you can see snow capped mountains in winter and hear birds singing when you awake to relative quiet. Well, quiet Italian style anyway. Our superior room was well appointed and was a (requested) non-smoking one, surrounded by the same. But sadly smoking seems to be allowed on the balconies and even with our sliding glass door tightly shut, the smoke came pooring into our room somehow and lingered. The worst of it was we were in bed and it lingered around us. Since there is no forced air, we could do nothing but breathe the smoke coming from the next balcony. Obviously I could have called downstairs to deal with the smoking neighbors, or to move especially after the baby started crying in the other room next to ours (thus making our 1st night pretty unpleasant), but moving in the middle of the night or encoutering angry, smoking neighbors wasn't how we wanted our 1st night in Rome to come to a close. Thankfully, we awoke to a fantastic breakfast (don't miss it) downstairs that bowled us over and afterward a walk around the grounds. Only then were we convinced that this hotel was a great choice. The not so greats: while our room was very pleasantly appointed, part of the drapes were very rumpled and looked just out of the dryer which at this level of a hotel seemed way out of place. The carpet: while very pretty, worn in places. All in all, everything looked like it had had a quick daily once over, but had not been thoroughly cleaned to perfection for quite a while giving it a rather unpleasant "occupied just the night before" look, with its bed sheets hanging down over the bed skirt, soaps streaks coming from the shower down it's wall and so on. It was so noticeable I wondered if the room itself had been cleaned, but it had apparently. My conclusion is that while the property has a fantastic locale and I wouldn't move, the rooms need thorough going overs or the maid staff needs better managing and balcony smoking in non- smoking areas strictly forbidden. If one o the many managers I saw is reading this please lay in the bed/s in room 463 whil someone is soaking heavily on the balcony in room next door and smell what we breathed in while sleeping. There is a vent issue somewhere! Tips: room service, while costly, brings good food that will feed far more than you suspect it will. So plan to split everything. Never tip the person who brings your luggage before he brings you ice. Ours here pointed my husband to the ice machine down the hall after we gave him 5 euro. Shamefull. This hotel has ATMs and everything else under the sun and brings a wonderful respite from a very busy city. So off season and save. Last but not least: included in our room was a shuttle to the center of the action but be prepared for all the additional walking around your tourist stops and bring super comfy shoes!,

Reviews.Title: “Bird's Eye View of Rome”
Reviews.Author: CCSGulfstream_Fl
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel nesstled in the seven hills overlooking Rome. Room was nice as I have ever had. The privacy/sound attenuation door was a very nice amenity. The balcony overlooking Rome was priceless. Magical touch. The pool areas were well attended. The lobby bars and lounge were comfortable even with Kolby Bryant and his body guards. Entertainment in itself. The gym/exercise area was clean and well appointed. A GREAT PLACE TO STAY.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dannmike
Reviews.Content: I only stayed one night at this hotel. It was amazing and a delight. I had a room overlooking the city and the grounds were beautiful. Out of the way but perfect. Good dinner and breakfast. Great staff!! Comfortable beds and one of the best spas I have ever had the pleasure to relax in. I will stay again at the Rome Cavalleri.

Reviews.Title: “Roma Cavalieri is spectacular if dated”
Reviews.Author: youngetal
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf Astoria Roma Cavalieri is a gorgeous property on the outskirts of central Rome. The property itself is in a park-like setting, looks a little dated (from the '70's) but inside it is a work of art. Our room - standard King - was spacious with a marble bath and balcony overlooking the front, with Rome in the distance. Be prepared for expensive cab rides into central Rome (20E) but the hotel runs a shuttle to Piazza Barberini which is very convenient, provided the schedule works for you. We enjoyed our stay but next time, we will go back to a hotel more convenient to the sights and not so far outside the center of the city.

Reviews.Title: “An exceptional place to stay in Rome....returning every time, for that unforgettable experience”
Reviews.Author: The_GlobeTrotter73
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf Astoria Rome Cavalieri is a pearl of a place.... start with a top notch breakfast (by the pool if warm enough), enjoy a glass of champagne on the balcony of your room over looking all of Rome - or order a lunch - tastes great, have a workout at their nice health club - if winter warm yourself up by the open fireplace by the indoor pool....(Pergola their 3-star Michelin restaurant was the only diappointment....not worth 3 stars, food too "germanic" tasting, and definetly also over priced)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Kendra E
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over the Christmas holiday and had a magical experience. The view from our room was spectacular, overlooking Rome with deep pink sunrises each morning. The hotel staff could not have been more professional and accomodating. The concierges went above and beyond in helping us secure tickets and reservations. We were traveling with our 6-year-old daughter and the hotel staff was incredibly kind and attentive to her needs as well. We upgraded to the Imperial Club floor with 7 a.m. -11 p.m. access to the club, which we'd highly recommend. We hope we can visit again someday!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Christmas stay”
Reviews.Author: Dan073
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was lovely, very luxurious with fantastic sized rooms and suites. The lobby was quite something and the bars and restaurants lovely. The setting was great in beautiful grounds and we were very happy with the hotel itself. However, the staff (50% of the staff) were not so good. we stay at many 5* establishments and this hotel offered the worst service we have ever encountered. I must stress that this did not involve all the staff, but at least half of all the staff were as good as useless. When we arrived (with a three year old tired from a long drive from SW France in tow, our booking was not found on their system. We then had to wait for nearly an hour whilst they tried to sort out their computer problem. Not a good start. The reception staff said that we needed to get onto our email (by paying for it in reception area with) to access our booking (although we had given them our full printed out booking with reference numbers). Eventually they found us alternative accommodation. We were placed on a lower floor but still in our suite and a separate room for our teenage daughter. The room was freezing for three days (no heating due to renovations going on in the rooms surrounding us). We found half of the door staff unhelpful and did not help you from your car, open the door for clients, whilst half were really great. The concierge staff sent us to a day outing which was closed two hours drive away and then stated that there were no available tickets in all the city for a concert or opera at all (I got online and booked within ten minutes of speaking to them three tickets to the opera). The Christmas day childrens entertainment was a shambles....very late, lots of unhappy kids waiting around and no qualified staff on hand whatsoever. we were then informed we had to pay 35 euros for our son to attend the party which was an hour late although I had been told by reception that it was complimentary for our suite. The room service staff were in contrast excellent (we have a lot of room service with a three year old!) they were efficient, polite, truly 5* service each and every time we used them. There was one in particular who often came to our room who was a cut above everyone else there and should really run the whole establishment! It would then be efficient! In short, the hotel was great, the facilities excellent, great pool, spa, etc, but the hotel should really shake up all the staff.....get rid of half of them and keep hold of the gems. the staff really let the whole stay down. We would not recommend to anyone to spend the vast amounts of money that we did not getting a 5* service at all. Sorry to sound so negative but we were all thoroughly disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Stunningly Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: TDinFLA
Reviews.Content: In my view it takes only one mistake from a luxury hotel to ruin a visit. The Cavalieri did this with their treatment of Hilton Diamond members. My two night stay was supposed to be the perfect conclusion to a two week tour of Italy but the Cavalieri left me angry enough to consider a switch of my brand allegiance from Hilton to another hotel company. I ignored the rushed and impersonal treatment from the front desk and concierge and attributed the abrupt treatment to a desire to be efficient. What I could not ignore is the "Colleseo Lounge" that was supposedly the executive lounge for the Hilton Gold and Diamond members. Did I read the Hilton Honors program description incorrectly? Where does it say Gold and Diamond members get lounge privileges at a temporary, over-lit, box of a room with grocery store level wines? This is what the Cavalieri offers. After day of walking around Rome, I do not look forward to waiting until 18:00 to fight for a chair, a bowl of almonds and a glass of cheap Frascati. Rome needs a Mandarin Oriental to erase this hotel from the map.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Rutim
Reviews.Content: Confusing booking system via waldorf central online reservations, ended up committing to an alcove suite and more money without fully realising but room was nice and I would recommend the Imperial Club lounge access option if you like to be able to relax out of your room each day, drinks and food available all day / eve inlc in room rate if you pay the supplement for the 7th floor. staff were excellent at all levels. Not the best hotel if you are there for first time as you want to be in the old centre/few steps from your hotel... good if like us, you're a regular visitor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel*****”
Reviews.Author: Maxkan
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel. Great rooms plus best view in all Rome. Set atop a hill on the outskirts of Rome it's a tranquil retreat from the bussel of Rome. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “"Good hotel while in Rome"”
Reviews.Author: bonnevie100
Reviews.Content: Our 3 night stay at the Hotel Cavalieri was good, but not great. The positives of the hotel are the large rooms with balconies and the massive buffet breakfast. The hotel is very large and looks 1970's-ish on the outside. The inside gives you the feeling of being on a cruise ship with a staircase in the center and bar to one side. Because we are Hilton Diamond Honors members, we had access to the Colisseum Lounge which was a small glassed in room offering nuts and potato chips from 6pm-10pm every night. I would recommend trying to get access to the Imperial lounge if possible, because it sounds much nicer. We took the free shuttle daily to the Piazza Barberini, which is a 20-25 minute drive from the hotel. All of the staff speaks good English and were friendly, but not overly helpful. If you can use Hilton points to stay here, I would say it's a pretty good use of them. Unfortunately, I can't say it was a memorable stay, but we did sleep well after walking all day!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service at the Cavalieri. A bit dated hotel”
Reviews.Author: NicholasPhan
Reviews.Content: A great hotel for our visit to Rome. Service is excellent and definitely 5*. The hotel itself however is a bit dated and in need of a facelift throughout.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel to stay when in Rome”
Reviews.Author: r0dneyj
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay with views over the Vatican from rooms with city views, spoil yourself and pay a little more for an imperial room so you get to use the imperial lounge,it has fantastic views,free breakfast,drinks,including French champagne at breakfast,and lots off great food throughout the day,book a package that includes dinner so you get to eat round the pool,the foods great!! A truly great 5 star hotel for that special occasion when in Rome.remember to get a price before using a taxi in rome as they do overcharge tourists when they can.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: luv2trvlots
Reviews.Content: Checked out the other reviews of the hotel and have to add our appreciation to the list. Hotel service and friendliness exceeded our expectations and the concierge was very helpful, be sure to use him! We arrived early in the morning before our room was ready so they checked our luggage and we took the hotel shuttle into town. The hotel shuttle takes you to Bernini Square and armed with the great map the concierge gave us we were able to wander the streets with confidence. The shuttle is a nice feature and $$ saver since the hotel is located out of the main ‘tourist’ areas. From the drop off point you can wander to all the sites (Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Pantheon, Plaza Novona….). Upon returning to the hotel, we were quickly checked in, our luggage was already in our room, and welcome Champaign placed in our room. The room was beautifully appointed, soft comfy bed, pillow menu so you can get just the right one, and OH the view! We lucked out on the December weather and were able to sit out on the balcony… Must have the Rome City View…. The grounds of the hotel were beautiful but the outdoor pool was not in service due to off-season ☹. We opted for the daily buffet breakfast included in our room rate. The buffet was one of the best European buffets we have enjoyed. Served in L’Uliveto, had quick table service for coffee and juice, large selections of pastries, jams/honey/jelly, hot items, and fresh fruit. Even though the hotel is out of town, there is a nice little ‘shopping’ area a couple of long blocks from the hotel where you could purchase sodas, additional waters, etc… and a nice “locals” restaurant De Luciano’s—very inexpensive and delicious! We found the hotel to be a very welcome retreat away from crowds, traffic and noise after busy days touring Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Top drawer, beautiful delivery,”
Reviews.Author: kjh777
Reviews.Content: just stayed at the Cavalieri, for 3 nights, and what a lovely hotel this is, in the style of Ritz carlton, silver service, well presented food, clean facilities, ranging from spa, to pool, would recommend Imperial Lounge , rosy, makes an awesome cafe american..., great service. nothing too much trouble, just what you need, to unwind, usual hotel issues, 10 euros fro 330ml of fanta!..etc ...but hey captive audience and its a break, so makes great sense to pay that little bit extra and head to Imperial lounge Inclusive, very much similar to club lounge..but on this occasion better, as the service for coffee,e tc was just excellent. Must ahves are a Roma room view,. which the hotelw ere kind enough to Upgrade us to, guess mixture of low season..and easy jet forgetting to load luggage, hotel taxi 50e, to airport in e class, rather than beaten to death local cars 42e, Shuttle bus, a lovely courtesy ..., all in all, just a great spot.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Service!”
Reviews.Author: LSUGirl25
Reviews.Content: I took a trip to this wonderful hotel with my mother and sister. I arrived at the hotel a little later than anticipated, but I was quickly escorted to the VIP check in lounge. Edwige Francis checked me in and was so very amazing. My sister was ill and she called to find a hot water bottle for her back. It was immediately sent to our room. Edwige gave us a tour and escorted us to our lovely appointed room. The beds are amazing, the city view was breathtaking, the bathroom was so luxurious. We stayed on the Imerial floor and loved having breakfast and afternoon tea there. Also having a pre-dinner drink there is a wonderful experience. We all enjoyed the spa, pool, and Turkish Bath. I can't say enough good things about this place. This is my second 3 day stay and it was as amazing if not more than the first. For all my fellow Diamond members, note if you do not book the Imperial Room specifically, you will not have access to the Imperial lounge. I know it was like that the first time I went, but it has since changed. They do have an alternative space for diamond and gold members, but it is on the first floor and not nearly as beautiful. The concierge is also very helpful. They will arrange all of your tours and car service needs with a quick call or email. The staff is very helpful and went above and beyond for us. Though the hotel is outside the city center it is still worth it. The shuttle will take you to a central location and runs to a decent time. We went to the Vatican on Sunday and got to hear the Pope's address. I encourage that and the trip each way was less than 10 euros! Completely worth the trip! Enjoy your stay at this lovely hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, excellent!”
Reviews.Author: thoma22d
Reviews.Content: I had a fantastic stay here recently! I'd been to five-star hotels before, but never treated with such individuality as here. I think in part because there were few guests at the time, since it was the middle of the week during the low season. My room was amazing: large, a seating area set aside from the bed and tv, large work desk, beautiful patio, a big bathroom with a large extra vanity area (the shower samples are Salvatore Ferragamo). It's kind of in the middle of nowhere so I had to order room service (I didn't inquire on whether I could order takeout), but there seemed to be lots to do in the hotel itself - cafe', shopping, etc. The staff were all very friendly and the hotel gets the old-world-elegance-plus-modernity-mix perfect. I got a special deal through the Waldorf website so my night was around $300. If I can get a good rate like that again, I would absolutely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Most beautiful hotel I have ever seen or will see”
Reviews.Author: squizz20
Reviews.Content: I know the prices are high, but still this is an undescribably beautiful hotel. Such class and elegance I've never seen anywhere else. Congress services are technically advanced but still manage to be completely in style blending modern technology with class. It's hard to find the words to give you an idea. Just a small example, the lift took you from -1 to the 5th floor arrived in mere seconds with a reef tank with sounds on the background. Swimming pool as in one's dreams, both indoors and outdoors, excellent original paintings and just everything in this hotel is stylish. Please go and see.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great service, what a wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: puppymama1
Reviews.Content: We chose the Rome Cavalieri based on the reviews we read on Tripadvisor and because we were able to book a room for free using Hilton points. I read that this is a popular choice for point redemption and I can certainly see why. Although it is a short cab or shuttle ride from the main sights of Rome, it is a welcome retreat and we actually thought it was a benefit to be away from the crowds, traffic, noise, etc.. of Rome. We had requested the discounted upgrade to the Imperial floor rooms and were lucky enough to get that upgrade at check-in. It was worth the 89 euros per night charge to have access to the Imperial lounge. We would go there in the late afternoon when we returned from sightseeing, to have our glass of wine or champagne and snacks. We usually returned in the evening for another glass of wine and dessert, and actually made the snacks our dinner on two nights since we had eaten a large lunch and weren't that hungry. We enjoyed sitting outside on the balcony and seeing the view of Rome, as well as sitting inside watching TV or talking with the other guests. If you can afford to get the Imperial floor upgrade, I highly recommend it. The grounds of the hotel were beautiful - we walked through the gardens admiring all the plants and the statuary. Since my husband is a Hilton Gold member we had free breakfast buffet every morning - it was quite good with tons of choices and the best crusty Italian bread - I wish we could have taken it home with us! We ate dinner in the hotel restaurant one night - very good but expensive. The other 2 nights we walked about 10 minutes down the street to 2 different restaurants - get the map from the concierge and it has all the local restaurants listed on it.. We preferred Vespri Siciliani (I think that is how it was spelled) - the food was very good and reasonably priced. Everyone at the hotel spoke very good English as did most people in the restaurants - enough that we were able to communicate with no problem. We only used the hotel shuttle once to return from Rome - the other days we used cabs to Termini, the Vatican, and the Coliseum - we never had any problem with any of them trying to overcharge us, and all the drivers were all very nice. There is an ATM machine in the hotel off the lobby which was VERY convenient and we felt much safer using it than having to use one on the street in Rome where it was very crowded. Overall, we were very happy with our stay at the Cavalieri and would highly recommend it to anyone visiting Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Delightful”
Reviews.Author: SandNJ
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a long weekend at this hotel in Rome. What can I say, it was absolutely delightful!!! The hotel is wonderful, the staff are very caring and considerate, nothing is too much trouble for them. Edwige Francais one of the Managers in particular gave outstanding service along with David on the Concierge desk. The food is delicious and even though this is a big hotel the atmosphere is very personal. The rooms are very clean, comfortable and cosy. The bed was probably the most comfortable bed I ever experienced in a hotel. The shuttle bus running regularly in to Rome drops guests in a very Central place to explore the city of Rome. The views from the hotel over Rome is truly wonderful. I would 100% recommend a stay at this hotel, we stayed in December and the weather was very kind to us 16/17 degrees but I would imagine that it is exquisite to stay at the hotel in the warmer months as the outside space of pools and bathing are the best I have seen on a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent !!!”
Reviews.Author: Vivienn
Reviews.Content: Absolutely beautiful and elegant!!! It is located on top of a hill, has breathtaking views over Rome, great service, helpful staff, elegant restaurants with tasty food, beautiful bathrooms, very comfortable, silent and clean rooms...everything you could expect from a 5 star hotel. We had a room on the 7th floor.The morning buffet is fantastic, with a lot of choices. The art gallery from the lobby is beautiful and precious. It is definitely a first class hotel and it worths the money because it's a real experience. I would like to go back again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to come back to and relax after the hectic of Rome”
Reviews.Author: frau-seefeld
Reviews.Content: My partner and me had the pleasure to spend five days at this excellent hotel in October 2011. The hotel is nicely located on one of the hills with an excellent view of Rome. The best way to get to the city is taking a taxi. A trip from the hotel to Castel St. Angelo costs around 10 Euros and the experience of roman traffic alone was worth the money. The hotel is surrounded by beautiful gardens, including two pool areas. Unfortunately we did not get a chance to make use of the pools, as temperature simply did not allow for it. We also did not get the chance to check ou the hotel spa. The room and bathroom were spacious, very well equipped and clean. Each room offers a balcony, which was nice to sit on and relax after walking through the city all day. The bed was extremely comfortable and a pillow menu to choose from was offered. The hotel definitely meets the expectations you would have of a five star hotel. I would recommend this hotel to my friends and would return on my next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rossnicholson
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. Everything about it was great apart from maybe the location although with the free shuttle bus that helped a lot. The rooms were very nice. Food was great. Service was top notch. I will be trying other Waldorf hotels now.

Reviews.Title: “Best view in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Babe E
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful, and had a view over the city to die for, especially if you can spring for the 7th or 8th floor. It is an expensive hotel, but worth it if you want somewhere nice to stay. Free shuttle to downtown, where you can walk all over. It is fairly close to the Vatican, but you would still want to take a taxi there. This hotel is situated at the top of one of the hills in Rome, so that is why it has such a wonderful view. The weather was right around 60 F/ 16 C at the end of November and the first part of December.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: Herbert K
Reviews.Content: This hotel is full of precious artwork, has an absolutely splendid Spa and exceptionally friendly and helpful personnel. And the breakfast menu is exorbitant, one of the best we've seen so far around the world. Definitely a place you should visit!

Reviews.Title: “Simply amazing!”
Reviews.Author: jasongianginis
Reviews.Content: Simply amazing! Service A1, and staff go to every length to make you stay as pleasant as possible. Thanks for a wonderful honeymoon experience!

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: mcw30306
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Cavalieri just before thanksgiving and were very pleased with the choice. The location is outside of the traditional tourist hotel district, but the shuttle takes you to the heart of Rome and taxis were always available and relatively affordable. The room was the largest I have ever seen in Europe and comfortable beyond compare--the luxurious bed, large balcony, and extra sitting area only added to the comfort. we especially liked the blackout shades and seperate noise proof door to allow us to sleep peacefully and recover from jet lag. we are hilton diamond, which meant free breakfast from the incredible buffet and free internet access as well as access to the hilton honors lounge, a definite plus as these services were priced fairly steeply. however, the level of service provided by the hotel and the concierge were simply top notch. the staff somehow figured out that my in-laws were also in the hotel and placed us on the same floor and the concierge was very helpful in arranging tours, suggesting sites and the best time to visit, and securing tickets and reservations at the requested times. in short, fantastic service at a beautiful property.

Reviews.Title: “The right place”
Reviews.Author: TheMightyRawdon
Reviews.Content: Having looked extensively for a really good hotel in Rome after a few trips, I was very pleased to have found it in the Cavalieri. The only downside - and it may not actually be a downside - is that it is a 10 minute cab ride from the centre. The food I had was excellent (breakfast and a late dinner in the bar). The building, fixtures and fittings are all great with the view from my 6th floor room facing Rome being staggering. It's a big place and has all the amenities that you would expect from a top clas establishment. Sadly as I only visited for a day and in winter I didn't get to use the beautiful outdoor pool. I am sure lunch al fresco next to the pool would be lovely at this time of the year and the place was set up accordingly. The staff were as good as the property and did a very good job of being friendly, attentive and professional.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place To Stay In Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Lisagary1993
Reviews.Content: What a view! What Service! The team at the Rome Cavalieri made our 21st Anniversary top notch! Thank you! The rooms at the Cavalieri are spectacular as well as the view over the entire city of Rome. You can see all of the monuments. The staff is courteous and very professional. Our beds were turned down every night with a gift of chocolate for both of us. The breakfast buffet is 5 star in my opinion offering something for everyone, from American style with bacon, sausages, omelets, scrambled eggs, French toast to organic and wellness foods to Japanese. There are meats, cheeses, breads, cereals, yogurts, and jams galore (this was great-all types of homemade jams), and of course yummy desserts abound! Well worth the money! Although not in the heart of Rome the service and view and the comfort of the rooms as well as the food and treatment by the staff make the short travel time (15min) into the city well worth it. They offer a convenient shuttle service (no charge) every hour from the hotel down to Piazza Barbarini which is one of the main transportation areas and with-in a short walking distance to major sites (Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, etc.) The shuttle drops off and picks up right on Via Venito (right down the road from the Hard Rock). The shuttle picks up every hour up to 8pm. We recommend this hotel and will definitely be staying with them again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “If you can afford it, search no further..l”
Reviews.Author: RustyCanuck
Reviews.Content: Quite possibly the best hotel, I've ever stayed at. We were treated to an imperial room with access to the imperial lounge, free alcohol and rotating food 24 hours a day, and what an experience. Beautiful views of the whole of Rome and the Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: djack7
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth trip to Rome and we wanted to stay in a different area. We usually stay in the Centro Storico. We had just completed an 11 day trip on Bicycle and wanted a bit of luxury. We found it! Located high on a hill to the Northeast of the Centro Storico the view from this hotel was a killer. Each night we relaxed on our terrace and looked out on the Eternal City twinkling below. It was a magical view. The rooms were spacious and offered many possibilities to relax. Everything about the bathroom was perfect. The buffet at breakfast can not be beat. It lacked for nothing. The transportation to the Centro Storico was great. We would have appreciated a later schedule. It stopped well before dinner ended and we ended up using a taxi each night. A problem with the cooling in the room was immediately responded to. The staff was superb. If you want a romantic hotel this is it! We visited in the off season. This is definitely the the to visit Rome. The weather was fantastic during the day and cooled significantly at night. A sweater was all that was needed. A room with a view of Rome is well worth the extra cost. We booked this trip through American Express and the details were handled perfectly and the additional benefits were well appreciated: late checkout, complimentary breakfast, complimentary Health Club access, complimentary WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnanthG
Reviews.Content: Cavalieri is a very nice hiltop hotel with a nice view. I was in the hotel for 2 nights and the service was excellent. The only issue I had was the price of getting online. 27 Euros per night (about $45) is on the extreme. I expected to have it included in the room price. The hotel is about 10 to 15 minutes from vatican but far from other Rome attractions. But the hotel has a shuttle that takes you to the center of Rome every hours.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: susanharrogate
Reviews.Content: we checked in here on the last night of our stay having made the mistake of staying at a smaller boutique hotel, (which we never do). Loved the Cavalieri from the word go. Tastefully decorated for Christmas. We had an Imperial Club room on the 8th floor, fab room, amazing view and of course the Imperial lounge is the best we have ever been in. Our room was as good as the one we had in the Krungthrep Wing in the Shangrila in Bankok. The only hotel we have been in which is better is the Gleneagles in Scotland, which is one of the leading hotels in the world. Absolutely faultless.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Property With a View to Die For”
Reviews.Author: bremar67
Reviews.Content: As others have noted, the exterior of the hotel is decidedly dated but IMO, the true star of this show is the view of the hotel's stunning mediterranean garden / grounds and Rome from the gloriously large balconies. Our deluxe Rome-view room was simply stunning - and by far, the largest / most oppulent rooms of our recent European getaway. The rooms are beautifully appointed with plush fabrics and rich woods. The bathroom was huge and had, what I'm confident in saying, will be THE BEST hotel showerhead that we will ever have the pleasure of experiencing in our lives; the first time that I actually miss any hotel's shower more than my own!!! :) The breakfast was absolutely superb and the restaurant staff was by far, the friendliest / most attentive of any of the hotels during our recent 2 week European tour - truly gracious and kind. Re: the hotel's location, just want to assure future guests that, while you are certainly away from the bustling activity of central Rome, the very large and super convenient shuttle bus works like a charm. Also, we actually elected to walk to/from the Vatican in lieu of taking the shuttle so, if you are not averse to long walks, it is very do-able.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay- the beds are thee best!”
Reviews.Author: Christian377
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent. The inside is opulently decorated, including many works of art. The rooms are spacious and comfortable, and the bed was great. The staff was friendly and helpful. The location is very quiet, but quite a ways a way from most of the attractions. They do have a shuttle service, or you can take a cab to the sights. Beautiful views of the city from up on a hill.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: globezipper
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for an extended weekend in Rome, using my Hilton points for a nice splurge. And what a great choice that was. I did upgrade to a small suite which was in hindsight an excellent idea. First of all the suite is wonderful. You have a dressing room that is almost a whole room by itself. An enormous bathroom with a "soap menu" just in case you're not satisfied by the anormous selection that's already there. A wonderful bed with a "pillow menu" with almost 10 types of additional pillow types that you can choose from. A large TV and a DVD player with a USB interface which - if you have a USB cable - you can watch your pictures from your digital camera on. Best of all, if you're in a junior suite or better, you have access to the "Imperial club" which is a lounge where you can have breakfast, lunch, dinner or a pre-bedtime drink and snack and that offers fantastic views over the city. The spa must be terrific too, it is rated one of the finest (if not the finest) hotel spas in Europe. I didn't have time to visit it though, and neither did I bring a bathing suit. Oh well. There's really just two "issues" with the hotel which are actually non-issues. The first one is that, well, you're in Rome. The hotel is so nice and fancy that it is really competing with the city for your valuable time there. You're really torn between hitting the city and "just sleeping there" (which would be a bit of a shame, given how wonderful the hotel is), or enjoying the hotel and cutting back on the wonderful sights of eternal Rome itself. In the end, do it like I did - mix the two, and you'll have the visit of your lifetime. The second minor "issue" is that you're a bit from Rome itself, which actually isn't a problem either. Taxis are relatively cheap (although they sometimes drive a few loops to bump up the fare), and there's a shuttle every hour (except unfortunately for the weekend, where there are some more gaps in between the shuttle services). From the hotel however you can walk over to the Vatican, and even to the city which makes for a very nice drawn-out walk (bring good shoes). The staff are wonderful, nothing is a problem, always attentive with a smile on their face. So... if you can afford it, stay there! It'll make an unforgettable experience in the eternal city of Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff,wonderful property”
Reviews.Author: redmanfloridapvb
Reviews.Content: The Cavalieri get's it done right,from picking me up in Civitavecchia to my early morning transfer to FCO,dinner reseverations for 7 at the hotel,Request for a room upgrade,and the most important and early morning check in all done with no problem .The entire staff were just GREAT.Management should be very proud them.Also take some time out to admire the works of art in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Adrienne D
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to the Eternal City. This hotel met and exceeded all our expectations. The room was exquisite, immaculately kept and offered a breath taking panoramic view of Rome. The staff could not have been more gracious and did everything to make this trip the memorable one that it was.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent but buyer beware you never stop paying.....”
Reviews.Author: markwlugano
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with great views,fantastic rooms and good service,surely nothing better in Rome.One of Italy's top restaurants on the top floor is a bonus,location of hotel a weakness,20 minutes from town. You can get quite good room rates,but once you are staying here you will be fleeced.Coca cola for 9 euros,Club sandwich for 29 euros...not friendly for a family on a budget....If you can get a club room however you get a good deal,as all day food and drink is gratis......

Reviews.Title: “Another fabulous holiday.”
Reviews.Author: RNGZG
Reviews.Content: We decided to go back to the Rome Cavalieri a second time and we had another fabulous holiday. This time we booked a Rome view which was worth the small extra and we opted for the Imperial club. Everything was perfect. Friendly staff, excellent service, beautiful grounds, magnificent food and a good shuttle service into the centre of Rome.The hotel has a stunning art collection. The weather in October was nice, around 21C and no rain. We will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: TonyMnUK
Reviews.Content: We were treated to staying here with a friend who works for Hilton International so we really couldn't tell you how much this place cost but I can tell you it's probably worth every penny! The location is up on a hill top overlooking Rome, so it's not in the city center but the views make up for the distance into town. We stayed on the east facing side so we were able to look at the city from our balcony. The room is very tasteful and spotless. The service at the front desk and concierge were top notched. The restaurant was great, we had breakfast there every day. The bar in the lobby was wonderful! We had great service throughout our stay. Comfortable beds and baths. Wonderful chocolates on the bed every night! Aside from the location being a little of an issue this place has it all!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Oasis”
Reviews.Author: tripping_lightly_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights pre-cruise in late October. On the outside it looks like a generic hotel. On the inside it is a wonderful experience. We had a non club floor room overlooking Rome. The view is amazing and made our stay. The experience would be very different without the city view. We are Hilton Gold and were treated very well. We did not get an upgrade to the Imperial club floor but we did get an upgrade to the city view. Some have an issue with this WA policy but it seems reasonable to me. The shuttle worked well into town. We had some concern on location but we found we loved going back to the hotel in the evening away from the noise and crowds of the city below. Taxis to/from the inner city area were not expensive. We ended up "picnicing" on our balcony two nights for dinner to enjoy the view. The breakfast (included with our stay) was an excellent buffet. We did not eat lunch or dinner at the hotel. We did use the Hitlon Gold/Diamond lounge in the evening. It was nice but very sterile feeling with way too bright lighting. The spa/pool area was nice. The jetted pool was not heated but a soaking pool was heated. I would stay again for sure as long as I could get a city view.

Reviews.Title: “Great for points, or if you can get a bargain booking”
Reviews.Author: JimBobSmith
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay here. The hotel is a little out of the centre of Rome, but there is a fantastic shuttle service to and from hotel to Via Veneto. The hotel is surprising plain on the outside but it is opulence defined inside. The artwork alone is worth a visit, if that interests you. There were one or two bugbears for us that ended up creating happy moments. For example, we didn't have a room service menu when we arrived, so we visited the very nice lobby bar. Then, when we got the room service menu, the phone in the room didn't work! Exit to L'Uliveto restaurant downstairs, which was excellent. A point off for nobody asking us how our stay was as we paid the bill. We might have given some feedback. A review of La Pergola, the hotel's 3* Michelin restaurant, can be found on tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel & beautiful views of Rome”
Reviews.Author: MettaP
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely gorgeous, the only downfall is that it is pretty far from the central part of Rome - it is on the top of the hills with wonderful views of the city. This means that it can become very costly travelling from the airport to the hotel and into/out of central Rome. They do have a shuttle bus which you must queue early for - we went on June which isn't really the peak season and sometimes we had to wait for the next one. On the first occasion the hotel paid for us to get a taxi with another couple as it was the last shuttle into town. The shuttle bus stops quite early on the way back to the hotel so you most definitely would need to pay for a taxi after an evening meal out / night out etc. I'm sorry but I can't remember the cost of the taxis! I don't think public transport is an option here and walking is a definitely no no. I was here with my other half who, on the trip became my fiance (he proposed at the Colosseum!) :) as a Hilton Diamond Member we got access to the Executive Lounge & had complimentary breakfast which trust me was well worth it! In fact we didn't pay for accommodation either as I used my points - we just paid the room tax which was really quite nominal as price per night is really expensive here. We loved the Exec Lounge with their free drinks (beer, prosecco, wines, soft drinks) and canapes and often sat outside on the terrace after a long day of sightseeing relaxing here. The first night there were fireworks from a wedding at the hotel. We preferred to go into Central Rome for dinner- we never ate the hotel as prefer to try the local food places. The breakfast was plentiful, lots of different choices including Japanese options (sashimi etc!) and the traditional cooked breakfast and lots of coffee etc. Breakfast is served by the pool area which is really lovely. We never used the pool as we were only there for a short period but I wish we had enough time as the weather was blissfully hot! (actually almost too hot!) We had king sized room and it was the perfect size, there were shutters leading on to the balcony and the balcony overlooked the whole of Rome. It was really magical. When we arrived there was a bottle of prosecco in the room with "Congratulations" in a card - I think this was their premature congratulatory bottle for us :) The staff all seemed very friendly and helpful - on the first night we spent too long relaxing in the Exec Lounge and the Concierge helped us find a restaurant that was open late at night. I would stay here again, probably on points as I wouldn't be able to afford the rate but I would go back in split second :)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel with Impeccable Service”
Reviews.Author: ArtLover1949
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed with friends on a four day break to Rome at the beginning of November and had a wonderful time. The hotel lived up to our full expectations and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We all agreed that although the facilities and hotel were superb the thing that really impressed us all was the level of service and attention provided by the staff. They were all exceptional and carried out there duties in a highly professional and courteous manner rarely found in other hotels. Excellent food, room and breathtaking art!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely property with beautiful views across Rome”
Reviews.Author: tahnee85
Reviews.Content: Three nights at Cavalieri to finalise a 4 week holiday. Arrived early and were escorted to Imperial Lounge - balconies have panoramic views across Rome. Throughout the stay, staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful however concierge assistance was not at the standard we have experienced in comparable hotels across Europe. Hotel lobby, lounge and room were beautiful and well kept. In room shower/tub combination was average but adequate. Otherwise, room amenities were excellent and bed extremely comfortable (especially the pillows!). Had an iPad and 24 hours of wi fi connection was only 9 euros - explained to us by friendly reception staff. Breakfast in the restaurant displayed a very large variety however hot breakfast items were quite average and almost cold. Breakfast in Imperial Lounge however was lovely and service in the lounge was unfailingly friendly. Room service extremely prompt and of a good standard. La Pergola restaurant incredible, a must-do dining experience. Late checkout requested and was not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE, HORRIBLE Experience. Items STOLEN!”
Reviews.Author: a l
Reviews.Content: Husband I went for our 6th wedding anniversary only to have our netbook (with ALL of our Italy photos), Bose & Beats headphones, Sony earbuds, and personal items stolen right out of our luggage on the Rome Cavalieri hotel shuttle (we left luggage in the shuttle for an hour). Hotel's response? "Sorry, you shouldn't have left luggage on the shuttle." "It's Italy, you should've expected things to be stolen." When they called back to tell us they've researched this in detail and have exhausted all sources, we asked if they checked the security feed and they responded with, "we are still working with Loss Prevention on that". They protect their hotel like it's a rate jewel and treat their hotel guests like dirt. Oh, I should mention, each person we spoke with regarding this suggested that we got the items stolen from us while we were on our way to the train station. How did we know the shuttle driver stole our luggage? The netbook was inside a backpack, the charger was wrapped separately outside of the backpack, under a teeshirt, headsets were under other items in the luggage, also not in the backpack. Netbook with backpack was taken, charger was taken but the shirt it was under still remained in the luggage, and the headsets were missing from other areas of the luggage. Someone had to have opened our luggage and rummaged through it to know what to take... and the only time we didn't have the luggage with us by our sides that day was when we left them in the Rome Cavalieri shuttle for an hour. Diamond Card holders and Hilton Grand Vacations Club owners here. When we asked about the Imperial Floor upgrade, we got a "sorry, no availability". I said, "I understand there may be a fee involved." The story then changed to, "we can upgrade you tomorrow." We were in Venice for three days before staying in Rome for four. Our friends received our Venice postcards the day after our return to the States. Rome ones are still missing. It's been a week. I wouldn't be surprised if the concierge didn't mail those out. (Yes, we paid for "stamps".) We walked out of the elevator once with an older couple behind us, and the female manager walked right past us to greet the older couple. And take my word for it when I say the $250 USD spent on the brunch and $780 USD at La Pergola was SO NOT WORTH IT. Yes, those are prices for TWO people. Spa was under renovation, so only the sauna was available to us. We tipped like we normally would in the States, didn't ask for cleaning (though they still went into the room and cleaned, dunno why), and mostly didn't ask for any room service. I felt we were not difficult guests and we've stayed in enough Hiltons to believe it was the chain for us. After this experience, we're thinking about switching over to another hotel rewards program. We stayed at Rome Cavalieri for the peace of mind, but instead we brought home headaches. We went into Milan with such heavy hearts after Rome that we know it ruined our trip entirely... but we couldn't help it. The attitude we received was beyond understanding. All of our photos were gone with that netbook...

Reviews.Title: “Most excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: LadyoftheLake1
Reviews.Content: Checked in after traing from Florence. Being diamond we were taken to another check in area and absolutely treated like royalty. We were escorted to the executive elevator which led only to the executive floor by an assistant Our bags were brought to us in our lovely spacious room soon after. The assistant then escorted us to the executive lounge to show and explain the amenities. We were blown away. Here we are in one of the most beautiful culture rich cities in the world and we wanted to stay in the executive lounge! They have tiny balconies off the lounge so I hope you are lucky enough to secure one at least once! The view is breathtaking - you are atop one of the seven hills and you overlook the Vatican and many other sites. The services, staff, amenities, location, quality of product, of this establishment can't be compared to any other place we've stayed in over the years of our world travels because it far exceeds any others. Taxis to sightseeing was easily obtained at hotel by staff. Anything we needed - all we had to do was ask. We will return and can hardly wait to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, poor location, poor value”
Reviews.Author: thptrek
Reviews.Content: The views, artwork, rooms are all amazing but you pay incredible prices. Was there on business for a conference and was amazed at the costs. 20 euros to use the spa per day, internet access is $108 euros per week per device. If you want to use your iphone and computer you pay double. For a large hotel the food choices are terrible. I guess during the summer the patio is open but during fall you are out of luck. Only choice for a coffee or snack is the bar which has very limited seating. Also expect to pay amazing prices for a simple coffee or sandwich. As many other reviews state the location is remote and takes 15-20 mins to get to city center area. Limited shuttle service. Taxi costs 10 to 15 euros. I would not return or recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Eye-wateringly expensive”
Reviews.Author: BillS_LondonLondon
Reviews.Content: A location to die for, lovely views and every luxury. But at a price. The 30 euro cheeseburger must be something of a record.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Marvelous!”
Reviews.Author: TAMember12282011
Reviews.Content: Absolute luxury. Go for an imperial room and have the pleasure to use the amazing imperial lounge offering free food and drinks all day with a breathtaking view of Rome! The spa is also available for your use. Restaurant and drinks a bit pricey but expected from a 5 star Hotel. Staff very friendly and helpful. Cost 50 Euro from airport by taxi and 10 euro to go to center of Rome. Depends what you want to do but for the luxery aspect, it's nice to get out of the city. One of the best places to stay in Rome to celebrate your 50th! Mr Jaffa the pianist playing in the bar was superb.

Reviews.Title: “A Masterpiece of a Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: arminhazari
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Roma Cavelieri is truly a masterpiece of a hotel. The plain facade belies the exquisite beauty waiting inside. Every nook and corner is filled with antiques waiting to welcome you. Each floor has either a heritage desk, clock and / or a costume worn by the famous ballet dancer Richard Nureyev. The Cuisine is to die for and the views are panarominc. Not for the fiscally faint-hearted, this hotel is really a celebrity destination! But once there, the property is a destination by itself. Located atop a hillside, the hotel offers its guests panaromic views and the solitude to enjoy a classy holiday. Regular shuttle services keep you connected to the city and one can avail of all the excitement of Rome. For Indians however, would advise you to carry your electric kettle and connector for your morning cuppas as the hotel - like most european hotels do not offer a in room service of tea and coffee. Apart form that, the hotel is ces't magnifique!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Property”
Reviews.Author: Gonzalez2011
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days at this hotel prior to boarding a Royal Caribbean transaltantic cruise. We used our Hilton Honors points during our Oct. 23-26, 2011 stay. Not in the central par of the city -- but worth it given the city view. Exceptional service - very pricey but a good use of our Hilton Reward Points -- and a good reason to stay at Hiltons and be a member of their rewards program.. From the bellmen, to the front desk, to our room attendant -- very nice, very professional and very exceptional service. We had a beautiful view of the city. And the person who heads up the breakfast buffet room -- was such a pleasure to visit with -- she was a delightful lady.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Experience but off the city”
Reviews.Author: Sanchit123
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very beautiful and truly top class. The staff is very firendly and always willing to assist the guests. While we "Indians" do like our morning cup of tea, there wasn't any provision of a kettle in the rooms, primarily due to security (fire) converns. However, on request the staff did make provisions to arrange for the same on the floor for all the guests every morning. Truly superior service experience Also, the hotel also went out of the way to arrange for vegeterian food for us on request and the chef did do a pretty good job at it too. The conceirge services are also very helpful and polite to organise day exercusions for us and provide us with as much information as needed. The room are large and spacious with a sit out balcony to enjoy your morning cuppa to look at Rome wake-up and have a drink in the evening and see the city "light up"again

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie S
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd time here. The hotel is an incredible splurge. Would normally never pay this much to stay somewhere, but for special occasions, why not. It was so worth it again. It's a bit pricey ($7.00 for a cup of Americano coffee!!) but it goes with the upscale territory! The room is beautiful, the only bad part is, you won't want to get out of the luxurious huge bed to go sightsee! My only negative comment is that the last shuttle returning to the hotel is at 830 PM, maybe they think we all need to rest!! Everyone speaks English. Concierges very helpful, ask about public trasnportation to see the Catacombs, fun trip, cheap and you get to experience local transportation. Coffee, wine, beer very cheap in the outskirts, yet still have the ambiance. Hopefully we will return again someday.....

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: BoyScoutBill
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 5 nights at the hotel this September using Hilton points and had a very nice experience. Although it is "a little off the beaten path", on a hill on the outskirts of town, it isn't so far as to make the daily journeys into town to see the sights a big deal, particularly since they provide free shuttle service throughout the day.
