Once, when the shuttle was full and we weren't able to get a seat, the hotel paid for a private taxi for us to go downtown. This was, in our eyes, tremendous service. Our room, a standard street-view room, was large, well appointed and comfortable. Watch out for the mini bar prices however- Something like $8 for a Coke! We found the prices for food at the hotel quite high overall, but there are a couple of reasonalbly-priced restaurants in the neighborhood, just a short walk away. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. The spa, with both an indoor and outdoor pool is very nice and the workout facility is about as good as you could find anywhere and the landscaping of the grounds is top drawer. The hotel is a great place to just take a day off from sightseeing and relax. Truly an oasis in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel very tuned into customers comfort and desires.”
Reviews.Author: mtgstrategistSC
Reviews.Content: We arrived tired from our flight having slept little on our night flight. We were able to check in early and also receive a Rome view upgrade. The room was spacious and wonderfully luxurious and comfortable. The early check-in allowed a nap before dinner at local restaurant arranged by the concierge. Service was beyond expectations. One day after cleaning of our room had occurred I needed another box of kleenex which Was promptly delivered upon request. I received a followup phone call 10 minutes later to make sure every need was being met. We liked the location away from the city as it allowed for quiet when needed to gear up for the next day's activities. Also in talking with other travelers staying in the city our room was much more generous in size. I anxiously await the time we can return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but some service issues”
Reviews.Author: styleandfashion888
Reviews.Content: Another great stay at this Roman hotel! We really like it due to the fantastic facilities and room size. We stayed here many times before in summer / this time was the first time in colder months and was slightly less exciting. here is why: 1. Rooms are very nice, modern and spacious but they are starting to have maintenance issues - our bathroom had quite strong toilet smell around the toilet. So you couldn't have a bath as all you'd have this unpleasant smell right in your face. 2. There was a bit of mould around the bath taps. 3. Service wasn't what we remembered - one of the waitresses was plain rude at breakfast which came as a shock at this usually very friendly hotel. 4. Dinner at the main restaurant is very bland without any atmosphere. In summer it is served on a pretty terrace outside but in colder months in a brightly lit room without any vibe. Food was also very plain and not exciting. 5. We went to the spa for couples massage, specifically requested double's room - they put us in a single room together and just added a very old shaky squeaky massage bed next to the permanent one. The bed squeaked every time the therapist touched me - which is all the time. Very unpleasant. That's enough with the negatives; on a positive side - 1. It has a great gym, better than most hotels / nice spa (unless you ask for a couple's room) / turkish baths / indoor poll - excellent! 2. Big rooms/ bathrooms 3. Great breakfast 4. Most importantly you can often get excellent prices in this hotel if you book in advance. All in all, we'll be back but it would be great if management could iron out a few of the above issues. And don't book at retails rates, I don't think it's worth $500-600 Euro per night. Look for a deal!

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Stay In Beautiful Rome”
Reviews.Author: katieg249886
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 nights in September and had a wonderful trip. As it was our first time in Rome we wanted to book the best, the Cavalieri was lovley but i did have a few reservations. A beautiful internal entrance and a warm welcome on arrival however the outside building looks tired and more of a high rise block of flats, the entrance view is of a huge pylon! Room was spaciaous and clean a huge bed and lovely crabtree and Evelyn products in the bathroom, the room was faultless. Very Nice indeed. The shuttle into central Rome is definately needed it goes around every hour and without this service Im not sure we would have booked this hotel. As the hotel is around 1/2 hour away from the centre. The decor inside the hotel is truely stunning. And breakfast is great with a huge choice be sure to add it to your booking as very expensive to add it seperately. One morning asked for cutlery twice and tea 3 times before it appeared. Drinks in the evening were very expensive too our bill was 100 euro for 4 cocktails and 1 small beer! My main dissapointment was on the Sunday, as this was our last full day we decided to take advantage of the beautiful pool and grounds and enjoy the stunning weather, we wandered to the pool after breakfast around 11am we had to pay 20 euros each to use the outside pool/lounger.....Unheard of in most hotels It was absoultely packed we couldnt get a space anywhere. After asking the pool attendant what to do, he took us to the kids pool and bought us 2 sunloungers, after around an hour a huge inflatable slide was put up and obviously the kids loved it but was so noisy and not relaxing. I asked the pool bar staff why it was so busy and she said it was like this every sunday the local residents arrive for a family fun day......my word it was sooo busy. At lunch my husband and I decided to share a club sandwhich I got the attention of the waitress she said she would be back in 5 mins to take the order, fine, but still nothing half an hour later, I walked up to place the order she burst into tears and said she is just too busy and cant cope with all the lunch orders.....i was gob smacked. I felt really sorry for her though. Anyway the order was taken by a waiter including 2 drinks, the drinks never arrived though. Not the relaxing day we hoped for. All in all Rome was great the hotel was beautiful but i wouldnt stay here again, purely location and the service wasnt what it should have been. I have been lucky enough to stay in some of the worlds leading hotels visualy this is up there woth them sadly the service isnt.

Reviews.Title: “Nice treat”
Reviews.Author: smitk037
Reviews.Content: A wonderful place to use your points if you are a Hilton hhonors member. We had a Rome view and it was amazing. A 15 min ride outside the city in a beautiful setting. We took advantage of the free shuttle into Rome, but the stop was hard to find in the city as there is no sign. You literally stand on the corner or via venetto under a briwn sign advertising a chinese restaurant. Hotel is lovely. A bit dated (isn't everything in Rome) The brunch/breakfast is amazing! Free lounge for gold and diamond members is ok. Limited offerings and not at all cozy. Extremely bright lighting and seems more like a banquet or meeting room that's been set up as an alternative to using the club level lounge. All in all-a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic experience; a first rate staff providing superior service”
Reviews.Author: ccg001
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our stay at the Rome Cavalieri. From the moment we arrived, we were taken care of by their superior staff. Everyone we came in contact with was friendly, helpful, and just very kind. Beyond that, the rooms have all sorts of extras that you won't commonly see in a hotel (power shade on the balcony windows/door to give complete privacy and keep out the morning sunlight, mirror that pulls out to become a soundproof door to keep sounds from the hallway out at night, your choice of pillow, etc., etc. The list goes on.) The breakfast buffet was the best we've ever had - 2 rooms of a large variety of wonderful food, including plenty of fresh fruit, a wonderful variety of breads with jams and honeys, amazing sausage, and many, many other items. We are Gold level Hilton Honors members, so the breakfast was free for us; I'm not sure what the regular price is, but regardless of what it was...it was wonderful and probably worth it at least once. The fitness center was fantastic (lots of machines), and the indoor pool wasn't large but is very nice and nice and warm. They also delivered a complimentary bottle of champagne to us for our celebration of our anniversay...which was a wonderful surprise/gesture. With the balcony over facing the sunset/city of Rome, it made for a very memorable/relaxing time. I could go on and on about the wonderful experience, but the bottom line is if you are looking for a relaxing oasis a bit outside of the action, this is a fantastic place to say. If you do splurge for the hotel or if you cash in on Hilton Honors points for a reward stay and are otherwise budget conscience, just note that again it is a bit outside of the heart of the action. The hotel offers a convenient, complimentary shuttle service. Currently the last shuttle back to the hotel leaves the city at 8 PM, so again just keep that in mind. It would be a shame if you didn't fully appreciate this hotel because it wasn't in the right location or the right situation for you. That being said, I understand that they may consider a later shuttle in the future, so check into that before making a final decision if you are concerned about the shuttle time. Also, if you are out past the shuttle's last run, or if you aren't near the pickup location, ask the hotel staff before you leave for the day for a current estimate of a taxi fare back to the hotel. I heard other guests say (and read on another site) that some taxi drivers take advantage of customers when they hear the words Waldor or Rome Cavalieri and charge a higher fare. In any case, this isn't uncommon among taxis in Rome - just make sure you know a fair price beforehand and negotiate a price before you get in the car. If the hotel is right for your situation/plans for your visit to Rome...definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location off the beaten path in Rome”
Reviews.Author: PRWeezer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights at the end of a 10-day cruise and overall enjoyed our stay. We chose the hotel based on the suggestion of friends, who also highly recommended splurging for a room with access to the Imperial Club. As a result, we took advantage of Hilton’s standby upgrade program (for a cost) and got upgraded to a room on the 7th floor with access to the lounge. The front desk representative who checked us in was friendly and professional. She gave us a thorough overview of all the amenities we could access with our Imperial Club room, unfortunately we didn’t have time to enjoy all of those perks. In fact, all of the staff we encountered were extremely professional and efficient. We were pleased by the offerings in the Imperial Club. They had a nice breakfast of hot and cold items, light lunch (including a great pea soup!) and canapés in the evening, as well as beer and wine throughout the day. The lounge didn’t open until 7:00 a.m. which seems late, especially for a hotel that appears to cater to business people and conferences. Since we had a 7:00 airport pick up on our departure day it would have been nice to have had a cup of coffee before leaving. The view from the lounge was spectacular, especially as we enjoyed a glass of wine from one of the terrace tables at sunset. Our room was on the front side of the hotel (non-city-view side), and far enough down the hall that the satellite tower wasn’t as bothersome as others have mentioned. We weren’t looking directly at it. The room had a good amount of space with the seating area and terrace. We especially liked the size of the bathroom, having just come off a cruise where the bathroom in our suite was tight. My husband particularly liked the large flat-screen TV and the towel warmers in the bathroom. From the hotel we walked down the hill to a nice neighborhood restaurant (Ristorante Luciano) that was recommended by the concierge. That same area also had a small grocery store where we bought some wine and snacks. The hotel is in a quiet, residential area which for us was a nice change from the hustle and bustle of the city. Rome was very crowded when we were there, more so than I recall from a previous visit, making a quiet hotel and a walk-able, residential neighborhood that much more appealing. Our one difficulty was the temperature and lack of adequate climate control. The air conditioning in the room wasn’t cool at all when we arrived. We were told it was because the week prior had been cold, so the hotel’s climate control system had been switched from air conditioning to heat. We like it to be fairly cool when we sleep, especially in a bed with such luxurious linens & fluffy duvet. The days we were there it did get warm in the room during the afternoon. We opened the door to our terrace which helped, though first thing in the morning there was some noise from people arriving & departing at the hotel entrance. The second night we left our terrace door open when we went to dinner, only to have it closed by housekeeping during the turn-down service, so it was very warm when we returned. We called the front desk to see about getting a fan for the room, which was not possible. The hotel representative offered to refund some of our cost in compensation for the lack of climate control. We were very pleased with her offer (we had not asked for compensation) and felt the problem was dealt with as adequately and professionally as possible given no alternative to impact the climate control system. We would recommend this hotel for people who want to have all the benefits of Rome but away from the noise and traffic.

Reviews.Title: “a classical 5 star experience”
Reviews.Author: zwiers
Reviews.Content: if you spend over 100 nights a year in hotels it is safe to say that 95% of them you forget the moment you leave. The Cavalieri is one of the true classics that creates a memory forever. The Cavalieri delivers on all fronts, from the asthetic to the service and ambiance, it is a 5 star experience. Here no experiments with trendy purple lights or staff that is employed on its looks alone, the Cavaliery stands well above all that nonsense and it shows what it is with pride. My wife and i truly loved the feeling of nipping champagne in the lobby bar overlooking the pool, great atmosphere. A definate pro for us was the location, quiet, silent and away from the city noise. Having breakfast outside, next to the pool and the only sound is of birds. and this in Rome. However there is a downside to the opulence and luxury and that comes with a price. Room rates in my opinion are in touch with other 5 star hotels, but you will have some wtf! moments every now and then. beer 10, champagne by the glass 20, cocktail 27, a cup of tea 10. A hamburger 28 WTF!?!, pizza margarita 25 etc. Order roomservice and they charge you 5 Euro per person deliverycharge ( wtf?). Of course you order and pay but it leaves an aftertaste behind of a a place that delivers and makes you feel good but is after your money in the first place. Will we come back? yes definately so in our opinion it is just the best hotel in rome and suits our taste. But.......

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheButterflyEffect75
Reviews.Content: Awesome place, beautifully located on a hill, with astounding view of Rome (tip: go for a room that is located in the 5th floor or higher). Quiet place, ca. 15 mins by a taxi from the centre, there is also an hourly shuttle service to Piazza Barberini. The only con: if you like architecture and stylish buildings, well, you won't be impressed ;) Anyway, interiors are classic and beautiful. One more remark - there is a large conference centre, so if you come in time of a major congress, this place will be totally crowded. Definitely, one of the best 5* hotels in Rome, worth recommending and worth its price.

Reviews.Title: “A MUST Splurge!”
Reviews.Author: devo1645
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our last night in Rome and it was the best way to end our Roman holiday. Best view, accommodating staff, and fantastic food and drinks in the Imperial Club. MUSTS: - upgrade to the Imperial Club and get a room with a city view. Breathtaking day and night views of Rome and Vatican City. - take a tour of the hotel. it's magnificent and seriously a museum. The concierge nicely gave us a tour. - hang out poolside. Worth every penny...or should I say Euro. I would go back to Rome just to stay here again. My favorite Waldorf Astoria property yet.

Reviews.Title: “Rome Cavalieri Excellent Escape”
Reviews.Author: lenore a
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 days in October at the Rome Cavalieri, a high end Hilton property that outshines even the NY Waldorf Astoria. We enjoyed every moment, from the helpful reception and concierge to the lovely, well appointed, spacious room. It is an exception for a bustling city like Rome, where peace at nighttime is hard to find. The shuttle service made access to the city easy and flexible, and only 15 minutes away. We loved the ambience of the hotel and felt like movie stars...a terrific experience. Excellent service and superb facility, including spa.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Emily C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here during the last days of our Italian honeymoon. As other reviewers have noted, it's a bit out of the way, so we decided to make this the last stop on our journey and just relax on the hotel grounds. This turned out to be a FANTASTIC idea! When we arrived, there were tons of police cars and secret service in the parking area because apparently Vice President Biden was staying at the hotel as well. Despite all the extra hoopla, staff could not have been more friendly or efficient during our check in. They noted it was our honeymoon, and immediately upgraded us to a beautiful suite. When we arrived at our room, there was prosecco, a selection of fruit, and a handwritten card to greet us. The room itself was absolutely amazing. Beautiful, elegant touches were everywhere, and the bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in. The thing that really blew me away however was the view. We had a gorgeous terrace outside both the living room and the bedroom, with the most amazing view of Rome. I cannot express how worth it it is to spring for a room with a good view. I spent most of my stay lounging on the terrace and just soaking in the beauty of it all. We dined at La Pergola one night, the Michelin three star restaurant on the top floor of the restaurant. I'm going to write a separate review for La Pergola, but it was by far the best evening of our trip, and one of the top three meals of my life. Not only was the food outstanding, the service could not have been more perfect. You have to book months in advance to get a reservation, but it is absolutely worth the effort. The Rome Cavalieri was my favourite hotel we stayed at during our honeymoon, and I will definitely stay here again whenever I return to Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Hotel with views to match”
Reviews.Author: berentis
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at this beautiful hotel, we had an Imperial room with balcony and city view, it was superb. The room was spotless and very comfortable, the bed was probably made by Carlsberg as it was the best one I have ever slept in. The Imperial Club offered canapes and drinks from 11am after breakfast service was completed. The food was excellent, we visited the second restaurant as we didn't get to the 3 michelin star restaurant, only because we couldn't get a reservation, a lesson learned there..! The bar staff were great and very entertaining, talking of which there was live music in the bar every night we were there, excellent. There is a complimentary shuttle from the hotel to the city centre with a return service which was very good, be aware though, it gets busy so arrive early to secure a place. We had a wonderful time at the Rome Cavalieri and would recommend it to anyone who wants to relax and pamper themselves, just a little...

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, Overrated, Pretentious, and not conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: DavisKGD
Reviews.Content: We were on a 3 week trip hitting the major spots in Europe and stayed at all Hilton or Hilton Brand hotels and this was supposed to be the "best" hotel we were staying at. Unfortunately, it didn't live up to the hype. Relatively speaking, it was the worst of the hotels we stayed at. Don't get me wrong, room patio view was great and common areas looked great too. You will get the standard amenities, A/C, and clean rooms, but that's not what you pay extra for. The food was beyond over priced (8 euro for an espresso, 75 euro lunch buffet per person) and average, the service was average with staff who were nice 50% of the time, the executive lounge was sub par and only open in the evening, it's not near simple conveniences like cafes or stores, and the rooms were average. Initially, I didn't mind that it wasn't centrally located because they had a shuttle taking guests downtown until I found out that you may not have a seat if you didn't show up at least 10 minutes before departure and it only ran until 8. If your going to Rome on a vacation, I suggest staying in a more central location to get the best experience possible. Many good restaurants don't even open until 8PM for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Great view but not worth it”
Reviews.Author: ruthL8690
Reviews.Content: This was my second experience staying at the Rome Cavalieri. While the view is incredible and the hotel is over the top, it is not worth the price or distance from the city. The hotel is getting a little dated in the common areas and needs to be "freshened up". From what I can tell, there have been no updates made since I stayed there 10 years ago. One great thing- the breakfast at the hotel is incredible. It was included in our rate and was a great start to the day.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Alex M
Reviews.Content: The hotel Cavaleri was a fantastic experience for my wife and I. The service and hotel staff were great....the rooms and views are beautiful. We would go back to Rome just stay at the Cavaleri.

Reviews.Title: “Resort atmosphere close to Rome tourist attractions”
Reviews.Author: texaninflorida
Reviews.Content: Booked with AmEx Platinum so was upgraded to concierge floor with city view. Room had balcony with view of Rome and pool. Gorgeous room with shower/tub, single sink, bidet and heated towels. Quiet room with ample space and neoclassical furniture;old world feel. Lounge buffet was plentiful and varied and very helpful staff but cannot take food to your room which may be a European feature as we have always done so in US. Excellent gym, spa, indoor heated pool. Nice jogging trail on site and around neighborhood. Dinner at 3 star restaurant excellent but pricey and late reservation meant not so great view; ask for table with view of vatican! Booked directly with hotel as AmEx concierge told me they were booked for several weeks and could not get us a table for 4. Only downside is $15.00 cab fare each way to most tourist attractions. Hotel offers shuttle to Piazza Barberini daily which was great and complimentary; somewhat limited hours.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the expense”
Reviews.Author: Kristen G
Reviews.Content: We went on a 2.5 week trip to Europe and stayed in this hotel the last night as a treat for the end of our vacation. The rooms were very pricey but we figured it must be worth it at that cost....honestly I would have much rather stayed somewhere much centrally located to Rome. You had to shuttle into Rome and the shuttle takes a break from 12:30-3:30 for lunch, it runs every other hours besides that until 8 pm which limited our day to what we could do. We ended up taking a taxi back becuase we wanted to stay later in Rome than 8 pm. The rooms were very nice, but the breakfast was expensive (they did offer coffee and a pastry for free in the front of the hotel) the drinks and dinner were extremely pricey and if we wanted to use the pool you had to pay for it. It seemed as though you paid a great deal for a room and then had to pay for anything besides sleep....In my honest opionion it was beautiful and away from the fast paced streets of Rome but that wasnt what I was traveling to Rome for. Would not stay here again. Oh and the beds were rock hard, which some people love but I do not..I slept terribly.

Reviews.Title: “Very good but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: TorbenFromDenmark
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights September 2011 with my wife. We had an attractive rate since we reserved during the winter sale at half price. Positive: Large, well equipped, comfortable rooms. We stayed in an executive room and the lounge was very good: Food above average, very service oriented and attentive staff. Pool area is very nice and when staying at executive level there are no problems with extra payment etc. Negative: Location is quite far from city centre and there is nothing of interest in the immediate neighbourhood. The hotel in general seems a bit tiered around the corners. The rooms facing the back have a very uninspiring view. Tip: If you’re going to the Vatican Museum buy your tickets online in advance and you can walk directly into the museum avoiding the long lines.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel with incredible views of Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Susan_in_Roswell
Reviews.Content: It's hard to come up with enough superlatives to adequately describe this property! The welcome we received when checking in made us instantly feel like VIPs. My husband is a Hilton Honors Diamond member, and we used points to stay for two nights prior to embarking on a Mediterranean cruise. All of the amenities we were to receive during our stay were described to us, and then we were escorted to our room. As others have remarked, I don't know of a better property to use Hilton Honors points than this one. The art is stunningly beautiful, and the pool area and grounds are luxurious. The views from our balcony were very good, and could have been have been the best if we had been willing to wait for a room to become available on a higher floor. But since we were tired after the overnight flight from the US, and we planned to be out and about in Rome during our stay, we opted to get into a room immediately upon arrival. The room was beautiful, the bathroom large with all the expected amenities, and the balcony quite nice with that lovely view of the grounds and Rome below. The only thing we would have wished to change was the mattress - it was on the hard side, but in the scheme of things, not a big deal. We were thrilled to be in Rome in such a beautiful hotel! The breakfast buffet was one of the amenities we received as Diamond level guests, and it had everything you could possibly want for breakfast in a very pretty setting. I loved the wall paintings of the cherubs in the smaller room. We enjoyed the buffet both mornings during our stay. We took taxis to and from the city, since we started each day in the Vatican area. Coming back to the hotel each night was like returning to a glittering oasis. It was so amazing to have such a restful retreat so near to the hustle and bustle of downtown Rome. There were several tips I gleaned from other Trip Advisor reviews that are worth repeating. Piazza le Delle Medaglie d'Oro is within easy walking distance (less than 10 minutes) of the hotel; turn right out of the hotel entrance and stay on Via Alberto Cadlolo until you run into it. There you will find ATMs, pastry shops, bars, a fresh market, restaurants, and more. It provides other options for dining within walking distance if you prefer not to dine in the hotel. We ate dinner in a Sicilian seafood restaurant here on our first night. My sister and her husband walked here each morning for their breakfast, as the hotel buffet breakfast was not complimentary for them. If you are a Bank of America customer, there is no charge for using BNP Paribas ATMs, and there is a BNP Paribas branch with ATM in this Piazza. We used RomeCabs for transfers from the airport to the hotel, and from the hotel to the port, and we were very pleased with their service. All our interactions with the Rome Cavalieri hotel staff were professional and cordial. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay Oct. 8th - 10th, and highly recommend the Rome Cavalieri to anyone visiting Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Slightly dated and rough around the edges”
Reviews.Author: RST1974
Reviews.Content: Over the years I have tended to agree with tripadvisor consensus and trusted the sight so much that I only use this site to do my research. However, this is one of the few times I wished I had done some more research. Good: Peaceful location away from the hustle and bustle of Rome. The courtesy bus service is regular and punctual. good choice of bars and restaurants with good quality food Good and well equipped gym. Bad: Club lounge, the food quality is poor and service is begrudgingly provided. It reminds me of the food and service provided by nearly bankrupt airlines. Rooms slightly worn and tatty around the edges. Overall it felt more fours star than five star.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in The Hills of Rome!”
Reviews.Author: BOLDMissionHills_KS
Reviews.Content: The Rome Cavalier is one of the best Hilton Hotels anywhere. If you're a Hilton Honors Member, this is where you want to use your points. The hotel is located in the hills of Rome and is about a 50 euro taxi fair ride from the Rome airport.This hotel is a wonderful retreat after a long day in the city. As you enter the hotel, you are greeted by attentive hotel staff and a beautiful lobby. The outdoor pool area is gorgeous and looks like a picture out of a luxury travel magazine. The gym and spa are the best I have ever seen and were recently voted the best in Europe by one of our US travel magazines. The guest rooms are first rate with wonderful walk out balconies and comfortable beds. If you're lucky enough to have a city view room of Rome, you will be delighted beyond belief. We sat and enjoyed the views of Rome for hours. The hotel signature restaurant is first class and one of the best in all of Rome, but very pricy. Hilton Gold and Diamond Members are given access to a first floor lounge for an evening reception of light food and drink (which includes wine and Prosecco till 11pm). The free shuttle service to the center of Rome is first class. As Gold Hilton Honors Members, we were given free breakfast with our reservation. It was the best complimentary breakfast I have ever received from a rewards program. In summary, I loved this hotel and would recommend it highly

Reviews.Title: “Beyond my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: caugh51654
Reviews.Content: I read every review I could find on this property for months in anticipation of our trip to Rome in advance of a cruise. The vast majority were very positive, but a few of the negatives ones caused me a few red flags and I am SOOO pleased to report that any concerns disappeared immediately upon arrival! Honestly I've decided that some people will complain about anything... I booked using Hilton HHonors points (I am a Diamond member) for 5 nites pre-cruise beginning October 4th and used Rome Cabs for all ground transportation (also highly recommended except for one issue - review will be posted on another thread for that). We arrived at the front entrance and I was prepared for aloof and unfriendly doormen from numerous reviews but even after the overnight flight and arriving looking less than beautiful :) we were warmly welcomed, given a claim ticket for our luggage and escorted to the front desk. When I provided my name, I was advised that there was a special registration area for me and I was taken to a small alcove next to the front desk, seated, offered something to drink, and all of the registration paperwork was handled by a wonderful front desk representative (I am sorry I didnt catch his name to thank him since I was so tired from the flight but he was really welcoming and professional!). We were given all of the information we would need, including shuttle schedule, access to spa and breakfast and escorted personally to our room which we were delighted to discover had an AMAZING view of the Eternal City. (I did not pay for an upgrade to the Imperial floor as we knew we would be in the City most of the time and I was prepared for a room without the view but this FAR exceeded my expectations!) When we arrived to our room, we found a lovely bottle of Prosecco with a Happy Birthday note to my Mother (the reason for this trip!) which was such a nice surprise. Thanks to the Management for this very thoughtful gesture! The room was SO much more beautiful than the photos I have seen online! Just perfectly appointed with the two beds that we had requested, beautiful furnishings, flat screen TV, amazing bathroom with all of the accoutrements, fluffly towels, robes and slippers, pillow and bath menus (those would have had extra cost but we didnt use them). There were complimentary bottles of water at all times and thankfully, since we were jetlagged, a room service menu. Our housekeeper did a great job keeping the room clean! The room felt and smelled clean, and there was turndown service at nite with a box of little gumdrop candies, fresh water, ice and towels. We enjoyed the remote-operated metal blackout curtain for the balcony slider door although the morning view of the City was a beautiful thing to wake up to...the giant hinged floor to ceiling mirror in the entry foyer doubled as a sound barrier and served to muffle any hallway noise - although we were close to the end of the hallway and out of the traffic pattern, we didnt hear much noise at all. We could have spent the entire time on the balcony overlooking the view. We had room 663 and I cant say enough how beautiful the sweeping view of the City was with St. Peters in the right foreground and the entire City sprawling before you! You could look down and see the beautiful pool area and the al fresco dining areas, along with the atrium covered indoor pool. Every nite there was a live musician singing out by the pool and on the first nite, for some unknown occasion - there were fireworks! We decided they were to welcome us to Rome! We opted to stay in the first nite and rest up so we could start fresh in the morning and took a closer look at the room service menu. Now you have already read in previous reviews that the cost of food at this hotel is not cheap. I was prepared and since we used points for the room, we splurged on a club sandwich, a beautiful panini with proscuitto and cheese, a caprese salad, some desserts, tea and coffee, and it was about $150 euro. Just know this and be prepared to bring snacks or go out for your meals if this is an issue for you. Even such a casual meal was served with complete flair though! Two waiters wheeled in elegant cloth covered tables with silver domes on the plates, little fruit tarts to go along with the tea and coffee service, and wonderful bread basket, along with olive oils, balsamic vinegar, etc...everything we could possibly need was there for us. I have never enjoyed room service so much and it was part of the fun of that first nite to be able to watch the fireworks from the balcony - in our robes - and enjoy that wonderful view. Just WOW! We overslept most of the time and missed breakfast, but we did catch it one time. The buffet is on the lower level below the main lobby and takes up two rooms with every imaginable option. The breakfast was free for Diamond members (I am not positive of the cost if you have to pay), and it was again presented with the style you quickly get used to in this elegant property. Now for Americans you will likely find a few things to complain about at any European breakfast buffet. The orange juice is not our "fresh squeezed" variety - they do olives better than citrus I've decided :), and the scrambled eggs are always undercooked, but this is just what you find in Europe - but in every other way, you are blown away by the dozens of choices of jams, preserves, every type of milk, yogurt, pastry, meats, etc. Since we are not big breakfast eaters, we only did the buffet once, opting instead to grab pastry and coffee in the City as part of the local experience. As you know, this location is not in the City center, so know this before you book, and decide whether a 15 minute taxi ride morning and evening is OK for you, or if you would prefer to be in the middle of the City. I have done it both ways now and can honestly say I am OK either way. Obviously there is a short drive to/from the City, but the plus is that you get dropped off exactly where you want to go every day. The taxi drivers are part of the experience also - some friendly, some gruff, some will let you practice your Italian and tell you what that statue was that you just passed...it's nice to see the various neighborhoods too that you would not get to see otherwise...I actually kind of enjoyed the experience of leaving the hustle and bustle of the city at nite and rising the hill of Mount Maria to our gorgeous view. For us - again - it was a no brainer since the room was free, the taxi's were a small cost alternative. The shuttle schedule, while easy enough to work with the written (and reliable) schedule, didnt always match our plans, so we ended up using taxis except once or twice. The shuttle bus is nice and large and it was never even 1/2 full. However we always wanted to stay in the City later than 8PM, so we taxi'd back to the hotel in the evening. The shuttle stop at Piazza Barberini is in a good location (surrounded by some pretty good Italian restaurants, pastry shops, pharmacies, etc - look for the giant shell sculpture for your landmark), but we sometimes wanted to end the nite in, for example, Piazza Navona or Campo de Fiori and it was easy to grab a taxi for approx. $12 euro each way. We just anticipated the taxi costs and were prepared with lots of $2 and $5 euros at all times. (Keep in mind you cant hail a taxi in Rome - they wont stop...you have to find the nearest taxi stand...usually just outside the perimeter of the piazzas.) We did not use the pool or spa - were just too busy in the City so I cant speak for those. We did visit the Concierge lounge on the lobby level a couple of times for a lite snack or coffee. They have pretty basic fruit, cheese, beverages and prosecco but it is a very nice lounge with good service attendants...the only thing I could find to complain about there is that they could use some "mood" lighting - the place was so brightly lit I felt I was in an operating room. ... Maybe a dimmer switch would work well there. :) The checkout process on Sunday morning as we were departing for the cruise ship port was a bit hectic because a couple of exiting guests were arguing with the 2 front desk clerks about their bill. I was finally taken care of by a third representative who opened another PC to help me out since my car was waiting...no big deal there at all but just allow yourself a few minutes on a weekend morning to check out because they do not have an express check out process that I could see. Without hesitation I would recommend this as THE best place to use your Hilton points and I am already planning a return trip! It was truly the highlight of our trip and made Mom's birthday trip memorable for her!

Reviews.Title: “There are many points I like but also some points I do not like at all.”
Reviews.Author: trustfriend
Reviews.Content: For example, the room facility itself, the view from the room veranda and delicious restaurant I liked much. But I did not like at all the smell of the toilet, insufficient sound proof of the room and not attentive work of receptionists. 1)I asked the housekeeping to remove the smell apparently coming from urine and it simply disappeared. Why was it not done without my request spontaneously ? The insufficient housekeeping level is too bad for this class of hotel. 2)Now being bothered by noise coming from anywhere I do not know, I am writing this in the room. I hear also noise from the window, next room or above room too. My room floor is covered by a carpet so I do not understand why I hear the sound of moving chairs or other furniture from the above. 3)I stay here under 3 consecutive reservations. In the same situation, I was sometimes reminded in other hotels to come to the reception to reactivate the key room card at the beginning of each reservation. But in this hotel, I was not told so and just told that I could stay in the same room until the 3rd reservation ends. As a hotel of this class, I do not accept this kind of negavie points. But too good to be ranked as average by me because of other positive points.

Reviews.Title: “Did not meet my expectations”
Reviews.Author: Tala L
Reviews.Content: Very good location. My room was on the 6th floor ( ?661). Window was broken - unable to lock. Bathroom was smelly. No any view at all. Room was dark. Very old TV with poor reception. Dusty floor for 6 days!!! Reasonable breakfast. Free Internet - lobby. Excellent restaurant with very nice food next door

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but they think they can over charge for the privilege.”
Reviews.Author: mike w
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great setting and very beautiful inside but it is spoilled by the excessive charges for room service and in the restaurants. We were 30 euros for two cups of tea by room service. The mini bar prices were the highest I have ever seen 8 euros for a very small bottle of water. Such a pity they were too greedy otherwise it would have been an ideal hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outrageous (in a good way)!”
Reviews.Author: Niko137
Reviews.Content: Wow, just wow. Please take my comments with a grain of salt due to an outrageous stroke of luck. We had booked two rooms (a regular Rome view and a small suite). When we arrived we were asked if we were willing to give up our rooms to have our two couples stay together in one suite. I was not too sure if that was something that I wanted to do, altough I was travelling with my wife and my brother and his wife, I thought sharing a room would be a little too much. In order to convice us, the hostess showed us our two booked rooms (they were both excellent) and then showed us the Presedential Suite (yeah, the one with the original Andy Warhol's and the jacuzzi roof deck). We immediately jumped on the chance to spend more time together in the luxury of this suite. We were not dissapointed. Incredible views of Rome, a sliding roof to the terrace with a jacuzzi, this place oozed luxury. Despite the fact that I can speak conversational Italian, the entire staff was fluent in english and were willing to offer their help whenever needed. We had access to the Imperial Lounge, which offered complimentary refreshments and snacks. This hotel is away from the madness of downtown, but is only a 12 euro cab ride away. I truly believe that I would be writing a similarly glowing review had we stayed in our original room, but this was truly a once in a lifetime experience.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible”
Reviews.Author: ChrisandHolli
Reviews.Content: Of all of the Hilton Honor hotels that we have stayed at, the Rome Cavalieri is by far the finest. It all started when we were greeted at the door and continued through to our departure. We had a beautiful view of Rome, very romantic. We use this stay to gauge other Hilton honor hotels to. And, none have come close.

Reviews.Title: “Rome Vacation Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tracif45
Reviews.Content: What an amazing hotel. The property is just beautiful. Staff was very pleasant. The rooms fit for a king. The pool area wonderful. The breakfast amazing! Can’t think of enough words to describe what a great hotel this is.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: CPAALP
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in August to celebrate my husbands 40th. Used HHonors points and upgraded to Rome view Imperial. Had read all the previous reviews so knew about the location not being central but thought the access to the pool would be nice in the August heat - it was so nice to take the airconditioned bus, sightsee then go back early afternoon, gym, then relax by the pool. The access to the Imperial lounge & Rome view balcony made it so special - waking up to the view, relaxing breakfast in the lounge (after breakfast drinking champagne on my husbands 40th birthday on the outside balcony), varied snacks and drinks throughout the day and night, finishing with cocktails prepared by the lounge staff. It would have been nice if the shuttle ran later in the evening but a taxi back didnt cost much (one evening we cut our night in Rome centre short and took the last shuttle as we had the lounge to return to & rest our weary legs). One day we walked from the hotel to the Vatican, extremely hot morning, but didnt take long then taxi'd back. Picked up our hire car from the Hertz desk after we checked out to then travel down to the Amalfi Coast. The hotel met and exceeded our expectations and we would love to return, just have to win the lottery!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington DC, District of Columbia, USA
Reviews.Title: “Only the finest!”
Reviews.Author: Sisco C
Reviews.Content: Truly the best part of our trip to Rome was this hotel/resort! We traveled to Rome for our honeymoon, stayed 7 nights at this wonderful hotel. The restaurants, pool, spa, and general ambience are amazing, world class. The room had a magnificent view of rome from this hillside where it is seated. Some complained about the distance from downtown Rome, but I actually appreciated it, nice and quiet area to relax in. Plus, when we wanted to go to town, there was a free elegant shuttle leaving every hour, for free. Also there is a small town area within 10 min walking distance, coffee, drugstore, small convenience items for sale. TIP: Pay extra for the Imperial Floor with access to Imperial lounge, the free breakfast and drinks/snack items all day is a lifesaver.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning view of Rome”
Reviews.Author: taxreduction
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here while celebrating our 20th wedding anniversary this summer. We were overwhelmed with the view of Rome and Vatican city from our room. I would suggest a room in the back of the hotel that has city views and the higher floor the better. The room was top notch with soundproofing and fabulous decor. We were greeted with a welcome bottle of champagne and felt pampered for our four night stay. The hotel is a bit out of the way for touristy destinations but they do offer a free shuttle and the cab ride back (if you stay in the city late) was not bad. Front of the hotel could use some upgrades for this style hotel but once inside you quickly forget about the exterior front. Be prepared to pay extra for everything including wi-fi and pool access. Concierge services were top notch and the staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Fabulous hotel for a special occasion or luxurious retreat.

Reviews.Title: “rome hotel”
Reviews.Author: sue clay m
Reviews.Content: really nice stay wonderful room and view of rome. easy trip into the city

Reviews.Title: “Only Fair”
Reviews.Author: Alvey
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rome Cavalieri in October 2011. My room had mold in the bathtub and significant mold in the shower. This is discusting regardless of the rate per night, but for over $300.00 USD/nightI was disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SandyDallasTX
Reviews.Content: From the moment we pulled up to the moment we checked out, the service was impeccable and the ammenities second to none. This is the second Waldorf Astoria we have stayed at and the brand continues to exceed expectations. The lobby was gorgeous, the room was large, comfortable, and beautifully decorated. The breakfast buffet was extensive and delicious. The staff went out of their way to accomodate our requests. My only regret was not being able to use the spa and fitness facilities due to long days touring Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful position”
Reviews.Author: EE528
Reviews.Content: This hotel scores very highly in terms of professional, well-trained and helpful staff. The view is terrific if you have a room above floor 5 facing room. The restaurant food is generally very good, albeit expensive but we did have one meal which neither of us enjoyed (salmon in a strange, sweet sauce). The breakfasts are amazing - we counted 10 different types of milk alone! Excellent range of hot and cold food and this was the best meal of the day. Most of the staff know that the tea tastes better if boiling water is placed over the tea bag rather than hot water and a separate tea bag arriving at the table. The rooms are very well appointed, clean and comfortable. There is a courtesy bus to the centre of Rome, which works well although taxis are plentiful and cost c. euro 15 each way.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel Away from the bustle of the city”
Reviews.Author: ATrainVB
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rome Cavalieri with my girlfriend for two nights. We stayed on points, so I can't speak to the cost of the hotel, but I will do my best to review the rest. The hotel is VERY nice, and VERY fancy. The concierge club is extremely well appointed. The rooms are top notch, the facilities are equivalent to any of the 5 star hotels I've ever stayed at. Keep in mind it's not a modern hotel, so don't expect that when you get there. The hotel is out of the city, but it's less than 10 euro taxi from the hotel to the coloseum. There is also a hotel shuttle that will take you for free to the center of the city, very near the Trevi fountain. The grounds and the hotel are impeccably nice expect old world charm, with top notch service in a quiet setting. The staff was all very helpful, very attentive and willing to help with anything I asked of them. As someone who travels for work and stays in hotels every week, I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “For that class of hotel ... too many wrong things happened”
Reviews.Author: RatkoM
Reviews.Content: Spend a week in this hotel - actually still here when I am writing the review. I think this hotel is great example of the hotel that wants to keep its reputation, but it just - does not work. Let me give you some examples: not all rooms have a great view of the Rome, as advertised on pictures. Actually some of them are looking at big communication tower on top of the hill where hotel is. Be carefull - only odd room numbers have good view (XX1, XX3... so on). If you want to change the room: sorry we are full. If you want to change the reoom because you want king size and not two beds, same answer. Minibar - cannot open it anyway, dont know why. Found some wine glasses in front of the door when we first entered the room - they stayed there for a two days before someone picked them up. Asked for help to consierge and specifically asked for a confirmation on a voice mail - nothing happened. Location is good if you have a room view and you want some kind of isolation in a lux hotel - otherwise it is very far from the town itself. But the worst thing was that for a whole day they did some serious rebuilding of the rooms two floors below our room - you could not het any rest in the afternoon since people were using some serious tools down there - very noisy and very unconfortable. As I have said - this is too luxury and expensive hotel for this kind of experience.

Reviews.Title: “Over the top, elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: ThunderBay17
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cavalieri post-cruise. We arranged private transportation through the hotel to pick us up from the boat as well as transfers to the airport. We had an absolutely amazing king room on the Imperial Club level facing the city. We loved the exclusivity for club level members such as separate pool, spa facilities, private elevator and especially the Imperial Lounge. During our first night, we were enjoying the Rome skyline with a glass of champagne (compliments of the hotel as we were celebrating our 25th anniversary) when we witnessed the most amazing fireworks display put on by the hotel! What a wonderful surprise! Overpriced? Maybe but you get what you pay for. We think it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Simply impressive in pretty much every way.”
Reviews.Author: MountainDawg
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for about a week vacationing in Rome. I used my HHonors points (this is a popular HHonors destination) and was able to upgrade to an Imperial Floor room for about 90 euros per night. In addition to a more spacious room, beautiful view of Rome, a private elevator on the lobby and spa levels, it also gave us access to the Imperial Club. The Imperial Club is essentially the most impressive, souped-up concierge/executive lounge I've ever seen (and I've seen a few). It has some form of food available all day long, serving breakfast, lunchtime items, and afternoon tea selections of treats and beverages (the coffee beverages are made-to-order by the Club staff). Various spirits for cocktails are available at night, and water, soda, and beer is available all day. There are semi-private sitting areas outside that also provide a great view of Rome as well as St. Peter's Basilica. The room had everything we needed, except for an iron, which we found was available for sharing in a room near the elevators. High-quality toiletries (Acqua di Parma if I recall) were stocked in the bathroom and the room was equipped with remote-controlled full black-out shades, which were awesome, but almost caused us to completely miss breakfast one day. Beds were EXTREMELY firm. First morning or two was a bit painful, but you adjust. The workout facilities and pool areas were superlative (I understand most hotels in Rome do not even have pools), and the spa provided about any service you would expect and was also equipped with an indoor pool and Turkish bath. The grounds were immaculate and the lobby staff were extremely helpful (while I tried to use Italian whenever I could, it was helpful that all of them seemed well-versed in speaking English). La Pergola, which is generally considered one of the very best restaurants in all of Rome, is the hotel's rooftop restaurant. Their restaurant on the lower lobby level (L'Oliveta I believe?) was very good (we had breakfast there everyday and dinner twice). If you're paying for the room, it will be very expensive (but it is a 5-star hotel in Rome, so what do you expect?). However, I've found few better uses of my HHonors points. TIP: The hotel is off the beaten path (northwest of Vatican City) and you will be forced to drive or take a taxi or the complimentary hotel shuttle if you want to go into town. We did a mix of the taxi and shuttle based on where we were going and when, but the taxi fare wasn't bad (about 11 - 15 euros each way, including tip).

Reviews.Title: “Plush but is it worth it?”
Reviews.Author: ohFussyone
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days as wanted comfy room - got that and were happy but it ended up costing u's $2k by the time we left with all the extras 20€ pp per day to use pool gym facilities was just criminal to charge when your paying $450 a night for the room. Service in bar area excellent but unfortunately we left our swimmers behind and when we both rang and emailled to ask for them to be left for u's to pick up at sister hotel Hilton garden inn at the airport they insisted we come there to pick them up! Ah hello if you are not italian have you tried driving in Rome?? Its a freaking nightmare with no apparent road rules. Ok it was our fault we left them there but didn't think that asking them to be available for u's to collect at their sister hotel 20kms up the road at the airport was to much to ask especially when we explained we were flying out and wouldn't have a car anymore. Not what I expected from a 5* hotel. My daughter left something behind at a Novotel (same chain ironically) and they rang u's within 30 mins of checking out and offered to send it back to Oz for u's!! Unfortunate really.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay! Get the Imperial upgrade!”
Reviews.Author: T1family
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rome Cavalieri for three nights, traveled to Sorrento for four nights, then returned to the Rome Cavalieri for two nights to celebrate my big 5-0. We had an Imperial King with Rome view on the 8th floor, then a corner suite on the 4th floor. Service was wonderful and our room was ready when we arrived at 10 am. The king room was beautiful, luxuriously decorated and a wonderful balcony with a view of all of Rome and St. Peter's Basilica nearby, especially amazing in the evening in my robe and slippers. The Imperial Lounge saved us money on food and drinks, from our morning breakfast with cappuccinos and fresh fruit to our afternoon snacks and evening hors d'ouvres and cocktails. The Imperial Lounge also had a concierge that was incredibly helpful and another fantastic view. The shuttle dropped us off at a great location and we cabbed from the hotel to Vatican City for 7 euro and back for 10 euro. We had a wonderful meal at the poolside restaurant, my veal with port sauce was amazing! We loved using the spa, exercise room, Turkish steam bath, outdoor pool (perfect temperature!), and the relaxation room. The corner suite was stunning, with a double balcony, luxurious living room with a great leather massage chair, lit artwork, and a marble bathroom with separate shower. The beds were incredibly comfortable and there were soap and bedding menus (for an additional fee). We kept the minibar closed since it was pressure sensitive (crazy prices) and ordered a chicken Caesar from room service, which came with a basket of bread and two mini tarts for dessert for 26 euros. While it was not near the city, that was helpful when we didn't have to drive through central Rome to the autostrada and the view was wonderful and peaceful. We were able to rent a car from Hertz onsite. I certainly hope to return to Rome and the Rome Cavalieri!

Reviews.Title: “What a 1st wedding anniversary at the Cavalieri!!!”
Reviews.Author: Clarkey7
Reviews.Content: We booked an Imperial Rome View room as 1 of 3 nights back in Rome to celebrate our 1st wedding anniversary (we got engaged in Rome 4 years previous). An amazing stay - from the free shuttle coach in Piazza Barberini to the very polite and courteous check-in to the room itself. We got there at midday - 2 hours before we could check-in - the check-in lady said our baggage was being taken care of and would be taken to our room when it was ready. As we had an Imperial room we could take advantage of the Imperial Club access where we could have some lunch and drinks (all complimentary if you have an Imperial room) and enjoy the views from the club, over the Eternal City. When we got into the room - we were even more delighted. The pool, the grounds, the finishings, the expanse, the service and the attention to detail were all part and parcel of our superb stay at this beautiful hotel. To cap it off - we had booked (way in advance) a window table in La Pergola,the 3 Michelin star restaurant on the top floor for dinner that night. It was an out of this world dining experience and again the service was exemplary. FInally, we have to say a huge thank you to the management for giving us a complimentary bottle of Prosecco in our room as a surprise for our wedding anniversary. We really appreciated that and it made it that bit more special. We will certainly go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and experience”
Reviews.Author: travelerinlove416
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Cavalieri and had a wonderful time. We used points and stayed in a baseline room which was excellent. It was much larger than expected and had all the ameneties. As Diamond members we were given free wireless internet, free breakfast, and use of their gym and pool facilities. We took advantage of their concierge desk and they never steered us wrong. They had a complimentary shuttle that took us too a central point in town but based on where we were going most of the time it was more convienent for us to take taxis (roughly 10 euro each way) to our exact location. The hotel had a complimentary lounge for Gold and Diamond members open for most of the day with snacks and drinks which was very considerate. We had driven into Rome and were going to return our rental car to the airport but the Hertz counter @ the hotel took care of it for us at no additional cost. Everyone we spoke with was incredibly courteous and helpful. If you can swing the cost or have points to use I would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recomend the Rome Cavalieri”
Reviews.Author: Digger503
Reviews.Content: We had six nights at Rome Cavalieri Imperial Room Rome View before our Cruise, and to say our stay was wonderful is an understatement from the moment we checked in the service started, our 7.15 am flight from Melbourne was met be the hotel car and taken smoothly to hotel arriving at 8 am...... bit early for our room...no sir, straight to our room no problems. And from there on just silk all the way brilliant staff at Club level and thu out the hotel,....service, degustation meal & view from La Pergola was worth the trip to Rome on it,s own. So all in all I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel....

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable!”
Reviews.Author: catsticks
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Cavalieri as worn out, bedraggled travellers and thought we had found paradise! The lobby blew us away and the staff warmly greeted us. Our room was unbelievable - luxury king room with a Rome view. It was outstanding. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was to die for. We had dinner outside beside the pool - and it was tremendous. We were sad that we had to leave so early the next morning to catch our flight home but are definitely planning on going back and will stay here for a few days next time. It is like a resort in the middle of Rome. It is located in Monte Mario, which is not as close to the touristy spots, however, I understand they have a free shuttle that will drop you at the Spanish Steps.

Reviews.Title: “Can't really fault but inpersonal”
Reviews.Author: teeathome
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to celebrate a silver wedding as it would not be the kind of hotel we would normally pick. We really didn't mind being out of the city, it was quiet and relaxing. We used the free shuttle service without any problems and occasional taxi's cost us between 10 to 20 euros. We ate in the restaurant by the pool, for dinner and breakfast. Dinner was fine though expensive for what it was, to be honest we ate better meals in the many many good restaurants in Rome but the service was excellent and that is what you pay for really. For those who complain about breakfast I wonder what they really expect for a buffet meal, this cannot be faulted, it was extensive in choice, yes there were things that would have been nice to be included but there was also an a la carte menu. I personally would have liked to have mushrooms on the buffet but i certainly did not go hungry! Our best meal during out stay was actually on room service and we were very impressed with that, considerably cheaper than the restaurant and very intimate.There is a degree of luxury available and that can be increased by being a member of the" club" earning HH points etc. It was an enjoyable stay and would recommend for those that want that kind of hotel, for us it was just too inpersonal and whilst we did appreciate the card and gift of a bottle of Prosecco in our room on arrival, you did get the impression that you were one of many and it was almost formulaic in presentation. In other words we had a lovely time but will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “return visit noticed decline in service and attitude on some staff”
Reviews.Author: burtontps
Reviews.Content: Just returned back from a six night stay here followed by two nights at the Hilton FCO. This is my second stay at each property. The first was for my honeymoon and I recall being treated like royalty complete with upgrades and imperial lounge access. While the hotel is still beautiful I found some areas a bit tired. Unlike others that post I do understand that they have to pay the bills and when you are a points stay you have to be willing to pay 8 Euro for a coke at the amazing pool. I have read a great deal about the differences in the lounges I have to say if you go in with the expectation that the lounge will be some place in the evening to get a coke, wine or beer you will be fine. I do not feel that the appetizers etc come anywhere close to what the standard should be considering this property. I am taking the imperial lounge out of the equation. My biggest complaint is that when I booked this room several months ago I had the diamond desk put comments in that this was a trip that I was taking my mother on to celebrate her 70th birthday. I even went so far as to send guest relations a follow up email a week prior to our arrival. I received back the following response "Dear Mrs. B, Good morning from Roma, I am pleased to confirm that we have taken very good note about the reasons why you are coming to visit us and of course we will do our best in order to make your stay absolutely memorable!” Imagine my disappointment when there was no mention, not so much as a sticky note- recognizing this special occasion. Even more disappointing is the fact that I sent the same individual an email after three days at the property reminding them of this and getting no response what so ever. Considering the Cabo Hilton decorated the entire suites for my sister's birthday and the Washington DC Embassy Suites provided a congratulation basket for my Godson when I took him there for his high school graduation. In nine years I could go on and on about what other properties have done. This was so disappointing and something you just can’t get back. What is sad is that my mother has heard me praise Hilton time and time again. She is left wondering what there is to brag about. In addition one night the cashier all but refused to convert money for my mother and sister, this after we have converted funds all week. Considering the Cabo Hilton decorated the entire suites for my sister's birthday and the Washington DC Embassy Suites provided a congratulation basket for my Godson when I took him there for his high school graduation. In nine years I could go on and on about what other properties have done. This was so disappointing and something you just can’t get back. What is sad is that my mother has heard me praise Hilton time and time again. She is left wondering what there is to brag about. We did go to the pool side restaurant on my mom's actual birthday and I did mention to waitress that it was her birthday. They did decorate her plate and brought out sparklers to recognize the day. I was very appreciative of this. In addition one night the cashier all but refused to convert money for my mother and sister, this after we have converted funds all week. " Our stay was finished by me telling the bellboy we needed a cab to the airport that would fit six bags and took credit. Before we knew it they were trying to load out bags in the smallest car possible. I mentioned that this would not work and asked if the cab driver took credit. He said no. I was promptly chastised by the Bell captain how informed me “You should have told us you needed a cab that took credit" I share with him that I did share it with the bell boy. The bell boy did speak up and take responsibility for forgetting this. I guess the bell captain forgot how to apologize. Bottom line - some staff are outstanding- others need to be relieved of their duties as they are making a beautiful property. There is a need for this property to go back to what made it such a monarch property and remind all staff they are there for the guests. We made our way to the FCO Hilton and found what I was accustom to with regard to lounges etc. and consistent customer service. I would recommend this for any stay you need to be close to the airport. One note there is a shuttle that will take you to terminal 5 for US departures. It is a very long walk and I was glad we took the shuttle. The shuttle to downtown Rome goes every two hours and will drop you off close to the Nation Museum (Ten Minutes walk). The last pick up is 11:45 pm so if you want a late night in downtown Rome you are able to do so. Will return to the Hilton FCO- it is however doubtful I will return to the cavalieri.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Distance from other parts of Rome not an issue”
Reviews.Author: Albert S
Reviews.Content: I took my family of four (wife, kids 6 and 10 years old) for our first visit to Italy in the middle of August. I'm a Diamond member and booked two connecting rooms with city view. Was not disappointed. Kids loved the location. It was a great refuge from the hustle and bustle of the tourist attractions. Use the hotel shuttle only once, since cabs were available and more convenient. Be sure to ask for the cityview rooms otherwise you get a view of a TV transmission tower. Also for Hilton Honors members, their complimentary breakfast buffet is one of the best I've seen.

Reviews.Title: “Class place to stay”
Reviews.Author: CaryFortWayne_IN
Reviews.Content: Not much to say...classy place...many amenities...far enough from the city to be absent of any noise...Hit a button in the room and automatically a screen comes up on the balcony doors to keep the early morning sun light out...shut the mirrored door just inside the entrance, and you get a sound proofed room. Most places within 10 minute cab ride...most of which are in the 15 euro range. Give yourself a treat....sit in the front seat of the cab and count the number of near misses on motorbikes and other vehicles...thousands of Smart cars and motorbikes park everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely gorgeous with a great view”
Reviews.Author: TANZANIA09Dc
Reviews.Content: The hotel is absolutely gorgeous. The spa and pool area is totally delicious! The only draw backs are the location, the extra charges (pool chair cushions), and the carpet was a little worn in the hall On the 6th floor. That being said, I would stay here again. The service was superb and the view from our room was awesome. The spa is a reason alone to stay! The cab ride from the hotel is about 15 minutes and costs 15Euros. A very classy hotel that is expensive but well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Need to work on customer service”
Reviews.Author: Monsieur_E
Reviews.Content: Worst experience at any Hilton property in sixty years. My wife was putting on her underwear when arrogant male cleaning crew started to make up room. The doorman was verbally abusive and steered the taxi in the wrong direction. Restaurant would not serve us because we did not have a reservation, etc. etc. When I checked out three Italian locals jumped ahead in line so when my wife who is handicapped in a walker had to stand in line for an additional thirty minutes. This hotel rates somewhere between 3 and 2 stars. Hotel lobby bar adequate, restaurant wait staff friendly. When checking out the garage attendant wanted an additional 30 Euro beyond the 30 Euro per day that I had finalized on bill. A little bit of drama before he gave me keys. We live in Italy, but not sure how many guests actually take advantage of garage. When I checked in the front desk told me to park on the street!!

Reviews.Title: “A Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy B
Reviews.Content: We returned to the now Rome Cavalieri, Wardorf Astoria Hotel, in September. It was the Hilton (but the group is the same). With the exceptions of reasons of health, we have been going there for over 20 years on an annual basis. We have watched over time this hotel in the last 15 years, continuosly upgrade itself to a level of the highest quality. 5* for sure, 6* well it must be very very close. The service is superb, the comfort sublime, the views fo the city and the Vatican breathtaking. The rooms are spacious and one has all the benefits of a city hotel with resort facilities. Dining a joy, from the 3* michelin restaurant on the rooftop, to dining by the pool in sublime summer evenings, to breakfast, buffet style and plentiful. My wife and I always say that if you rteurn, year on year to an hotel, the staff remain, some in their positions, others promoted, but all there, recognising you, pampering you, then that says much for the hotel. I know not of a better Hilton, and better hotels there may be, but they are few.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible service”
Reviews.Author: TerryOB
Reviews.Content: We had an overnight stay in the Rome Cavalieri prior to a cruise and after reading some of the reviews we must confess to being a little concerned as to what sort of establishment we had booked in to. I travel for a living and really have seen both ends of the spectrum when it comes to quality and service, but the Rome Cavalieri surpassed all of my expectations. We took a pre booked taxi from Fiumicino and arrived at the hotel around midday. We were seen straight away by the desk staff and immediately taken to a separate area, offered a drink and the check in process was completed quickly and efficiently. At all times the check in girl was friendly, smiling and efficient. We were told that we had been upgraded to a suite, but were told that the room wasn’t ready yet. A phone called confirmed that the room would be ready in 10 minutes. We were taken to the room personally and our luggage followed shortly. We were then introduced to the lounge where the staff were attentive, friendly and professional. In all, and incredible experience and I would have liked to personally thanked all of the staff that we came in contact with and mention them by name to the hotel manager. Thanks again, you are a credit to your profession

Reviews.Title: “Peace in rome, with great views,best in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: butch54
Reviews.Content: Without Rome for any traveler journey is not over. Rome is romantic, artistic & for the guys who believe in GOD Holy pope is there. I travel for art, views not for some God thing anyway Its 70% kind of resort which is decorated artistically to look like hotel so you get both in 1 place. We spent almost a week in the hotel in summer. We booked the suite called penthouse without expecting any thing amazing but as soon I enter in the lobby itself you can see art of rome nicely designed hotel.Suite is spacious, great wooden work amazing furniture's. Artistic work, great toilets with hydro massage tubs with the view of rome's sky ,great balcony attached sofa's to seat & enjoy amazing view of mesmerizing Rome under moon light.Even private small gym is their.Excellent room terrace .Get view of St. Peter’s Basilica frm bathroom, awesome dining area with bar.& with suite u get access to their special club of spa, not to miss it. Even binoculars r provided to catch the glimpse of old rome.Best artistic suites in the world.Great restaurants one has 20 diff kind of waters in menu.La pergola best restaurant in rome. great service & wonderful food & wines.U can dine in ur room too but give a try its best.Best Bars i have seen in resorts hotels.Not in suite be in Bar enjoy.They got some good art collection too.Great location, Great service amazing view ,great artistic suites hotel itself,amazing food & bar.Marvelous place in rome feel like King . Not at all expensive go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in the Roman Hills”
Reviews.Author: cormac7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the finest in the world. WE travel extensively and we spent 4 nights in the Cavalieri Hotel during Easter Week 2011. The rooms are luxurious - even a "pillow menu" with 8 different kinds of pillow. The hotel is loaded with valuable art, and it is truly magnificent. Only downside is the restaurants are all expensive - the formal dining room is rated by many as the best restaurant in Rome and make reservations in advance. Well worth the money to pay more to get on the executive floor which includes small buffet for breakfast and lunch, snacks in the evening, and unlimited wine, beer and soda. The hotel is a short cab ride from the center of Rome, but has a beautiful park like setting - indoor and outdoor pools are lovely, depending on the time of year. Service is excellent and could not be more helpful The hotel is not cheap, and typically beyond our price point, but it was certainly worthy of a one time expense Another trick if you are traveling with family is the Hilton Minibreaks program - you can't get this on the US site, but you can on the hilton.co.uk or by calling the UK reservation number. Under that program, you can get a second room for half price if you are traveling with kids under 18 - at over $500 per night, this is a great savings.

Reviews.Title: “A magnificent view”
Reviews.Author: Olos
Reviews.Content: The view alone is worth staying here for. We had an upgrade to city view room, looking at Rome from above was mesmerizing. Rooms are spacious with lots of storage space. We were 5 friends traveling together and had 3 rooms at the executive level. Two were alike; small entrance hall with lot of storage space and connecting door to the adjacent room, then a privacy door to the bedroom. The third room did not have the entrance hall, but total space was the same which of course made the room seem somewhat larger. There was an extra door to slide in front entrance door to muffle any sound from the corridor. Beds, pillows duvets, bed linen were all very comfortable. Bathroom was rather small, unfortunately not a separate shower stall, but in any other way both practical and comfortable. Bathroom amenities were plentiful and seemed to bee of very good quality. Bathrobes and towels were large and fluffy. No problems with water (water pressure might have been some higher, but not a problem). Balconies had excellent space for two, maybe three but five was a crowd (but then again it is a double room). Rooms was kept clean and tidy by housekeeping during daytime, and turndown service at night also changed towels and looked very well after the rooms. Executive lounge was superb. Excellent service, food and drinks changed several times during the day. The lounge had several balconies overlooking the pool area and the city. The staff was very friendly and easygoing. Reception checked us both in and out efficient and courteously, concierge was helpful in finding restaurants and whatever else on could inquire about. Getting to town in Taxi was fast and very reasonable priced, there could be a wait for taxis during the peak our in the evening when everybody want to get into town to have dinner (Rome’s taxis seams to live their own lives) the hotel’s doorman staff did an excellent job in providing taxis. The shuttle bus was an option during the day and was comfortable and quite fast. To sum it all up, we had an excellent stay in a brilliant hotel, and when in Rome again we will return.

Reviews.Title: “You can find better”
Reviews.Author: BHill288
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Rome Cavalieri on a business/lesiure trip a few months ago at the end of June. Needless to say, it was just your average "roided out" Hilton. As far as large scale luxury hotels, WA seems to be lacking in comparison to Fairmont and Ritz-Carlton properties.
