The service overall was good considering the staff was assisting two groups staying at the hotel at the same time. On that note, however, the hotel overbooked and some members wound up having to re-locate to the Grand Via Veneto, thus adding unecessary travel for meetings, etc. The food was also subpar for a five star resort, but alas, we're still talking about a once great hotel franchise now cheaped down by the Hilton name. Frankly, you can pay €15+/- for a cab into Rome and get a much better meal than the €30+ sandwiches, etc offered at the hotel. The actual location and property, apart from the building, were very nice. The pool side of the hotel had a fantastic panoramic view of the entire city of Rome with the dome of St. Peter's basilica situated off to the right. The grounds were well landscaped and the pool area was well kept. The rooms were a bit cramped and disappointing overall, along with the fact that the balcony was just dirty looking. Frankly, the entire building is in serious need of updating. The rooftop terrace is a nice touch, especially for a great night light view of Rome. The biggest drawback to location, however, is the distance. For being so close to the heart of the city, it still usually takes about €15-20 to reach certain parts of the city in a taxi; plan accordingly. In conclusion, if you're looking to overpay for a semi-familiar American presence while staying in Rome, this is your spot. Otherwise, try one of the botique venues in Rome. Besides, walking is all you will wind up doing while in town.

Reviews.Title: “Truly magnificent hotel with breathtaking views and marvellous service”
Reviews.Author: Egg_chili_fry
Reviews.Content: The old adage: ´you get what you pay for´ isn´t always true, but in this case it certainly is. The Cavalieri is a beautiful hotel with excellent services all round. I was fortunate enough to have stayed on the executive club floor which affords you the free use of internet enabled computers and the club room. The club room is luxury at it´s best - mini tapas style snacks are available around the clock, breakfast lunch and dinner are served there (all included in the price of the room), several fridges stocked with wines, beers AND champagne are freely available as are other snacks like nuts and crisps. the club room overlooks the whole of Rome with the Vatican City just there on the right. Very few hotels in this class offer a service like this, it´s the perfect place to relax before going out to dinner or just chilling out.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing wedding anniversary weekend”
Reviews.Author: KEVO78
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights stay at the Rome Cavalieri for our wedding anniversary and we were not disappointed one little bit. The staff on arrival were very friendly and all very smart in their matching waistcoats and bow-ties! Reception is amazing with lavish paintings and artwork which look like they are worth a fortune - the hotel even has its own collection which must be hidden away somewhere! We stayed in room 515 which has a City view - to be honest if we didnt have a City view I dont think the experience would have been the same - Colosseum, Pantheon and the Vatican could all be seen along with the mountains in the distance. Amazing view. On the other side of the building the view would have been of a phone mast and a block of apartments. Tip 1/ Make sure you get a city view room! Now for a hotel like this you are not going to do it on the "cheap" so if you are expecting budget meals and pool bar burgers then think again. The food is superb, from breakfast right the way through to dinner. Tip 2/ Book a pool-side table in the restaurant to really appreciate the live singer and pianist with dinner and sit there and relax alongside the blue lit pool. Overall an amazing experience and below are just a few extra little tips well worth taking onboard. -Turn up early for the shuttle bus into the City as once full you can not stand. -Be prepared to pay, but if you want quality then it doesnt come on the cheap. -Get a City View room at all costs! -Be prepared to see the biggest breakfast choice ever! Overall, ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tfdmedicman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights before we went on a Mediterranian cruise for our 29th anniversary. This hotel was awesome. the rooms were unbelievable, very spacious and the staff was very friendly. The food was excellent and reasonably priced for Rome. The pool area, although we did not use the facilities were beautiful to look at. Would definetly stay there again if the opportunity allows.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Jamie E
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed only a couple of nights and unfortunately not longer at this wonderful hotel. For complete pampering at a luxury hotel you cannot find better nor will I even try when returning to Rome. The accommodations, staff and service is impeccable without making you feel stuffy or out of your comfort zone. Do NOT pay attention to the few negative comments made about this hotel. If they occurred they were the exception and not what you will experience during your stay. My daughter is stationed in Italy so we will return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Vishal H
Reviews.Content: To spoil myself for my birthday we spend one night in this hotel and it was a wonderful experience. As we usually book budget hotels because we usually don't spend much time in our hotelroom, this was a real treat. The rooms are large and comfortable and the view over Rome from the balcony was just amazing. Personnel was very nice and helpful and the complimentary Prosecco for my birthday was very well appreciated. Location is outside of the city center. This can be both an advantage and a disadvantage, depending on the purpose of the visit. In our case, we just wanted to relax, so it was nice to be in a quiet area. For sightseeing Rome, it might be wiser to book a hotel in the center (like we did for the rest of the vacation), although this hotel has a free shuttle service to the city. Everything is quite expensive in the hotel, but we knew that beforehand. Although we initially planned to have dinner in the hotel, we found a small but nice restaurant within 10 minutes walk from the hotel, which was very good and very cheap. So even for the traveller with a smaller budget who wants to give himself a treat, this hotel is a good option as you don't need to have too much extra costs besides the cost for the room. It's just wonderful to sit on the balcony in the evening, enjoying the Rome view (and the Prosecco) with live music from the pool side on the background. Very romantic! Breakfast in the morning was very complete and tasted wonderfully. All in all a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, the best in Rome!!”
Reviews.Author: soszeus
Reviews.Content: We spend 3 nights at the Rome Cavailieri in August and I must say that this hotel is fabulous!! Since you step into the lobby you will be amazed with its magnitude and beauty. You will find a piano bar, an outdoor patio and a plenty of space to relax. Enjoy the acquatic complex with 3 outdoor heated pools, indoor pool with cascade and hydro-massage, a large and complete fitness center, sauna, turkish bath and a SPA...everything for your comfort (SPA treatments are paid of course). We stayed in an Imperial Room which is very spacious (50m2) with separated seating area, private balcony and a very beautiful bathroom. Imperial Floor guests have free access to the Imperial Lounge, a very nice lounge with food&drinks all day long - including breakfast - and a great view from the city as the hotel is on the top of the hill. Imperial guests also have complimentary access to all the pools with free sun chairs. The hotel has 2 main restaurants: L'Uliveto where it's served the buffet breakfast with all you can imagine, and it's open for lunch and dinner too, and you can choose to have your meal inside or by the pool, very lovely place. The other option is the 3 Michelin-Star rated La Pergola on the top floor, a very fine (and more expensive) restaurant open only for dinner (dress code and reservation are required). We had dinner at L'Uliveto one night with nice live music by the pool which we loved!! Yes, the hotel is a little bit far from the city center but it worths the distance as there is no other Resort like this in Rome. Besides that, they offer a complimentary shuttle service to the city center from 8am to 8pm, which means that you will only need a taxi to come back to the hotel if you decide to stay until late night. Renting a car would be another option, but depending on the season you are in Rome, it's hard to find a place to park your car in the streets. So my advice is forget the car, use the shuttle service during the day and take a taxi back to the hotel if you stay after 8pm, it costs 10-15 Euros maximum. I highly recommend this hotel and there is no doubt that this is my home in Rome from now on...See you guys next time for sure...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, a little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: RoxburyNY
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel (pricey) and a little out of the way from the center of the city. We stayed for one night. Nice room, clean, but expensive. The mattress was soft. Nine euros for a small bottle of diet coke out of the room fridge - very excessive if you ask me. If you touched anything in the fridge they charge you. The atmosphere was a little pretentious as the lobby is old school. The hotel does have a shuttle bus, but the hours can be limited in the afternoon and evening (stops at 8pm). Next time I would stay closer to the city center as a cab can get expensive and take some time to get to the hotel from the main attractions. Not much happening in the local neighborhoods by the hotel. A convention was going on in the lobby, which made things kind of noisy and didn't leave any places for regular guest to sit and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “What a treat!”
Reviews.Author: srsdls
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing hotel, and after staying here we couldn't stay anywhere else if we return to Rome. We were here to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. The staff could not have been nicer, that is he entire staff including every single person we encountered. We were very well taken care of. The view is beyond amazing, and in addition each night there is music by the pool to enjoy from your private balcony while you watch twilight settle over all of Rome. The breakfast buffet had an amazing number of pastry choices as well as meats, cheeses, cereals and hot items. And the free shuttle into town was very convenient and prompt. There could be no other experience quite like this in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “"perfect"”
Reviews.Author: slinqee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for one week while in Italy for a family wedding. There are no other words to describe the hotel itself other than "perfect". Rooms: clean, a good size with everything that you would need to be comfortable. Our room overlooked the front of the hotel and the water feature. There was a wonderful view each morning from the table and chairs outside where I would have my first cup of coffee. The executive lounge: the best lounge I have been too. There was never a need to ask for anything. It was stocked with the best champagne, whiskey, scotch, after dinner drinks, a coffee maker and treats throughout the day!!! The staff: were helpful, pleasant, and always accomodating. Downfall: the amount of ignorant, stuck up, arrogant Americans that felt that they could dominate and control the seating arrangements, the food distribution, the bottles of their favorite drinks, and the conversation. My husband and I travel alot, and have found ways of simply entertaining ourselves with their ignorance which is what you have to do here. We had a female actually exit the patio , enter the lounge and announce that all the Americans were on the patio should any other American want to join them! Followed by two American women who insisted simply because I am not Caucasion, to attempt to speak to me loudly and in some version of their own Italian without ever just saying hello. We also made some great friends though, those that were treated the same. Dorin, Simone, Doc and Carolina....thank you for filling our trip with wonderful memories. I will cherish them and your friendship! The waldorf..... a must see and stay for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “One of the most relaxing hotels with spacticular”
Reviews.Author: PGShapleigh
Reviews.Content: The Rome Cavalieri executive floor excels in accommodations and service staff is outstanding. The Cavalieri has the most spectacular views of Rome setting on the hills above Rome. Being up in the hills above Rome has its draw backs, it it means you have to take a free shuttle to the city (about 25 minutes) , but the hours are somewhat limited and you might end up with having to take a taxi, but the location is worth it for the views. Dining is a very positive, but expensive, experience and you will want for nothing, they have it all. Not many other dining locations available in the area so you need to go into Rome for other dining options.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: KikiHanoi
Reviews.Content: My parents and I and my husband stayed for 4 nights. The rooms were spacious with nice decoration and functional design. We were expecting a nice view of the city from the balcony but our floor was not high enough and we could only see the gardens and trees of the Hilton Property. Since the location is little bit far away from the center of tourist destination, we used taxis to go out and to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Property”
Reviews.Author: dkuchs
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not in city center. I find this to be very desirable as it's location is so quiet with beautiful grounds. They have a great shuttle that runs throughout the day. The rooms are absolutely beautiful and if you can snag a room that overlooks the Vatican, absolutely magical especially in the evening. They have a wonderful lounge for executive level rooms with wonderful food and drink throughout the day and evening. The staff have a can-do attitude. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Stay”
Reviews.Author: BizTraveler_scr
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in August - and wish it could have been longer. I was concerned when we first arrived as we were treated rudely (our rental car was not a Ferrari). Before we could get the back open for our luggage we were told to "hurry up an move". Luckily that stopped when we walked in the hotel - front desk, concierge and housekeeping were very accommodating. We were never made to feel fully welcome when entering the hotel. The room was what you'd expect of a hotel of this caliber but I really enjoyed the large balcony with live music by the pool every evening and the pillows. If for some reason you didn't like any of the wide variety of pillows on the bed they have a pillow menu available. With the metal enclosure for the patio doors and large mirror barrier beyond the front door we had a completely dark and quite room. If you use these be sure to put in a wake-up call - we overslept and missed a morning tour. Breakfast was wonderful. If you think there's one thing that they don't have, keep going...we didn't discover the 2nd room of food until the 2nd day. It does take a while to get a drink - or just about anything from a server though. As a Diamond member I was given full access to the hotel, if you know what the word budget means and you're not hhonors Gold or Diamond, watch for all of the little (and not so little) charges added on. Lounges also have nice views and are fully stocked. The Views, Food, Pools, Spa and Lounges were spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: willy b
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel!!!! the imperial room is wonderful (even without the rome view), very big and so beautiful with all the comfort you can dream of. The impirial lounge is also a dream, so relaxing and so cosy. Everybody is also so friendly and every thing is so clean.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel on acres of land”
Reviews.Author: rosyro
Reviews.Content: This was a fabulous hotel with amazing views from most of the rooms. There is acres of land with swimming pools, a fitness centre and impressive restaurants. The breakfast was incredible and very relaxed outdoor option. The room was great - the walls a little too thin but the overall room was gorgeous. I had a balcony and a wonderful bathroom. The service was great and nothing seemed to be a problem. My dry cleaning came back in 4 hours. The only issue I had was a 15 minute taxi ride to the city centre as this hotel is a resort and just outside the city. Worth a stay for a great 5 star experience. The hotel also boasts an art gallery which is nice to spend some wandering around.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Experience”
Reviews.Author: Fanis M
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel and staying there is a uniqie experience! The Hotel is beautiful, alla the personnel is very helpfula nd friendly and of course luxury and service is on top marks. Depending on the price you can find a room for, it ranges from decent to excellent value. Make sure you get a room with breakfast in the price, it is top notch, with excellent quality and huge variety. All personnel was very helpful. Due to a family health issue we had to leave earlier, but we had a room at a very good rate wich we had pre-paid (that is why we had a low price). Obviously, we could not get a refund, but the dutty manager was helpful and found a solution: alla our extra charges (room service, dinner, etc.) were covered from the payment for the 3 nights, so we did not pay anything extra. Nice gesture....sure I was expecting something like that, but I am fully aware that they were not obliged to do so. Rooms are very spacious and beautifuly decorated, with excellent soundproofing. Bed is very comfortable and you can choose from many different pillows! Because it is not in the center of Rome, you have to either use the shuttle bus or take a taxi. Are there any negatives about the hotel? Of course there are, at least form me. Mainly 2 things: 1. When you pay so much money for a room, I find it ridiculous to charge you 9 Euro per day for WiFi. We live in 2011...it is free even at hotel that cost 1/3 of the price of this one. 2. I agree to charge visitors for using the swimming pool, but to charge the guest 18 Euro per person is very insulting. 3. The HUGE antenna on the back of the hotel, is ugly and I am sure is it note all that safe. All in all, to summarize: PROS: 1. Excellent service 2. Room Size 3. Polite and helpful personnel 4. Twice a day turndown service 5. Luxury 6. Shuttle bus (though necessary because of the location) 7. Excellent breakfast 8. Very good restuarants (though expensive) 9. Gardens, view of Rome from the fron rooms. 10. Unique experience CONS: 1. Charges for using WiFi 2. Charges for using the swimming pool 3. Expensive restaurants and minbar 4. Location (it is nice, but not very convenient)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Toma A
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights Loved every moment of it. Make sure to dine at Michelin 3-star restaurant located on the rooftop of this hotel, La Pergola. Food is superb , view... priceless !!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: rrrivas
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel will please you! The size and quality of the rooms, the big breakfast, the nice attitude of its staff... The ONLY problem I can see is its a little far from the main city attractions.

Reviews.Title: “At the Cavalieri, again.....”
Reviews.Author: TBRG
Reviews.Content: Perfect place to offer workshops, too. We visited the Cavalieri several times now, it's really a property to come back to. Even our dog seems to like this hotel very much. Good staff in general, though the pool-bar seemed somewhat "understaffed" this year. Perfect view of Rome from the Imperial Club lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: ElcioBR
Reviews.Content: I listened that some people say the hotel is away from the city, but actually it´s really near some of the best attractions in town and you can reach the others easily by cab. The staff was friendly and helpful. I remember the internet that checked me in and every time he saw me at the lobby he came to greet me and check if I was fine. If you have access to the executive lounge, you will experiment a great service with a bunch of choices and the same friendly staff. I recommend the hotel and I´ll be back soon

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful unique hotel with resort amenities! Awesome views of the Vatican.”
Reviews.Author: MaryBrierleyPeterman
Reviews.Content: Beautiful "museum like" hotel with historical significance. Objects of art are located throughout the hotel. Gorgeous gardens surround the hotel. Residential location on the hill overlooking the Vatican. Relaxing spa and pool areas. Excellent food and beverage. Complimentary shuttle service to the Spanish Steps. Friendly, helpful five-star service personnel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: jshankland
Reviews.Content: This place was over the top great! As Hilton Diamond members we were able to access the spa and spent many hours lounging there. The diamond members guest suite was fully stocked with drinks and food that changed multiple times during the day and was always fresh. Would absolutely return.

Reviews.Title: “Our Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Laurel99
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights on HH points at Cavalieri; it was time for all the mid-winter stays at Hampton Inn in Des Moines, Chicago and Minneapolis to pay up. This place is grand, no question about it. Some will love it and feel right at home, some probably might feel uncomfortable with all the real or perceived pretentiousness. Most of the guests looked like they just failed Real Housewives of Beverly Hills casting and went to Hilton Cavalieri as consolation prize. We were warmly welcomed upon arrival, asked to step in a special area, offered a drink and a seat while we were checked in. As Hilton Diamond members, we were told of all the perks we should expect: upgraded to an executive room, free access to Colosseo lounge, pool and spa, free breakfast and internet access. The WI-FI Internet, by the way, is excruciatingly painfully slow, maybe the cable is better. As we entered the room we were impressed with it and disappointed with the view: 6-lion statues and a “beautiful” monument dedicated to Guglielmo Marconi. I became even more disappointed later on when through an opened door across the hallway I saw the breathtaking views of Rome. So you know, all the even number room have no views, all the uneven have great views. Maybe I should have asked for another room, but I did not, I assumed either no rooms with a view were available or we did not have the special credentials to deserve one. At any rate, it is hard to complain with the accommodations. The breakfast was really good, with lots of choices and the staff was very accommodating. The Colosseo lounge was nice for a drink and some very light refreshments after a long day of walking. These days all you get in the Hilton executive lounges are very, very light refreshments. We visited the spa and were offered a quick tour, but we run of time and did not had a chance to enjoy it. The shuttle was full and few people were turned away, only one time (leaving the hotel). Rest of the time was not an issue; it was very convenient and runs great. The only complaint was that the last bus leaves Piazza Barberini at 20:00 (8 pm) which is way too early. Several times we had to take taxis back to the hotel and that cost about18-20 Euros. We did not eat any meals other than breakfast (in the hotel) and cannot speak for the quality of the restaurants. We dined one night at the nearby The View Restaurant and although the views are great and the staff friendly, we were not impressed with the food. Overall, this is a very nice hotel and it would be hard for us to find any fault with either the building or the staff.

Reviews.Title: “So thankful for a pool to escape the heat of August!”
Reviews.Author: Lyndar1422
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights in August and was it hot! We expected heat but not the heatwave they experienced the week we were there. I was really torn when making the decision regarding our hotel choice - central location or pool. I am so thankful we picked the pool. We caught the 8:30 shuttle into town most mornings and did our sightseeing, returning to the hotel for an afternoon swim. We paid to upgrade to the Imperial Club and it was worth every penny. The lounge was fabulous - courteous staff and a constant stream of food and drinks. We definitely got our money's worth. The rooms were nice although try to get one that's not adjoining another. We had upgraded to the Rome view and our parents were on the other side. Their room was much nicer than ours! It was bigger and the bathroom was huge. Ours was so tiny and cramped but one of the few complaints we had. We would definitely stay here on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel But Expensive”
Reviews.Author: SQBill
Reviews.Content: Yes, this is a top tier hotel and can be a wonderful place to stay. For me, I felt it was better managed as a Hilton.The transformation to a Waldorf seems to have softened some of the warmth and benefits. The rooms are large, comfortable and well planned. For HHonors members, there are two lounges, the ground floor and one on the Imperial/executive level. There is only access to the lounge on the first floor for Hilton HHonors members if you are not in an executive room. While it has drinks all day long, there are few to no snacks. A salad until middayand then some small sandwhiches until 5 or 6pm. You must stay on an elite floor to have access to the other lounge. Breakfast is included for Gold HHonors and costs €38. for everyone else. A hamburger for lunch costs €39 in L'Uliveto, the casual restaurant. The free shuttle bus goes to a stop near the Spanish Steps but there is no transportation to the Vatican. The bus is hourly until about 8pm and has a break in the afternoon. Since the hotel is not inside the city wall, every taxi ride is metered and instead of a flat rate had to pay by the kilometer. We arrived in Rome via train and had trouble getting a taxi willing to go to the hotel (about a 15 minute wait) . It's the same when you leave the hotel. Traveling by taxi to a restaurant in the city is about €15 each way; about €45 to the airport; or 90 by hotel car. If you are not Diamond, you must pay to use the pool. I'm not sure but think it's around €18. Although it is a nice pool, it is quite deep - 5.5 feet at the shallow end, 11.5 feet at the deep end. The workout area is very nice and incorporates the new Hilon standard of Technogym Equipment you see worldwide.The "free" internet is capped on usage and you get enough to make one 10 minute Skype call per day. There should be plenty of time for emails or VOIP, however.To up to unlimited internet is €27/day. We found the staff to be cool and unengaging - unlike everywhere else we visited in Italy (which included three other Hiltons). On the good side, the rooms are spectacular and the views (if you get one) wonderful. The Michelin Starred Restaurant, La Pergola, is there and ranks as one of Rome's best. If you would like to eat there, book about two months in advance. You may also want to get a feel for the prices and type of cuisine they serve, to avoid a surprise. If you want to leave the property and walk to a restaurant the only real choice is da Luciano, www.ristorantedaluciano.com which we enjoyed. Finally, we found the concierge and housekeeping staffs to be very good.

Reviews.Title: “Pretend opulence at a steep price”
Reviews.Author: tomjet3
Reviews.Content: It was simply "put on" elegance for the most part. Front desk fast and just courteous. An aging, fairly well appointed hotel at steep prices. Fortunately I was part of a business group and was not paying. $500 and up per night? Wow. Our hallway was flooded for the stay and the smell of really strong detergents wafted thru. Room was spacious and comfy with little seating area and balcony overlooking lot. Grounds were well kept and view of Rome is stunning. They will schlep you 20 mins down the hill every half hour via shuttle. Nice service. The hotel is away from everything. Food and banquet service was top notch. Basically this is not my cup of tea. Caters more to HHonors folks and has the air of snootiness. I feel was overpriced and just not spectacular. it was a big property with old school appeal and no personality. I would not choose as my first choice. Wifi cost ridiculously expensive and not very good.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: VacanzaItaliana2011
Reviews.Content: Overall, I was not impressed with this hotel considering the price of a room. The only bright spot was that the room was large, comfortable, clean, and quiet. Other than the room itself, this hotel is not particularly impressive. Here at the items that make this hotel not worth the price: - Shuttle Bus: The shuttle bus only runs about once per hour and fills up very quickly since it is super tiny. If you are not at least 15 minutes early, you are out of luck in terms of finding a seat. Additionally, the shuttle stops running at 8pm. - Upgrades: Unless you are a Gold/Diamond Hilton Honors member, don't expect any special treatment. I am a Silver member and that simply did not cut it at this hotel. When I asked for a room upgrade, I was told that I had to pay an additional 90 Euros per night. I have never been asked to pay for a room upgrade at any Hilton property ever. Usually, if an upgrade is available (which it was in this case) it is complementary. - Garden View: The garden consists of some grass and lion statues - not impressive in the least. - Restaurants: The poolside restaurant is overpriced and the food is mediocre. The service staff seated us in a corner and then forgot about us. And there are no other restaurant options in this neighborhood. Unless you are a Gold/Diamond Hilton Honors member, you will not be treated as a valued guest at this Hilton property.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful Hotel with wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Ken050
Reviews.Content: In this wonderful hotel seek a room with views over the City. That side givers you a spectacular view of Rome and St Peters. We were on the other side and that was fine but you should seek a view of the city etc, just special . We found the hotel a wonderful oasis of relaxed quiet and calmness in Rome when the weather was very hot. Friendly courteous and caring staff. Excellent pool and air conditioning works effectively. Excellent restaurant with very good service. Room first class in every respect and a very good size. Bathroom superb. We caught the shutlle into the city. The only drawback is that this hotel is a little out of the city on a plateau, so if you are out of "shulltle pick up " times you will need to get a taxi back. We also paid for the Imperial Executive lounge on 7th floor and had our room on same level . This provided excellent facilities with drinks, light breakfast and then afternoon snacks which some people used as a light early evening meal. the lounge does have the most wonderful view of the city and sitting on one of the outside balcony tables with a galss of champagne was very special . Had dinner overlooking the poopl area, did book and it was well worthwhile being one tier level above the pool. Very good quality food and drinks and wine of high standard. This was a most enjoyable stay in a beautiful hotel with superbly trained staff , but do remeber you are out of the city. We will certainly use again in a bout 15 months when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location, but the hotel charges too much for extras!”
Reviews.Author: casaransom
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a beautiful location, overlooking Rome and just above the Vatican. However, above and beyond the exorbitant nightly cost to stay here, they charge you for television use beyond basic cable and 20 Euros a day for wireless internet! Movie choices in the room are also a hefty 20 Euros, if you are able to get your television to work (mine didn't the five nights I stayed there). The food is quite good in the standard restaurant at pool level, but guests are not given access to the wildly popular restaurant on the roof. They are booked for over the next three months, or so I was told. The staff is wonderful and I felt quite pampered, but I was disgruntled with the extra costs. I was also unable to book any Spa time that fit into my schedule...frustrating to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “Roman Retreat.”
Reviews.Author: 10814BRNS
Reviews.Content: What could be, yet another Roman masterpiece,is truly not.5 Stars is unfortunately a large stretch.4.5 maybe,4 for sure.To start,I am an HHonors Diamond,not only was I not upgraded I was downgraded.Yes the situation was handled professionally,and yes we both agreed,however my reservation was made from real time available inventory and not available at checkin.So much for being a Diamond.Well it doesnt end there,On one day of six I am not on the HHonors list,they give me bill for breakfast and no water for what now is the third time.Also access to the HHonors lounge is questioned.Although my room was on the sixth floor,lounge privelages on the seventh/Imperial floor were extended as that is what I was paying for in my room rate.Sadly however I only went to the lounge on three occasions, as apparently the new American vogue is to cram as many family members into one room and then this family will eat as many meals, and I mean meals as humanly possible in 24 hours.Truly not five star,and I havent touched on acceptable global standards of behaviour,and not just the children.Anything but five star.On two occassions the bellman was trying to welcome new guests into my room.Wow.The room was very lovely,but dated.The Grounds were a mess on day one, and by day five were starting to look up,but far from perfect.The decor of the hotel in general is all over the place.Absolutely no cohesion,might be a suggestion for the owner of the hotel to retire their collection of antiques and impressive paintings and hire a world renowned designer.Unfortunately a sixties Conrad Hilton original was not intended as a Baroque museum.The only interior reminder of Mr Hiltons period is a fabulous modern abstact painting in the lower lobby level.Room Service was very good.Bar/Lounge service OK.L'Uliveto was excellent.And La Pergola is La Pergola,pretty hard to beat.The view , food,wines and service are all truly world class.Standout staff,Gugliermo/Bill the official greeter was both genuinely charming and enormously helpful.The location of the Cavalieri Roma is the hotels best asset,the ten minute seperation from Rome proper is a welcome relief,and the view is one of a kind.Would I stay there again,or more importantly would I recommend the hotel to friends and family,a BIG maybe.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel for families in Rome in August”
Reviews.Author: Fiona H
Reviews.Content: Rome is hot in August and yes Rome is expensive. We stayed for 4 nights with two children ( aged 16 and 11). But we booked and prepaid months previously getting a good deal on two connecting non-smoking rooms on the Imperial Floor, with views overlooking Rome. The views are spectacular and you have to have this. The rooms were very comfortable ( uge bed with lots of pillows), marble bathrooms with plenty of lights, spacious with sofa and plenty storage space, as well as excellent air-conditioning. The Imperial Floor has the advantage of the Imperial Club, where the staff work very hard to ensure you alwyas have food and drinks there. The food was fine ( the small cakes were delicious) and the cappucinos in the morning were perfect and so welcoming. The staff there couldn't have been more helpful. The other advantage is that you get the towel covered cushions for the loungers round by the swimming pool included with the Imperial Rooms. The swimming pool was a must for the children with the August heat. The slight disadvantage was that the shuttle service wasn't always convenient and with the last shuttle leaving the hotel at 7:30pm wasn't ideal for dinner. But there were plenty taxis costing10-15 Euros each way, and being August, when most of Rome is on holiday - only took 10-15 minutes into the city. In other months expect to take about 30 minutes each way. If we were in Rome in the summer again, I would definitely consider staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “what a great Hotel, if you like Rome and want a 5* expeience then the Cavalieri is the hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: David E
Reviews.Content: Breakfast at the Pool Terrace is a must!! The staff from check in through to check out couldnt be more helpful, the rooms are spaces and well apointed. Worth upgarding to an executive room to enjoy trhe complimentary lounge this is not a 5* hotel it is a 10 star!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, pools and lobby. Senior management needs upgrade.”
Reviews.Author: bmatraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a bit of a tough review to write as in many ways this could have been the perfect hotel for my family (a couple with 3 young children). However, there are some issues with the front office that will need to be fixed. For starters, I knew I was trading a central location for the space and comfort of a resort hotel. From prior experience, I knew that having a pool was an absolute must if touring in Italy with children in August. In this regard, everything was "as advertised". The outdoor pools and indoor pool were great and the grounds, with their own lemon and lime groves, were fun to explore. They even had a big, inflatable slide at the kids' pool on the weekend. As for the trade-off, this was well worth it as the cab rides to/from central Rome were quick an not too expensive (10-15 euros). Keep in mind, we were there in August, when street traffic is nearly non-existent. (The bus schedule is very tough to plan your day around and one time, even though we timed it perfectly, we couldn't use it as it was already filled by other guests...) As for the food, we found the breakfast, although an impressively varied spread, to be rather average. It was certainly a case of quantity over quality. However, given the large number of guests having breakfast each morning, I give them the benefit of the doubt. (I also think I am a bit jaded from my breakfast experience at the San Clemente Palace in Venice last summer, which was other-worldly). Overall, I would put breakfast in the "positive" category. We had dinner in the hotel restaurant twice (note that this is not the 3-star, premiere restaurant upstairs, which was closed for August) and found it to be below average. In addition to the expectedly high-prices, we found the food somewhat bland and the service to be pretty spotty. Note that this is not a totally sleepy hotel restaurant... as a result of the hotel's somewhat remote location, it seems to get enough activity from guests to warrant a better experience. My most important advice would be to include the Imperial Club in your reservation (to the extent they are charging something reasonable). The Club serves light fare and juices, sodas and some alcohol from 7am to 11pm. Another positive would be the Concierge desk, led by Marco. They were enormously helpful and friendly, especially when it came to touring the city. As for restaurants, they didn't seem to have a lot of conviction in their choices....some of which may have been because many restauarants are close in August. As for the negative, I found that the front desk, altough staffed with polite and cheery young women, had a strange, negative attitude from the moment we checked in. Given that we had booked 12 room-nights (2 rooms for a 6-night stay), they were less than totally cooperative in getting us two non-smoking rooms. (Tip: As you should everywhere in Europe, it is essential to check the rooms at this hotel before moving your bags in if you do not like the smell of cigarette smoke... it is prevalent in the hotel, even in non-smoking rooms). What was irksome was that, on several occasions, the front desk staff (and even the hotel manager) referred to our "excellent rate" as an excuse for not being more helpful. This was particularly offensive in that I booked the rooms directly through Hilton (and not through Expedia or some other cut-rate agent) and received a good rate solely because I was willing to pay for the entire trip in advance, non-refundable, even before I left the States. It was almost as if, since they already had my money, they didn't feel that they had to ensure my satisfaction. After having a direct conversation, it was clear that this attitude came from the top (i.e., the property manager) and flowed down from him. This is extremely disappointing from a hotel of this caliber. Finally, I need to note that this is a particularly "Americanized" (almost exclusively English language) hotel. While this worked well for us, it may not work for those looking for a more authentic, local experience

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings. This hotel is good and bad”
Reviews.Author: canadianwarmth
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in august for 4 nights The feelings of my family are mixed. The rooms are nice. The location is not. The pool is great. The food is not. Some front desk staff speak english and are helpful, some don't speak english and are rude. Some managers are good, some were not The shuttle to the city is not good. Taxis were usually available at 15 euros each way The biggest problem at this hotel is the smoke. While there are no smoking rooms there is not a no smoking floor. We had a heavy smoker in the room next to us which defeated the whole purpose. The staff agreed it was a silly policy but said they will not change it So, stay here if you want to swim, don't mind paying for cabs to rome centre for sights and for dinner and if you like second hand smoke. These annoyances sadly did not offset the beauty of the location and the breakfast and mixed service

Reviews.Title: “Living in a Palace”
Reviews.Author: Skylarc24
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife been here last March 2011. After our 3 days escapades we had in Venice, where we also stayed in another Hilton property - Hilton Molino Stucky, we decided to make a very short visit to Rome to have our Ash Wednesday there. We took Easyjet flight from Marco Polo Airport to Fiumicino Airport early in the morning. We reached Fiumicino around 10am as far as I remember. We took cab which has a fix price of 60 euros from the airport going to hotel. Travel time took around 50mins to an hour. The distance of the airport to city centre is quite far... Upon arrival at the hotel, we were greeted and welcomed by the courteous staffs of the hotel and lead us to the very elegant desk of their reception. By the way, If you will have a look the exterior of the building (view from outside) it's like an old apartment building on top of a hill. You will feel a li'l bit disappointed coz the building is quite old and no appeal to your eyes... But as what others saying : DONT JUDGE THE BOOK BY ITS COVER. When we entered the hotel, we were so amazed coz it seemed that we went in a museum or an art room of a palace; the paintings were so elegant and the ambience gave me a bit of goosebumps because of it's luxurious interiors. The receptionist was very welcoming and check us in very quickly. The receptionist who assisted us was very helpful coz she almost come with us to accompany us to show our room. Our room was upgraded since I was a Hilton Honor Gold Member. Upon entering our room, I just can't describe how I feel. I was so amazed coz the room was so huge. It has a terrace with some chairs and a garden table, it has an office desk in the room, it has a big sofa, big bed, big tv and big bathroom. This was the first time also I experienced and saw a metal blinds - an automatic partition between the terrace and the room itself aside from the glass door by the terrace. They've got a double mirror door as well at the door entrance of the room so that you can't hear anything from outside and vice versa. I cant say anything bad with the room, it's like me and my wife were dreaming. Like you're a living in a Palace. They said that it's better if you will have a room viewing the city of Rome but unfortunately we were on the opposite side of the building - viewing nothing special. We also got an access with their executive lounge and compared to Hilton Molino Stucky Venice... I think the executive lounge in Venice is much better in terms of selection of drinks, canape's, sweets, nibbles and sandwiches though in Rome the only good was you have a good view of the garden of the hotel and the pool with some hint of the city's view. Though others said that the Rome Cavalieri was quite away from the city centre, me and my wife didn't had any difficulties going down to down town. We went by cab at the city centre and paid just 8 euros for 10 - 15 mins travel time. Though the hotel got free shuttle bus to and from the hotel going to the central; we just used their shuttle service once when we went home on that night from Plaza Barberini. We also used their indoor pool and since it was still March at that time the water of the pool is not that really warm enough to stay longer in the pool though it doesn't really matter coz we just stay their anyway for about 20 minutes. The pool's slippers was nice though. I was looking forward with the outdoor pool but it was close due to still winter temperature during that time though the max temperature reached 24 degrees celsius when we went to Rome last March during day time. The best part of Rome Cavalieri was the breakfast... It's like you're having a proper lunch buffet though in reality your just having a breakfast. Alot of selections from drinks to hot and cold food to pastries as in EVERYTHING... they've got japanese section as well. Their orange juice was strange though i love it so much coz the taste was so unique and the color as well. I can't describe their breakfast buffet... just amazing... utterly genius. Rome Cavalieri impressed me and my wife so much and we're planning to come back and stay their not only for 1 night... We're planning again to go back in this hotel by February particularly celebrating Valentine's Day... Not just only for 1 night but for a week. Thank you very much for the short but memorable experience we had in your property. All I can say is - Simply the best.... WELLDONE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, welcoming staff.. excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Brian C
Reviews.Content: We arrived here using Hilton points to stay for a couple of nights. The staff were friendly and informative, made us feel very welcome in the hotel. We had a standard double room that came with a double bed, marble bathroom, sofa, balcony and armchairs.. there was a sound proofing door just in case you're a light sleeper. The grounds were nice & the facilities were top class as expected. We had breakfast there, where everything was laid out in a buffet style. The food was well presented & excellent quality. We also decided to use the relaxation room & the sauna / steam rooms. It was very luxurious & the staff were excellent. The location of the hotel is a little far from the center of Rome & the bus service wasn't as regular as we hoped. We had to wait sometime for a taxi home. However, if you're lucky enough to get a room with a view.. the views over Rome seem quite spectacular. Would be nice to have some additional extras included such as WiFi and basic television - I think additional charges for these basic services are a poor reflection on the hotel. Hopefully they will include them in the future. All in all, this place is definitely worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “20 years later and still the best”
Reviews.Author: row62
Reviews.Content: Last time I was here was fabulous, and when it came time to return to Rome on a weeked with the better half we are glad we stayed here, after all this time (and a name change) it's still fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed every minute”
Reviews.Author: SueBeth
Reviews.Content: Recently my husband and I stayed at the Rome Cavalieri and thoroughly enjoyed it. It is a beautiful hotel and part of its appeal is that it is set in a nice neighborhood outside of the center of Rome. The hotel provides a shuttle and with just a little planning on a guests part, this works out quite well. After 8PM it is very easy and reasonably priced to take a taxi to the hotel from downtown Rome. One thing that impressed us was the kindness of the hotel staff. From the lovely girl when we checked in, to the staff in the lounge, they were all doing a great job with a pleasant attitude. I hope that someday we will be fortunate enough to make a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “I hope you are sitting down!”
Reviews.Author: wsjohnson.phd
Reviews.Content: From the minute you drive up to the front door (or are driven there) you will be IN LOVE with this property!! Absolutely and with no sense of doubt!! Heck, even Stevie Wonder can see this is the place to stay if in Roma (yeah, I know, I know) The first person you encounter, the doorman (Pedro in my case) will immediately put you at ease; yes, you do indeed get what you pay for and believe me, the Rome Cavalieri is WORTH IT!! I have stayed in several Waldorf properties in the past and (sigh) must admit the Waldorf=Astoria has been surpassed. Every member of the staff are world class and allow you to feel as tho you "belong" as silly as that sounds I think you know what I mean by it. Never at any time did we "want" for anything that the staff couldn't provide! And the room, well what can I say? It was tremendous, large, expansive and completely comfortable. Loved it (and no I am not being a shill) The hotel has two restaurants (both world class with the most attentive and knowing wait staff we've encountered) the facilities on site were also world-class, the workout center and trainer perfection, the swimming pools and attendants fabulous. We stayed on the 7th floor and had access to the Imperial Club, again well worth the expense. The young ladies staffing the Club were extremely helpful, courteous and well above what you'd expect. Professional and attentive. The view from the club's balcony were/are OUTSTANDING!, really, if I used terms like 'breath taking' that would describe it after dark, the city seriously twinkles below you (we had the same view from our room and wow, wow) No kidding, this was the absolute best place to spend your anniversary as we were (as were several people we met in the Club) or any other reason to visit Rome. Honestly, I really can't put into words how much we appreciated this property and the staff and the VIEWS!! Trust me, there may be less expensive properties in Rome (and I'm sure there are, but no where will you feel like you will when you're actually sitting in the lobby and appreciating your surroundings. Love this place and oh yeah, (like Douglas MacArthur), I will return! However, the weather in Rome in August is a bit HOT, didn't know that - or realize how hot it would be - when we arrived, just be aware of that if you're thinking of a summer visit But then, like we discovered, there's very few reasons to leave the property (souvenirs, the vatican, sight seeing etc., granted) Just think as I did, while walking in the sun, of what awaits you on your return. The hotel provides hourly shuttle service to the Piazza Barberini, which is minutes from the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain and there's a metro stop as well which places you minutes from anywhere in the city. The metro is air conditioned (like my mom's refrigerator) so no heat worries there. I have nothing to complain about; seriously, nothing at all. The perfect place for a holiday or romantic weekend: the city and the Hotel fit together like well, Rome and Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: JIMKChicago_Illinois
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at the Cavalieri during spring break. We booked 2 rooms and were absolutely thrilled every moment. Met at checkin with cool towels, sparkling water, and a warm smile, we were directed to a small lounge to wait for our rooms to be ready. (We arrived at 10:30 from an overseas flight). The room was excellent, the views breathtaking. The staff was expert, knowledgeable and friendly. Advice on family friendly restaurants was perfect - the tour of the Vatican that the concierge arranged was a highlight of our trip. We plan on going back again and again!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel, hope to be back one day”
Reviews.Author: Linda056
Reviews.Content: When booking ask for room overlooking city of Rome. Make sure to have buffet breakfast, excellent. Disappointed 18 Euro charged each person per day to sit by the pool. Staff very friendly. Rooms spacious. I liked being able to have doors open at night onto balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Really pleased with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Canadian-Beagle
Reviews.Content: This is certainly not one of the best hotels in the world but it was very good. The rooms were of a very comfortable size and were furnished nicely. The grounds were very attractive. The breakfast and dinner service was very good. The pool is large and attractive. The Imperial Room was not great but was a nice place to get a drink and some snacks. I would have like the bathrooms to have a separate shower but not the end of the world to have the shower in the bathtub. The hotel is not downtown but that is what we liked about it. It is close enough to the action but enough away so as to not feel overwhelmed by the city. We did not pay a fortune for our rooms (we prepaid months in advance - no cancellation or modifications permitted) so I felt that we actually got a deal. All in all, I was very happy with this hotel and would be pleased to recommend it and also to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Roman Fantasy”
Reviews.Author: Rashwan_11
Reviews.Content: The service at the Rome Cavalieri is Top Notch.The hotel is everything I imagined when I dream abouy Rome and its authenticity.From the minute I arrived at the hotel,I admired its unique antiques collection,and I knew that I stepped into a world of fantasy. The staff are extremely accomodating and exceptional.The room was extremely comfortable with a unique view of Rome.This hotel goes above any other hotel in Rome and above any other Hilton hotel in Europe.Service at the Imperial Club is impeccable,no fault could be found. The staff of the Imperial Club were friendly,professional,and went out of their way to be helpful.The hotel is absolutely not to be missed when I go back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: Beauboy
Reviews.Content: We were blown away when we arrived - the hotel and grounds are stunning. We found the staff vey friendly and the bedrooms beautifully appointed. We are two families and our reservation for two twins in one name and one double in another name was meticulously specified online, but we were allocated an adjoining twin/double and another twin instead. A small grumble and not the end of the world, but the reception staff did not seem interested in trying to change our room allocation for us. What I found jaw-droppingly unbelievable - and what has prompted me to write this review - is the 18 euro charge to use the pool. We were a group of 6 and were entertaining another family of 5 in the restaurant, spending no small amount of money. I can understand that they feel the need to charge non-residents a fee to use the pool (although, if they are eating in the restaurant, I don't think it would be unreasonable to waive the charge), but we ended up paying 200 Euros for our group to have sun-loungers (two of which were subsequently misappropriated by other guests) on top of the 500 Euros we paid for (a delicious) lunch. I've read a couple of the replies to similar complaints and I must point out that I have no wish to join the HH club and accrue enough points to gain access to a swimming pool. When I pay for a room in a hotel, I expect to be able to use the hotel's facilities without additional charges. Wi-fi is fair enough - it's not uncommon to be charged for it, but there also appeared to be a charge to use the TV as well. I have stayed in 5* hotels all around the world and have never come across such a policy before. We stayed only one night as we were at the end of a cruise. We fully intend to return to Rome before too long, but - as much as I loved the hotel - I couldn't possibly envisage staying here again because of the afore-mentioned charges.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but out of the way”
Reviews.Author: Susyabbo
Reviews.Content: Great views and huge rooms (particularly for European standards). Location is not ideal for walking out the our and exploring the city of Rome. Very good service and serene atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “A Flawed Diamond”
Reviews.Author: Roger8218
Reviews.Content: It goes without saying that the furnishings rooms and grounds are excellent at this famous 5 star hotel however as this is not simply a business hotel a little more is required. The hotel may be busy with many short stay visitors but it is 5 star and it charges like a 5 star yet the element of service is not there. Whilst the reception staff are charming most things thereafter are not. Poor quality service at beakfast,indifferent/rude service from certain pool staff(non Italian) poor service from concierge desk and surly service at the front door do not make this a pleasureable experience. For Hilton Diamond members no access to the upstairs lounge and a small lunge on the ground floor has an extremely poor offering compared with other similar class hotels eg Park Lane Hilton London dryed up sandwiches sweaty cheese no spirits...above all its just the attitude of many staff who are jaded and who have little in the way of interpersonal skills. This hotel is for what I can see is trading on its name and not on its currenr performance. A grerat disappointment as I had been looking forward to staying here for a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Really Great Hotel 7 stars”
Reviews.Author: Pat675
Reviews.Content: We stayed there with the entire family. This is one Hotel I loved and I am not a big fan of Italian Hotels. They only allow three people per room. We had to get extra rooms and split everybody - That was the only draw back. The Hilton Cavaliere is really a museum with wonderful service from the minute you walk in you are welcomed to the most beautiful hotels I have ever been to anywhere including Las vegas. In one word, it was "Owesome". I want to send a bottle of wine to the friend that gave me the referral.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Very well appointed luxury hotel! enjoyed it !”
Reviews.Author: msqden24
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a surprise trip for my partner's birthday. And it was right choice the hotel absolutely fantastic throughout from the entrance to the top floor restaurant. We really enjoyed our stay and no complaints whatsoever. I booked a room on Imperial floor which is level 7 and 8 which you can gain access only by sliding your room key in elevator . Rooms are very spacious well appointed with a Aqua Di Parma bathroom kit refilled twice a day. Unless you book rome view do not expect anything special viewwise from your room as its roof tops and nothing special but we wasnt bothered about it at all so it was fine . Imperial club serve champagne from 7 am till 11 pm nonstop and other alcoholic beverages from around 6 pm . bite size food served 5 times a day ( literally nonstop ) and a coctails from 7 onwards . As a gold Hhonors member all pools and spa access complimentary which was a bonus and enjoyable after all day browsing rome . Shuttle bus runs every hour with an hour pause in service around 3 pm . we was going out on a shuttle but coming back by taxi which was only 10 euros ( no matter where from you coming back it was 10 euros and 15 at night) Vatican is 20 minutes walkaway if you turn left from hotel . We have enjoyed our 4 night stay at this property and could not fault it for anything so very well done and thank you to all members of staff who makes this hotel so perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing !!!”
Reviews.Author: Eden111
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simply gorgeous!!Starting from the staff -polite and friendly,the rooms are huge,including the bathroom,balcony with great views over the city!!Simply comfortable and very clean.Breakfast is amazing - big choice of everything that you can imagine.The hotel itself is like a museum,shiny and stunning!!!There is a free shuttle bus service to the center and backwards.We enjoyed our stay and would definitely come back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: jgm2
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights on our whistlestop tour of Italy. Missus has been busted down to silver HHonor status which meant we could no longer stuff ourselves at the lounge and save money on dinner so we had to press our face against the glass like starving orphans. Looked pretty good fare. That said we still had free use of the spa and indoor pool which was most excellent. The hotel tries to charge you for the sun-loungers around the outdoor pool but we were having none of it and nobody bothered us to ask us to sign anything. lucky for them. What do they want you do do? Sit on the floor? Fine. Move the sunlounger. I'll lie on the grass before I pay 4 x 15 Euro to lie on a sunlounger. Pay for the sunloungers at your own hotel? Are they mad? Breakfast buffet was excellent. Views from the top floor are excellent. As are the views from the room if you've paid to be on the Rome side of the hotel otherwise you have a fine view of what has to be the biggest radio mast in the whole of Italy. It must be what the Pope uses to speak directly to God. It's huge. We had a view of the mast but then for 200Euros per night I wasn't too bothered - the room was huge as was the bathroom. Hourly buses to and from the centre of Rome are free (about 15 - 20 min drive). Plenty of FREE onroad parking available just outside the hotel. Car unmolested for the entire stay. Concierge excellent and well informed. Staff all kind and helpful. Book well in advance for the best restaurant in Italy (L Pergola) which is on the top floor. This isn't my hyperbole - this is according to Mr Michelin and his three stars. The price (Menu degustation 200 Euros EACH) will make you cry tears of blood but the food is great and the views over Rome are world class.

Reviews.Title: “Such a perfect hotel and a breathtaking view of Rome!”
Reviews.Author: m981
Reviews.Content: Never experienced a better service in any other hotel. It's the highest point of view looking on Rome, even higher than the "zodiaco". The SPA is roman-style, made with marble and precious materials.. you will never want to get out. The outside pool is really nice, and for the winter you can enjoy the inside pool. The best thing are the 2 restaurants: the 3-star-michelin "La Pergola" on the rooftop (remember to book with early advance) and the "Uliveto" poolside restaurant, definitely less expensive but still with great quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bhersh3550
Reviews.Content: This was a fantastic old world property with all the amenities you would want in a first class hotel. Try and get a room facing the City with a higher floor and you will be VERY happy. The spa is very nice and the pool is fantastic. The only negative is that you are a 10-15 minute ride into the city where you will most likely want to be each day and night. The hotel does provide a complimentary shuttle so that is very nice but it just requires a little more planning. Since I am a Hilton Gold member I was able to receive some nice benefits which were free internet and spa access which would have otherwise been an additional expense. However, the hotel, staff and food were worth the extra planning to get into the city and I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: R55wilson
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days in august with access to executive lounge, pools, spa, and fitness center. Wow, the best fitness and spa area in any hotel I've ever been to. The entry and hallways are full of beautiful art, statues, tapestries. Rooms were large and comfertable. Hotel sits on a hill overlooking Rome and the Vatican with free bus service to Barberini Metro station which is walking distance to Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps. Restaurant has good food but quite expensive. Paid 8 EURO [ 12 US ] for peach ice tea at poolside?

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Views”
Reviews.Author: rayne65
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf has everything one would expect from a high end hotel. The rooms are large and very well equipped. The views from the balcony overlooking the gardens and Rome are beautiful. The thing to take into consideration when planning a stay are the prices. We ordered a pizza from room service, expecting the usual service charges to be applied but were surprised upon check out at the additional fees and taxes added to the bill. A pizza we expected to cost about $45 ended up costing $75 USD. The staff are very courteous and helpful. The hotel is situated a bit away from the sites of Rome, too far to walk. A quick cab ride is all it takes to get to the must see sites.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary Service From The Moment We Arrived”
Reviews.Author: PSDixon
Reviews.Content: This is an exceptional hotel property. It is grand in every way. Hotel grounds are like a grand estate. Staff are very attentive. If you can include the continental breakfast with your room - go for it as you will not be disappointed. Room very clean and well appointed. This hotel is on a hill above Rome. Views are dramatic. There is a shuttle service that runs throughout the day to and from the hotel but does not run late in the evening. Taxi with gratuity is about 12 Euros each way (we utilized taxis several times).

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Lineejlersen
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel due to the pool and facilities. However you have to pay for these facilities unless you stay in a suite (imperial room). We stay in a lot of hotels mostly 5 stars and have never experienced this. It was €18 to sit by the pool, €20 to use the gym, €22 to have wifi for 24 hours. Furthermore the food at the hotel was also very expensive and not that good. We had a room overlooking a mast, so we weren't very impressed. The rooms were quite dated and stuffy, but the bed was extremely comfortable. There was no iron in the room and we were advised that we weren't allowed to borrow one, but we had to instead have our clothes pressed and as it was weekend and bank holiday it was 50% extra. However most of the staff were courteous. For our last night in Rome we moved to the Boscolo Exetra at plaza de la Republica and that I can thoroughly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experience - hope for the best, and prepare for the worst”
Reviews.Author: mcacadian
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife in July. Similar to many reviews here, our experience ranged from poor to great. For us, the location was fine. I would strongly recommend getting a pre-arranged car service (we used romecabs for 50 euro which was fine). The shuttle bus service was very convenient and efficient. We had them drop us off at Plaza Flamingo which is a great area (1/2 way to the normal drop off). Taxis were reasonable to the hotel from city center and the Vatican. We liked being out of the city center as it allowed us to see areas of Rome we had not seen before (e.g. we really like walking from Plaza Flamingo to the city center). However, I would not recommend staying here for a first trip. I think the hotel is very geared to conventions as there is a large convention hall in the building. So it seemed like service for non-convention goers was not as good. I was also staying on points (as I think many at this hotel do) so that seemed to result in a poor experience at the front desk. I can understand from the hotel's perspective, it has to be annoying having guests book points stays and then asking for "city view" upgrades so I understand why they are not very hospitable, but it was disappointing none-the-less. For instance, I asked for a late check-out of an hour and the manager (K Khaled) told me the hotel was fully booked and one was not available. He was quite obnoxious. I checked online and the hotel had at least 12 rooms open and I have never had a Hilton deny a late check-out even when they are booked up. The room was nice and spacious but furniture was a little dirty. The bed was great, as well as the bathroom. I did have a weird experience with a cleaning lady barging into the room checking the mini-bar. I asked her to leave and she wouldn't until she checked the mini-bar. I always thought those stories were a hoax until it actually happened to me. The outside of the building is not so great (thay's why there are no pictures on the website) but overally the grounds are very nice and the common areas are well decorated. The gym and pool are great. There are some restaurants near the hotel. I tried "The View", which does have an amazing view but the food was just OK. There is a little town square about 7 blocks away and the restaurant the concierge recommended was fantastic....one of our best meals. The HH lounge was nice and the snacks were fine. Breakfast was included with our stay (which was only pointed out on our second day) so, for free, it was fine. However, I would have been very disappointed if I paid for it. The coffee was horrible and the eggs were cold - of course, we ate around 9:30 each morning. If you can look past potentially awful service, the Cavalieri is a nice place to stay. I could see it as a great place with kids because of the pool, or if you are part of convention, or staying on points. For someone looking to be close to the city center, first time vistors, or someone picky about service, I would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “We will certainly not go to this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: cojusna
Reviews.Content: I reserved an imperial room which must have a privilage.But they gave me the worst room possible with residents view.I reserved a 50 m2 room but they cheated and gave a smaller one.Our room was at the end of the corridor and there was 1 entry for 2 rooms which make the room smaller than others.I wanted to change it but the guy at the reception wanted to persuade me that size was same as other rooms.They think you are stupid.I saw the other rooms while they were cleaning and there was a huge difference.Our bathroom was 5 m2.The hotel soon will need a renovation.Swimming pool is old and because of its old system it is not clean.Top of water is always greasy.I would not recommend to pay such a high rate for this hotel as it does not offer anything super.With those prices you can have a perfect holiday in Turkey at high luxury hotels.In Italy you pay a lot but you get nothing.This hotel is an example of this.Internet is extremely expensive.Even in the imperial rooms it is not free.They do not send iron to the room and they say because of security reasons.And to iron a dress they want 18 € ! They can make a room where guests go and iron theirselves.

Reviews.Title: “Good value if you book early”
Reviews.Author: Brad781
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this hotel and found it to be a good value and the rooms were definitely larger than comparable rooms across Europe. If you plan ahead and are willing to prepay for the room (which we did), you can do well for both room choice (only consider and pay extra for the Rome-view side of the hotel), got interconnecting rooms guaranteed which was important since we were travelling with kids, and our rate came with breakfast included, which ended up being a great value considering what the cash price is if not part of your package. We were travelling with another family that did not guarantee themselves Rome-view (just "best available"), and sure enough they ended up on the radio-tower side of the hotel and not loving life, whereas we enjoyed a spectacular view of Rome below our rooms. Also, we were aware when we booked it that the sun-lounger day-rate of 18 Euro per lounger is part of the deal when using the pool, so no surprises there, and if you are only interested in a quick dip at the beginning/end of the day, you won't need the sun-lounger nor need to pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Win the lottery first”
Reviews.Author: milesw
Reviews.Content: Just not sure about this place… Travelled with kids and two other families at the start of our Italian summer holiday, and I was upgraded to an interconnecting room over the city, with the other two families on the car park side of the hotel. The view is amazing and it really isn’t a problem being a quick 10-15 Euro taxi ride from town. The rooms were well appointed and well maintained. And as someone who stays about 100 nights a year in hotels, I liked the different traditional décor of the rooms on the view side of the hotel (the non-view rooms are still nice, but all the same). The public areas are very nice too, as is the pool area, but it could all do with a total modernization – it’s a little 1980s. Don’t get me wrong, it’s all very well looked after, but trapped in 1985. So why am I a little disappointed…well the staff, while generally attentive were not particularly good – the Concierge wasn’t very well informed and it’s a bit industrial in places. But the biggest issue by far, as most other reviewers point out is the cost. Everything, and I mean EVERYTHING costs. Sun loungers were a stunning 18 Euros each and pool side drinks were 10 Euros. Breakfast was a further 38 Euros (same price for children) and food by the pool was more expensive than dinner at my local Gordon Ramsey Restaurant in London. Don’t even think about he minibar… To have breakfast, sit by the pool and have a drink for a family of four will set you back over 260 Euros a day!!!! Its daylight robbery and total destroys what could be a world class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “First Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: mindoslu
Reviews.Content: We have spent 4 nights at Rome Cavalieri, in The hottest month of the summer with our 2 sons. The rooms were superb, the outdoor pool came to the rescue after long walks in the sun. We used the fitness center, but not took the advantage of the gteat spa facility. The front desk staff was helpful, although at times there was a difficuly of understanding English. We were using our points as HH diamond members so we had the access to all the faciliies at the hotel. We liked the breakfast buffets a lot. My kids eat different foods so it wasn't a problem at all to make them happy. The fruit table was rich, there were many different fresh juices, cold cuts, cheeses, bread selection and pastries. There was even a Japanese breakfast offered, I've never seen that in any other country before. In the other reviews I've read the complaints about the hotel shuttle, during our visit, when there were too many people they added another minibus, so transportation was never a problem. The drivres even accomodated to the passengers wishes and changed the route and dropped them off closer to their destinations. I don't know how the other passengers felt when there was a custom made route each time though. The hotel website does nor specify where to take it from, if you want to ride it from downtown the first time.Piazza Barberini is a big plaza and you might be waiting for it at the wrong side, the shuttle stops on the corner of Via d Basilio, there is a clam shaped mini fountain on the corner. My only negative comment is about the wifi connection. From our rooms we could get on the internet, but it was either too slow or cutting off every five minutes.In this day and age I believe Hilton can upgrade its system, better than any no name hotel.We did not have a chance to eat at La Pergola because it was under renovation, but we have seen a lot of people especially traveling with young children eating at Ulvieto in the evenings. We have stayed long in town in the evenings and took a cab couple times (last shuttle is at 8pm) and did not pay more than €10. Overall, we had a great time at Cavalieri and if we ever come back to Rome I'll stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Rude”
Reviews.Author: kasmar
Reviews.Content: I cannot believe all the raving reviews about this resort. Out of our three week stay in Europe this was by far the most unfriendly hotel we stayed in! Yes, it is beautiful, but please tell me there other hotels in Rome that are beautiful, and friendly. Staff was very rude in every way. Service was extremely slow and don't dare ask a question to any of the staff. They will either walk by you or give you a look. Very uncomfortable. One of the things we were looking forward to was the use of the pool. There were no chairs to be had, at least that is what we were told, but upon returning to our room and sitting on the balcony we saw the staff carrying cushions out to chairs???? We did use the indoor pool and I am mystified why we were told we had to use swimming caps. The advertisement on the tv in our room showed a long haired brunette swimming in the indoor pool with her hair flowing freely. And, the only way to enjoy this hotel is to have a city view. If you get a room on the other side of the hotel you are looking into a dirty complex and a huge satelite antenna. I would not recommend this hotel.....period!!!

Reviews.Title: “trying to be something it is not”
Reviews.Author: rossiliverpool
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights for a conference, I had high expectations for the hotel, due to the 5 star status. Firstly I have to say there was no bad experience to specifically talk about. The score comes from the whole experience, As mentioned in previous reviews, the pricing policy is totally unjustified. 29 Euro for burger and frozen french fries, not even home made chips, is just wrong. We ordered 4 glasses of coke and 3 sprite for a total of 81 Euro!!. Thats enough on the pricing as you get the picture. The room we had, faced the biggest pylon/communication tower I have ever seen, we nicknamed it the eiffel tower. The room itself was ok, nothing bad but just very average. have styed in much better rooms for a lot less. The balcony looked like a 2/3 star, it had rubber cable running along the rim and into the soil, cracked and flaking paint, just not what you expect at this level. The service in the hotel was unattentive at best, in both bar area and restaurants. Apart from the concierges, who were both friendly and attentive. Pool is large and warm, but we had an agreement to use early as part of our business stay, would not be happy if had to pay. Overall the hotel is just dissapointing and does not have that special feel. I have stayed in a great hotel called splendid hotel, much better in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Best part of 4 week European trip, but could use a little improvement”
Reviews.Author: cldkb
