Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed here for 3 nights at the end of our month long tour in Europe. Yes, the hotel is not in the middle of the city, but it's not that far from major sites. There is a shuttle and we took a cab to the Vatican which was only 7 euros for 5 people (we had a tour guide with us). When we arrived my wife and daughters started crying at how beautiful it was. The art collection in the hotel is incredible. The large commode/dresser that greets you as you walk is something you should take the time to look at. An amazing piece of craftsmanship. I have to say that our trip through Europe was not spent in hotels this nice so my review might be a little biased. The staff was very accommodating and the concierge really helped me put together my 20th anniversary celebration with my wife. The rooms are large, nicely appointed and very comfortable. The bed was so welcoming after some of thing things we had to sleep on. Finally the view over the city was amazing. Yes I paid for the upgrade to the city view room. Being able to control everything in the room from buttons next to the bed was really nice. I have to say our room was beautiful and clean for the most part. The bathroom needs a little help (see below). For our anniversary we had the most amazing dinner at La Pergola. It is a Michelin 3 star, it is expensive and if you like to dine it is worth it. You don't have to have the tasting menu (6-9 courses) which is what I think people really complain about when talking about price per person. We had an incredible 4 course meal, champagne, sauterne and a bottle of wine and our whole meal was less than what I see some reviews quote per person. I would say 200 euros per person is a fair estimate. The only problem we had was a table that was seated next to us had a guy that had to keep bragging about how he has eaten there before. He ran his mouth so much we actually had to be moved inside. Still the dinning experience was totally worth it and Chef Beck even came out and answered our questions about some of his preparations. Okay, I'll get back to reviewing the hotel. My stay is not without complaints. The hotel is confusing regarding the use of the pools. We were told on check-in that we were allowed to use the indoor pool and that we would have to pay to use the outdoor pool. We later found out that we could swim in the outdoor pool, but couldn't use the lounge chairs. The whole pool situation was a little strange and I wish it was clearer. It didn't bother us to use the indoor pool because you weren't allowed to smoke in there. The outdoor pool was like a smoking lounge. The hotel has some really beautiful grounds, but they really need to work on where people are allowed to smoke. It's allowed everywhere outside and if you want to enjoy a evening cocktail overlooking the beautiful city be prepared to have a pack of cigarettes to go with it. It's really sad that a non-smoker has to suffer the consequences of a human chimney. A couple other complaints. The jacuzzi tub in in one of our rooms didn't work and the shower head needed to be replace or cleaned in the other. The toilettes need some work too... The breakfast was very nice and a nice variety of foods. The smiley face in the cappuccino was a fun touch. We had to sit inside though because of the smoking issue. The hotel also has an incredible looking gym and spa. I say looking because I didn't have time to use either, but they looked nice. Bottom line, I would come back to this hotel if I came back to Rome. My expectations would be higher though and if the problems (pool use, bathrooms and smoking) I mentioned still existed I would probably only rate it a 3 star place.

Reviews.Title: “Business Travel with Wife”
Reviews.Author: SOCalTraveler1952
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a marvelous experience then this is the place to stay. While you may not be within walking distance of the Coliseum, the Spanish Steps or Trevi Fountain they are all reachable for a cheap cab fare. As it was our first visit to Roam we caught a cab at the hotel who took us on a brief tour of the city to get our bearings and to see in one quick tour the major points in the city (30 Euros – Cheap investment for limited time frame). The staff was excellent – the room was great (even had a secondary sound proof door to keep the sound from the hallway from entering the room). The hotel restaurant was excellent we ate outside by the pool. Also you must get a room that overlooks the city. My wife will go back in a heartbeat – she was not wanting to leave when it was time to go. Do not stay here if you are looking for an inexpensive lodging solution or concerned about the Euro dollar exchange rate – stay at Motel 6 – They keep the lights on.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: vbnet
Reviews.Content: Stayed as part of a 25th anniversary trip. While the view was spectacular, the rest of it was not really worth the price. The room appears sumptuous at first, then you start noticing the condition of the linen, cracked tiles, etc. Service at front desk is s l o w, elsewhere, pretty good. The breakfast buffet was very good. The location was pretty far from things we wanted to see and do but we knew that going in. We thought the hotel was going to be really special and our overall impression was it was pleasant, but not the big deal they would like you to think. Everytime you turn around there is an extra charge - fitness center, pool (yes, they charge you to use the pool)..

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: Lechiensview
Reviews.Content: great service, friendly staff, very accommodating of children, Pools and gardens are the clincher particularly in the heat of summer. Close to major sites, but an escape from the crowds. we will be back

Reviews.Title: “stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: StuartCookKampala
Reviews.Content: Disappointing from the moment we arrived. The service levels for a five star hotel are not on point. Holes in towels, room not turned down two days in a row. Breakfast had to ask for coffee, cup cracked, had to ask for a teaspoon, then milk, then sugar! Most common answer amongst staff is, 'no' or 'we're closed' At 400 Euros per night you still have to pay to use the gym (20), pool (18 for a sun lounger) & internet (27) and 45 euro for breakfast. Certainly not 5 star value, we left feeling underwhelmed.

Reviews.Title: “Location is far from downtown, property is beautiful and big.”
Reviews.Author: DaZipper
Reviews.Content: Read a lot of reviews warning of the high prices they charge you for everything. If you are a Hilton Honors gold member (or higher) this will take a LOT of the pain away via free room upgrades and access to free food, booze, coffee, and soda at the Colosseo Lounge from 11am to 11pm. all in all the property was beautiful, checkin was smooth with pretty English speaking girls securing our room for us even though we arrived -at 9am. Room was plenty big with a nice view overlooking the balcony. Selection of English speaking TV stations are pretty much limited to news stations like CNN and FoxNews. The view from the 9th floor rooftop is the hidden gem at this hotel and arguably the best single view to be had of all that is Rome. Breakfast Buffett (included for Hilton Honors members) is probably the best breakfast buffet I've ever had. The pool is big and deep and my teenage sons enjoyed the occasional French ladies sunbathing topless - something you just don't see in America. The free shuttle to downtown is prompt and the drivers friendly although they speak very limited English. The food at the restaurant for dinner was mediocre and expensive. We walk a mile down the road on the 3rd evening and found a much better quality and affordable restaurant with al fresco dining. In summary, service was great, location is not convenient, property is beautiful, amenities like the pool, breakfast, colosseo lounge, and wifi make it a great place to get acclimated to the city before transferring downtown to a hotel more centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “A little far from sites but wow - beautiful hotel with red clay tennis courts!”
Reviews.Author: Scribulous
Reviews.Content: 3 nights at the Rome Cavalieri was pure luxury! We got a great deal online in January to book for 3 nights (no money returned if cancelled) so we went for it. The rooms were beautifully appointed with lovely furniture, comfortable beds, pillows of your choice, beautiful, large bathrooms fully appointed. We had a patio although our view was a bunch of run down buildings with laundry hanging out of them and a TV tower (the other side the views are gorgeous - city of Rome but are an upgrade). They have an incredible pool which you have to pay extra for (I think it's $45 euros/day) so we passed on it. Passed on the spa too as we didn't have time. The breakfast is to die for (it was included in our package but it is normally chargeable). It was far though - a 15 euro cab ride to the main city centre, Vatican, ruins, etc. - so that is the drawback - but after a busy day, it felt like a refuge. They have absolutely pristine red clay tennis courts in a lovely setting so bring your tennis racquet. They have a piano player at night - we saw a different person each night and they were really good. Romantic actually. Patio outside was beautiful at night, overlooking a glowing blue pool. Also, for club members 5 pm Happy Hour every night but it was always so booked and you couldn't get seats so we asked for wine in our room which they obliged with. Overall, the best place we stayed in Italy by far!

Reviews.Title: “Everything was (a) Grand!”
Reviews.Author: TimeTraveler0123_10
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, great room and wonderful staff, except one guy at the front desk! Breakfast was very good, the shuttle was great and punctual. The hotel is not conveniently located, I think where the bus leaves you is probably better, Piazza Barberi on Via Veneto. The concierge were great. Like some of the reviews I felt some of the other lobby staff were expecting tips for anything and everything. Overall a beautiful place, but pricey and a bit pretentious. In the past it's been rated the best hotel in Europe, it's hard to beat on many levels but I would think there are other more consumate hotels. Can't go wrong here, but can go right elsewhere too!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: fayeq8
Reviews.Content: this hotel has a great location, very quiet and safe, great service and beautiful restaurant

Reviews.Title: “Majestic hotel with fantastic views for many...”
Reviews.Author: panda999
Reviews.Content: This is a luxurious hotel. The rooms were spacious and very comfortable, the beds were especially lovely. Soundproof door also really helpful, no noise here at all compared to other hotels. Electric shutter over the balcony too if required. We booked a long weekend with Sovereign & they had incorrectly informed us we had a Rome view...well it turned out to be a view of a huge telecom mast - in Rome I suppose! Although the room was great, we really felt we were missing out & decided to upgrade to a proper 'Rome' view. It was fantastic! If you are going to book to come here in the 1st place (it's fairly expensive) then you may as well pay extra for a Rome view. Being perched on a hilltop, you can see most of the City of Rome & loads of the historical landmarks from your balcony. To have them spread before you really is amazing. I now wish I'd taken a small set of binoculars with us & a camera with a better zoom. We had no problems using the Courtesy transport to and from the City Centre. All members of staff we encountered were excellent - so polite and nothing was too much trouble. There was so much choice at breakfast, we couldn't fault a thing. Room service was also excellent. Our only problem was with so much to see and do in Rome, we ran out of time to use the pool and spa. We will just have to save that for a return visit. Being new to Waldorf Astoria (Hilton Honours) loyalty, we were happy to find we'd also accumulated loads of points to use back in the UK. I would be very surprised if you didn't enjoy your stay here! We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Spa & Pools, Bit Far From Town.”
Reviews.Author: Kalanianaole808
Reviews.Content: Overall, highly recommended. The spa was fabulous, we got great massages. The various hot tubs, steam rooms, etc were perfect for relaxing. The only downside to this hotel is that it is a bit out of town and is not really walkable. We walked back to the hotel one night and I would not recommend it - it's quite a hike uphill through a wooded area, and then the sidewalk runs out and you're on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and an even better La Pergola Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: southdevon
Reviews.Content: The lounge is great and looks stunning. The rooms have air con and everything you need but an iron and ironing board. However there was a room provided with a very good iron in it. Breakfast was very good and the espresso or capucino mmmmm, what else to expect in Italy. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The executive lounge is a bit small and cannot compete with others in Europe. La Pergola the exquisite restaurant on the top floor is just perfect. The view is probably the best in Rome. The food is second to none, yes it has its price but it is worth every cent. The "normal" restaurant is very good as well but make sure you get a terrase seat as the air con in the restaurant is ok but the fresh brise outside is much better and more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “The Wow Factor”
Reviews.Author: magsj59
Reviews.Content: No.1 Wow - First sight of the hotel, warm welcome by concierge & reception. 2 Wow - Being congratulated on our 30th wedding anniversary (mentioned briefly in our original booking back in January),then being given a letter selecting us for upgrade to Imperial Room. 3 Wow - Imperial room, stylish design, breathtaking views, delicious food and drink, lovely welcoming staff, nothing too much trouble especially the numerous trays of tea we British like. 4. Wow - The Imperial bedroom on the 8th floor, forget the view of the telephone mast and apartment buildings, this is Italy and the balcony also gave a delightful view of the front of the hotel and the gorgeous fountain. Far worse views from many top class hotels in numerous other cities. Not a negative factor at all. The bedroom wanted for nothing, even an umbrella if it should be needed - the amazing thunderstorm viewed from the balcony one evening was thoroughly enjoyable but maybe the hotel can't take too much credit for that! The hotel, however, did provide the balcony complete with canopy so thanks for that. 5. Wow - The bathroom deserves its own Wow, everything you needed, expertly cleaned, very ornate but functional and apologies but there are now a couple of Cavalieri soaps in my bathroom at home with instructions not to use them! 6 Wow - The shuttle bus, always on time, loved being driven through the crazy roads of Rome, a fascinating insight into Rome life, a very modern coach, air conditioned and a very professional service. 7 Wow - The amazingly friendly, professional, caring, attentive staff who speak excellent English. I do not think I ever had need to open a door for myself, every single staff member whom we passed, whether it be housekeeping, concierge, restaurant, shuttle driver, or just staff simply passing by - always, always took the time to smile and afford a greeting. They make you feel so welcomed. 8 Wow - Last but not least Wow - The Cavalieri Hotel itself - never apologise for your location, its just perfect, not only for the views it affords across the city of Rome but from the enjoyment we got from being at the top of the dome of St. Peters and being able to see the Hotel clearly and say "that's where we are staying, yes that lovely hotel on the hillside so clearly visible from here". The Cavalieri Hotel did not live up to our expectations of the past 6 months, it surpassed them and for that we thank you and for a truly amazing 5 days in Rome. Priceless and unforgettable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-money saving tips in review”
Reviews.Author: docjimbo
Reviews.Content: I think the hotel has been covered by everybody before me. It is ugly from the outside but boy is it beautiful inside!! Truely magnificent, rooms are 50 sq meter and furnished lovely. Ignore all others that tell you to upgrade. I got the cheapest rooms (family of 5) . We're only in the room to sleep so a view didn't matter, Beds were big and very comfortable with pillow menu. Interconnecting rooms with full marble bathrooms and usual Hilton freebees. Breakfast included and at best was adequate, certainly not worth paying for on the day. Lots of fruit that you can take to snack on during the day. The pools were fantastic main pool 25m long and approx 15 m wide and strangely very deep even in shallow end, staffed very well indeed but a bit heavy handed on the kids not allowing them to dive or jump in even in the separate kids pool. Every one moans about the 18 euro fee for a lounger. Well we just got towels from the attendant didnt ask for a foam mattress which is what they charge for not for the towels and used any free lounger around the pool or better still to avoid looking like a tight git use the loungers around the kids pool were more cost savy people are all lying on loungers without the foam mattress for free!! get extra towels for extra comfort. Pool bar way too expensive, 29 euros for a burger and chips, same for a sandwich and pizza, 6 euro for small bottle of water-get real guys, charge less and more people will eat. Consequently most tables are free. Service poor considering price. Money saving tip -portions are huge therefore order food to come to your lounger and share with your partner. kids menu is good and reasonable order from that for them, the adult sized club sandwich will feed 3 kids easily. Buy water down town and keep the bottle, there are water stands carefully hidden around the pool which you can use to fill your bottle up. Lunch time better still to leave hotel turn right at exit and 200 meters brings you onto a nice little square where we had great service great paninis, drinks, coffee, kinder eggs all for the price of one burger back at the hotel!! get your water and wine there to drink back at the hotel. Everyone says there are no restaurants nearby-however there is! Tturn right out of hotel 100 meters on there is a tiny park, take the steps down and immediately opposite is a restaurant called 'The View' takes max 5 mins to walk there. The food was fantastic and very good prices indeed nearly as good as the view over the city-quite stunning. It is a quality place so dress up for it, we didnt and consequently a very snooty waiter took some offense but after I sent a bottle of wine back with a few choice words to him ie 'your a waiter drop the attitude' amongst others and generally made sure he knew what I thought of him things did pick up, needless to say for the first time in some time I left no tip, he didn't say goodbye but his colleague who obviously found the whole thing amusing came to shake my hand when I left!! Cheque out was easy and quick, stayed around the pool rest of day and used spa changing areas. Used rome.net transfers which were punctual and reasonable price. Coliseum tour booked in advance for the underground and third tier tour-well worth it, go early am or late pm to avoid the queue (absolutely massive and make sure you get in the right line)), even with a prepaid voucher you will have to wait, always leave 30 mins of queue time even with prepaid voucher, many people missed their time slots and got very angry so beware. Vatican tour again great, get a guide when you book, ours met us outside took us through then got all the tickets and took us around, go at 3pm tour time then you will have the place almost to yourself. The little cafe is very reasonable price for a pitstop!! If you can afford to eat at the Hilton why is everybody moaning about the Taxi price?? The shuttle into town is fine, Taxi to furthest point we went was 15 euros for 5 of us either way. Taxis everywhere and easy to flag down, we couldn't be bothered to wait for the shuttle or walk to it. Value for money. In summary beautiful place, fantastic pool, average service, great location, pool bar too expensive, bring in your own water, take the fruit at breakfast, eat outside hotel or inside carefully. Visit the view restaurant for great food with a grumby waiter with the small goatie-ish beard for a fun time provided you can handle and stick up for yourself. Have fun DocJimbo

Reviews.Title: “You'll never stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: WWWBL
Reviews.Content: What an outstanding hotel. The location is amazing, up over the hills of Rome with a magnificent view of the city. The staff were so helpful and the room very plush. It's a short (but fast!) taxi ride into the centre but worh it to stay out of the hustle and bustle of Rome. There are two pools, one indoor and one outdoor and an amazing health and fitness area. The food was lovely, what more can I say only we plan to return!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Oasis in Rome”
Reviews.Author: davemanly
Reviews.Content: If you don't mind spending money...and are looking for an Oasis in Rome away from the noise and bustle...the Cavalieri is the spot. My wife and I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights July 21-23, 2011. Here are the highs and lows: Highs Beautiful location high on a hill overlooking the city. Make sure you get a City View room...those that do not have look at a radio tower Pool is fabulous....great lounging and drinks The lobby and property are filled with antique artwork...charming Many rooms have a view of St. Peter's...we could see thru trees. Restaurant La Pergola on the roof is rated by many as best restaurant in Rome. We agree...see review on the restaurant Easy cab ride to center city...less than 10 minutes...about 10 euro. All cab drivers know the hotel Quiet....a true oasis Not So Good Very expensive....but our taste of service. Pool is free but a pad etc costs you. So does internet and gym. Bottom-line....a great hotel...but if you want to walk out the front door and be near Piazza not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: travelBerlin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 3 nights after our cruise. We had booked hilton bed and breakfast. The location was not good, far from everything. There was a shuttle bus running every half an hour but only until 20 pm. The building looked like a construction in the previous socialistic countries (big but not inviting). The breakfast was good and we were glad to have it included in our rate, otherwise it would have been too expensive to buy it ( like everything else at the restaurants ) and no other options close to the hotel. Our room was spacious and nice. We did not receive the paper, the turn down service on the evening kept living us a message saying she came and we did not answer, which was not truth. By the wy she came apparently at 22 .30 in the night, which I find kind of a funny time for such a service. Although the hotel has indoor and outdoor swimming pools and a gym we were told at reception that we could not use any of them unless we paid an additional fee of about 25 Euro. Although we knew that there was an additional fee for the spa, it was not clear to us that all swimming pools from the hotel belong to the spa and either you have a rate that includes them all or you cannot use them. This was specially dissappointing for not being able to use the gym. I mean what is the point of booking in such a hotel if you are more or less confined to your room looking at the radio antena and feeling like a second class citizen because either you pay much more or you canno use the facilities which even in three star hotels are normal and free of charge to guests (gym and swimming pool). My conclusion is this is an expensive, not price worthed hotel to which we will not come back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: JustininHT
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights, four of which were on Hilton Points. Our first night was a "paid" night and we reserved a room overlooking the city. Fortunately (and to their credit), they didn't move us to the back of the hotel (with the outstanding view of the cell phone tower !) for our following four "free" nights. The room on the 6th floor had excellent amenities and the view of Rome from the balcony overlooking the pool area, was spectacular. On our first night we were treated to a 30 min firework display over the pool area, celebrating a birthday party. This is apparently a very popular hotel among Romans, for weddings, honeymoon's and other special celebrations. All the staff at the hotel were friendly and helpful and all we encountered had a much better command of the English language, than we did Italian. We had a very special dinner one evening at 'La Pergola' which is Rome's only 3 Michelin star restaurant and is located on the 8th floor. Both the service and food at La Pergola were truly delightful. We also had one dinner at L'Uliveto restaurant in the hotel which was very good but be warned, the portions are huge! We used room service on one evening and it was fast and efficient. The ONLY reason that we are giving this hotel a 4 star rating rather than 5 stars is the quality (and cost) of the buffet breakfast at L'Uliveto Restaurant. It was really quite bad for a hotel of this stature. There was no selection of cheese or cold meats; just some fruit and breads with lukewarm fried and scrambled eggs, bacon and a type of breakfast sausage in the warmers. The cost if I remember correctly was E39.00 each.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: passwordb
Reviews.Content: I treated my daughter to a spa weekend after a semester of studying in Italy.The hotel is on top of one of the Rome hills and you have to take a cab to get up there, but the hotel and the view are both spectacular. The lobby is large and there is artwork everywhere. They even have an art historian on staff (you have to make a reservation and pay 100 euros for a tour with him/her, so we opted not to do that.) I had booked a deluxe double, but our room looked more like a junior suite. It was large, with exquisite furnishings - two double beds, two comfy chairs in the sitting area, large bath and large balcony with table and chairs - and a fabulous view! Since it was my daughter's 21st birthday, they may have upgraded us without me asking because they also sent up a bottle of Prosecco, a box of candy and a birthday card to help celebrate the occasion. This is a large hotel with some boutiques like large hotels have. There was a wedding one night. There is a large spa and a very large pool. There appeared to be more European guests than Americans - and they appeared to be happy laying by the pool instead of sightseeing. The hotel offers a free shuttle during the day to/from the Piazza Barberini. Once, when it was full, they drove the two of us to town in a Mercedes sedan! (You can see why I liked this place.) The drawback about the location is that you have to eat in their restaurant because there is no place you can walk to nearby - and the restaurant was expensive. Actually, it was all expensive, but it's a Hilton and sometimes there will be a special online deal.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, disappointing view”
Reviews.Author: dramadrea
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel, but the web page does not make everything clear. Half of the rooms in the hotel look out on an incredibly ugly cell phone tower which spoils the view. You can change rooms to the pretty side of the hotel, but it costs another 90 euros a night. There are stunning art works throughout the hotel and the staff are very friendly and helpful, but be careful of hidden costs. I could not understand why so few people used the lovely pool until I found out that it cost 18 euros to rent a sun bed. Internet was not free, so if you want to keep in touch with family, budget for it. The hotel did provide transport into Rome, since it sits on one of the seven hills and there is nothing in walking distance. All in all, we had a lovely time especially at breakfast, which was the best I have ever experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful View of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Al_Baja
Reviews.Content: This was one of the most elegant hotels I have visited in Italy. The views from our balcony overlooked the city of Rome and it was spectacular. The pool and spa were large and offered everything you would look for in a spa. One large outdoor and indoor pool were enough to keep you cool in the hot summer sun. A wonderful workout area with a full sized gym was also handy. Although we didn't dine in the hotel we enjoyed the complimentary lounge during the day with little sandwiches and small bites with wine, beer and beverages as well. Prices for food could have been lower, especially pool side where sandwiches and pizza were $28 Euros. A free shuttle into Rome was quite handy but we usually took a taxi back since it was too far to get back to the pick up area. Totally recommend this hotel and would go back in a heart beat!

Reviews.Title: “Really old and not all that charming”
Reviews.Author: traveltheworldcs
Reviews.Content: There are so many quaint and wonderful places to stay in Rome. Skip the "Hilton" experience and embrace a nice B&B instead.

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate Hotel, we'll definitely be back !”
Reviews.Author: Anuj_Bandlish
Reviews.Content: Ultimate Hotel, we'll definitely be back ! Located on a hill top, you have an ultimate view of the city. All the major attractions are easily visible sitting in the balcony of your room. Rooms are quite spacious and comfortable. Breakfast is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good but not an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: yy715
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Cavalieri for Christmas break, considering the high price of hotel in Rome, we chose this Hilton group hotel in order to earn some hilton points for our summer travel. Check-in was fast, though the receptionist was a bit icy. The overall hotel condition was good, room was in a large size, king size comfy bed, a balcony over looking the front garden, marble bathroom with a small makeup table. Not something surprisingly great nor disappointing. Breakfast was in very high standard with basically everything offered, they even have a Japanese corner which satisfy my Asian stomach, and it's 1st time that I found "Yakult" drink in Europe's hotel. The only downside was the location, it's far away from the centre, located up in the hill, even though they provided hourly shuttle for rome centre, I personally found it restrained our time. We have to plan our day according to the shuttle schedule. Once we missed the shuttle to come back, and the taxi charge was near 18EUR. No fault of the hotel, however next time I would prefer to stay in the centre for more convenience of action.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, what a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: kazdaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cavalieri for 4 nights in June. Check in was easy despite our early arrival. Rooms were perfect and exceptionally clean. Staff were very helpful. The lounge and bar were very relaxing, amazing decor and art in the hotel. the whole experience was wonderful. Breakfast was something else, especially sitting outside overlooking the pool. Yes the hotel is out of the city but the free shuttle bus provided by the hotel is excellent. They even provided a 2nd bus when there were more passengers than the bus could take. My only critisim is it can be a bit of a free for all when getting on the bus, especially in the city when catching bus back to the hotel. If we ever go back to Rome, would def stay here again. We had a wonderful time

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mamastro21Canada
Reviews.Content: Just the best hotel in Rome to feel the luxury of this great city. Every peny that you are going to spend in there is worth it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Third visit and we'll be back again”
Reviews.Author: WHCTTraveler
Reviews.Content: This is the third time in five years we have stayed at the Cavalieri and hopefully, we will be back again soon. It is one of our favorite hotels and that is because of the service, the amenities,the beautiful rooms, the most comfortable beds, the art work throughout the hotel and the breakfast. I do have to say that the breakfast is not quite as sumptuous as it was in past years but it is still quite nice and eating it outside by the pool is a treat. This year is the first time we experienced the special room for gold and diamond members where there are snacks out for a good part of the day. We really enjoyed that perk. We did use points to stay here and it requires many but we always feel that it is worth it. We usually find that the shuttle does not work with our schedule and so we just expect to pay for cabs. Although it is a little bit of an inconvenience, we like the fact that at the end of a day of sight seeing, we get out of the city and can relax by the pool at the Cavalieri.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property but too far away from city center”
Reviews.Author: nettee78
Reviews.Content: We are hhonors gold level members, even though we made reservations 6 months in advance, we weren't given an upgrade,which by the way we would have had to pay for. We originally wanted to stay all of 6 nights in Rome here, but all nights weren't available. Turned out to be lucky for us. The hotel is too far from everything, not even local restaurants within walking distance, we asked. The prices at the restaurants on property are really high. The shuttle is a joke. Only 2 stops, not even really close to any sights. Luckily, we stayed in central Rome for our first 3 nights and saw a lot of what we wanted to see. On the positive side the property is beautiful and the rooms are very nice. Great place to stay if you just want to stay on property and relax. For me, too many things to see and do. I 'll plan a trip to the beach for r & r.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but very nice”
Reviews.Author: beans987
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Cavalieri on our first leg of our honeymoon and life many of the other reviews I've read the hotel is a 10-15 euro ride to the center of Rome. You really can't walk into the city if you want because the hotel is on the hill. However I found it nice because it was relaxing to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city. They have a shuttle that will take you into the city and runs hourly for those inclined to take, it runs until 8pm. After that its a taxi to get in and out. The room we had was very nice, the light blocking shades were key to our late afternoon naps and the soundproof doors were a nice touch as well. The hotel from the outside looks a little bit dated, once you get inside though it is very nice. Expensive as anything, so be weary when getting drinks, mixed drinks were 15 euro and food and a hamburger was 29 euro. However the staff and ambience of the hotel created a great atmosphere. Being silver hilton members we received waters and access to the spa, which is great in itself. If we hadn't being staying there on points I don't know if we would have chosen it though because the most basic room will cost you 300+ euro a night. For a hotel out of the city and nothing really around it, I can understand why some people knock it. However if you can afford it and you want a hotel that is a bit more quiet just on the edge of the city then this is your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rome Cavalieri better than expected”
Reviews.Author: maxnest
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Rome Cavalieri for two nights prior to a cruise. While we had been to Rome on three previous cruises, each time we had been limited to 8 hours as part of private shore excursions. This time we wanted to visit some of the Roman sites at a more leisurely pace. As has been mentioned in other reviews, the primary disadvantage of the Rome Cavalieri is it's location outside of the city. We used the shuttle into town twice and taxis on four other occasions. The shuttle was larger than I expected and operated on schedule. The drop off location was okay, but somewhere closer to the Trevi Fountain would have been better. We had no problem finding taxis on the occasions we used them, with one way prices ranging from 7 Euros to/from the Vatican (about a 10 minute ride) and 14 Euros from downtown (about a 20 minute ride). As a result, we found the location outside the city to be mostly a non-issue for our needs. While our room was located on the side of the building facing away from the Roman skyline, It was one of the more luxurious hotel rooms we've ever experienced. The room was large with a very comfortable bed, had a marble surfaced bathroom complete with towel warming rack and higher quality bath products, a 32 inch flat screen TV, plenty of storage space, and a nice balcony overlooking a park-like setting. The air conditioning was excellent, which was important in late June. Two interesting features of the room were a mirrored inner door between the bathroom and the closets that could be used to block sounds from the hallway (we heard none, with and without the door being closed) and an electric external metal roll down shutter that blocked out light and sounds from the outside. As Hilton Honors gold members, we took advantage of the free drinks and snacks in the Colosseo lounge on several occasions. The staff in the lounge did an excellent job of keeping the drinks and snacks in stock and were constantly attending to the area. Note that the small sandwich bites are little more than a snack, not a substitute for a meal. BTW, I had the opportunity to visit the Imperial Lounge and, while it's nicer than the Colosseo lounge, I wouldn't pay for an Imperial Room to get access to it. The breakfast buffet was wonderful, with tables inside and outside along the pool. Eating breakfast poolside was one of the highlights of our stay at the hotel. Speaking of the pool, there is no charge to use either the indoor or outdoor pools. However, sunbeds around the outdoor pool area are available for 18 euros. We found some chairs in the indoor pool area and swam in the outdoor pool. Taking a dip during the hot afternoon, between trips into town, was wonderful. Note that the outdoor pool is too deep to stand (I'm over 6 ft tall) except for very near the wall on one end. Not a problem, but different from most pools. The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly, with all staff members smiling and greeting us wherever we were on the property. We stayed at the hotel using Hilton Honors points. However, we definitely would have stayed there if we had to pay for it as well. Overall, this is a magnificent property. We hope to return some day. P.S. As with all Rome hotels, remember to have your 3 Euros per person per day available to pay when you checkout.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at the Cavalieri”
Reviews.Author: MEDRoswell
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 12 day stay in Italy and spent 2 nights at the Cavalieri prior to departing on a cruise of Southern Italy. Full Diclosure: We used Hilton Points as it seems had most of the Americans staying at the property. That Said, they were points very well spent! When we arrived we were informed we had been upgraded to an Imperial City View room. The room was large, particularly by European Standards, and the balcony overlooked St. Peter's Basilica. The room was very nicely appointed, if you are a fan of marble, this is your place. Nice inlaid marble floors in the bathroom and plenty of room for 2 to get ready for a day in Rome at the same time. The room came with access to the pool, gym and spa so we did not experience the nickel and dime (multiplied by Euros) others have talked about. But I would say that the level of service at the pool by the attendants must be factored into any discussion of price. The pool stewards were very attentive, brought thick pads for the deck chairs and would make sure umbrellas were moved to give you shade from the July Rome sun. The spa attendant was equally quick to make sure you had a robe and towels for use in the sauna and jacuzzi areas. The service in the Imperial club was good. They had a nice selection of waters, juices, wine, liquor, beer or would make you an espresso drink. Breakfast was very nice including everything from eggs to the more standard meats, cheeses and fruit. In the evening light appetizers are put out, we had carpaccio and octopus salad, both tasty. My wife and I actually enjoyed the location and access to the city, but do not expect to walk anywhere from this hotel. The shuttle bus runs on the hour from the hotel and returns from Piazza Barberini on the 1/2 hour. I believe the last shuttle back is at 8:30 PM. From the drop off point Trevi Fountain is about a 6 minute walk, the Pantheon another 5 minutes and Piazza Navonna another 5 minutes. We had the best time just wandering the streets between the Pantheon and Navonna. After 6 PM or so, after all the tour buses have left town, the city feels more intimate even in July. There is also a Metro station at Barberini and for a Euro you can go toward the Vatican in one direction or San Giovanni in the other. If you find yourself with 10 minutes before the shuttle arrives about 50M up Via Veneto from the pick up spot is a small church with the stacked bones of monks in the crypt. Cool and creepy. We found the shuttle service worked well for us and returned us nightly to the quiet of the Cavalieri. If going to the Vatican it is easier to grab a cab from the hotel and costs 7 euro. Our only real complaint was the wireless internet. While it was complimentary for us, there was about a 10 sq meter area in the room where it worked well. From the club or the balcony reception was flaky. If I had paid 20E for it, I would not be happy. This hotel is a nice sanctuary from the noise and traffic just down the hillside. In my opinion the service and quality is fitting with the Waldorf Astoria brand and we would look to stay again at the Cavalieri the next time we are in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in Central Rome”
Reviews.Author: candaceblattner
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for our two day stay in Rome based on the high ratings and how nice it looked on the website. While the grounds are very pretty and the rooms are good it felt like staying at a convention center! The food was absolutely horrible and was incredibly expensive (27 Euros for a mayo caesar salad). I'm not sure if my husband I were tainted coming from the Il San Pietro in Positano (which would highly recommend) but would 100% recommend staying in the center unless you are looking to lay at the pool all day (which you are charged 18 Euros/chair). Even though they offer a shuttle we found it useless and had to take cabs in the day for our sightseeing and then again at night for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property overlooking Rome”
Reviews.Author: MACOLEMAN0
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Cavaleri and it remains a premiere property in Rome. I would however only recomend staying here in the summer as it is out of town with relatively infrequent (especially on Sunday) shuttle service into Piazza di Popolo. In summer however it is a gem. We checked in early from our flight had our suits handy and went to the pool/spa. While there is an additional charge it is a fabulous 25m pool; great spa/fitness center and good poolside dining. Those not so prepared where annoyed that they could not check-in..put your suits in your carry on!!

Reviews.Title: “so worth it; tips for cutting down the cost”
Reviews.Author: lgrant_2011
Reviews.Content: Great, great place to stay. True 5 star (with that touch of professional "aloof" that Americans find so "unfriendly"). It was really wonderful to be away from Rome's bustle and noise. The Cavalieri is pricey, though, and no "points" here; so, every euro counted. But. The rooms are HUGE by European standards and they don't charge for a roll away. It was me and my two 17 year old boys. We were all truly comfortable (and, really, any good 3-4 star triple in the heart of the city is not that far off in price from a Cavalieri room with a free roll away - check it out). Pay for the Rome view. Spectacular. Don't pay for the "Imperial" stuff and don't get the bed and breakfast room rate. There's a slew of Americans eating away in that category and you can't eat enough to make it worth it (even by 17 year old boy standards). Instead, simply, take a right at the hotel entrance and take the very short, easy (flat) walk to the Piazzale Medaglie d'Oro where there are two cafes, a wonderful fruit seller, everything you need (including wine merchant to take a bottle or two back to enjoy at the hotel). The cafes have lovely sandwiches, too, that you can pick up for a song and eat for picnic lunch in Rome (at the pool) or where ever. The neighborhood is fantastic; very expensive on the top of that hill the Cavalieri sits on. The valet will even give you a huge umbrella if you need it for the walk. That little piazza is a wonderful, friendly treasure at the Cavalieri's doorstep. Also - no taxi should be more than 10-12 euro anywhere you need/want to go in Rome (keep an eye on the opening price on the meter - should be 2.80 euro on weekdays and Sat - a bit more on Sunday). The pool is fantastic. And the hotel does NOT charge for swimming OR for the lounge chairs; It's the white cushions that go on the lounge chairs that are 18 euros a pop. Instead, you can use the big white towels they hand out , and which are free (btw get to the pool early on Fri and Sat if you want a good spot, and make it your own for the day by draping your stuff around - then you can leave and come back to "your spot"). Splurges for family: A 30 minute massage in the Cavalieri Spa - over the top special and reasonable. The Florentine steak at Il Pomodorino off the Via Veneto (can easily feed two) - the Cavalieri's concierge can set that reservation up for you. The Rome Segway Tour; so much fun, and a great overview of the city. Enjoy the Cavalieri without hesitation, and buon viaggio!

Reviews.Title: “Will Never Go Back!”
Reviews.Author: DWY224
Reviews.Content: My wife and booked this hotel (using points) believing it would be the perfect end to our Silversea cruise vacation. We taxied to the hotel and upon our arrival at 1330, were totally ignored by the bellmen. Even our taxi driver was astonished by the lack of response from the hotel. After he attempted to get the attention of a bellman, he turned to us with a puzzled look on his face and shrugged. My wife and I then brought our own luggage into the lobby. The desk clerk was apologetic and did arrange to have the concierge store it as the room was not yet ready. We decided to have some lunch while we waited for the room to be ready. We used the hotel's restaurant. The woman who seated us was quite pleasant, but it ended there. Having been seated for less than two minutes, our waiter asked if we were ready to order. Having barely looked at the menu, I ordered a bottle of rose. It arrived promptly. The wine steward then proceeded to pour the wine and sloshed it on the table, my wife's menu and my menu, then jammed it back into the ice bucket and fled. After ordering food, we were again ignored until the food came and then ignored after its arrival. The lunch was prepared very well but the service was horrible. From our lunch table I attempted to book another hotel, however one was impossible to find at the last minute. We are experienced travelers and have previously lived overseas (Japan and my wife in Sardinia). I have never experienced the ennui and lack of common courtesy in any hotel, let alone a Waldorf Astoria. In fact, the best service we received was when leaving. Our luggage was whisked to the taxi without delay. We will never, ever patronize this hotel again. We are also leaving the appropriate feedback with the Hilton Honors program.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in an amazing city”
Reviews.Author: cabaldwin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing. We went for three days, two nights, for my 40th Birthday and the hotel and staff made the experience perfect. Upon arrival we were upgraded to a corner suite with panaramic views of the city - thank you so much! The room was well worth the extra wait (for it to be cleaned). We had seen reviews on here and the one element that caused us some small concern was the location: well, forget about those concerns, the location is perfect, far enough away from the buzz of the city to give a really relaxing experience, but close enough to be a short taxi ride (cira 10 minutes and EUR 12) or bus ride (hotel shuttle, free and takes 20 minutes) to all the main sights. The hotel itself is very luxurious and the staff are so very helpful. The rooms are great (recommend a Rome view) and the commmon areas with all the artwork are splendid. We booked Imperial, and we would urge you to do the same: getting access to the Imperial lounge and the Spa is a benefit not to be sniffed at. If you are only planning on sleeping at the hotel and not spending any other meaningful time there then the 'normal' rooms would, I am sure, be more than fine; but if you plan on relaxing at the hotel at all then please do upgrade to Imperial, otherwise you will find yourself spending a lot more money (on snacks/food and drinks, spa, pool etc) and possibly end up with a false economy. The Spa is incredible and worth a visit or two, and the swimming pool is lovely. Our room was a highlight, with its panoramic views and incredible furniture and art, but the main highlight must be La Pergola, the rooftop restaurant. We went for dinner there on my Birthday and had the nine-course tasting menu (with recommended wines), and it blew our minds. This is a must, the best restaurant I have been to. Quite pricey, but still good value! Service was great, and a special thanks to the staff for bringing out a small Birthday cake (after the multiple desert courses we had already tackled it was, perhaps, a step too far!) for me. If you want to see Rome in style then you should stay here. Perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, hope to return one day”
Reviews.Author: Tansri_11
Reviews.Content: Our expectations were met at this hotel. Our room was clean, cozy, modern and spacious. Staff were helpful. We stayed in a suite without the view of Rome but we had the upgrade allowing access to the hospitality room which had free snacks and drinks all day and a balcony with an incredible view of the city. Without the upgrade, the Internet, pool, breakfast, and hospitality room would not have been included would have been expensive extras. Breakfast was delicious with plenty of choices. Pool area was fantastic with a separate adult pool and 2 heated children's pools. The shuttle to Rome was easy and convenient. Did not use the gym or spa but looked very good.

Reviews.Title: “Just Returned - Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: sdavis0041
Reviews.Content: Best Location. Escape noise and crowd of Rome. Beautiful property and services. Pool is great also.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel...BEAUTIFUL INSIDE AND OUT”
Reviews.Author: ilovetoeatoutpa
Reviews.Content: This hotel was simply amazing. The location is about 10 minutes from anything in downtown Rome. (A taxi cab ride for about 15 Euro could get you anywhere!) It is quiet and serene on the Hill that overlooks ROME...THE VIEW IS priceless. We were not fortunate to have a room that faced the city (our room faced the Ghetto...well at least that is how I felt). We asked for a change of scenery but they told us we would have to pay $200 Euro a night...(it wasn't worth it to us)...But the room itself was VERY LARGE AND VERY CLEAN AND VERY BEAUTIFUL (however I did find 2 dirty tissues behind the bed...I wasn't willing to touch them but I could only imagine what was on the time...SO if someone from the hotel reads this...we were in room 846... I THINK...after leaving elevators make a left and we were a few doors down on the left)...If you go be sure to sign up for the CLUB LEVEL...This entitles you all day to "FREE FOOD AND DRINKS" in the Lounge...IT WAS SNACKS ALL DAY but the Drinks were free... They had tables on the terrace where you can just grab a glass of wine or proseco and relax while looking at the beautiful city...BE CAREFUL NOT TO GET TO CAUGHT UP IN THE VIEW>>>YOU MAY STAY THERE ALL DAY! The mini bar water was 9 Euro....but a short walk to the lounge it was Free...YOU DECIDE!.. Breakfast Buffett was included in the price and it was beautiful and wonderful to sit outside eating from a WONDERFUL selection of both Hot and Cold...(THEY EVEN HAVE A GLUTEN FREE SECTION on the buffett which I thought was a nice touch). I used the spa....UNBELIEVABLE! We did not make it to the pool...but IT LOOKED AMAZING!. oh and one more thing...The internet was $20 Euro a day...(which I felt was very pricey for something that should be free) If you go to Rome...STAY HERE you won't be disappointeed!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely property but a bit stuck up”
Reviews.Author: EmmaM3232
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend while we were traveling around Italy for another friends wedding. The friend I was traveling with booked this hotel on Hilton points so we didn't have to pay for it (good thing). The hotel is a bit far from most of Rome's attractions but the shuttle is quite handy. The outdoor pool is nice (get there early to get a good spot). The indoor pool is heated and relaxing-- you must wear a swim cap which is quite normal for Europeans but not for American's. We had dinner once at the hotel bar and drinks there twice and although expensive (come on...it's the Waldorf) the food was good and service at the bar was friendly. We convinced the piano player one night to play some "fun" songs opposed to the boring stuff he had been playing. :) The rooms are well appointed and offer all amenities you would think from a 5 star. My only suggestion is that the employees lighten up a little bit and have some fun. I get that this is a prestigious hotel and all but when people are on vacation it's nice to be greeted with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Rome equals romance at the Cavalieri”
Reviews.Author: mikeyhand
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of my round the world trip, just coming off a suite at Conrad in Hong Kong. I wasn't disappointed. The room was normal, but upgraded to a city view. Get one of these because the view is great. Try for a higher floor and you can see St. Peters. The room is like a junior suite setup. The bathroom was nice and balcony was too. No complaints about the physical part of hotel but be advised of two things: 1. It is far from center of Rome. Easy $12-17 EURO every time i wanted to go into town. I knew this before hand but their shuttle is good if you can live by their time, which isn't too bad. 2. They charge to use the pools. You can swim for free but a lounge chair is $18 EURO per person, per day. I feel that is ridiculous for the price of this hotel. The wifi is expensive too, but mine was free due to Gold VIP. The breakfast was great too, also free with Gold VIP. Great hotel if the location doesn't bother you. I kind of liked being away from the hustle and bustle sometimes. I only took a taxi a few times. The shuttle drops you at Piazza Barberini. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: BCHP
Reviews.Content: Our 4 night stay at the Cavalieri was extremely nice. Be aware that the other reviews are true - this is a place could be extremely expensive if not prepared. This is where the rich and famous spend their time and they don't worry about what it costs to stay alive like most of us do. This fact hit us upon arrival when we were sent away from the entrance by an enormous group of security personnel to sit down the street for about 15 minutes so the PM of Isreal could come or go. The place was covered up with Security for two days of our stay so it was probably one of the most secured areas in Rome. We stayed on Hilton Points but had an upgraded city view room on a middle floor that was just fantastic. Our Hilton status got us free use of the pool areas, we were able to use the Hilton Member lounge for free drinks/snacks after our long days walking through Rome, we used the 5 Euro a day parking option and the free shuttle to the city was very nice. The staff was fantastic and extremely helpful. Other Hilton members like us vacationing in Rome clearly stoodout against their normal clients who get to use the real "Executive Lounge" but we never felt treated differently by the staff. We did do two things at the Hotel that I highly recommend; 1) Did a private tour of Vatican arranged by the hotel that was absolutely amazing. The guide was an offical Vatican tour guide employed by the Vatican to tour/escort guests of the Popes. The Private tour of the grounds was the 5 of us truely wandering alone where the Popes have for generations and was completely away from the crowds of tourists. We got to sit alone in places were various Popes regularly sit/sat each morning to gather their thoughts and insperations. The rest of the tour throughout the Public areas of the Vatican was equally as fantastic since the guide was so very knowledgable, friendly, and interacted so very well with us. The guide paid for the cab to us from the hotel to the Vatacan, bought us water to prepare for our walk and refused to even talk to us about a tip at the end of the tour. Absolutely first class all the way. 2) Did dinner at La Pergula on the top floor at 8 pm on our last night. Fantastic food, fantastic service and the view of the city was simply breathtaking. We did Dinner early so we could see the transition from day to night and highly recommend doing it that way. (See seperate review.) Okay - so both of these events cost a bit of cash but I'm telling you without hesitation that each was absolutely fantastic. We arranged for each several months in advance and the word 'perfect' doesn't capture the quality of our experiences. Our entire stay at the Cavalieri was perfect as well.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel should be in top 10 on tripadvisor”
Reviews.Author: travelerut
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently and was a bit hesitant to stay in this hotel due to it's mediocre ratings on tripadvisor. However, I found it it won the star diamond award and I have to say it's well deserved. Customer service is fantastic! I would call for extra towels, get those towels within five minutes, then receive a follow up call to make sure I recieved them. They frequently left complimentary items in our room, like bottled water and chocolates. We booked through a travel agent so we got amazing rates, including free upgrades (which Cavalieri did give us!) and access to the Imperial Lounge, including free internet, buffet, drinks, and amazing views. We also got an 85 Euro credit to our room! When we checked in, we were taken to a VIP area and offered drinks and fruit. The pool is HUGE and the gardens are absolutely beautiful. The views from our balcony of Rome were phenomenal. The only downside to this hotel is it's location. It's 20 minutes from Rome so if you're looking to stay downtown, this is not the hotel. But if you want the resort experience and don't mind a short shuttle ride, you have to try this hotel. Rooms are great, service is incredible and the grounds are very pretty. I spied many expensive cars there, so I'm assuming they get a lot of high-end guests. To be honest, in spite of the shuttle ride, I would definitely stay there again were I to return to Rome. Thank you Cavalieri Hilton for an outstanding experience!

Reviews.Title: “Trying to be something that it isn't”
Reviews.Author: bucketlist100
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many five star hotels and we are struggling to get our heads around this Waldorf Astoria property. Right from the entrance, never did we have the Doorman open the door for us, sometimes there was a hint of a smile, that's as good as it got.I'm not being ridiculously pedantic, but I thought that was what Doormen should do and I think guests expect this from a Waldorf Astoria hotel. The pool area is fantastic but to be told by staff that we were allowed to use the pool for free (I would have thought this to be a given!) but would have to pay 16 euro per person for a deck chair mattress(in other words, have the use of the facilities) is beyond comprehension. The location is both a bonus for the tranquility and a negative for easy access. The shuttle bus works fine, though it finishes too early to use as a dinner option. The Concierge staff we found to be very helpful and obliging. We personally felt that this was like a 4 star hotel with 5 star prices and would look elsewhere when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely awful service, we were so disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: K_M_McGehee
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an absolute disappointment. We were disgusted with how they treated executive lounge members, and with the lack of concern from the manager when we complained about the treatment. The concierge staff was utterly useless. While the hotel is gorgeous, it seems that all they care about is their appearance. My husband stayed there several years ago, and it used to be his favorite hotel of the many Waldorf properties he has stayed in, my, my how the times have changed!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good for Hilton point usage”
Reviews.Author: wartoni
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at 60000 pnts per night and that was worth it. I cannot imagine paying the full rates for this hotel. The diamond level at Hilton let's you use free Internet, pool, and breakfast. If not you pay big bucks for these items. The hotel is very nice for sure and the staff is friendly. Cab ride to the Vatican is 5 euros and they have a shuttle bus/ van to the city center each hour (free). They have two pools, one for adults mainly and another for kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but.....”
Reviews.Author: drjoe66
Reviews.Content: We were very excited about our two nights at this hotel. I had pre-ordered a hotel limo from the airport. To our great surprise, the driver did not greet us as promised. We waited around for about 20 min, then finally called the hotel. They promised to call me back, but after 10 min of wait we had to call them again. Then, someone with our name on a piece of paper (misspelled) finally showed up and took us to the hotel. The hotel location is far away from the city center (forget walking), but they have a shuttle bus, which unfortunately does not run in the evening. The grounds are wonderful, the room was great, the view incredible. They need to decide when their outdoor pools are open. The rood guide says 10.30 pm. I called the front desk, just to be safe, and they told me 10 pm. We went downstairs around 7.30 pm and then there is a sign that says 7 pm! We are talking June here! This led to a great disappointment since our daughter was so ready to swim. So, we had to use the indoor pool. The pool attendants are really cool, but need some training for a 5 star hotel. They are amateurs and need to practice their customer service skills. Its not cool to talk on your mbile phone while dealing with a customer. Breakfasy buffet was ggreat, but service again was lacking. I had a cappuchino and the server (in 30 min) never returned to out table asking if i needed another one. Not accepetable for a 5 star hotel. My wife never got more coffee and they never removed any used dishes from our table. Maybe I am asking too much, but with a Waldorf Astoria for me comes flawless service. It was not flawless.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: CleopatraHampshire
Reviews.Content: 1st visit to Rome and wanted somewhere we could relax after all the wonderful sightseeing. Yes as the other reviews say it is not in the centre, and although the shuttle bus is very good, there will be occasions when a taxi is required. The cost for a taxi ranges from 15 to 20€. The hotel is of a modern design on the outside, inside is beautiful, with amazing views from the hotel terraces and balconies overlooking the whole of Rome. We decided to stay in an imperial room, yes a little pricey but comparable with similar standard hotels in other major cities. Our check in was smooth and reception staff very polite and courteous. Although our room was not ready ( we arrived early ) we were shown to the Imperial lounge for drinks and light snacks. Our room was very comfortable , with fabulous views over Rome. There is a decent size swimming , my only comment is that the sun beds are packed very tight around the pool and it does get busy. All the staff were polite and very helpful. So our next trip to Rome we will come back to this hotel it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Awful!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: PattiBruno
Reviews.Content: The worst service ever!!!!! The people are so rude!!!!! They don't know what customer service is at this establishment. They ruined our very special anniversary that I had long planned.. God forbid you ask the concierge a question and it's as if they don't want to be bothered. I asked if they could arrange a ride to the airport for us and he rudely said just come down tomorrow five minutes earlier and we'll see what we can do. Hilton needs to do something about their awful customer service at Rome Cavalieri as soon as possible because I'm sure there are many people they treat as bad as they treated my family!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, stupendous service, away from Rome's main attractions.”
Reviews.Author: jwspoonjr
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with some of the best service in the world. Stay here if you can to escape the hustle & bustle of the city. Breakfast is awesome! The city is still close by hotel shuttle or taxi (€10 - €15). Don't plan to stay here if you are going on the cheap!

Reviews.Title: “BEST view of Rome”
Reviews.Author: activetrveller
Reviews.Content: I honestly can't believe anyone would call this a bad location. I LOVED the location. My wife and I had a tough time deciding between here and a hotel with a city location. We could not be happier with the decision. You are outside of the city, but only by enough to climb a large hill that sits beside the city and affords a spectacular view of the eternal city. If you are considering this hotel, you probably already know it's not cheap. The additional cost of cab fare to/from the city is insignificant in my mind. We did take the shuttle a couple times and it is a very nice amenity, though it only runs once per hour. We booked an Imperial Rome view room, which gave us access to the 7th floor exec club lounge. This is a huge perk and much nicer than other lounges I have seen. They are open from early morning until 11PM daily. The club is well stocked, well staffed, and they change the food choices 5 times/ day. I highly recommend paying the extra for the club. The rooms are gorgeous. beautifully appointed, very spacious (a rarity in Europe), and with the most incredible view of Rome that I will remember forever. Don't even think about staying here without getting the Rome view- you will deeply regret missing this view and the view on the other side of the hotel really does stink. Here's a tip- pack a good pair of binoculars. It's a good way to get acquainted with the city. You can easily spot the Colosseum, Palantine hill, the Forum, St. Peter's Basilica, the Pantheon... etc. My wife and I ended every evening sitting on our balcony (usually with a bottle of wine) totally captivated by the view of the city. I saw a few reviews where people said the staff was rude. I found every employee there to be friendly, hard-working, professional and truly genuine in their desire to help. You can tell they are well trained. You can't pass a single staff member without a pleasant greeting, any time of the day or night. The concierge desk was amazingly patient in answering questions, providing directions, restaurant and tour suggestions, making dinner reservations, and even providing an AC adaptor for my laptop. The facilities and the grounds are truly outstanding. The artwork displayed throughout the hotel really gives you the feeling that you are in a truly special place. OK- I have Hilton Gold priviliges, so I did not have to pay for internet or the pool. I booked a second room for my daughter and her friend. Julia later called our room to tell me that the rate was reduced (2nd person free) and the room was upgraded to a Rome view because of the HHonors. Thank you, Julia! OK, for the bad part, and there's only one- the restaurant prices are ridiculous. We sat at the poolside restaurant for a quick lunch shortly after checking in. 39 Euros, roughly $55.00 USD, for a hamburger!!! I had a plate of risotto for about hte same cost and it was the last time we used their restaurant. All told, I can't possibly imagine staying anywhere else on my next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “OMG!!”
Reviews.Author: DemandingGuest
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicest hotels we have ever visited. At least as good as the Breakers or Four Seasons in Palm Beach, and better than the Plaza in NYC. But note the caveat at the bottom of my review. Rome is a hectic, noisy, crowded place, but this hotel is away from all that, and set in a large property so all we heard were birds chirping and people playing at the pool. Sleeping late (if one is so inclined) is assured by the amazing shutters which roll down with the press of a button to shut out every single photon of sunlight trying to disturb you. The view of Rome is amazing. Breakfast was sumptuous.The pool was a jewel. We did not mind at all that the hotel is outside the gates of Rome. The hotel has a free shuttle to Via Veneto, and a cab to any other place was about 10 euros. (Although I think its weird that the shuttle doesn't run between 12 and 3 pm.) It was well worth the incovenience of a suburban location to gain the relaxing, quiet time we needed after a day in Rome. But be prepared for the cost. Not only are the rooms outrageously expensive, but the cost of any food you consume will stop your heart. 46 euros for tortellini! 49 euros for a hamburger! And 55 euros for loin of lamb and vegetables! For that price, it better be the loin of the mythical lamb with the golden fleece. So the Rome Cavalieri is OMG in every category. Beauty, relaxation, but also cost. Note to the management (it appears you read these reviews): When we went to the pool, the woman at the spa desk asked how she could help us and I told her we were trying to get to the pool. She then asked me if I was a "member." It is a rude question to ask. As a guest of the hotel, I have the RIGHT to use the outdoor pool. I don't have to be a member of anything, and I didn't like feeling like I was someplace I didn't belong. She should have said, "Of course, the pool is right down this hallway and through the door as the end. Would you like a chaise lounge poolside?" I also think staff should provide towels there at the desk or at least tell me where I get them. I had to ask where the towels were, and then I was sent over to the Lifeguard, of all people, to get towels. Why is the Lifeguard at the kiddie pool in charge of handing out towels? Shouldn't the Lifeguard be dedicated to guarding lives? If for some reason yo need to know whether the person using using the pool is hotel guest or a member of the "Club," then she should ask, "Are you a member of the club, or are you a guest of the hotel?" That way the guest immediately knows he or she is welcome as a guest. By her tone, question and response to my inquiry about the pool, she definitely made me feel unwelcome. Snobby staff is a real turn off.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at Rome Cavalieri”
Reviews.Author: rubletx
Reviews.Content: I am a seasoned traveler and I have to say this is one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed at. The rooms were beautiful with the most fantastic view of the city of Rome. The pools were lovely, as were the grounds. The food was excellent. We stayed on the concierge floor and got to take advantage of daily meals, cocktails, appetizers - they were all wonderful. I would highly recommend this hotel just be advised that it is about a 10 minute shuttle ride from the city center, but we did not have a problem with this.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible location, Terrible value, Great service”
Reviews.Author: jannSF
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I just returned from our trip to Rome and wish we had more closely read the reviews regarding this hotel.. For those of you that may be thinking of staying here, BUYER BEWARE: TERRIBLE LOCATION. By far, the worst thing about this hotel is that it is NOT located in the city walls of Rome! It is located in a suburb in the middle of no where that is 30 minutes away from the city. If you take a cab from the airport, since it is not within the walls, it is not covered under the cab flat rate of 50 Euros. It cost us about 65-70 Euros one way. Also, they have an hourly shuttle that runs from the hotel to the city (that does not run for 2 hours at noon and ends at 8). So count on taking multiple cab rides to and from the city if you decide to stay here (about 15-20 Euros one way from the city).. THEY WILL NICKLE AND DIME YOU. This hotel does have a nice pool -- however, THEY CHARGE YOU 20-37 EUROS TO USE THE POOL (depending on if you want to use the indoor or outdoor pool)!!! I have never been to a $600 a night hotel that charges you to use the pool! Actually, I have never been to any hotel (whatever the price) where they charge you to use the pool. Also, there is nothing to eat here except their restaurant or room service (expect to spend about 50 Euros/person). THE SERVICE IS GREAT. If you can deal with the feeling of being "nickled and dimed" and the terrible location, the service is really great. Everyone was very friendly and helpful with any questions you may have.

Reviews.Title: “In a word - Wow!!”
Reviews.Author: don543
Reviews.Content: Yes the price is steep, but this hotel made our Italian vacation. We booked two rooms and they gave us adjoining without us asking. Our view was to die for - perfect view of Rome. They had a pianist with great singer near the pool who we can hear in our balcony. The beds were outstanding and everything was first-class. Breakfast was awesome, staff was polite. The location wasn't great but not a big deal. It was around an 8 Euro taxi ride to the Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - Upgrade to Imperial Club if you can”
Reviews.Author: LHanco
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night break to this fantastic hotel. IN fact the hotel was so good we struggled to leave it and should have spent more time sightseeing however just means that we'll have to go back to explore Rome further. All staff smiley, friendly and helpful. We travelled with a 13 year old and toddler and both were catered for. However beware this is a true 5 star hotel eg Coke 8 Euro, Water 6 Euros, Burger and chips 30 Euros so don't stay here if you are on a budget or if you want a hotel in the centre of Rome as you will be unhappy. PLus there are lots of extras ie internet, outdoor pool etc that are added onto your bill. IF YOU GET THE CHANCE upgrade to Imperial CLub this cost us an additional 90 Euros per room per day however you get the following free. Use of outdoor pool spa use, free internet 15 mins per day, free drinks on a self-serve basis coffee etc plus alcohol, free breakfast and snacks throughout the day 7am-11pm plus a stunning view of Rome from the 7th floor balconies. So a big thank you to previous reviewers who have mentioned this as saved us a small fortune. There is a shuttle bus running around every hour in the day til around 7.30pm and then a taxi back is between 10-15 Euros. Transfer is around 15 -20 mins. In short luxurious hotel (pillow menu), fantastic views, upgrade to Imperial Club if you can , lovely heated outdoor pools including kids pools Cons very pricey, not central location However a fantastic treat if you want to be spoilt

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous family resort with great views”
Reviews.Author: jonaburd
Reviews.Content: This resort provided a much needed break from the hot, crowded city after hours of sightseeing. The kids (ages 7 & 10) always looked forward to swimming in the beautiful pool during the late afternoon. Rome can be overwhelming, and the Cavalieri was our luxurious refuge from the mayhem. The service was top notch (English speaking) and the food was terrific. Insist on a city view room and you may never leave your balcony! The one drawback was the 15-20 min cab ride into the city everyday- or take the complimentary hotel shuttle which drops you at Piazza Barberini every 30 min.

Reviews.Title: “Pluses and Minuses...”
Reviews.Author: hdss379
Reviews.Content: It's a great hotel with plenty of space and amenities, especially if you are given access to the Imperial Lounge. However, if you are looking for an intimate experience with your loved one, this is not the joint. It's a big hotel, and at some hours you feel like cattle riding up and down the elevators. The breakfast is a gorge fest, people running around like they've never seen food before in their lives. It's a good breakfast, nothing to rave about. Lots of people love it because of the endless supply, but I think the quality is less. If you don't get a chance to eat at La Pergola, definitely try the other restaurant (where they serve breakfast). The food was fresh, delicious, and lovely...but expensive (although a bargain compared to Pergola). The property is beautiful and the views are to die for...the shuttle was not our style, so we took a cab in and out of Rome. Bottom-line: great hotel, big rooms, all the hilton perks...Cons: big hotel, lots of people, not very intimate, feel like cattle in elevators. The St. Regis in Rome is better.

Reviews.Title: “Early summer in Rome”
Reviews.Author: reggob
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel from the 6th to 10th June. We had an Imperial Club room with a view overlooking Rome. The Imperial Club room allowed us access to the club lounge which served buffet breakfast together with snacks all day and alcoholic beverages in the evening. The Imperial club room also gave us access to the pools and Grand Spa. The service level at this hotel is extradordinay to say the least, bearing in mind that for the time we lodged here, there was a large EU-US conference, weddings, childrens poolside birthday parties and the service to us was no way compromised by some of these events. The location as other reviewers have noted is not in the centre of Rome, but lets face it, in the middle of Rome's summer heat it was a pleasure to go back to the hotel following our time downtown. The shuttle bus service will deliver you to Piazza Barbereni and from there most sights are within walking distance. We certainly enjoyed our time here and would have no hesitation staying here again, there really is nothing to fault about the Rome Cavalieri, it is 5 star all the way. We have stayed in many 5 star properties around the globe and we found the Rome Cavalieri to be exceptional. Please retain your standards and we look forward to returning sometime.

Reviews.Title: “Grand hotel in the suburbs of Rome”
Reviews.Author: tuslac
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 2 nights. We rented a car and had no trouble geeting to the hotel with our GPS. We had to pay 5 euro per night for parking.
