For those not renting a car and not wanting to pay for an expensive cab ride from the airport I recommend taking the Metro to Barberini stop and hop on the hotel shuttle which stops there on a regular basis. The hotel property from the outside looked a bit dated but once you step inside that perception changes immediately. The reception staff was very friendly, professional and efficient. Our room was not ready when we arrived although it was about 1 hour after check-in time. The recptionist had us wait at the Colosseo lounge and we had to wait about 45 minutes. One issue I did notice is that the people at reception where not able to give me all the HIlton Honors Diamond benefits included in my stay. I had to ask several times and they had to get clarification from someone else at least once. We where "lucky" to get upgraded to a city view room although since it was on the 3rd floor all the view we got was of some nice trees on the property. Nevertheless it was probably a better view than those rooms with a garden view. The room itself was large, funcitonal and very clean. There is also great soundproffing barriers near the front door and balcony. As a Diamond member I got 2 - 24hr certificates for free Wi-Fi, although the reception was not good in the room. We also received free breafast on the -1 floor restaurant which was very lavish and had a large variety of food options. Again, the service was great. Some last miscellaneus comments: - no ironing in guest suites, I was told that if your are a Diamond you have to be escorted to an ironing room, or else pay for ironing service from the hotel. - try the hotel spa/sauna/turkish bath, it was great, although I think you may have to pay if you are not a Diamond. - shuttle was excellent, and drive was very corteous, although the last return was very early and did not give us a chance to have dinner in central Rome. - lastly the Coloseo lounge was nice but I agree with other people that Diamond's shoudl have access to the imperial lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it used to be...”
Reviews.Author: flgregg
Reviews.Content: Disappointing stay in what is truly a beautiful property. Our third visit, first since it has joined the Waldorf chain. Upon checking in, I was ushered to a private check in area given my status with HHonors. I booked an Imperial view room and part of my stay was booked using points. The check in rep was extremely rude reiterating again & again that 'things have changed' and "we wouldn't have access to the imperial lounge once our points stay began.' No mention of anniversary stay even though it was in the reservation and my wife mentioned it....kept requiring verbal acknowledgment that we understood 'we wouldn't have access to Imperial lounge at 12 Noon the first day our point stay began'...Really? Making matters worse was I never received the room I booked for almost €800 a night!! She elected to move us into a standard view room that did not offer a view of the city. No options offered to pay vs. using points to remain in an Imperial room... I would have happily done on my anniversary trip. When we arrived in our room there was a card 'welcoming' a different guest, no standard amenities (water, letter, etc.) and a used eyedrop vial on our bathroom sink. Compare this to our first stay (honeymoon) - a warm welcome & congratulations upon check in, upgraded room, welcome letter, congrats letter and cake in room - HUGE difference, not feeling the Waldorf experience..... We took the opportunity to share our feedback with Khaled, who I see posts here often. He was congenial and, once he stopped policy related 'reasons' (excuses), extended us access to the imperial lounge for our entire stay. Unfortunately, there was NO additional follow up during our stay and, as others here have mentioned, the service throughout the hotel was mediocre. The spirit of service is severely lacking for a luxury brand. We were in the Waldorf London in May and had tremendous experiences throughout our stay. Our Cavalieri experience got to a point where we shortened our planned 10 day stay and checked out after 4 days. Hopefully management will embrace comments left here & provided while I was in the hotel. The property (location, views, art, spa, pool gardens) remain truly amazing, hopefully the service improves to the same level!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel right outside of the City”
Reviews.Author: ZachT
Reviews.Content: I stayed four nights at the Rome Cavalieri over the Thanksgiving holiday week. This was an amazing hotel that I would definitely return to, and would recommend. The most important factor to know about this hotel is it's location: about 5-10 minute cab ridge outside of the city center. If you want to walk out of your hotel door to restaurants, shops, and sights, this is not the hotel for you. If you want a wonderful retreat from a full day and night in the city while still being able to see everything from your hotel window or balcony, this is the hotel for you. It is worth the extra money to book at room with access to the Imperial Club which serves food and drinks throughout the day including a nice breakfast presentation. You can easily make up for the extra cost with the food and beverages made available as well as other amenities. The concierge was great, for the most part. I did receive one bad restaurant recommendation. However, the arrangements for a tour of the Vatican as well as help in securing a dinner reservation at La Pergola (located on top of the hotel) easily made up for the one bad recommendation. I would highly recommend La Pergola if you have an opportunity to go. You will have to make time to really enjoy the dinner (two plus hours), but the food, service, and view are absolutely worth it. Overall, the service at the hotel was great. Never tried room service for a meal, but they were prompt in delivering some basic requests for drinks. The air conditioning/heating system can be rather difficult to figure out. When I noted that I was hot in the room, the front desk quickly arranged to have a portable air conditioning system. Most hotels, even luxury hotels, would not go through such an effort. Going back to the location issue, the hotel does provide a shuttle that runs frequently to a central area of Rome. A cab ride was not expensive at all. Again, the location of the hotel all comes down to what you want at your immediate doorstep. To me, the ability to get just out of the city after a day and night of sightseeing while having a breathtaking view of the city was worth the 5-10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay at the Hilton Rome Cavalieri. It is the biggest rip off ever and is in a terrible location.”
Reviews.Author: Bbg1
Reviews.Content: The hotel was our conference hotel and we supposedly got a deal!!!!!! The room cost 374 euros plus tax per night. That is about 560 us dollars per night before tax. That got us a room with a view of a gigantic microwave tower that was right outside our window. If you wanted to use the swimming pool it was an additional 18 euros or $27us. To use the gym was 22euros or $33us. The Internet was 27euros or $40us per day. One hamburger in the lobby was 29euros nearly $45us!!!!!!! The hotel's location is very inconvenient and a 25 euro cab fare to anywhere. On top of all of this the desk staff are incredibly rude. When you go to Rome there are so many fabulous hotels from which you can pick. Never stay at the Hilton Rome cavalier.

Reviews.Title: “Very good introduction to Rome”
Reviews.Author: Rosemary30
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the beginning of an 8 week trip to Italy and France and had arranged for a hotel car to pick us up at the airport, which was expensive (70 euros) but flawless. Our room unfortunately did not have a view over Rome, only over the front of the hotel and apartment building adjacent, however the room was large, king size bed superbly comfortable, addition of a little sitting area was a bonus as well as the small outdoor patio area. Our rate included breakfast and I would highly recommend getting a rate with this inclusion as the breakfast was fabulous, catering for all tastes with fabulous fresh fruit through to superb hot buffet, and we ate outdoors in the sunshine overlooking the pool which was gorgeous. The courtesy shuttle bus was OK, however last bus from the Rome stop was at 8:30 in the evenings which meant it was necessary to take a 20 - 25 euro taxi fare back to hotel. We stayed for 3 nights, went for a week down to Puglia, then back for another 4 nights, however hotel couldn't accommodate us on the 4th night so we went to a fabulous apartment in the heart of Rome (see separate review for Moses Fountain, Rome) and being within walking distance of everything in Rome made us realise how isolated Rome Cavalieri really is and I don't think we would stay there again for that reason alone. That being said, the hotel staff were fabulous, very informative and everyone spoke excellent English, the hotel itself contains fabulous artworks and the grounds and pool are superb. I paid 27 euros to connect to the internet for 24 hours to check emails and skype home but the internet service signal was not strong enough - I am totally over having to pay these outrageous amounts at hotels and from now on will only consider hotels with free wifi (as in the Moses Fountain).

Reviews.Title: “Perfection.”
Reviews.Author: RNGZG
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we had a genuine, warm welcome at reception. We checked in quickly and our room was superb with views over the garden. We opted for the "Imperial Club" which was worth the extra. Everybody was friendly and polite. Gardens wonderful. Excellent swimming pools. The hotel has an impressive art collection. We will most certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Bring lots of Euro”
Reviews.Author: deapackedandready
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a conference. Although the room was lovely, it was overpriced at even the conference rate. Room service prices are beyond imagining and if we hadn't been so exhausted when we arrived, we certainly wouldn't have used it. This is a destination hotel/resort; you cannot just walk out the door and find restaurants, shops, and the usual neighborhoods that one typically associates with being in Rome. There is an additional fee to use most everything. Just be prepared. The service ranged from wonderful and friendly (room service) to arrogant and rude (conference breakfast, cashier). As is still unfortunately typical, the more expensive the hotel, the more they charge for internet access. This was no exception.

Reviews.Title: “quiet location”
Reviews.Author: happycamperSt_Albert
Reviews.Content: The rooms were lovely but not overly elaborate. Service was good. The complimentary breakfast was HUGE. The grounds are large and well decorated. It is a 15 euro cab ride to ancient Rome. The shuttle is good but does not run at nights if you want to go out for dinner. Considering the class of this hotel I was very surprised that the insides of the shower doors were mouldy and when I ran a bath the water ran brown for several minutes. We did not use the pool or spa as we were too busy seeing Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Second time was just as good”
Reviews.Author: ccbozard
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel that sits above Rome, which makes the views fabulous. We could see St. Peter's from our balcony, even better at night. The staff was very friendly, the accomodations were luxerious. When you walk into the lobby, you will be amazed at how beautiful it is. The pools are phenominal as well - several to choose from. We used the spa services for the jacuzzi and turkish baths. They provide a shuttle bus to downtown that makes walking to the sites very easy. Finally, the grounds are very well manicured and pleasant. Highly recommend this!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, luxurious and romantic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brookesy33
Reviews.Content: My partner took me away here as a surprise and the hotel blew me away! It was not too big or too small and attention to detail was fantastic with lots to look at everywhere - reception was full of antiques and art... Our room was amazing and we had a huge stone balcony overlooking the pool where every evening we could sip Prosecco whilst listening to the singer playing the piano. I really loved it here. Somewhere very special to be spoiled! Oh and breakfast was the best I have ever eaten in a hotel, choices, quality, service and environment... Bliss....

Reviews.Title: “Was amazing, would go back tomorrow!”
Reviews.Author: Cebie
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fab, would resommend to anyone, We went to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary with friends. I would recommend it to anyone. The staff were very friendly and could not do enough for us. The hotel upgraded us to a junior suite. The only down side was we had to pay 18 euros a day to use the sun beds which was a big let down. We ate in the restaurant on the top floor which was also lovely but very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Property”
Reviews.Author: DCavidtraveller
Reviews.Content: I've probably read every single review of this place over the last three years and I have to say this is one of those place where people either love or loathe. I also noticed that those who did not like it did not temper their expectations. General problems I've seen in reviews: 1. Hilton Diamond Members. Many (but not all) of these people expect to be treated like royalty. They skew the reviews of everyone else. I've done my research on other forums like flyertalk and tracked down a couple of people doing these reviews their expectations were ridiculous. Staying at Hilton Garden Inn's through work will eventually give you Diamond status. It's funny because in the Diamond Perk's details it shows exactly what you get from a property like the Waldorf. 2. People Booking non Imperial Floor rooms. If you book an imperial floor room then the issue of nickel and diming disappear. Yes they do charge you for almost everything but you don't have to purchase the service. 3. Location Location Location. If you love public transportation and want to walk everywhere in Rome then this isn't your place. It's explicitly called out that you have to shuttle into the city. Also if you do a Google map search of the location you'll see how far it is from things like the Vatican or Coliseum. On to the Review. This was one of the best hotels I've stayed in top to bottom. I saw an amazing promo for 1/2 off the bed and breakfast rate so I booked the hotel. I am the type to take public transit and originally this wasn't the most convenient place to book, but the rate was too good to pass. Honestly from the moment I arrived to the moment I left we were treated professionally. We booked the imperial lounge based on previous reviews and I was not disappointed. If you have to choose from a Rome View or an Imperial Lounge floor room, then take the later. It is worth it especially because of the rates charged for the mini bar or restaurant. We had a view of the antenna which we didn't mind because the room was for sleeping only. We hung out in the imperial lounge drinking champagne overlooking the Vatican and Rome. We arrived around 8AM at the hotel but our room was not ready. Because we had imperial lounge access we hung out their for about 2 hours. They provided breakfast and for the other hour we decided to our the property. Because I needed wifi access they provided me with two days of free access because I had an Ipad and our room wasn't ready. Once we got to the room I realized this was an older property but the room was absolutely within our expectations. We did not use the pool because we wanted to tour the city but it was available for free to us because of Imperial lounge Access. The included breakfast there was superb except for their Japanese section, which was horrible. But once again why would I want a Japanese breakfast in Italy. Everything was fresh. The shuttle was useful as we took it in the morning and came back in the evening. It's good to take the last shuttle into Rome to find an amazing place to eat. Just take a cab back. It's about 10 euro's. The one overseen benefit of this place is the fact that it's spacious and on a hill. You don't see much grass when in Rome. Service: Top Notch. You ask and they can do. Gave us a bottle of Champagne when we came back during turn down service. Provided places to eat and directions to places to go. Room: Very spacious for Rome. Comfortable bed. Sheets were decent but not as good as Grande Bretagne. Food: Delicious. Be prepared to Eat, Drink and Be Merry.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced hotel that nickel and dimes you for everything”
Reviews.Author: Smooth_Obturator
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rome Cavalieri at the recommendation of a colleague, and were greatly disappointed. While the location was not ideal (it is far from most of Rome’s sights and the complimentary shuttle only runs until 8pm, which is very early by Italian standards) we were well aware of this prior to booking, and therefore have little to complain about in this regard. One of my biggest beefs with this hotel is that even with its pricey rate, they insist on charging you for every amenity. There’s a fee to use the lackluster pool, a fee to use Wi-Fi, and a fee to get a boxed breakfast (even though breakfast was included in our room rate). Moreover, the hotel is decidedly undeserving of its Waldorf Astoria branding. The hotel and its rooms exhibit all the signs of an aging property – peeling paint, non-working lights (four in our room upon check-in), water temperature issues (half of my showers alternated between lukewarm and cold), and a mediocre breakfast buffet. The service also left much to be desired. The staff did not appear to be too concerned about our feedback, and the attitude overall was largely dismissive and somewhat arrogant. I am well aware that my opinions regarding this hotel appear incongruent with most of the other reviews here on TripAdvisor (I am sad to say this is the first time TripAdvisor has failed me on a recommendation), so perhaps my experience was simply an unfortunate incident. That, or they save their run-down rooms for cash-paying non-HHonors members like us. In any event, on future visits to Rome I will take my money elsewhere and stay at a true five-star property.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest hotel we have ever stayed at - wonderful view and staff.”
Reviews.Author: scheskiewicz
Reviews.Content: This is the nicest hotel we have ever stayed at, it is truly amazing in its facilities, ammenities and view of Rome. This is a true 5-star experience in one of the great cities of the world. That being said it is a good 20 minute ride (cab or hotel provided shuttle to Rome attractions). This is both a plus and minus as it is quiet and beatiful but you cannot walk to anything from the hotel. The hotel does offer a nice shuttle service. If you are on a budget we advise taking beverages/snacks with you from town as there are not places you can walk to near the hotel which leaves you only the mini bar or hotel restaurants which are quite expensive. If you don't mind the 20 minute ride to town, this is most likely the best hotel expererience in Rome. If you want to walk out the door and be in the thick of things you may want to forgo this exceptional hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “If you want an extra special treat, then this is the hotel for you.”
Reviews.Author: bumfluff179
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our 25th Anniversary and we weren't disappointed. In fact the hotel and staff were so brilliant that we didn't want to leave the hotel. Whatever you do, pay for the upgrade for an imperial room and the imperial lounge. It is well worth it. Our room overlooked the vatican and because I made the staff aware that it was a special occasion when we booked I felt they'd given us a particularly special room. The imperial lounge serves drinks and snacks which is included in the price. Had we not paid for the upgrade I would have got pretty miffed at the prices and it would have been a very different kind of stay if we had only gone for a standard room on a room only basis. As it was everything was perfect and I mean perfect. The room, the staff, the spa and pools and of course all the attractions in Rome itself. A special hotel for special memories. Thank you to all the staff for making it so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place, too far from the city center!”
Reviews.Author: kaliron
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay in the hotel, but it is too far from the city center and it took 40 min every morning to get to the main sites of Rome. Not worth staying there if you plant to spend most of your time in the city.

Reviews.Title: “BEST VIP TREAMENT EVER”
Reviews.Author: maintainin
Reviews.Content: I seen and read several reviews of this property and I'm a little confused. As a Diamond member using the VIP package offered by Hilton (which is the ONLY way to go), I was met by the manager on duty, given a tour of the property and all its perks. I stayed in May (not avail in drop down), so I didn't get upgraded. The room was very nice and the view was not of Rome,, but I didn't stay in the room much. The VIP floor was superb! Free food and drinks.....5 times a day. Now the view from the lounge? THE BEST. Service from all was excellent. It's a little out of the way, but they offer a free bus ride that drops you off and pickes you right down town. Taxi fare not bad, if you prefer. BTW, the birds are beautiful! Matter of fact, we are contemplating going again next year. We are afraid we will be disappointed if book anywhere else, as they set the standards so high. Thanks Rome Cavalieri, Waldorf Astoria Hotels & Resorts staff for a GREAT STAY!

Reviews.Title: “Met my expectations”
Reviews.Author: SmileySnowman
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Rome Cavalieri for 3 nights at the beginning of June (both mid-30's). I am a Gold Hilton HHonors member (same for Marriott…I travel A LOT), and used points for the three nights. Per my status, we received daily Internet vouchers, access to the Colosseo Lounge (free drinks and snacks), and 2 free, small water bottles in the room each day. After the various reviews, I simply had the expectation that I was getting a free room in a nice hotel. That’s it. I didn’t have expectations of great service or anything like that. Truthfully, I’ve had better service…but I’ve also had far, far worse. I would have loved a room upgrade, but the hotel was packed. Again, I had an expectation of a free room…and that was met, so I can’t complain. If I would have paid for the room, I would have had drastically different expectations. What I liked: ** Clean, clean, clean rooms ** seemed like a safe area; plus, the Israeli Delegation to Republic Day stayed there while we were there. ** safe in the room ** convienent, relatively private ATM machine ** Colosseo Lounge for free drinks and some snacks. ** Air-conditioning ** Prompt shuttle, polite driver ** Toiletries were Crabtree and Evelyn, and replaced daily ** Beautiful hotel ** Staff spoke great English and for the most part were very friendly. I was impressed (and they didn’t laugh at my poor attempts at Italian). What I didn’t like: ** There was no iron in the room. “No iron” is common throughout various hotels that I’ve stayed in, but I just personally like an iron. ** There also was no hot water kettle; again, simply a preference. ** I don’t fully understand why the hotel guests can’t use the outdoor pool for free? I had free access to the indoor pool. ** I had a full understanding of the location of the hotel but I didn't like the distance from Rome. If we were on a looser budget, I would have stayed elsewhere, but the free room was too enticing, so we dealt with it. What I really didn’t like: The bellman basically stalked my husband and me about wanting to “take our bags to our room as our room might not be ready.” I explained several times that I would keep my bags as a) we packed very lightly and I would be happy to carry them to the room if the room was ready – as I did over 2 countries, 3 airports, and 3 train stations; b) that I would give them the bags if the room wasn’t ready, but that I needed to get some items out of the bags first. Rinse and repeat twice in the 5 minutes before I checked in! While I was checking in, and my husband had the bags a few meters away from me, the bellman came up to the receptionist. He clearly said something to the receptionist about the bags, and he turned to me and indicated that the room wasn’t ready yet and that he could store my bags. Receptionist then told me that my room wasn’t ready and that the bellman would take my bags. As the bellman started to take my bags, I told him to stop (as I still hadn’t gotten out what I needed) and he literally stood there and waited until I finished obtaining my items. As soon as the bellman had possession of my bags, the receptionist told me that the room was ready. TO THE MANAGEMENT TEAM: As a guest, this really, really irritated me. I can deal with a dirty room - it happens. I can deal with a surly staff member - it happens. This just drove me absolutely MAD since I was very clear multiple times with my expectations. I repeated my stance on the bags to the bell staff no fewer than 3 times in the span of approximately 10 minutes. I get that the bell staff wants a tip -- they made that clear with their behavior. However, the occurrence with the receptionist and the bell-staff made me not trust her EITHER. Why should I want to hand my bags over to someone who so clearly is interested in taking them for their own purposes? Seriously, it made me wonder if they will be looking through my bags. The bell staff should BACK OFF if a guest says “no” -- and don't play games with the receptionist/check-in. Bottom line: I’d come back, if I could use my points. I personally wouldn’t pay to stay here. This level of luxury hotel is not my style at this point in my life. Tips: ** We found the shuttle to be convenient going into Rome, but not returning to the hotel (simply based on how early it stops running in the evening). ** The hotel shuttle stops running pretty early. We took the Metro to the Cirpro station, and then grabbed a taxi from there, back to the hotel. It was about 10 Euro. ** It was about 13 Euro to Termini from the hotel. ** Line up early for the shuttle bus. While we did not have difficulty getting a seat, other’s did. I heard that the hotel paid for a taxi for those that wouldn’t fit on the bus, but I don’t know if that is true or not.

Reviews.Title: “an amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: Alitown64
Reviews.Content: Only spent 3 days in this hotel but seemed like longer. Works of art everywhere. Fabulous spa and pool area. Our room had spectacular views over Rome. The hotel gardens and patio was superb we would love to return for a longer trip. There is a good shuttle bus for a twenty minute journey into city centre handy for Trevi Fountain and Spannish steps.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with Rude Disappointing Service”
Reviews.Author: b2r0bb22
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Cavalieri2x during the month of June 2011. The hotel itself is gorgeously appointed although out of the way relative to sight-seeing. The rooms were elegant with large balconies overlooking beautifully landscaped grounds. That said, I will not return to the Cavalieri nor can I recommend it. The staff was rude and officious. The pricing policies were outrageous. In addition to a $1200 per night room charge, there was a $30 Euro charge to use the pool plus a 12 Euro charge to sit in a chair and an 8 Euro charge to use a towel. No coffee service in the room without a 25Euro charge for room service. I was appalled at the gouging attitude. The Cavalieri obviously does not believe in hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “cannot wait to book again”
Reviews.Author: TheWebsters
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here annually for the last 5 years, to celebrate the New Year. Being a HHonors Diamond member, I consider it well worth paying a bit extra to stay in an Imperial room and get access to the Imperial lounge. The Imperial rooms are all incredible and a Rome view is a fantastic bonus, if you can get one. The standard of service has always been superb, the food in the lounge excellent. Although the hotel is a fair distance from the centre of Rome, there is a complimentary shuttle bus provided. Mind you, we have walked into Rome on a number of occasions, taking approximately 45 miinutes. We can't wait to revisit this year.

Reviews.Title: “Expectations met.”
Reviews.Author: balburns
Reviews.Content: After reading the tripadvisor reviews, I saw the broad spectrum of ideas regarding the Cavalieri. I was prepared for an experience that was luxurious and was not going to be cheap. The grounds and interior of the Cavalieri went beyond my expectations. I did not have time to do the Ipod tour of the artwork, but wished I'd had. The rooms were gorgeous. However, we were not lucky enough to had an odd numbered room (with a view of the city). They were booked solid and had no upgrade availability. That's why it's an exclusive property. It expects that those who are staying there, can afford the extras to be luxuriously priced. We were prepared for the expensive add-ons and the distance it was from the city center. The free shuttle was convenient. Gold and above Hilton Honors members do have perks, free internet, free breakfast (wonderful breakfast buffet!), and executive lounge (main lobby level). If you wish to have dinner in their upper level restaurant, men are required to wear jackets. One thing to note, in the city, the shuttle meets at the corner of Piazza Barberini at the corner of Via Veneto, near the SHELL FOUNTAIN. There are three corners to this spot and the newcomers were always puzzled exactly where the shuttle would stop. When you get on the shuttle at the hotel, If you ask the driver to stop near the vatican (ottovania), he will let you know when to get off. It's halfway between the hotel and Piazza Barberini.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably beautiful, the art collection and orchids were matched by an attentive, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: cdressing
Reviews.Content: We had a absolutely 5 star experience at the Cavaliere! Truly gorgeous hotel with top notch appointments thru out the grounds. We stayed 3 nights, wished it was longer! The breakfast was beyond anything I had ever seen before, 2 large rooms filled with exotic, exciting, homemade dishes that will appeal to all international visitors. The lounge for the "elite" level was awesome, food and beverages allday until 11pm, this ended up being a gathering spot for alot of Hilton honors people and we had such a great time meeting and chatting with fellow travelers, all 3 evenings turned into quite the cocktail party! We found the shuttle service helpful to keep cab rides to a minimum but do wish they had at least one additional stop on the vatican side of the river... it has only one stop and it only comes once an hour. We managed to make it work most of the time but it was not as helpful as it could of been. This is a first class hotel that offers a first class experience.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous. Worthy of an indulgence.”
Reviews.Author: SemiMonty
Reviews.Content: This is one of those hotels where you must let go of your budgets and enjoy every single thing it has to offer. Our suite was astonishing and worth every penny. I loved the hotel, the service, the attention to details and the food was awesome. The view from the suite of the entire city of Rome spread out below you is a sight to behold. Just let go and you will have a blast.

Reviews.Title: “amazing hilltop location”
Reviews.Author: anilghei
Reviews.Content: great hotel with the largest private art collection..spread all over the hotel...great brunch on weekends.. lovely gardens and pool..micheline star restaurant -pergola is amazing..nothing beats the location

Reviews.Title: “Attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: arborgirl2
Reviews.Content: Many many people have already given rave reviews to the hotel. I just wanted to add my 2 cents because I was also very impressed. Our room was very large, with a city view and nice balcony. The Imperial Club was very nice. The thing I found most impressive though is that if the hotel shuttle into town fills up they actually pay for you to take a private taxi. We thought that really went above and beyond. One warning: We did find it inconvenient that the hotel was located outside the main city, so we felt "trapped" there after returning home in the early evening since we did not want to pay the 15 euro each way for a taxi, whereas we might have gone out exploring the nightlife if we were staying in town. This is not a fault of the hotel (we of course knew this would be the situation when booking!) but rather just something to note.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I've Ever Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: JimAdams1
Reviews.Content: This tops the hotels I've stayed in. I'm sure the fact that sitting atop of Rome and looking down over the Vatican had something to do with it :) The service was impeccable. The view was spectacular. Rome, Italy has a vibe that compares to few cities in the world. La Pergola, the restaurant on the top floor was the most impressive dining experience I've had. The rooms were magnificent, and quite roomy - especially considering a typical European room is quite small compared with U.S. hotels. This was my first trip to Italy and can't wait to stay in the Rome Cavalieri again. The Rome Cavalieri is the only hotel I will ever stay in, while in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Trader0909
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Rome Cavalieri is one of the finest hotels I have ever had the pleasure to stay in. I used Hilton points to pay for the room, and still had the highest level of service. This hotel is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel with a view”
Reviews.Author: MisterB49
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 30th wedding anniversary at this hotel, and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel is very fine and the opportunity to enjoy breakfast every morning around the pool area was very welcome. Service for breakfast was slow and you often had to ask for cutlery or coffee two or three times before it arrived. Apart from that, staff elsewhere were extremely helpful and the view across Rome was lovely. I pity those people that had rooms at the front of the hotel though, as the view must have been pretty grim. I would suggest you request a room at the rear of the hotel so that you can enjoy the views.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent if you are staying for free on HH points or are rich”
Reviews.Author: Canadian_Hoser
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were quickly escorted to a special 'Diamond Desk' and treated like celebrities! I am at the highest tier of Hilton Honors and they definately cater to you as such!!! We stayed 2 nights using free night certificates earned during the previous year.. no issues whatsoever. I am sure we would have been upgraded to a 'Rome view' but the hotel was packed so we had a nice garden view. The room was a nice size, probably close to 600 sq feet.. very large for Europe. Very nicely appointed and luxurious. No complaints, The executive lounge was nice with free wine/champagne/beer from 11am to 11pm. We enjoyed this thoroughly. They serve some light appies and we pretty much filled up on them for dinner as unless you are rich you could never afford to eat in their restaurants. Dinner with wine would run you about 300 euros here or much more. The pool was nice and we were glad it was heated. Very large, deep and nice. The 'Hot tub' was the same temp as the pool.... not sure what the deal is with that... unusable. If we had paid to stay here and I was not a diamond member we would have been very disappointed with the price for what you get. everything here is very expensive... even 18 euro to use the outdoor pool (each) and breakfast is VERY expensive. The breakfast was easily the worst we encountered on all of our travels on this trip and we stayed at other comparable properties that were excellent such as Molino Stucky Venice, Conrad Cairo and Hilton Athens. Each of these properties blew the Cavalieri away both in terms of food and service and executive lounges. I think that they have become complacent at this property. As much as we enjoyed our stay here on points, we would NEVER think of staying here if we were paying for all of the things that I mentioned. Our stay was great but if we were paying $ 1000 USD a day for the room and all the inclusions of my diamond membership we would have felt ripped. We are fairly well to do but it was obvious to us that this was a place for rich people.. millionaires..you could see it in most of the guests. Very stuffy except for the staff. They have a free shuttle as the place is out of the way.. you could walk to places in 30 minutes but there are no sidewalks so it is not safe. A 5-10 euro cab ride will take you anywhere you want. We used both the shuttle and taxis and it was no problem. It was nice to go back to an oasis at the end of the day with a tremendous view of all of Rome. In short, AMAZING if staying on points and AMAZING if you are rich. If you are paying and aren't rich you will feel cheated. Very expensive!! We had a GREAT stay on points and the inclusions were great!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay with a Perfect View”
Reviews.Author: Travellin' More
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Cavalieri Waldorf for four nights. The setting is perfect for relaxing or you can take in any on the hundreds of places in Rome that are so interesting. From the time we made our reservations until we checked out the service was friendly, prompt and helpful. The breakfast buffet was extensive and the best we have ever had. Again, service was always available and never with anything but a smile. Your coffee cup doesn't get empty. The city view from our room was picture perfect with the balcony being quiet and private. It is difficult not to overuse superlatives in describing this property but the three separate sets of friends who recommended it to us were all correct in saying it was the perfect place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: mummytravelor
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay here and would return.Staff were very good and receptionist was excellent.Only down side is you have to pay to use the pool which I disagree with but the Hotel and views were beutifull.

Reviews.Title: “Another perfect weekend at Cavallieri Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: Philip84
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hilton many times and once again it was a great experience!Everything was perfect , the gardens , the staff , the room,the service.I will come back again

Reviews.Title: “Choose this hotel above all!”
Reviews.Author: ennaines
Reviews.Content: Go in May. Try to book the room with the view of the city. Executive lounge is a must!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Facilities!”
Reviews.Author: Spartycat1
Reviews.Content: Beautiful grounds and views of Rome. Sits on a hill overlooking the city. Best views from higher floors. Staff was very helpful and accommodating. A nice resort in Rome. Would be a destination resort if you don't want to visit Rome. Shuttle to city a 30 minute ride down the hill. Rooms are large with balconies and very quiet. Food is upscale and a little expensive, but very good.

Reviews.Title: “5 star luxury in Rome”
Reviews.Author: BritinVA
Reviews.Content: Purpose of stay We attended a wedding in London and then ‘added on’ a 3 night stay in Rome before returning to the USA Pre Arrival I had e-mailed Guest Relations prior to my visit with some questions and requests and they provided me with quick and helpful replies. At their suggestion I also contacted the Concierge who was able to help me with restaurant reservations. Arrival We were picked up at the airport by Rome shuttle limousine. Their website is http://www.romeshuttlelimousine.com. Very good service, cost was 40 euros Porters were there to swiftly help us with our luggage. Check in Friendly attractive check in staff who immediately recognized me as a Hilton Gold member. Ran through the list of benefits and told me that we had received an upgrade to a Rome view. Also provided me with the vouchers/codes for the use of the wireless internet service which worked well throughout the trip Room Our room was on the 4th floor so I was a little concerned about the view. However when we entered the room we were immediately impressed with the quality of the furniture and fittings. The view was excellent. Hopefully you can see that in the pictures. Two (small) bottles of mineral water were provided and regularly replenished In addition sweets and chocolates were left on the room at night while we were out to dinner. The rest of the room you can see from the pictures. The luggage was also swiftly delivered to our room. Colosseo Lounge By now it was close to lunch time and we decided to explore the hotel before starting our sightseeing. So we wandered down to the lounge and found a welcoming if not super luxurious space. I’ve also posted some pictures to help. Although not as richly furnished as some of the Hilton lounges I’ve visited, or as well supplied with food, it is I believe it is adequate for the task. Free wine, beer, and sodas are provided as well as a simple array of foods. We made up a small salad and some sandwiches and that was enough to keep us going until dinner. During our stay we usually dropped into the lounge on returning from the city to enjoy up some water, soda or wine before returning to our room. L'Uliveto Restaurant and Breakfast The restaurant and terrace is located on the lower (pool) level of the hotel. Although the restaurant does not have a view of Rome it does have a pleasant pool side terrace where it was warm enough to have breakfast on two of the three days of our stay. The interior of the restaurant is pleasantly decorated and is not an unpleasant place to have breakfast. The buffet selection was excellent. They really do cover pretty much all the possible breakfast options. There are juices, cereals, various breads, fruit, yoghurt, hams, cheese as well as multiple hot options. I have never seen so many jams and preserves. Finally there are some Japanese and Asain options as well. Very comprehensive and excellent service as well. More impressions This not an ideal base for touring the center of Rome. However the hotel have mitigated that problem with their shuttle service which we found to be efficient and very comfortable. If you are reasonably fit you can walk to the Vatican from the the hotel. It took us about 30 minutes, return will be longer as it is uphill. It took us about 40 minutes so you may want a taxi for that. We also noticed that people could get dropped off from the shuttle near the Vatican. YMMV! Driving into the city by taxi averaged around 10 euros. Summary It really is a wonderful hotel with a real 5 star ambience. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just wow!”
Reviews.Author: Soujourner69
Reviews.Content: Opting for an extended weekend in Rome to escape from all the daily humdrum, I decided to add a bit of 'splurge' to my stay there and chose the Rome Cavalieri as my lodging. Boarding my plane in the wee hours of morning I arrived at the Cavalieri at about 9:30am with the pleasant surprise that my room was already available! So, after a quick fresh-up and changing clothes I jumped into the shuttle-bus which dropped me off in downtown Rome in less than 30 minutes! The hotel itself may not look that much from the outside, but inside it is pure splendor! The rooms are spacious, beautiful decorated and come equipped with all the amenities you need. Each room - even those not facing the city got a balcony (at least that's what I could gather from my personal observation). And my room was utterly quiet and offered a good nights sleep. What else... mhmm... well, breakfast buffet was perhaps the best I've ever indulged in, hotel staff was top-notch and the bar served unusual but extremely tasty cocktails. Full marks from me!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room and amazing service”
Reviews.Author: LIESQ
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I spent three nights in the Rome Cavalieri and it was truly a wonderful experience. We were upgraded to a beautiful room with a large marble bathroom and a terrace with a magnificant view of the pool and the city of Rome beyond. The hotel staff could not have been more friendly and accommodating. The only drawback to the hotel is that we had to take cabs to get to our destinations during the day. The hotel provides a shuttle bus but we were not able to coordinate our schedule to the shuttle schedule. I would still return!

Reviews.Title: “This is an older hotel that has been well cared for and has large rooms and great views.”
Reviews.Author: limecilantro
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night before we left on a cruise. We had reserved a room on the executive level, and I believe that because of that we were allowed to check in before noon. (After an overnight flight, that was worth a lot to us.) The view was beautiful and had the weather been warmer, it would have been great to use the large balcony. Paying for a "Rome View" room....having done that, I'm not sure that it's worth the money. If you get a room on a high enough floor, you can have a great view on the other side of the hotel, too. (If you get a Rome view, you look out over the hotel park, and on the other side it's a residential view until you get some height.) I am SO glad we chose this hotel rather staying in a small, cramped room in the center of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Magnficent”
Reviews.Author: lilac11wine
Reviews.Content: An oasis in Rome. As others have described, it's outside of the city and a cab ride away from everything, which is not necessarily a bad thing. The service was impeccable, the public areas and the room were stunning. I can't imagine staying anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Not a "Waldorf Astoria" experience”
Reviews.Author: TravlAgain
Reviews.Content: At least some of the staff really seem to try, but there must be a management issue here, because for all the trying so hard it just doesn't live up to what you'd expect at a Waldorf Astoria property! My stay began wrong, because I had to argue with the front desk staff and threaten to leave in order to finally get a room with a view of the city (rather than the parking lot view which half of the guests must endure - the hotel rooms face one of two directions, towards the city view of Rome or towards the parking lot). It was a long and somewhat arduous discussion with the front desk manager. The city view is so much nicer, although for me it was an exhausting and tense conversation to get it! The rooms themselves were once magnificent, although they have not always been well cared for, as there are signs of neglect in many places. The pillows on the sofa were ripped, the drapes were quite old, the A/C system outdated and did not function (it was either too hot or too cold at all times). The hotel itself is quite grand, sitting on a large plot of land with a nice overview of the city below. After long days of walking the streets, it is nice to return to this quiet oasis. This alone might temp us to return, albeit with very low expectations. One major downside for being "away from it all" is that you need to get a ride to go anywhere. You can't even go to a local restaurant without taking a taxi. Plus, the taxis can be scarce at peak times. When we went to go out one morning there was a line of about a dozen people waiting to get a taxi. This also means that the hotel has you as a captive to some extent. They charge exorbitant prices for even the most-basic things (e.g., tiny bottle of still water costs $10). While Rome in general is not a cheap place, this hotel seems to takes that up a notch. The breakfast buffet in the restaurant is quite nice, and one of the better services on the property. They appear to do many large banquets/weddings there, as they are organized for large-scale coordination of serving food. Our only complaint here was the eggs - which they seem to love raw. To avoid the pre-prepared runny ones, we special ordered hard-boiled eggs twice and both times they came back liquid, and the staff didn't seem to understand why we wouldn't want to eat them that way. Talk about risk of salmonella! The gym and pools are also decent, and worthwhile if you have the energy left after touring Rome. There is of course a fee for using any of these. As a top-tier member of their hotel's frequent traveler program (HHonors), you get access to the Colosseo Lounge, where they provide you with free drinks and a few snacks. However, I found this to be a quite annoying and uncomfortable experience. The lighting in the lounge is overly bright, it was normally crowded, and rather than a "benefit" it felt more like a little torture to get a free drink. When we visited, one gentleman got yelled at by the staff for walking out the door with a soda in his hands as he looked for his wife. Talk about poor service! That lounge was really just was a bad experience. The best part of the hotel experience was the bedding - with oversize pillows and comfortable beds, along with the quietness of the property, we were able to rest well. Again, getting away from the hustle and bustle of the city is a big plus. Thus, overall, the hotel has much potential. The beautiful photos on their website are of course more gorgeous than anything you are actually going to see as a guest there, but it is in fact a beautiful property - and quite an accomplishment to have such a place located in the midst of a large city like Rome. I'd recommend looking elsewhere if there were better options available in Rome, but we've tried several and have yet to find "wonderful."

Reviews.Title: “Expected a bit more for the money”
Reviews.Author: MaxWatty
Reviews.Content: Visited Rome for the first time with my extended family to celebrate a birthday. Were highly recommended the Rome Cavalieri by friends of friends and this was probably where we went wrong. Although the hotel was very nice, we didn't get what we were expecting. We should have booked a room with a Rome/City view. Our room was to the front of the hotel and our balcony didn't get much sun and faced a very large radio mast... The room was very spacious, a very comfortable bed with plenty of pillows and the bathroom again to a vey high standard. Decor though was probably not to my taste. The breakfast was superb and lots to chose from. Service was at all times was very helpful. Dinner on our first night there was very nice although expensive and subsequent nights were spent eating out in the city centre. The free shuttle service was very helpful and essential for getting into the centre for sightseeing. It would have been nice if this was more frequent and ran later into the evening although taxi's to the hotel were not too expensive (get a map from the concierge as this was very helpful). Be careful you know where to collect the shuttle on your return though as we were dropped off in a different location to pick-up on the first trip - I think down to road works. I did use the swimming pool in October which was nice and warm. Overall a nice stay, but next visit will try another hotel closer to the centre.

Reviews.Title: “A True Waldorf experience”
Reviews.Author: worldtravellerplus46
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really a luxurious one.Fresh flowers every day, a sumptious breakfast, delicious canapes and expansive grounds.The staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “best rome hotel we have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: STEVE EGAN
Reviews.Content: over the top decor,but the service,food,facilities all match this! We have stayed in 12 hotels over 10 years including four 5 star...this is the best!!

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Diamonds BEWARE!!”
Reviews.Author: jquay85
Reviews.Content: This is a five star hotel with zero star treatment of Hilton Diamonds. As a Hilton Diamond member for five (5) years, this hotel provides the worst treatment of status of any Hilton property I have ever stayed in. The greeting was non-existent and any amenities are not explained. Received a room upgrade for 49 Euros per night and had a beautiful view of the cell tower in the front of the hotel. When I spoke to the manager that I wasn't satisfied with the room, I was moved the following morning to another floor with a better view of the cell tower. Upon checkout the 49 Euro was still on the bill. When we needed to check-in for our return flight and to get boarding passes we had to pay 6.65 Euro to use the computer and printer. Word to the wise, save your points and money and find a hotel closer to the city!! Hilton Diamond member now looking at other Reward Programs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in a great city”
Reviews.Author: travelforgood2
Reviews.Content: First of all: We love Rome! and we love this hotel - well, you can't call it anymore a hotel, it's a dream, it's like heaven! We stayed in one of the Executive Rooms overlooking Rome, with a direct view to the Vactican and the city. There is a great garden, a pool and it is just perfect. Don't miss to visit the spa area (to be honest it is rather expensive) but after a day in the city you absolutely can relax there. It is just great - nothing else to say! Even the bathrooms at the lobby are just stunning, and don't fortget to visit the restaurant for dinner - GREAT GREAT GREAT! Thanks for a great stay - Rome is fantastic and the Waldorf Cavalieri just made it to our favourite city on the planet!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel overlooking Rome”
Reviews.Author: jlnmw
Reviews.Content: Lovely location on a hillside overlooking Rome and the Vatican. Surrounded by several acres of manicured grounds. Very quiet. Beautifully decorated, elegant rooms with balconies. Has hotel shuttle or its a short taxi ride to Rome sites and the Vatican. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “5 Star hotel, 5 star prices”
Reviews.Author: B0NE5
Reviews.Content: We had a King Deluxe room with a Rome view. The rooms are beautiful & the grounds of the hotel are very pleasant & the inclusive breakfast is of a very high standard. Dinner at the hotel restaurant is expensive, but again of an excellent standard. They provide a free bus service running hourly throughout the day to the centre of Rome but it stops running about 8pm & after that you'll be looking at around a 15 minute walk to the nearest Metro stop (the Metro is a very cheap way to travel around Rome). After splashing out for a 5* hotel, I can't help feeling ripped off by the prices of extras - examples €11 for a glass of wine in the bar & €27 a day for internet. Worst of all use of the leisure club is not included in the price, costing €20 per person per day. After paying to stay in 5* hotel accommodation, I really don't expect to have to pay extra to use the leisure facilities! Finally our Rome View was largely obscured by trees.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay in Rome, truly a five star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DeborahNY1
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights beginning Saturday, April 16th and then returned for 1 night on Friday, April 22nd. We received connecting rooms as we requested with spectacular views of Rome both times. The rooms were spacious, beautifully decorated and spotlessly clean. We stayed on the Imperial Floor and were thrilled with the food, drinks, breakfast and service in the Imperial Lounge. Everyone we encounted on the hotel staff was friendly and very helpful from the front desk to the concierge to the cleaning staff. Our rooms were ready on arrival from our overnight flight. The concierge helped with restaurant recommendations and making reservations. The Imperial Lounge staff made checking out a very smooth process. We were able to get taxis promptly whenever we wanted. The hotel's location enabled us to have a great view of the city from our room and enjoy swimming in their indoor and outdoor pools after touring every day. While the hotel was expensive, it was truly fabulous in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Better value to be had elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Travelbugboi
Reviews.Content: The dated exterior hides the more opulent interior with plenty of marble and plush fabrics and furniture along with a fantastic art collection. Be prepared to pay for it though as it's not the best value for money. As a Diamond member who booked and paid 4 months prior for 2 nights I wasn't given an upgrade, refused a room with a view and also a late checkout. Not impressed hence won't be returning or recommending. A pleasent location within a short free shuttle bus ride into town or taxi back if need be. A couple of nice local restaurants only 10 minutes walk (right out of the hotel) as a good alternative to the hotel. ATM machine within the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel overall, BUT EXAGGERATEDLY EXPENSIVE in some ways”
Reviews.Author: lmhcfl
Reviews.Content: The Hotel overall is great, it is a beautiful landmark in Rome, is very luxurious, the rooms impeccable, the service, facilities and amenities are excellent, but is extremely expensive. So be aware of some charges, services or items that are exaggeratedly expensive, as an examples: a small bottle of water on the pool bar cost € 6 (same brand “Levissima” that cost on a regular market in Rome € 0.30 or less), a orange juice € 12 (in Vatican City Museum Coffee Shop € 2.10 fresh squeeze), a regular coffee € 8, a towel for the pool € 18, a regular hamburger at the pool bar € 29, Internet service, local calls, and many more other that are exaggeratedly expensive and not comparable to other 5 stars luxury hotels, as Intercontinental, Ritz Carlton, Four Seasons, etc.; and remember that 1 euro is almost 1.5 USD $. Another thing is the shuttle bus to Rome that only have a capacity of 29 passengers and does not run continuously, and the hotel is far from the center and main attractions of the City, so if you do not catch the shuttle bus, due capacity or schedule you need to spend some money on taxi transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location - prepare to be gouged for everything.”
Reviews.Author: calemoo
Reviews.Content: I must say that the hotel itself is in a beautiful spot with amazing views. I stayed in the room 615, with a view overlooking Rome, it was an incredible view. The service was great, staff very friendly. The hotel itself is a bit dated and needs some upgrades such as international plugs and a couple other things, nop major complaints here. There were a few things that really annoyed me about the hotel. I stay in 5 star hotels all over the world in every country, this is the worst ever in terms of charging for everything. I am surprised we weren't charged for using oxygen to breath here. You have to get a special hotel package to use the pool, are you kidding me??? Doesn't the pool belong to the hotel? We had to pay 20 Euros per day to use the pool and an additional 18 euros per day to use the fitness facilities. Even at the 5 stars in vegas they charge a one time resort fee for use of all facilities, why do we get charged for everything? This seems totally over the top. The internet is $27 Euros per day!! Thats like $38 dollars, and get this, they block netflix and movie downloads so you have to pay the $20 euro fee for their terrible movie selection. Thats 28 dollars per movie, you can't be serious. So the rate of 305 euros per day covered breakfast which was pretty great, but absolutely nothing else. prepare to spend another 100 euros per day if you want to use anything that most other 5 star hotels provide for free. I would prefer they just charge more money rather then nickel and dime for every service. The hotel itself is in a beautiful location however I likely would not go back. I would prefer to spent 500 euro a night at a hotel where everything is included. It just gets ridiculous paying 18 euros for a drink poolside and having to pay another 20 for the pool. Come on Hilton, get your act together, include basic services in the rate, charge more if you have to.

Reviews.Title: “HHONORS BEWARE”
Reviews.Author: Ttouch00
Reviews.Content: It is very disappointing for one whom chooses Hilton as the choice hotel for all Business Travel and contributing to over 100 nights per year to have to write this review. Being an HHonors member for the 1 reason of being able to enjoy the rewards when on vacation is most likely everyones purpose of being a member. Well, unfortunately the Waldorf Rome Cavalieri is not the place to use your points nor even pay for a stay. For the first time in all my travels have I encountered such visual image evaluating personel with no sense of knowledge of customer history. One would hope a Manager would do his research on a HHonors customer prior to arrival and make sure they are treated accordingly. Well, when using 60k points per night (in which they bill back Hhonors $$$), one would think an upgrade as a Diamond member would be automatic especially to earn future travel. Think about a Diamond member and how much one must travel and of course all the people a Diamond member must know on all his travels. Would it not occur to a Manager the valuable importance of word of mouth marketing from such a customer. Unfortunatley not at the Rome Cavalieri. Ok so a Rome City view Room is not available, one would be fine if they were to accomodate such a view with Imperial Lounge access to enjoy the view for a couple hours on your stay. Instead you get a Lounge on the ground floor with no view and if you would like the Imperial Lounge it comes at a cost of 120 Euros per day. Amazing how something so simple which costs the hotel $0 is so hard to come by. Something that would easily make their must Loyal customer satisfied as well as most likely earn a greater network of business travelers through word of mouth. My Suggestion, pay for a local hotel as they are all great in Rome. I visited many of my friends/network of business travellers whom were in town and they had great accomodations closer to town. Save your points and money for better quality Hilton such as the MALDIVES (great stay last year). No more bickering, it is just disappointing on how some just dont see the BIGGER PICTURE. Now I will have to stay more nights at Starwood Hotels so that I may enjoy the Rewards at the St Regis Rome next time. Diamond Member Room 514

Reviews.Title: “Hilton should be ashamed to be associated with this property.”
Reviews.Author: EllenLM
Reviews.Content: I used points, so maybe I got what I paid for. The concierge staff are unqualified and indescribably uninformed. My teenage son wanted to visit a music store, and he was told to go to a general intersection on the via del Corsi--a major street. No address, no phone. I thought he hadn't been clear, so I asked and got the same response. I asked for dinner reservations one day--the concierge forgot. The next day I asked for reservations at another restaurant--4 hours later he still hadn't called, saying he would wait until evening. I had to inform him they were open for lunch. Umm, isn't he supposed to know that? Watch out for the staff in the restaurant. If you are in the way, they will push past you with vigor. ALL of them. Seems customers rudely show up and should know better than to try and serve themselves at the breakfast buffet. The bellmen? Watch out for them, too. I really liked asking for a cab and having it arri e, only to have the bellman give it to the leggy blond who came after me and asked for a cab. And watch out for staff on the elevator! I had one mockingly wave at me as the door was closing while I was trying to get on. I can still hear him snickering. But the best of all was reception. My flight was delayed due to weather, so my teenage son arrived 3 hours before I did. They did not offer him a drink of water or a place to sit. He wasn't allowed to check in without me--I am okay with that--but a bit of courtesy or an offer to sit in the Hilton Honors lounge (I am gold level) would have been a small kindness. Did I mention my request for two beds was ignored? Apparently, this kind of treatment is only for regular folk--Hotel staff blocked the way to the elevator so some soccer team could ride without delay. All in all, I would rather have spent money on lodging than to put up with this pathetic excuse of a supposedly luxury hotel. Spare me the status name and give me a modicum of respect as a customer.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I used HHonors Points instead of paying”
Reviews.Author: limeyferg
Reviews.Content: As mentioned the hotel is on a hill above the Vatican. The neighborhood is residential meaning that you either eat at the hotel or take a 8-15 euro taxi cab into town to eat. There is an hourly shuttle that takes you to Central Rome but not to the sites we wanted to visit (Vatican and a restaurant west of the river). Odd numbered rooms have the spectacular view but you can also go up to the top floor and enjoy the view from the bar. The rooms are luxurious and the beds heavenly. Like most Waldorf's and other high-end hotels all the extras are extortionate. The breakfast buffet was 38 euros although the waiter did say that we they had 17 different types of marmalade!! This was our last night in Italy and although we enjoyed the room I wouldn't recommend this hotel to mid-price travellers. Taxi to FCO airport was 50 euros on Sunday morning (no shuttle) and we saved our money and ate breakfast there before we boarded.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views of Rome - the Imperial Club is a must!”
Reviews.Author: doilybug
Reviews.Content: Rome Cavalieri is a wonderful hotel. The staff are courteous and attentive, the rooms have great attention to detail and the food is exquisite. The hotel lobby is large and reminded me somewhat of the London store Harrod's: elegant, elaborate and yet still tasteful. Check-in was a breeze, despite arriving a few hours early. The polite staff really put the guest first, as you would expect at a Waldorf Astoria hotel. I cannot recommend the Imperial Club enough. Should you stay in one of the beautiful suites or Imerial rooms, you will have access to the Imperial Lounge on the 7th floor. The view overlooking Rome was the highlight for me. The most romantic moment of our trip was eating by candlelight out on one of the Imperial Lounge balconies. Breakfast with the same view was a close second! Food and drink are available 7am-11pm, so not only will you not go hungry during your stay, but you will be able to relax in a luxurious setting. It is the perfect place to escape the noise and fumes of Rome's centre. Although staying in the heart of the city is great for exploring, the location of Rome Cavalieri cannot be faulted. There is a shuttle service provided, but a taxi to Termini station only costs about 20 euros (tip included). We walked to the Vatican City from the hotel, but returned by taxi (15 euros after a little negotiation) as walking back up the hill in the heat would not have been a worthwhile experience! My only fault with Rome Cavalieri is the sound-proofing. The window shutter and mirrored pull-out door specifically created to block out sound did help, but we could hear so much from the rooms either side. Of course, it depends on whomever should occupy those rooms, but unfortunately we were adjacent to someone who liked to watch TV very loud in the early hours. I did not sleep much. I am yet to give a 5-star review as I am in search of absolute perfection, but the Rome Cavalieri was so very close. I would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone with the money to spare who doesn't need Rome's attractions on their doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel overlooking Rome”
Reviews.Author: savvytraveller60
Reviews.Content: We over-payed, but it was because of a business performance meeting which took most of the hotel. We were understanding because we were on our way to a performance meeting in Spain after leaving Rome. What a spectacular place on a hilltop oasis above the Vatican. It was nice to be in a beautiful quiet place retreating from the hustle bustle of Rome. The service and staff were terrific. The rooms may need updating soon and the baths were small. We would happily return and recommend this property!

Reviews.Title: “OverPriced Hotel Away from all the Sites”
Reviews.Author: JaniceMT
Reviews.Content: The rooms were not well appointed and there were multiple issues with our room. Food was underwhelming among the small selection offered. Hotel staff was incredibly rude and condescending. Wait times to be assisted were long and seemingly unnecessary. Hotel manager was the worst! Rude, pretentious and unwilling to listen. Finally called Hilton directly from the Hotel for assistance. Hotel is a considerable distance from the main sites. 30 Euros each way made this hotel even more unappealing. We changed hotels- best decision ever!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: cp0006
Reviews.Content: Came to this hotel in april 11 as a complete surprise from my boyfriend! which turned out to be a proposal! The hotel is spotless and a complete pardise. We stayed in the imperial rooms and these were beautiful! and with access to the imperial club made it even better!! Breakfast in bed service was amazing and the turndown bed service everynight made it even more special. the gym and turkish baths were beautiful and well the pool area is something... the consierge service are extremely helpful. Yes the hotel is quite a bit out but taxis are readily available and the hotel shuttle bus is free of charge and great!! this hotel is spectacular and i didnt want to leave! i would love to return tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing hotel away from the hustle and bustle of the city”
Reviews.Author: nkwhitney
Reviews.Content: It's important to fully understand the location of this hotel before you stay here. It is NOT in the city center or in walking distance to anything really....If you are looking for a hotel centrally located to the sights of Rome, don't stay here. We actually enjoyed the hotel location because we wanted to get away from the hectic city after touring around for the day. The Cavalieri is a little slice of heaven with amazing views of the City of Rome, lush grounds, and large comfortable rooms with peaceful balconies. We were quite happy with our standard room because it is very large compared to most European hotels. It has a large beautiful bathroom with towel warmers and Crabtree and Evelyn bath products, a large sleeping area with an amazingly comfy bed, nice sized sitting area and again, the balcony. Make sure to reserve a room with a pool view/city view. If not, you will be disappointed if your room faces the front of the hotel. We enjoyed using the fitness center, spa and spa facilities, and pool several times during our stay. It helped us wind down after a busy day of seeing the sights of Rome. The hotel is quite expensive so be prepared for pricey drinks, food, entrance fee to use the pool, or fitness center or spa facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Rbraheny
Reviews.Content: When I first became a Hilton Honors member, I had my eye on this hotel. After a couple of years, my wife and I finally were able to take a vacation in Italy and the Rome Cavalieri definitely lived up to my expectations. For a frame of reference, I am a 27 year old middle class American who travels enough for business to be a Hilton Diamond Member. I had a couple of free night certificates that I chose to use at the Rome Cavalieri (I probably could not afford this hotel otherwise). Location- The hotel is located in the hills north of the Vatican. The location gives you a great view overlooking the city and Vatican. I was perfectly fine with the location, as long as you have a room that faces the city and not the communications tower. The shuttle to downtown was very convenient and is right next to a Metro station. We went down in the morning and caught the metro and went directly to the Coliseum. Executive Lounge- It is located on the first floor and is open from 11-11. I thought it was great; drinks available all day with different types of snacks. The wine was fantastic. Concierge- Always friendly and helpful Breakfast- Great selection and very good service Overall, I couldn't be happier with my choice to go to Rome and stay at the Rome Cavalieri; I only hope I am able to make it back there. I have no complaints with this hotel and would definitely recommend this hotel as a reward for staying at Hiltons.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price”
Reviews.Author: RalphJacildo
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf never disappoints. This was our first trip to Rome, and the hotel was perfectly situated above the city with perfect views. The room was more expensive than the normal hotel; however, it is worth the price if you want luxury and relaxation. Pros: Hotel grounds and room was immaculate! The state of the art gym was amazing. Cons: Everything was way over priced. 18 euros for mixed drink? All in all, I definitely recommend staying here if cost isn't an issue.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time in this hotel this time in a vista suite with rome view”
Reviews.Author: NJBrit
Reviews.Content: 2nd time for this hotel, the hotel suite was excellent but pricey for what you got, the suite was located on the 4th floor so you didn't get as good a view as we did last time(last time was the imperial suite with Rome view) the suite was very roomy, 1 bottle of complimentary water- for the whole stay! room service was hit and miss. The room location was next to the cleaning room so noisey in the mornings. Access to the imperial lounge which offers breakfast and snacks all day,comes with this room, I felt it was overpriced for what you got.For the 2nd year running tried to make reservations in Le Pergula resturant in the hotel, fully booked again, after making a fuss a table came up the resturant is no big deal it is overpriced with not much choice other that seafood and fish on the menu. After being told it was booked up for 2 month, we had a 730 reservation we were only 1 of the 5 couples in there, go figure? why booked up? The spa was excellent as usual very professional They had wi fi internet in the rooms for a price.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: boohers
Reviews.Content: When we arrived our room was still occupied by the previous guest so they upgraded us to the most beautiful suite. The staff was very helpful and friendly. I enjoyed waking to the sound of birds every morning. The location is like a country oasis in the city of Rome. The views of Rome are unbelievable, we could see the Vatican from our balcony. We would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarilynM
Reviews.Content: This was our fifth time at this hotel. You need to understand the location but once you do and manage travel back and forth to centro storico it's heaven. The rooms are large with a beautiful seating area. Our room did not have a city view, but we were rewarded by the radio tower decorated for the 150th Unification of Italy in the colors of the Italian flag. Housekeeping is meticulous. They change the freshly pressed pillow cases daily. Service was as would be expected at a 5 star hotel. We enjoyed the lounge in the evening, especially entertainment provided by the piano player. Book the Imperial floor if you can. The food, drinks and service were amazing, plus you get limited free internet and fitness center usage. Views from the balconies rival any in Rome. Using the shuttle service to the Piazza Barberini is convenient but cab fares are reasonable from anywhere in the city. One of our best stays in Rome ever.

Reviews.Title: “Beaultiful hotel in an out of way location”
Reviews.Author: Nardiesally
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel with my wife for our annivsary. We got a room for three nights on points. I had read the reviews and hoped to avoid the dreaded "TV Tower" side of the hotel. Unfortunately, I did not. they put us on the 4th floor as far over as possible. We saw the TV tower, but also had a nice view of the hills below the hotel. The other side of the hotel with the view of the Vatican is spectacular, but we didn't have that view. The room was beautiful. Very well appointed. Large bathroom. We had a great balcony. Very quiet each night. The work out facilities were terrific, but surprisingly, a lot of weights than cardio marchines. Spa is beautiful. Nothing was included in our rate. We paid for the breakfast for one morning, just to try it out because of all of the great reviews. It was very expensive USD$55 per person. Everyone else seemed to have it included. It was beautiful, but not work $110 for two people. However, seeing 8 different kinds of milk was cool (soy, almond, goat etc..) The location is the biggest problem. The shuttle is great, but it is tough to be on their schedule. Any cab is at least USD$14-16 to get back to the hotel each night. You are never going to just stop in to the room in the middle of the day to change etc.. You leave in the morning and get back at night. The physical structure of the hotel is beautiful The lobby is spectacular, staff is friendly, but not great. A little snobby. They have one of the most expensive hotels in Europe and know it. I would not stay at the hotel again, solely because of the location. However, if you are a elite level HH Honors (which I am not) and you get the great view, free breakfast and imperial room, I am sure you would gladly recommend the hotel and stay there again. Without those perks, it is just too far away for my tastes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: moonh
Reviews.Content: This was truly nice hotel with great service. This hotel offered nice size rooms, great view of the Rome, very friendly staffs and other many things you would expect from five star hotel. Only small negative, if you want to call this negative, is that the location is not in the heart of the city. You have to take 20-30 min shuttle ride to be in the center of the city. However, because of this setting, I could have relaxed a lot more after being in the chaotic party of the city for a whole day. Oh, Markus from the concierge desk was great helping finding places and setting up day tours. Markus remembered us by names and asked us how our trips were after he helped us set them up.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, awesome view”
Reviews.Author: Roma1_11
Reviews.Content: We were greeted with a warm, friendly welcome and were pleased with the customer service. The room was beautiful and very clean. I loved the free snacks downstairs - how lovely to have a glass of wine in the afternoon. The free shuttle was a huge bonus. A great trip for a great price. Free included breakfast was THE BEST!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: noortje60_11
Reviews.Content: "Coming to the Cavalieri hotel already for over 10 years I must say that I am impressed by the increase in quality since the hotel became part of the Waldorf Astoria Collection. The staff members/employees show a true interest in you, no question is too much; they are very helpful, pro-active and friendly. Everywhere you feel the eye for the detail. Staying at the Waldorf Astoria Cavalieri is a great experience. Wim Dooge Chairman Board of Directors Hotelschool The Hague"

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Noortje60
