Reviews.Content: "Coming to the Cavalieri hotel already for over 10 years I must say that I am impressed by the increase in quality since the hotel became part of the Waldorf Astoria Collection. The staff members/employees show a true interest in you, no question is too much; they are very helpful, pro-active and friendly. Everywhere you feel the eye for the detail. Staying at the Waldorf Astoria Cavalieri is a great experience. Wim Dooge Chairman Board of Directors Hotelschool The Hague"

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Fit For An Emperor”
Reviews.Author: JaseMe516
Reviews.Content: Definitely a great 5 star hotel, but prepare to drop a lot of money. We got a room with an amazing view of Rome and our private balcony allowed for a really romantic dinner. Room service is expensive, but worth having on your private balcony. The entrees for room service are very large (unlike standard restaurants in the city) so do not order too much...two entrees would be more than enough. The room itself was beautiful with a very warm and classic feel. The bathroom was gorgeous and huge. Though, I didn't like how there was no shower door to completely shut. There was just a single glass pane that went halfway across the tub. However, the towel warmer made up for that. The only inconvenience that I see guests running into is the shuttle service, which runs every hour, but sometimes does not have enough space to accomodate all the guests who want to go in to the city or leave the city. My suggestion is to get to the shuttle pickup location at least 15 minutes before it's scheduled to arrive to guarentee a seat. Those who showed up when the shuttle was scheduled to leave did not have a seat (and you are not allowed to stand). Overall, the hotel was great escape from the hustle and bustle of touristy Rome! FYI, a cab from Stazione Termini is about 40 Euro and a cab from the hotel to the airport is a pricey 60-70 Euro (no shuttle service provided to the airport).

Reviews.Title: “It's like a museum”
Reviews.Author: panthe0n12
Reviews.Content: The Roma Cavalieri is a bit far from the centre of town, it's about a 15 minute cab ride away. However, the distance from the centre also awards it space, its a huge property with multiple swimming pools, many restaurants and a nice spa. The rooms are also nice, but you have to be careful while booking...because one side of the hotel affords a magnificent view of the city, whereas the other side looks on to the porch, driveway, parking lot and cellular base tower! The best thing about the hotel is the food at the restaurants. The Italian restaurant on the main pool level (below the lobby) has a lamb pearl lasagna, the likes of which i have yet to taste in Italy. LA Pergola, the resturant on the top floor is a michelin starred restaurant, and although pricey, is a must do if you're staying at the Roma Cavalieri. Remember that bookings at this restaurant are really hard, so it's best to reserve at the time you're booking your room(s). The other great thing about the hotel is the ART. Like a lot of places in Roma, it has the luxury of it's own magnificent art collection and the lobby and other levels are dotted with spectacular works. The worst part of the hotel is the service and the concierge which takes absolutely ages. The staff don't have attitude or anything, but find it difficult to cope during season or when the hotel is fully booked. I guess that could be a problem anywhere during season...

Reviews.Title: “Bellissimo ! stupendo! A centre of excellence for hoteliers”
Reviews.Author: ChrisBD
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed here for 2 nights we had a Rome view room on the club floor. Our room was a good size, very comfortable and nicely decorated with a separate seating area and balcony with a fantastic view of the city. Fantastic staff everyone we met where cheerful welcoming and very helpful. Room service was very prompt and followed up with a call to check everything was to our satisfaction. The club lounge was very peaceful – worth paying the extra for breakfast, drinks and snacks thought the day. The hotel isn’t located in the city centre but this wasn’t a problem, the hotel has courtesy coach making regular trips into the city throughout the day or its just a short walk to the bus stop or Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Impecable and amazing customer service... Simply the best!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: FPTron
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent. The managers on duty are amazing and would do anything to make you feel like a celebrity. Diamond members are treated like royalty. Free breakfast buffet. Room upgrades. Free Internet. I have to say that from all Hilton hotels this is the best service I've ever received.... And I live at the Hilton's during the weekdays. You won't regreat it. Absolutely the very best!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “How Romantic!!”
Reviews.Author: tellyman1978
Reviews.Content: We have spent Valentine's day at Rome Cavalieri and boy did we make the right choice! We have reserved an Imperial room with a view and were assigned a room on the 8th floor with a breathtaking view of St. Peter's and the city centre. This type of room grants you access to the Imperial Club on the 7th floor open from 7 am until 11 pm, where we had breakfast and chilled out having snacks & beverages all complimentary. Access to the Grand Spa was also included and I have to say it was one of the best facilities I have ever been to. The shuttle to the centre was very practical as it only took us 15 minutes to reach Barberini Sq. but make sure to arrive at least 5 minutes ahead of schedule as it fills really quick. Next time in Rome, we would definitely stay there and we will also be recommending the Cavalieri to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, but plan ahead to make the most of your trip”
Reviews.Author: ASWh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cavalieri last weekend and it is a lovely hotel, very luxurious. It is worth checking with their reservations directly when they do a deal as you can get 5* luxury for the same price as something reasonably ordinary in a more central location, particularly if it includes the excellent buffet breakfast. You need to do your homework before going though as it is out of town, but the pay off for that are the fantastic views across the city. We had a deluxe king with city view and it had its own private balcony, the room was very spacious and well fitted. There is a shuttle which goes from the hotel every hour to Palazzo Barbarini which takes about 30 mins (its quite slow), although you can ask the driver to drop you off on route. It was only about €10 back to the hotel from Piazza del Popolo which had taxis available, except on Saturday night when we had to wait a little while. Buying anything in the hotel is very expensive, the wi-fi is about €22 per day and the room service prices are exorbitant but Rome has so many restaurants to choose from that you'd be very unlikely to want to order in when staying there. All in all, a relaxing and enjoyable stay - if you're on a budget, be organised about getting there and back and you'll have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “I'm going back !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sitteetravler
Reviews.Content: I have been reading the latest posts here and was not allowed to submit this one without putting a date so the date it shows is not correct. I actually stayed at the Hotel in 2008 and have just been reviewing the current post I am so tired of hearing people complain about the hotel being so far away from the main city centre. People need to do a little more research before making a reservation. I personally think it is great were it is located as it is in a quite neighborhood away from all the hustle and bustle of the city. also one should remember this is not a 2 or 3 or even 4 star Hotel it is rated as a 5 but I'm calling it a 5 + Most people say the food is too expensive but for the top quality food they serve especially the awesome breakfast buffet I don't think it is over priced. just remember this a Mercedes cost around $ 50,000 a Rolls Royce about $ 200.000 To me this Hotel is a Rolls Royce I can't wait until This July 2011 I will be staying At the hotel with some family members and I can't wait for them to experience this place. Mike D

Reviews.Title: “"Breathtaking View"”
Reviews.Author: trackerLondon
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Rome and the Cavalieri we were not disappointed . everything was excellent service was next to none would not hesitate to recommend

Reviews.Title: “One of these is needed in every city.”
Reviews.Author: Chillinathtown
Reviews.Content: The place is among the most luxurious I have been to (only one other is in that category). I think I probably got a regular room, but by any standard it was bigger than what you see as a king room. Being in Rome it was no surprise to see the entire bathroom was marble. Some busy walking was done during the days and thankfully I was always able to get a restful sleep. I only ate breakfast once but it was good!! However, ask if it is included as I would think the price would be a bit high. I did not make use of the concierge much, but the few times I did it felt like they could get you what you need (reservations, etc.) Maybe the one drawback, depending on how much time you have, is the location. It is on a hill which is about 10 minutes from any public transportation. Alternatively, there is a shuttle periodically during the day to one of the piazzas. Can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “So luxurious, you can't believe it!!”
Reviews.Author: TwilightZone55
Reviews.Content: The room we had was the best hotel room ever!! Huge bathroom, large bedroom, a sitting room, and a balcony. Beautifully appointed and very, very comfortable. The restaurant served a sumptuous Sunday brunch, and the dinners were fantastic. The exclusive restaurant on the top floor was a very enjoyable experience. The staff, especially at the concierge desk, were helpful in every way. We also made good use of the shuttle service to and from a central point in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Awesome”
Reviews.Author: sinpc
Reviews.Content: The service here at this hotel is #1 as expected. Everyone is very friendly, attentive and more importantly very pro active in anticipating our needs. Although we were out all day sightseeing, we looked forward to catching the complementary shuttle back from Bernini to a relaxing experience at the heated indoor pool with cascading waterfall, Turkish bath and heated hydro massage pool in the spa. City view from the room was romantic and enjoying a pizza margarita from room service late night made a perfect day. Kids love it and we had a great time. Simply Awesome

Reviews.Title: “NIce Hotel but very expensive”
Reviews.Author: zr_travel_Opinians
Reviews.Content: If money is no object, this hotel is amazing. from the art, to the rooms, to the spa. It is all super high class, and really beautiful. But if you do value your money, i would stay away. every thing is super expensive. The staff though was mostly nice, and professorial. One other issue, the hotel is not central located. It is impossible to walk from the hotel to the attraction. you must take a vehicle.

Reviews.Title: “The best yet--personnel, location, and attention to guests.”
Reviews.Author: tex12345
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the Cavalieri Hotel with two rooms that overlooked the city. Even though we were in Rome to sight see, the hotel was so inviting, it was difficult to get out to visit the beautiful city. We are Hilton Honors' members and were staying at the hotel on HH points. We were given every courtesy as full payiing guests. The Imperial Lounge is so welcoming, and the breakfast in the downstairs restaurant can't be equaled anywhere. We are still salivating over the accommodations of this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Darsono
Reviews.Content: Rome Cavalieri is indeed a plush hotel with great service. The view is magnificent, the room is classically designed and the stay is just wonderful. The all you can eat breakfast buffet has a vast array of choices, is elegantly prepared and is very tasteful.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: ottleydesign
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rome Cavalieri for our Honeymoon before departing for our Seaboun cruise. Our flight arrived to Rome and we took a cab to the hotel. We were so exhausted from the plane ride from Miami - that all we desired to do upon arrival was to sleep. There wasn't any rooms available so they put us in a room with 2 twin beds... yes for our honeymoon! My wife was real upset and no one at the hotel really seemed to care. We were grateful to check in early and sleep but the Hotel never moved us to a room with a bigger bed. My wife is a diamond member too! Also the room had issues with the alarm system, so every 20 minutes someone from hotel security would knock on the door and wake us up. We were both trying to sleep and they thought we were pulling the emergency cord in the bath tub. The breaker box was open and kept tripping or something because we weren't doing anything but trying to rest. Good grief... The Hotel shuttle goes to the city which is 25 minutes away... but it ends early at 8PM so you must take a cab back which can be costly, you have to pay to use the pool and service was just OK - expected much more. The food was decent but very expensive. I would probably stay there again but it wouldn't be my top or preferred choice. I would stay closer to the city for the same $. Wish someone from the Hotel would have made it right... it was our Honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, the staff couldn't have been more accomodating”
Reviews.Author: Watson67
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and the service was great. It was a special occasion and as a consequence we were given a room on the 6th floor with magnificent views of Rome and a complimentary bottle of fizz on arrival. This was a complete suprise especially as we had booked the room using the weekend offer price paying almost half of the standard rate. The hotel is outside of Rome's center (20 mins with the free courtesy coach). I actually liked the fact we could leave the bustle of the city in the evening but I imagine if you wanted to experience Romes nightlife perhaps a hotel in the center would be preferable. I imagine this hotel must be great if you're in Rome in the summer, the pool area and gardens were really fantastic. The building exterior isn't the most beautiful but this shouldn't be a problem as most people are looking out admiring the view. My only negative point really would be the mini bar prices.........9 euros for a mini box of Pringles seems a bit steep but then I guess you're in a 5 star so it's to be expected. To sum up it was a great weekend, really friendly and helpful staff...I will definatley come back.

Reviews.Title: “No surprises here!”
Reviews.Author: mchud
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three nights at the Cavalieri to kick off our Italian holiday. We read all the reviews previous to coming and reserving our rooms - and most are spot on. The hotel is not at the "center of the universe" - it is a 20 - 25 minute shuttle ride to the center of Rome and a 10 minute cab ride to the Vatican museums. We took a taxi directly from the airport vs. the fast train into Rome Termini, then taking a cab or dragging suitcases to meet the shuttle to the hotel. Cost is about 50 Euro and was much quicker and not much pricier than the train/cab/ shuttle option. Take the cabs vs, the airport shuttle services which were about 20 Euro more. The rooms as stated by most reviews are very nice - very large by Euro standards. Half the rooms will face the city - the other half the apartment and the infamous "tower". As a Hilton Gold member, we were upgraded to a City View on a lower floor. As Gold we were also given vouchers for internet (you can use the wi-fi function on your "smart phones" if you don't have a pc or even a phone that works in Europe - worked great for us) as well as access to the lounge on the top floor. The lounge is a lovely place to unwind in the evening with a glass of winer, sparkling, beer or something stronger. Different times of the day/night different snack type items were put out -but don't count on it for your dinner! Yes, membership has it's priveleges - as a Gold you may eat breakfast in the lounge, or enjoy the superb breakfast spread at L'olivetto downstairs. Eating the breakfast there carried us for the rest of the day. The staff across the board was terrific. I strongly suggest going to the Hilton website and looking for "specials". I saw a couple on-line that were really excellent deals that included the above mentioned excellent breakfast buffet. At that point it becomes an a real all around deal compared to alot of hotels in the area. While in Rome we booked several tours through Viatour - a large tour consolidator. We used them for several tours throughout our trip. Viaotur was very easy to use, both by phone and the internet. Two of our tours were over the top and I would very strongly recommend them. The half day Vatican tour and half day Coliseum tours presented by "Dark Rome" were phenomenal (prices direct with Dark Rome or Viatour were about the same). The knowledge of our tour guides totally made the experience. The groups are kept small - 20 for the Vatican and 25 for the Coliseum - made for a more personalized experience. The guides had wireless microphones while we carried receivers with an ear plug. This allowed us to wander a bit while the guide was talking without always being bunched up together. Be prepared to walk! Our evening bus ride to the monuments was a mediocre selection at best and we wouldn;t recommend. Last bit of advice. We took trains between Rome and our other destinations. I strongly recommend going directly to the "Trenitalia" web site vs. going to Eurail. Hit the British flag on top of the site and it will be in English. This allowed us to find the very best fares and was a real bargain compared to Eurail. As an example - we used a "Mini" fare between Venice and Milan and it was 18 Euro for the both of us - I saw someone who purchased a ticket same day - 62 Euro. Personally, you do not need to upgrade to 1st Class - 2nd Class was more comfortable than your average airline coach seat. Italy and Europe in general are very expensive by American standards - don't come and carp that everything is soooo expensive - it just is! You order from room service - it will become your conversation starter with your friends when you tell them how you spent $55 for a turkey sandwich and a piece of cake. Don't ruin your holiday by fretting about the cost of everything - you have been forwarned! Bottom line, we would strongly recommend using this hotel as your Roman base!

Reviews.Title: “Oh, the view!”
Reviews.Author: flyntasticmom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to the Cavalieri for our anniversary with our dear friends who were celebrating the end of a difficult year as they had battled Leukemia . Since my husband is a Diamond member with Hilton we were upgraded to the Imperial Club floor. I was slightly disappointed that our room didn't overlook the city, we had a beautiful room that overlooked a modest apartment building. But we were blessed with access to the Imperial Club and our view didn't matter. We were able to give one of our keys to our friends who were on a lower floor so they could join us and enjoy the Imperial Club. We never got charged for them (as they mention in there materials) for their visits. We would meet in the "Club" and have breakfast, before sightseeing during the day. Then meet again for a drink before dinner or a night cap before bed. The club has beautiful yet intimate balcony's that over look all of Rome. Oh, the view! We also used the spa for the Turkish baths, and the exercise room was top notch. Breakfast was included in our room and the restaurant was fantastic with amazing choices of everything....I never knew there were so may types of milk! One of our best meals in Rome was at a restaurant down the street from the hotel called Luciano's. It was a local gem, family owned and operated. If you ask the door man, he knows the place and can give you directions, it is a leisurely walk into town. The entire hotel is beautiful, the grounds are lovely and the staff is nice and respectful. Overall if you can get access to the Imperial Club you will love this place and save a bunch of money!

Reviews.Title: “exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: jmurray602
Reviews.Content: I am a hilton honors member and this hotel treated you like a loyal customer! all the service levels where excellent from all staff from top to bottom where fantastic polite and helpful. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for the best hotel with fantastic views the quality you are looking for and the respect for their customers you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect ending to own honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: TanyaMaia
Reviews.Content: Customer Service goes a LONG way in my book and Rome Cavalieri deserves a gold star in customer service! My Husband and I took a two week trip to Italy for our honeymoon. We started off in Milan and ended in Rome. Naturally, we wanted to end our trip with a bang. We had points to use, but via the Hilton website, the dates we wanted to stay there were no longer available. My Husband emailed the hotel to ask permission to use our points, he explained that it was our Honeymoon and we wanted to make it the best trip possible. Not only did they let us use our points, they gave us the REAL 5 star treatment! We had an amazing corner suite with a spectacular city view of Rome. When we arrived they had candy, a bottle of champagne, and a beautiful hand-written note waiting for us. They even gave us complimentary entry to Cavalieri Grand Spa Club. The turkish bath was AH-MAZING! Our room was spotless and the sheets smelled fresh! The staff was polite, the concierge was knowledgeable, and the grounds were BEAUTIFUL. We had our breakfast on the patio and simply fell in love with that place. We even bought gifts for the staff members that helped us. They were amazing and truly gave us the experience we wanted. The grounds are a little far from the City center, but during the day the shuttle was very convenient and taking a taxi didn't break the bank. We love you Rome Cavaleri!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel as long as you get the rooms with a view..”
Reviews.Author: Mrsdp123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on Hilton points as my husband is a Diamond member. We were upgraded to a room with a view of Rome (561) but not an Imperial Room, although we did have access to the Imperial Club (the Colosseo lounge was closed, perhaps they have read the bad reports on it)! If we had not have had the view of Rome or had the view from the Imperial Club I would not have been impressed with this hotel as the back view is of a phone mast and apartment block! The hotel was not at all busy so normally you would expect an upgrade which luckily we go (though to only 5th floor) and also our request for a late check out was denied which although not too much of a problem was a bit odd seeing as they were not busy. We at breakfast at L'Uliveto restaurant rather than in the Imperial as the spread was better. In fact breakfast choice was excellent, room not busy and food was lovely. The food in the Imperial was also good (not as good as the Hilton Arc de Triomphe, Hilton Waldorf London or Park Lane Hilton though) but they serve sandwiches and cakes throughout the day and also they serve alcohol until 10.30pm at night which is a bonus as you are not near any restaurants. After this, we went down to the lobby to listen to the pianist. Friday night's pianist was excellent but such a shame that the bar area was not busier. We walked into Rome on our first day to the Vatican (Around 30 minutes downhill) - turn left out of the hotel, right at the mini roundabout, left at the traffic lights (or down the stairs on the left) and head towards the dome and keep straight, you come to some steps which take you up to the Vatican Museum and a v lovely walk. The other days we got the free shuttle which was excellent. A cab from the Vatican cost 10 Euros. We did the usual tourist sites and didn't find any of them that busy, we also did an open top bus tour which was OK (We did 110 Route think other buses looked better). We did get ripped off eating out, which I rectified by not leaving a tip and I had my hair mousse taken off me on the return flight just before boarding as it was flammable - she let me keep my lighter though).... Overall hotel location lovely for amazing views of Rome but ONLY if you get a front facing room. Our room was definitely tired looking, bath was old, carpet was ripped by the patio doors and paint all scuffed. But it was very clean (balcony a bit shabby), bed very comfy, large room, great view. Not sure I would have been that impressed had we paid full whack but to use points it was lovely. We used the spa on the final day and the weather was pleasant enough to lounge around outside in dressing gowns around the open air pool.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutes Luxushotel mit Aussicht auf Rom”
Reviews.Author: SWH2010
Reviews.Content: This Waldorf Astoria Collection hotel is located on a hill about 1 mile from the city center. The view of Rome, including St Peter's dome, is magnificent. Everything oozes the atmosphere of luxury. Rooms are very spacious and bathrooms are amazing. Each rooms offers a separate soundproof door which closes off the door to the hallway. Rooms with Rome view have great terraces facing the east. The central bar is open till after midnight and service, including cocktails is superb. The outdoor pool is a lovely place to mingle and views Rome. The hotel offers complimentary shuttle services at stated times.

Reviews.Title: “Wondrous Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Sunny32332
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at the Cavalieri Hotel, at the end of our cruise, it was the perfect place to relax and enjoy a few more days of rest and recreation. Our room was very comfortable, with a very nice location. We enjoyed the view from our balcony, as the sun set over the city. The shuttle into the city was so convenient, it was nice not to worry about finding a cab back to the hotel. The staff was very helpful in anticipating our needs. Our stay at this hotel was very nice, and would highly recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter_Miami31
Reviews.Content: Stayed with wife at the end of our two weeks trip to Italy, got a nice room with good view, no qualms with the service and staff very professional and attentive, but definetly too expensive room rate, seen it was low season expected an upgrade. Too bad, would go back but maybe better value in good 4 stars hotels in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Pure luxury”
Reviews.Author: GlobalHolidayer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I returned to this hotel for our wedding anniversary and were again impressed with the very high standards. The rooms are pure luxury, the staff very welcoming and helpful and the attention to detail is excellent, making our stay truly relaxing and enjoyable. The one disappointment was the Michelin star restaurant which we dined at on the Saturday night. In our experience, restaurants of this standard should have the “wow” factor for food but on this occasion we were very disappointed. The quality and attention to detail was very good but the flavor and pure “foody experience” just wasn’t there.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: TatiRiodeJaneiro
Reviews.Content: Check in and check out fast and efficient ,gentle receptionists ,great room's size ,excellent cleaning service, very convenient shuttle to the city center as the hotel is a bit far away and has no metro nearby . Thanks Rome Cavalieri for the wonderful time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “11/10”
Reviews.Author: Gurnip
Reviews.Content: A belated contribution - travelled to watch the rugby & booked 4 months in advance - unfortunately for TV coverage the game we travelled for was switched to the Sunday and we missed it - but I digress - we've often stayed in Hiltons, but I have to say this one belongs with the very best of the chain - this view might be tainted by the fact that they upgraded me to the Penthouse Suite - with the possible exception of the Presidential Suite in Malta it's probably the best Hilton room we've stayed in, bolt on the Imperial Club, (possibly the best exec lounge I've enjoyed globally), the fact that we missed the match we'd travelled for seemed less of an issue - oh and the England team were staying in the hotel but weren't 'important' enough to get access to our floor... Great hotel, great facilities, great staff - highly recommended - PS did I mention the 3* Michelin Restaurant - it was good to meet Hans Beck!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: AmsterDD
Reviews.Content: Rome hotel is Cavalieri one of Europe’s nicest hotels. Located a bit outside the centre of Rome but worth the time with the shuttle. Rooms are wide and contain a seating corner and a desk. The whole design is elegant and impressive. Breakfast is great and rich and the Spa is simply amazing. Roma design. But the greatest treat is the art collection scattered around the hotel. Painting and sculptures, an amazing collection. The hotel attitude towards pets is simply impressive and unique. Not only you can bring them along, they are actually welcomed there. They can have room service menu, pets care and more. The executive lounge though is somewhat disappointing if compared to other Hiltons in Europe, but the hotel is worth a visit. Prices are starting at Euro 300 a night.

Reviews.Title: “The Pros and Cons of luxury 5 star hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: GlobalPolyglot
Reviews.Content: Pro: - great beds, duvet covers, pillows - rooms are nicely appointed with nice balcony views - very quiet area in and around hotel - very clean hotel - free shuttle to downtown - there are menu items available via room service you would never get anywhere else, like English Teas with crumpets, petit fours, tiny sandwiches and several types of marmalade... Con: - breakfast and breakfast service are a mess, the 3 days we staid we always had to wait about 15 minutes to get a table, the staff was disorganized, the food bland and cold and we also had to wait for coffee and tea - not all staff speak English and the hotel seems understaffed in general and the staff stressed out - lines to get taxis - extra fees for Health area and Internet - hotel is not for everyone, seems outdated and atmosphere is "thick", probably a good experience for older couples, no kids and if on an expense budget Con:

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: acdhuber
Reviews.Content: The Cavalieri is quite possibly one of the finest hotel experiences in the world. The rooms and the service are nothing short of exquisite, not to mention the amazing cuisine at the hotel restaurants, including the famous La Pergola. We stayed at the Cavalieri during the Thanksgiving holiday, preferring Italy to turkey back home. However, the hotel offered a fabulous holiday buffet, had we been interested. We actually preferred the hotel's hillside location; it was a slice of heaven to return to the hotel following a day of sightseeing on the bustling streets of Rome. The Turkish baths certainly hit the spot after a long day of walking. The shuttle bus to and from the Via Veneto could not have been easier or more convenient, dropping us in a very central location from which to start each day. Go for it. Splurge on this slice of luxury. It's worth every single penny.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite service & views”
Reviews.Author: hnandms
Reviews.Content: Nothing was overlooked! Our room had an amazing view of the pools, property and Rome itself. Room was very well appointed with marble everywhere. Extremely comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “As Good As It Gets”
Reviews.Author: sscheck
Reviews.Content: The hotel was phenomenal. No complaints at all. Great service. There is a lot of talk here about the location. The shuttle drops you in less than 30 minutes at Piazza Barberini, probably the best spot in Rome to explore the city from. If you miss the shuttle its a 15 Euro cab ride to the same spot. We explored the whole city from there on foot without difficulty. The "out of the way" location (not very far) is actually an asset, since you get away from the noise of the city and get a good rest after a long day. The complimentary "continental" breakfast is fabulous. Don't miss the free i-pod tour of the hotel['s famazing art collection as well. Definietely will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but a bit expensive”
Reviews.Author: Vaughn1942
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel this is although a bit expensive and not anywhere near the sights and sounds of the city itself. It is off the beaten path but a most wonderful stay. The rooms are beautiful and they even give you the use of a terry cloth bathrobe and slippers. You can buy the robe but the slippers are yours to take home. They have a free cocktail hour so enjoy it while you are there. We used Hilton Honor points to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best hotels in the world”
Reviews.Author: MurrayH3
Reviews.Content: cannot say enough good things about this hotel...... and I stay at alot of them....

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sheilamarie
Reviews.Content: First of all, hotel is amazing-best hotel I've ever visited! That being said, the location was pretty bad, you're far from everything. I'm a frequent Hilton guest and used my points for a free room (4 nights VIP rewards), which made it even more of a bargain option for me. We had a room on the 4th floor with a balcony and beautiful view of St Petere's basilica-Vatican City. The amenities in this hotel are incredible-plush beds, huge bathroom, 2 closets, bathrobes and slippers, even a little area that you close off near the door to help sound proof your room. I also had free access to the Imperial room and spa, which the room is on the 1st floor and you have to consume everything "In" the room. Snacks are very light, nuts, chips, and finger sandwhiches. Free wine, sodas, and water and the room is open 11-11. The hotel breakfast is phenominal-traditional breakfast of eggs, meats, etc or a Japanese breakfast, gluten free options and even a fruit smoothie bar w/blender! My daughter and I tried to outsmart the taxis because they charged more on Sundays and take the metro/bus to the hotel. We managed but it wasn't easy w/luggage so don't bother. Get a cab. It bothers me that the hotel shuttle can't go to the termini metro stop, would make it so much more convenient for their guests. The shuttle runs hourly and we took it the whole time except for 1 morning we took a cab to the vatican and it was (I think) about 15 euros which we included a tip. Swimming pool was so nice and warm (indoor) and the gym is huge! You miss out on the sounds of Rome-church bells, convenience of evening gellato runs, etc, but you do get big hotel amenities. Not sure if I'd stay here again for that reason (but given the room was free for me, this would be a hard call)-would rather soak in all of Rome-but make no mistake, the hotel is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “luxurious interior”
Reviews.Author: kwc196
Reviews.Content: The Cavalieri is an unusual deluxe hotel, as it is located atop a hill overlooking Vatican city and Rome, which both makes it much quieter and more remote than its competition. The hotel is home to one of Rome's top restaurants, an art museum of sorts, and has beautifully appointed, posh, rooms with a separate seating area and private balcony. Going to and from the city will require using either the hotel's free shuttle or a taxi, which in Rome can be of dubious integrity. As such, this hotel is perfect for those who will spend more time in their room, or enjoy retreating from the city's bustle at night.

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed our expections as Hilton Diamond members”
Reviews.Author: TampaJack
Reviews.Content: Two weeks ago I stayed at the Cavalieri for two nights with my wife as part of a long-planned 30th anniversary trip. It was the best hotel experience we've ever had. Here is what I encountered firsthand. The exterior of the hotel is actually quite nice, but the interior is incredible. The works of art surpass many museums. We were amazed. The Colosseo executive lounge was large and airy... I honestly have no idea why it has gotten such criticism from a few folks. It is modern and well lit. I loved the design and decor. Two walls are glass -- one glass wall looks into the hallway (with some great paintings by the way) and the opposite glass wall looks out on a private patio. There are ten tables that sit four people each, so there's seating room for 40. There is a large glass refrigerator that holds juice, soda and several quality beer selections. There is also coffee, tea, red wine, white wine and champagne. Food is "snacky" such as nuts, finger sandwiches, etc. Our room was gorgeous. The rooms are designed to feel like a mini-suite, and the woodwork is beautiful. The marble bathroom is quite large. The balcony is also large and has complete privacy from neighboring balconies. The side walls of the balcony have mirrors, which is a novel way to make the view even more striking. We were fortunate to be upgraded to a Rome-view room, which overlooked the City and also the Vatican, not to mention the beautiful grounds. We will never forget sitting on the balcony drinking champagne. It was among the most romantic settings we've ever experienced. The location of the hotel is, as everyone knows, on a hill on the outskirts of the city. To us that was a huge advantage. The city itself tends to be dirty, noisy and crowded, and the Cavalieri served as our "retreat". True, it wasn't convenient to all the historic sites, but the shuttle ran like clockwork and we had no problems getting around. Restaurants are in walking distance (20 minutes). The breakfast buffet was without question the most varied, luxurious and decadent spread we've ever seen. It had everything. For example, there were fifteen different types of jams! If I were to rate all of the breakfast buffets in my life from 1 to 10, this would be a 12. The spa was also incredible. I loved the Turkish bath (a huge steam room), which had a cold plunge pool inside of it and a large jacuzzi nearby. I'm shocked and a more than a bit embarrassed by Hilton members who complain about the Diamond perks. Wow, what can I say. Upgraded room; unlimited wine, beer and champagne; free use of the spa; free Internet; and the most amazing breakfast buffet ever. The service was also exceptional. As a Diamond member, I was greeted in a special check-in area. We were treated almost like royalty. Our luggage beat us to our room. We were personally escorted to our room by Mr. Khaled, the manager on duty. He couldn't have been nicer. I also had the opportunity to meet the General Manager, who is a truly great guy. He obviously lives and breathes the Cavalieri and takes great pride in it (to say the least). We discussed briefly why the Cavalieri has taken a beating from a few posters, and he was sincerely perplexed because he feels that they work hard to make every stay a memorable one. They certainly did that for us. I guess it's obvious by now that I love the Cavalieri and can't recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel but a disappointed HH Diamond member!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ragu_ON
Reviews.Content: We were so captivated with this hotel 2 years ago ( Sept/2008) that we had to come back to enjoy the splendor of this fine hotel. We were given a fantastic room facing the city and pool area. The staff was excellent and aslo paid for taxis when the shuttle bus was full. But as a HH Diamond member, my wife and I were deeply disappointed. The executive lounge for HH members now resides on the main level and now the old executive lounge on the 7th floor is for WA members only. But you can also pay an additional 80 euros per night to have this privilege. On our last stay we stayed on the 7th floor and had the use of this lounge which was astounding!!! The food was awful, the atmosphere was plastic and the service was terrible. The executive floor at the airport Hilton was far superior!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just another great experience on our vacation”
Reviews.Author: IndianapolisRonnieB
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spend 6 night at the Rome Cavalieri. I was a bit concerned considering some of the reviews that I had read; however, the experience that we had at the hotel erased all of the negative reviews that I had read. Below is a highlight of our experience: Limo service - We arranged to be picked up at the airport to avoid and hassles of trying to explain where we were staying. We were prompted met at "the meeting point" at the airport and quickly brought to the hotel. We felt that this was money well spent. Originally, we had only arranged the service to the hotel, but was so satisfied that we arranged for the service for our return. Just a note about driving in Rome - Rome drivers are probably some of the most aggressive drivers that I had ever seen in all of my travelers so I would never suggest driving here. There were a couple of times that I just had to close my eyes and stop looking at the speedometer. Hotel - From the moment you stepped foot on property, you knew that you were at a 1st class resort. Upon check-in, Julia brought us to a private area for VIP check-in (Diamond HH member). She was wonderful in explaining all of the amenties and advise us that we were upgraded to a room with a view of the city. The room was absolutely great. It was a huge room by Europe standards with a balcony (all rooms here have a balcony). Executive lounge - This is the only area that I would be a little critical of. In most Hilton properties, the executive lounge has a private access. At the Cavalieri, it is down the hall on the first floor. It just seems that anyone could walk in (although they asked for your room number). In my opinion, the Imperial level should be your executive level and it was give your distinguish guests a better overall experience. Room service - Although I read bad reviews about the price of room service, I would tell everyone that it is worth the price. One of the night, we did not feel like going out and finally gave in to the "expensive" price of room service. When they delivered our food to our room, we got over the sticker shock. The presentation was gorgeous and we felt like we had our own private dining room in our room. Shuttle service - This is a wonderful service offered by the hotel.. The shuttle was prompt and was a great money saver. We took at taxi to the Vatican on one of the days of our vacation and it was 15 Euro. Trust me this service is a true benefit and worth tipping the driver considering the cost savings. The drop off/pick up location is easy to find. Gym and spa - This property has a full gym with state of the art equipment. With the exception of the Hilton - New Orleans, I have never seen a better gym in all of our travels. Nearby restaurants - Believe it or not, there are restaurants near the hotel if you don't mind a little walking time. We ate at 2 wonderful neighborhood restaurants and got the chance to witness a true Italian eathing experience. Finally, I know that individuals complain about the huge tower in front of the hotel, but here is a good thing about it - it can help you find the hotel when you are walking. One day, we decided to be adventureous and walk from the Vatican back to the hotel. We did use the tower as our guide. Although it was quite a long walk, we felt like we had won "the Amazing Race" when we got back to the hotel. Thanks to the tower we were able to find the hotel. Without it, we would probably still be looking for our way back. Overall - I would highly recommend the Rome Cavalieri for its outstanding service. The hotel website is on target - you know exactly what your experience will be. So if you want a relaxing vacation up on a hill top in the lap of luxury, you definitely want to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: Babatoos
Reviews.Content: Staying at Cavalieri was one of the highlight of my trip to Italy. I was well aware that hotel is not close to Rome center but there were too many things to compensate for that distance (cab was 15 Euro from hotel to city center). Free shuttle helped as well but I wish it had more extended hours. I was pleasantly impressed with a lot of things . I have stayed in many luxury hotel collection over the years. Cavalieri definitely stands high in the list. First impression from outside of building maybe not exciting. Walking into the hotel changed whole my perception. The gym was definitely the best I have ever seen in any hotel I have ever stayed, easily competitive with any fancy chain fitness center. ( I admit that gym was compliementary). Breakfast Buffet was very good. Though, It shouldnot be compared to Las Vegas Buffet which basically serve brunch rather than breakfast. Lobby Ambience was warm and alive. I admit the night I arrived, I was so pleasantly impressed by the hotel, I stayed at the hotel instead of going out whole evening. Certainly all these great amenities come with big price tag, but it was not something unusual if you know you are in a World class Luxuary Hotel. Thankful to Cavalieri for making a wonderful trip , even more amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HotellerieGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights and it was great, the hotel is more than luxury. The breakfast buffet is delicious and huge, really nice. The view of the roof terrace over the city is amazing. The staff really friendly and helpful, and the guest rooms are big and well equiped with all standards and have a nice view if you get a room with city view otherwise you look at the entrance area which is a bit dissapointing. The only thing is the location as you need a taxi if you stay in the city in the evening to come back, not within walking distance. But during the day a shuttle bus is offered by the hotel free of charge so thats great too. I would again book this hotel for my next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “INCREDIBLY ELEGANT ROOMS TIPS”
Reviews.Author: Tadtv
Reviews.Content: Wow. What a lovely hotel room. In fact I would have to say the room is probably the most elegant I have ever scene. And this includes Many Ritz Carltons and Four Seasons. What makes the rooms so nice is the colored Venetian Plaster finish on the walls and ceilings- no paint, smooth as a bowling ball. Also the book matched wood grain panels and room divider. And marble inlay on bathroom floor. And smaller recessed ceiling accent lighting using halogen bulbs not those ugly CFL bulbs. These features make the room a step above most high-end rooms. The room looked just like the website photos. We chose a non-city view since there were many trees that have grown up to block the view. Excellent value since we booked the advanced non refundable rate. The buffet breakfast had the largest selection of jams I have ever scene- 21 and 11 types of milk. Only downsides were location- must use their free hotel shuttle or taxi to get into city since location is on top of a hill- no sidewalks along busy steep road. Also, they charge for the outside pools but there is no sign as you walk into outside pool area stating so and it's a whooping 16 Euros per person per day. Never heard of a hotel charging for a pool. This is a horrible trend. There is a free indoor pool. Very nice. TIP: Hotel shuttle runs hourly on the half hour into the city and drops you off at Piazza Barbarini Square. (close to most things) Return is on the hour and stops at 8pm (20:00) TIP: GET ROMA PASS 25 Euros at most tobacco stands- gets you onto subways for free and by pass Colosseum lines. Free entrance to first three sites. TIP: Go to Sistine Chapel first Outside of Vatican Square and then it dumps you right into St. Peter's Basilica without the long line or clothing police.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, cant wait to return”
Reviews.Author: Kiwiinoc
Reviews.Content: When reading reviews of this hotel prior to travelling, I was a littleconcerned but soon found out that should not have worried My wife and I travelled to the Cavalieri for our anniversary. I used points and being a HHonors Gold received a complementary upgrade to a Rome View room I had thought about spending the extra to upgrade to the Imperial Floors, I am pleased I did not as everything from breakfast at L'Uliveto Restaurant to the complementary Colosseo Lounge for Gold and Diamond members exceeded my expectations. A lot of people have commented on the location, I have to say I loved the location and never once had an issue taking the shuttle, Any time the shuttle was overloaded the Hotel arranged for complementary taxis for the guests that did not fit on the bus. The shuttle trip is a 15-30 min trip depending on traffic and time flies as you take in the sites as you travel to Piazza Barberini, The shuttle stop is also a stop for the Hop on hop Off bus and within easy walk of Spanish Steps, Fountain of Trevi and Pantheon. After a day of walking the Rome streets it is great to be able to get away from the hustle and bustle of the City and relax back at the hotel. If you do want to spend extra time in the City it’s only a 10 – 15 euro taxi fare back to the hotel . I highly recommend having a meal at La Pergola but book in advance, The food was amazing and my wife and I could not have asked for a more perfect setting for our anniversary dinner. Food wise this was the highlight of our trip I cannot say enough about this hotel, I have stayed in many Waldorf Astoria properties and the Rome Cavalieri stood out from the others. On a sightseeing note, If you get the chance try the Vatican Necropolis tour, You have to book well in advance 4 months but you can email scavi@fsp.va, but go to http://saintpetersbasilica.org/Necropolis/Scavi.htm and get all the info you need to send to get approved, we visited on the 28th Oct and they are book till January, They are also looking at reducing the number of people a day down from the current 200

Reviews.Title: “Strip the Waldorf Brand from this One”
Reviews.Author: WonderousTraveler
Reviews.Content: What a disappoinment! This hotel looks like a 70s building all around and the ornate, antiquated decor leaves a lot to be desired. The staff could use a refresher course in luxury service - or transfer to a Holiday Inn or Best Western. Though our room had a gorgeous view - the Vatican and the city of Rome with the Roman Forum and key structures in view - the room itself was so outdated its last renovation may have been in the mid-80s (thank goodness for a new bed). We did not want to even tough the furniture. So unless we slept on the balcony -- we did not want to spend ANY time in that room. The bathroom fixtures were not working properly and we had to repeatedly call for service. The hotel itself is perched on a hill overlooking Rome (which could be a plus) but you then need to taxi it over to the city every single time so it does not allow for a leisurely walk since you are so far away. The staff kept selling their Spa - which is beautiful - but really - a spa is not the main selling point here. How about you take care of your service delivery, rooms and get up to standard with the Waldorf brand. We spoke with other guests feeling the same disappointment. This hotel leaves a LOT to be desired and is not worth the money. Be careful which view you get when staying there because you can either get a nice Rome view or a building and large antennas on the other side. Skip this one and stay in Rome itself. This one had its day already and needs to get up to the times.

Reviews.Title: “Very Elegant and Classy Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: siberia129
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Rome Cavalieri hotel. My husband was a Hilton Diamnd member, so we were using points for the stay. The hotel was very beautiful, elegant and classy from the minute we entered the compound of the hotel. The staff was courteous and we enjoyed our stay. Room: We had the room with the Rome View. It was so beautiful. For 2 consecutive mornings, we saw perfect sunrise. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was nice. Restaurant: We had free buffet breakfast and it was the best meal for us everyday. The breakfast buffet consisted of a huge selection of food; it even had a small corner of Japanese breakfast. The different type of juces were great as well, and there's even champagne available. We did not take any other meals at the hotel. The room service prices were quite expensive. (For example, a cheeseburger was 22 Euro). Location: This hotel was not located at the city center. From the airport, after we got off the highway, it took a while driving through some neighborhoods to get to the hotel. I was a little worried at first since we arrived at night and we seemed to be passing through some pretty quiet neighborhoods. Because of the location, we do need to follow the hotel's free shuttle schedule or take taxi when needed. The taxi to Termini cost around 20 Euro. Overall, I think this is a very nice hotel, and enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing,staff not helpful and quite rude,not worth the price at all!”
Reviews.Author: becca61
Reviews.Content: First i must say I am from California and as a family we have traveled alot around Europe, my disappiontment level at the Hotel Cavalieri is incredibly high. Lets start with the hotel staff as you know is the first impression, we found them to be rude for the most part and very unhelpful, we stayed in a suite with an connected room which looked very different from the photos on the internet, the room were standard more like a holiday inn, most definately not worth the 1200 a night I paid! Plus there was a seperate charge for everthing at this hotel, you had to pay an extra fee to use the pools! The hotel is not walking distance from the sights you need to take a bus or a cab which was very expensive daily or you can wait for the hotel shuttle but be prepared to sit and wait for awhile! We went to the Nice directley after our stay in Rome and had such a wonderful time we opted to stay there another day instead of heading back to the Hotel Cavalieri, I can honestly say I would never stay at this overpriced hotel again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Thicks!! Insects on my bed on the very first night !!!”
Reviews.Author: Ininrum
Reviews.Content: This is hard to believe that's why I took some pictures of them... After flying for about 8 hours to get to Rome I went to sleep, which was kind of hard because instead of air conditioned the had the heat turned on and the room was really hot. I woke up at 12 am due to the lack of air in the room and when I turned on the lights, guess what, the bed was full of blood sucking insects... Unbelievable!! They changed me from the 4th floor to the 6th floor... The rest of the night were not much better because I had to open the room windows to get some air and all the noises from the street and the cigarette smell from other rooms came in... The other thing, the pool and SPA facilities are really good, but be advised, you will have to pay at least 20€ if you want to use them no matter if it is just for a few minutes!! And finally but not least, Internet service is free in all hotels but the Rome Cavaliery. Instead of paying their expensive rate for Internet I had to walk couple o streets way fron the hotel to get free Internet connection... In conclusion, next time I will stay in a cheaper hotel with with a clean bed and free internet service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in the Rome Area”
Reviews.Author: stampzip
Reviews.Content: Had a chance to use some Hilton QF3 certificates in Rome and stayed at the Rome Cavalieri after an Italian cruise....hotel was excellent in service, food, and room accomodations...have to say this is one of my top hotels I have stayed at in years. They provide a free shuttle to downtown close to the Trevi Fountain and the train station. The breakfast buffet was included with the room and many, many choices of food. Only watchout is the 50-55 EU one-way charge to the airport. Free high speed internet to Hilton Diamond members. Hotel is very, very pricy, but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “In the hills of Rome”
Reviews.Author: hennessyparadis
Reviews.Content: While travelling through Italy in August I stayed here with my girlfriend for one day. First impressions Driving up to the hotel by the hotel shuttle bus felt a bit disappointing. The building, especially in daylight, isn't very attractive. Once you walk up in doors that changes, though. It feels like an American hotel at this point. The room Reception upgraded us to a Club room on the higher floors. The room was spacious, the bed was every bit as comfortable as it looked. The colour of the furniture felt a bit dated although everything was in pristine condition. The bathroom was spacious and well-appointed. About the view from the room - The Cavalieri is located in the hills with, from some parts of the hotel, views over the city and the Vatican. The room from our room was not very good, however. We were located on the "wrong" side of the building facing the hill side. The room has a big balcony but with that kind of view and very basic furniture, it isn't very tempting to use. The breakfast The breakfast was served indoors and outdoors by the pool. The selection was vast and the quality was good. Facilities The Cavalieri hosts hundreds of works of art around the building, especially on the banquet floor beneath the reception. Definitely worth to tour the hotel. Overall Staying in a Club room entitled us to use the club lounge. I'm not big on hotel lounges, I really don't understand the concept, however the lounge was nicely decorated, service was efficient and the view was wonderful (the right side of the building) - especially from the balconies. Being situated on the hillside this hotel is located quite far from the main sceneries in Rome. Having a bus shuttle service helps but taxi rides are evident. The upside of the scenic location is potentially beautiful views and calmness / wonderful sleep quality. The pool and its facilities looks very tempting however I did not have a chance to try it!

Reviews.Title: “class.... and the finest views of the eternal city”
Reviews.Author: pickyfella
Reviews.Content: though the three-michelin star left us underwhelmed - we've enjoyed finer one star restaurants - there was no denying the sheer beauty of the dining room or the exceptional views across the city. if visiting, make full use of the lounge; it's not inexpensive though the constant stream of delightful snacks and drinks allied to the wonderfully sophisticated air make it worthwhile. the rooms are four out of five. it deserves it's reputation as being among the city's best.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BSinPNS
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 8AM via hotel car. Had booked using Hilton Honors points and requested an upgrade to the Imperial Club floor. We were offered the upgrade (for a price) which we gladly accepted. Since our room was not ready, we were given a key card for access to the Imperial Club and invited to wait there. The Imperial Club offered some food items all day long. The only restriction was that neither food nor drink could be removed from the Club. Not a problem. Internet access was complimentary. However, they needed to see your passport each time you wanted to use it. Had pre-arranged our pick-up at the airport via email to the Concierge. The driver was waiting for us on arrival. So, we arranged all our tours through the Concierge including a day trip to Pisa. The drivers we all professional and very personable. Can’t wait to return to the Cavalieri.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: mel39TauntonEngland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing! In every way luxurious and the staff make your stay as perfect as they possibly can. An absolutely fantastic experience.

Reviews.Title: “The Highlight of Rome was the Cavalieri”
Reviews.Author: jrocketjr
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a week after visiting Paris on our honeymoon. We did spend the extra money on the imperial club option and we were very glad that we did! The view from the hotel is magnificient and the cappucino at the imperial club every morning was fantastic! We sipped coffee and had our complimentary imperial club breakfast every morning and we marvelled at he view of St. Peter's Basillica, the colosseum and the city in general. The shuttle from the hotel to downtown was very convenient and if there were two many for the shuttle the doormen would provide taxi service free of charge. This is a 5 star hotel and I do mean 5 star. Having worked in the hotel industry I enjoy hotels as much as I enjoy the beach. This hotel is to be enjoyed. If you do not purchase the imperial club option at the time of booking, you definitely won't be as happy as those who do. Take my word for it. Each room on our floor (imperial club) had shutters that blocked out 100% light even on a sunny day. The extra privacy/noise door provided soundproof comfort that contributed to a very restful sleep. This hotel is very ritzy and i tended to feel a little underdressed most of the time, but i didn't let it effect my enjoyment of the hotel or our honeymoon. Also...be sure to book the 'driver' for your trip to the airport, yes its 85euro but he spoke very good english and was a wonderful start to our trip home! i wouldn't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and elegant”
Reviews.Author: Feistyrg
Reviews.Content: When reading reviews of this hotel prior to travelling, I was a little worried as some painted a picture of a very snouty, stuck up place that overcharges for everything. I should have not wasted time worrying. This is a wonderful hotel, and I definitely would stay again. Quick and very pleasant check in. Our bags were in the room before we were. Everyone from the doorman to the front desk to the concierge to the bartender was unfailingly cheerful, polite and helpful. Our room was huge and plush. We had booked the least expensive and it was still wonderful with a balcony large enough to eat on if the weather had been warmer. View of a radio tower though--views on the other (more expensive) side are much better. There is a free shuttle to downtown Rome. We generally took the shuttle to town then came back in a taxi on our own. Be aware that a lot of the cab drivers think this is still a Hilton, and if you tell them the Waldorf Astoria, they don't know what you mean. Concierge made dinner reservations for us both nights at restaurants I had researched online. We did not eat in the hotel restaurant. But we did have drinks in the bar. No more expensive than any other big city hotel I have been to. They gave us umbrellas to borrow on the day it rained. Grounds are beautiful and fun to explore.

Reviews.Title: “Sadly not what it once was”
Reviews.Author: JimandJudy
Reviews.Content: My last review here was 6 years ago. After 6 stays I've seen this once great hotel become good. While still a nice property, it no longer is quite what it was. Rooms are nice and it has beautiful art work. However, the hotel's attitude to Diamond (and gold) Hilton Honor members has especially deteiorated. I paid over $100/night extra for the Imperial lounge that is no where as nice as it used to be. The breakfast in their restaurant (included as a Diamond) is very nice as are the views and spa. The grounds are also very nice, but that's because they are very far from where you want to be. I no longer recommend it as a five star property. If you are looking for a nice lovely property that takes at least an hour (travel time)each day from your vacation experience and you can get a good price, you'll enjoy your stay. But, it's no longer all that special.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeHubbard
Reviews.Content: What a superb hotel and superb service well worth upgrading to exec club on 7th & 8th floor as every where is expensive (ie) 10 euros for a bottle of beer ouch.All the hotel staff were very kind and couretous Room was huge very very very clean at ALL times what a nice place to sit with the view over the city of rome.Well worth a visit to Harry Bar for a romantic evening meal set in astyle like Frank sinatra in the 50s.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: grnglide
Reviews.Content: With an establishment like this where do you start??? My wife and I arrived by taxi from the airport through the usual "do I really want to visit this place" areas and arrived at the hotel which surprised me even though I had seen the pictures - I assume it is an early sixties building but has aged well! Got out of car, staff took luggage, welcomed by reception staff. Asked if I wanted the free upgrade to the Imperial Floor (HHonors Diamond member!) or the chargeable upgrade to a suite. Were shown both rooms and given a choice - opted for the suite on the third floor rather that the Imperial Room on the seventh. Seventh has the better view (the trees prevent some from seeing a great view of St Peters) but the suite was awesome! Signed in, went to room, luggage arrived. All the staff were incredible helpful - nothing was too much trouble. Suites and Imperial rooms give access to the Imperial Lounge (Executive Lounge in normal Hilton terms) - food available all the time, drinks available most of the time (unlike in UK where they tend to lock the alcoholic drinks away at 8:00pm). If you have had a reasonable lunch the "snacks" here will quite happily do as a light dinner. Hotel has three pools (at least!) and the imperial room / Diamond Membership means you dont have to pay and no-one challeged us anyway. Also got complimentary internet access - useful for online check-in for the return flight! The view from the hotel over the city (especially at dusk / night) is amazing and is worth having to use the taxi / minibus to get to the city (which isnt actually far). A true five star hotel in every sense - amazing decoration everywhere, room was impeccable. Would I return - of course I would! Was it worth the money - every penny! Was it cheap - of course not. The level of service provided doesnt come cheap and cutting corners isnt worth it. For anyone who does not have the advantage of HHonors Gold / Diamond membership to hopefully get the Imperial room upgrade (not guaranteed) I would recommend paying if you can stretch your budget!

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, high quality hotel - not much on location”
Reviews.Author: SurfVB
Reviews.Content: Very high quality rooms and amenities ("pillow menu") with nice pools but be prepared to pay top dollar for everything (8 Euro coffee). There is nothing in the vicinity of the hotel however they do run a free hourly shuttle bus that drops off in Bernini Plaza. Hotel has a great view of the city because it is up on a hill but only half the rooms face that way - the rest face an apartment building and huge radio tower. Nice balconies and electronic metal shutters that close out all light and noise if desired. Internet was said to be complimentary in the hotel guide but was actually fee based when we got there. Service was good but the staff was reserved and didn't seem overly enthusiastic about going the extra mile. We had a plumbing problem (shower drain clogged) which took two calls and over 15 hours to get fixed. Two good, reasonably priced neighborhood restaurants about 3-4 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel with some minor setbacks”
Reviews.Author: in31
Reviews.Content: Rome Cavalieri is one of the best hotels I ever stayed in. Staff is amazing, rooms on Imperial level great, view from Imperial lounge spectacular. I treated myself to a massage in SPA area and it was top level massage. The only problem I had, was that I had to wait for my room 2 hours pass the check in time and the excuse was that hotel was fool and that they are late, at the same time I booked a king size bed room and I got a twin bed room. My advice for the hotel management would be to avoid similar situations in the future, while it leaves an unnecessary stain on the image of the hotel in guest eyes.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, but not as good as in the past...”
Reviews.Author: Ducatista-1
Reviews.Content: Over on the Flyertalk Hilton forum there has been a lot of discussion regarding the situation at the Cavalieri. We stay there 2-3 times each year for 5-10 days per stay so feel pretty familiar with the property (most recently this September). Value of Imperial Floor Upgrade: First, Diamonds used to be regularly upgraded to an Imperial Floor room... but this seems to have become extremely rare... even when the hotel is quite empty. If the Imperial Lounge was even a shadow of its old self, then paying the up-charge would be a no-brainer. Currently, its sort of a toss-up and I am not certain whether we will bother with the upgrade when visiting in January. The food in the Imperial Lounge has declined dramatically and is really not worth eating. Also, the drink options are diminished. Staff attentiveness is mixed. On each shift there seems to be one person who might be helpful. Most of the lounge staff struggle to avoid eye contact lest they be asked to do something. The decline in the lounge is dramatic in comparison to 5 years ago... and more subtle in comparison to more recent stays. The view remains as remarkable as ever and the porch (in good weather) is a wonderful place to have coffee or answer email. A nice feature of the Imperial floors is the "ironing room" near the Imperial Lounge (not sure if there are ironing rooms on the other floors). The rooms on the Imperial floor have nicer toiletries, etc than the rooms on the other floors. If you stay on the Imperial floors avoid room 842 which is next door to a very large house keeping facility with an automatic door that slides open every time someone walks past in the hallway. Each time it opens, the door shakes room 842. We spent one night in this room and changed rooms the next day. Desk staff insisted that the sliding door was not a problem but did (rather cooly) move us to another room. Also the wireless internet does not work in room 842 (or at least did not during our stay). La Pergola: A fabulous restaurant, expensive but worth it. Given the situation at the Imperial Lounge, we sometimes came up to Pergola for a better quality glass of wine and a snack. Equally great view. So one option is to skip upgrade to Imperial Lounge and have a few glasses of much better wine at La Pergola. A small complimentary snack was served. Jacket required. Internet: Gold and Diamond receive free wireless... this did not used to be the case at the Cavalieri ... it is normally very expensive (something like $27 Euro per day). I realize that this is a Hilton-wide policy and not unique to the Cavalieri ... but its a big improvement anyway. Breakfast: Breakfast has also declined over the years, but it is still very good. I would only avail myself of it for free as it is very expensive otherwise. Again the breakfast staff seem to have attended the same training as the lounge staff which permits them to avoid all eye contact with customers and breeze right by. If one is able to flag one down... they were unfailing polite. We much preferred the breakfast offerings downstairs to the breakfast at the Imperial Lounge. Of course, if a porch seat is available, and the weather is fine, sitting outside and soaking in the view is hard to beat at the Imperial Lounge. Location: Ok, this is a topic where reasonable people might disagree. But I LOVE the location. Quiet is rare in Rome ...or most big cities... and the Cavalieri is quiet (the design of the rooms help on this issue also). The Shuttle makes runs to town (except Sunday) and Taxis are cheap (be sure the meter is set to zone #1 within the central city, including Cavalieri). On this last trip, our Shuttle driver was rude and obviously disdainful of the passengers. Shut the door in an older passenger's face as he tried to board and made a rude gesture at him. Also more frequent shuttle runs would reduce crowding. City View Rooms: If one is staying on the Imperial Floor ... I see little reason to pay extra for the city view as the lounge has the best view of all. If not staying on an Imperial Floor, the city view is often obstructed by trees unless the room is on 5th or 6th floor. Colosseum Lounge: This is a miserable space. Bright white and overly lit. Food and drink are even more limited than in the Imperial Lounge. Skip it. Bad even for free. Overall: We still like the Cavalieri. Concierge desk still very helpful. Fitness facility unusually good (especially for Rome). The artwork on display is remarkable, the best I have ever seen in a hotel. The grounds and solitude are unsurpassed in Rome. However, perhaps there has been a change in management over the last couple years as there has been a substantial decline in the lounges and in the attitude of the desk staff. Also, previous Diamonds received various perks like newspaper, gift, sparking wine upon arrival, etc. This month we received none of these. We did get water in the room each day and this was greatly appreciated. One gets the impression that the Cavalieri gets overwhelmed with folks staying on "points" and does not treat them as well as in the past.

Reviews.Title: “Over the top!”
Reviews.Author: cwberg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rome Cavalieri for two nights after spending time in Southern Italy. It was just beautiful and elegant, you couldn't ask for more. The rooms were beautifully appointed, although we were disappointed that we didn't get a better view with my husband's HH status, it was still very nice. Susan, at the front desk gave us a tour of the hotel and was extremely helpful and attentive. The artwork collection left us speechless. They have a complimentary shuttle that takes you to the center of town and back on the half hour, which was a welcomed amenity. The spa was equally as amazing with the baths and a quiet room. Breakfast? We didn't want to leave. We sat outside among the olive trees with a pristine pool, and nearly forgot to eat. I'm not sure we'll see anything like it again!!!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is beautiful , the rooms are...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful , the rooms are large and so are the bathrooms. The view from our room was gorgeous !! The only draw back is the location u really can't walk anywhere. They remedy that by having a free shuttle that takes you in to piazza barbarini, great location to be dropped off and picked up at. That being said I would still recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Elevate Your stay in Roma...Simply Bellissimo!”
Reviews.Author: bobbyvegas22
Reviews.Content: Rome Cavalieri will make your Roma experience Perfect! Sitting high on a hill overlooking the city but yet tucked away nicely from the outside busy world for that incredible resort-style experience, the Hilton Cavalieri will literally "Elevate Your Stay" in one of the greatest cities in the World. Simply Bellisimo! If you are a Hilton Diamond member, than there is no other place you should consider staying while you are in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I stayed in Europe.”
Reviews.Author: Ivonne6669
Reviews.Content: Charming, just excellent! Staff was amazingly friendly and welcoming. Interior design magnificent! So much art over there. The outdoor pool is big and the water is warmed up. They are so friendly to pets, you can send your pet to Spa. Gentelman playing in the lobby after 10 PM has a wonderful voice and he's very funny. Wonderful breakfast! The location is not the best so they provide a free shuttle to and from the city center. What can I say - if I will be in Rome again - I wish to stay there again. Wonderful place!

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing in so many ways”
Reviews.Author: Mum4k9
Reviews.Content: Don’t flame me for this review as I will be among the minority of people who are not impressed by the “Waldorf” brand or the Michelin rated restaurant the hotel contains…. the service of the staff here was lacking and I expect better from a 5 star property . The Pros: Beautiful grounds/spa/pools Room/bathroom was large and fairly well appointed Sound-proof door to hallway Beautiful artwork in common areas Expedient check-in at VIP desk Somewhat helpful concierge desk The Cons: Extremely far from city center Shuttle schedule-once an hour w/a 4 hr. break in middle of day and stops at 8pm Doorman service was lazy Exterior of hotel looks like something out of the former East Germany Interior hallways to rooms have carpet seams that are pulling and need some TLC for the walls Standard “Executive Lounge” (not the Imperial Lounge) offered laughable food and sub-par wines & no liquor Let me start by saying that we used my husband’s points/certificates as a Hilton Diamond member which afforded us an “upgraded” room which was only mediocre if it was, indeed, an upgrade. While check-in was expedient at the VIP desk and the girl who checked us in was informative, the overall feeling we got was that we should be grateful to be staying here “gratis.” As mentioned we were informed that our room was “upgraded” but near as we can tell it was from the street side to the pool side. It was on the lowest floor and nothing to write home about. We were granted access to the “Executive Lounge” which is about a 20x20 room with a very small patio attached. The room is kept EXTREMELY cold and the food offerings consisted of items rotated throughout the day which ranged from green or pasta salad, potato chips, nuts, a bar mix of some type and sandwiches of mostly bread-hardly any meat and always a slice of cucumber on top…as if that can camouflage how chintzy and ultimately disappointing and flavorless the item you just picked up is! There were ample soda/juice/coffee/tea options but the only choice of alcohol were some second rate wines and prosecco. Honestly, my husband and I had a good chuckle at the entire set up and would have been completely pissed if we had actually paid for this place. As this was my birthday trip my husband tried to get us reservations at La Pergola. The concierge basically turned up his nose saying that it was not possible….I’m a foodie, we’ve eaten at Michelin rated restaurants before…it’s always possible! Whatever, we heard from another couple who dined there that it was overrated and the service was snooty so we saved ourselves $400+. Be warned that you want to be lined up for the shuttle at least 10 min. before it’s supposed to leave if you want a seat…coming and going. (Also, and they won’t tell you this unless you specifically ask, there is a public bus not a 5 min walk away which runs every 10-15 min and costs a Euro to get over to the city. It runs until midnight (bus #913).) And, there is always cab service which will set you back a few Euros but it is convenient. Now, let’s talk about breakfast!
