On first blush it appears to be a fine spread and, in some respects it is, however, while there were ample servers we could never seem to get coffee refills (we had this same issue in Sorrento so maybe it’s just an Italian thing?), the egg selection offered was HORRIFIC…the “omelette” was a cold, rubbery, corrupted version of its elegant French cousin, the scrambled eggs were runny and lukewarm, and the “fried” egg looked baked actually and was tepid and rubbery as well. No seasonings on table (salt/pepper should be de rigueur). The meat selection was nice and well stocked as were most of the other offerings. I just expected more considering the establishment. I should say that we experienced the same issue with the eggs each day we dined there so it was not just a one-time occurrence. There were several conferences going on while we were there (Bank of America being one of them) and the noise from the on-going set ups was, at times, distracting. As far as it being expensive; yes, it is and they don’t make any apologies about it but when heading to this sort of property it should be expected. Overall impression is that it’s just a former Hilton that they spruced up by adding some fancy furniture to the common areas and some nice artwork. Using total generalities, the staff is LAZY in every respect and then gives attitude-and not the good kind. In my book, if you want to be a 5 star property, SERVICE should be your first priority because when it comes down to it, pretty things are nice to look at but what people remember is how they were treated. Please, if anyone from Waldorf Management or Guest Services happens to read this, don’t bother sending the pedestrian “Thank you for choosing/we apologize for” reply…focus your attention on your staff and kindly remind them they are in the “service industry.”

Reviews.Title: “A glorious end to our honeymoon...”
Reviews.Author: kdch1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the last 3 nights of our honeymoon. Upon arrival, we received private check-in which was very welcoming and hospitable. Afterwards, we were escorted up in a private elevator (for imperial club members only) to our luxurious, spacious, opulant Vista Suite. The view was breathtaking and the room size and beauty was epic. We highly recommend paying the extra daily fee for the imperial club. The pool/spa/fitness and lobby bar with a wonderful pianist and some more quality artwork were impressive. We ordered room service for dinner every night and we weren't disappointed with the pasta dishes we selected (loved the risotto)! We took the hotel shuttle bus to Rome which wasn't crowded and very prompt with drop off and pick up. If we had to find one negative, albeit minor in comparison to the many positives, the walls were thin. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for, only wish we could have stayed for more than one night.”
Reviews.Author: w_collins40
Reviews.Content: I fell in love with the room when we opened the door it was spacious, relaxing and luxorious. Forgot why we went to Rome and wanted to stay and enjoy the hotel.Only slept there which was a waste really as it's a full holiday hotel.We paid extra for the Rome view which was twinkly from our balcony. The indoor pool was warm in the morning followed by a full buffet breakfast, every thing you could wish for, including international fare, never seen before ect lotus flower pickled, japanese omlette.yummy. Great if you like to try diffrent foods and the service was magnifico.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but a worthwhile indulgence”
Reviews.Author: katieren
Reviews.Content: We came with our youngest child for just one night on a "business and pleasure" trip. We went for an Imperial Room and loved our quiet and very comfortable room. The Imperial Lounge was lovely and the other perks that go with the Imperial rooms were worth the small extra cost. The main outdoor pool was lovely, my son and I were the only ones in it and it was wonderfully warm (incredible for late September.) The staff were extremely professional and accomodating at all times. We ate in the pool bar as the michelin starred restaurant was closed. This was just as well for us as our flight had been delayed and we weren't able to eat until 10pm. The meal was pricey but lovely (dread to think what the other restaurant would have set us back! We also had lunch the next day which was equally enjoyable. Fabulous mini lasagne for the baby too! At all times we were made to feel welcome and looked after. Yes, it's an expensive hotel but it is five star and it is in Rome, so you have to expect to pay a premium.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing News upon arrival”
Reviews.Author: spacatutto
Reviews.Content: In a nut shell.....I made a reservation at the Rome Cavalieri hotel for three nights starting 9/14/2010/ I confirmed the reservation upon arrival at the Rome airport with no issues. However upon arrival the Manager tells me that they cannot fulfill my reservation due to a group of delegates that were not granted visa and could not be forced out of the hotel. They provided another hotel option that was NOT even close to the Cavalieri at no additional expense, BIG Deal! As a Diamond member I felt I was NOT given priority and frankly they completely destroyed the atmosphere I worked months to create for my wife and I. When I checked in they took me to an quiet office to break the news....give me a break! They should have told me on the phone when I confirmed the reservation prior to arriving. I would Never go back to this property for this reason alone. Any other Waldorf property would have handled this in a much more professional manner.

Reviews.Title: “What a view!! Nothing but class.”
Reviews.Author: Turk802
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to start our 10 days in italy. Big rooms - friendly staff - Only downfall is you have to bus 20 minutes to the center of town unless you cab it - Incredible view from the restaurant and the city view if you pay more - they do tend to nickle and dime you for using the pool 6 euros... and if you want a cot for the day, another 8 or 10.

Reviews.Title: “top notch!”
Reviews.Author: NormajeanN4
Reviews.Content: the food is excelent. beds/pillows emaculate. view is spectacular

Reviews.Title: “Six months later - still highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: dsweet
Reviews.Content: After my last stay at this hotel in February, 2010, I wrote a review calling this hotel clearly the best in Rome. As business brought me back to Rome, I booked another stay. it is often the case that you see far more of any hotel's flaws on the second visit. I am please to say that I found the Rome Cavalieri to be at least a good overall as my last visit, and as I experienced some additional amenities, and with a change in the Hilton frequent stayer program, perhaps even a bit better. The stay started poorly. As my arrival in Rome was in the very early morning, the start of my booking was made for the evening before. I emailed the hotel to let them know that I would arrive early in the morning, and to hold my room for this early arrival. Unfortunately, this was not done, and my reservation was cancelled as a "no-show". Thankfully, the hotel was not full, and the end result of this situation was the need for the hotel to manually recreate the reservation. This took nearly 30 minutes, and created an unfortunate bad impression at the start. This was the only service lapse during my visit. I was again upgraded to a view room on the Imperial floor. The view over Rome remains incredible. Since my last visit, Hilton has begun to offer free internet to its Gold and Diamond (I am Diamond) members at all of its hotel, and one of my key complaints - 30 euros per day for internet - went away. The internet worked well. My service requests were responded to very promptly, generally within five minutes. The Imperial Lounge continues to have a very good breakfast, including bagels, french toast, eggs (a bit runny), bacon, cereal and lots of fresh fruit. There is food of varying types offered throughout the day. During this visit, the check-in staff let me know that I could also have breakfast without charge in the dining room. The buffet here was very large. This trip, I did use the pool/spa/exercise facility, and believe that it is the best of its kind in Rome. Free use is given for Imperial floor. I also ate two dinners at the hotel (last visit I did not have the opportunity to do so), and the pasta and main courses were very well prepared, and room service, with an oven as part of the delivery cart, was also very good. Rooms on the Imperial floor are very quiet, thanks to the soundproof closable door in the vestibule of each room. This remains a very high priority for me. The downside of the hotel remains its location. While the walk to St. Peters is only around 3 km, it is over some steep hills. The shuttle was completely filled one morning, which resulted in the need to take a cab. Despite this drawback, I will definitely return to the Cavalieri.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton's Wonderful Astoria Collection”
Reviews.Author: aturtle1
Reviews.Content: Rome Cavalieri, The Waldorf Astoria Collection The staff, rooms and the city room views are exceptional. Great pool, spa, fitness center and out of the way location. Although this hotel is out of the hustle and bustle or Rome city center they make it convenient to get back and forth to the city center with a free shuttle. The hotel sits atop a hill that overlooks the entire city of Rome. It does not get any better than this. Very pricey. A hamburger by the pool is 28 Euro not for the faint of heart.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you'd expect from a 5 star European hotel”
Reviews.Author: S2288
Reviews.Content: What do I expect from a 5 star European hotel? - expensive everything. 16EUR for a sun lounger mattress at the pool. No free internet in the rooms & 28 EUR for a burger. Seriously. For a burger. We also ate at 'La Pergola' restaurant for dinner, but we knew what the cost of this would be - and it was fantastic. - beautiful room. Our room had a view of the city and it was gorgeous. Clean, comfortable & had an 'old yet new' feeling to it if you know what I mean. Something could be done about the sound-proofness of the rooms, however. We overheard a live sex show on our first night. - Extensive breakfast. American style - everything and anything. Eggs, bacon, sausage, potatoes, white rice, sparking wine, lots of pastries, lots of everything - A lot of North Americans. The hotel was packed. - Snooty service. As my husband said, the concierge 'didn't pretend enough that he was happy to serve me'. One thing that we saw and didn't expect, was the crappiness of the VIP lounge (where they serve free drinks/food for Hilton gold reward members). Having just spent time at the Hilton in Athens - where the lounge is gorgeous and has an amazing selection of food and drinks and VIEW) - we were taken aback with the room at this hotel. Absolutely no view, florescent lighting, crap selection of food and you only get 15 minutes of free internet in this little cubby hole at the back. It felt like a teacher's lounge in an outdated high school. Would I recommend this hotel? Yes. But just know what to expect :)

Reviews.Title: “all things were excellent”
Reviews.Author: gerritsenadvies
Reviews.Content: Grand hotel with superb services. Great vieuw over the centre Rome. An oasis of stillness and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - OUTRAGEOUS additional charges policy”
Reviews.Author: HotelMavenLondon
Reviews.Content: We chose the Rome Cavalliari for its position on the outskirts of Rome. Firstly given it was mid august we figured it would be a nice respite from the heat and secondly given we were driving It was more accesible by car than some of the hotels in the centre. The hotel delivered on both these points and was pretty accesible from Rome Fiumicino airport from where we were travelling. The hotel itself is very odd - and feels like you are staying in a 1960s office block, there Is a good reason they don’t show that many photos of the hotels façade on the internet. If you're lookng for a historic experience, this is most definitely not the hotel for you! The interior "design" in the communal areas was also patchy, again the photographs on the website were very good, as in the flesh there was definitely an uncomfortable juxtapposition of 1960s fixtures and fittings vs antiquities - not in a cool way either. That said the room itself was very comfortable, and pleasant - (once you were inside looking out!), and having paid EUR 75 extra for a city view room we had a very pleasant evening on the balcony which had beautiful panoramic views over rome (nb. you should get a room on the top floors if you want to see the Vatican which costs ANOTHER EUR 250+)… On this note you should be aware before you book the hotel that absolutely EVERYTHING costs extra - I appreciate in high end hotels that this Is often the case having stayed in many. But when, as a paying guest, you have to pay to park the car, for the spa facilities, to get a sun lounger by the pool, and your burger in the pool bar costs EUR 30, the blatant profiteering leaves a bad taste…. It should also be noted that when we declined to pay extra for the lounger the spa staff were very snooty -- apparantly they couldn’t grasp the concept that we were not interested in paying on principal and because we only wanted to swim for 30 mins before we left, not because we couldn’t afford it. Additionally the changing areas were very poor and dated and yet again there was no shampoo, shower gel or conditioner in the showers. Extraordinary! That said the overall experience was ok, I am not sure we would stay here again if our priority was not that we were driving, my preference would be to find somewhere with more charm, that doesn’t blatantly rip of its patrons.

Reviews.Title: “Truely Rome's best Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: UncleSamDavid
Reviews.Content: When staying in Rome, this great hotel is the first choice. Compared to the mini-size-rooms most even 5-star-rated hotels in Rome offer, the 50m² (540 sqft) rooms at the Hilton are very spacious and tastefully furnished. Try booking a Rome View Room at the Imperial Floor, which includes free access to the pool area and free all-day food and drinks at the fantastic Imperial Club with a spectacular view over Rome. The rack rates are out of this world (around €600 per room per night), but there are specials so you can get a better deal most of the time. Avoid the minibar by all means, a 0,2l Coke or mineral water is charged 8 Euros, which means the costs of one liter mineral water adds up to 40 (!!) Euros. That isn't even funny any more and casts a damning light on the hotel. Unfortunately, HHonors Gold or Diamond status benefits are not recognized. Another down is the Restaurant L'Uliveto which we cannot recommend at all. Next to the room size, the large-scale pool area is one of the reasons to stay at the Hilton. A truely magnificent experience for relexation. The very attentive staff offers a high-end service level above expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Can't say enough good things about this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: zoom101
Reviews.Content: My husband, 15-year-old son and I just returned from an Italy trip which included 5 days in Rome at the fantastic Rome Cavalieri. We have nothing but good things to say. In the thick of the summer heat, there is, without a doubt, no better place to stay in Rome than this hotel, which has the true feel of a luxury resort in the hills overlooking the city. The massive, magnificent swimming pool (one of several on the property) was a glorious relief after hot days of seeing the sights and great for a full day of just plain relaxing. The grounds were extensive, beautifully landscaped and well-maintained. The hotel is luxurious and comfortable. Our room was spacious and elegantly furnished. Our bathroom was well-equipped and we were happy to find a US-style shower. True, the Rome Cavaliere is a 12-minute cab ride from the city center sights and restaurants ($12 to $20 US each way and readily available) but figure that into your trip plans--it is well worth the additional expense, especially in the warmer months. You do have to figure on taking cabs, as the hotel is in the middle of what is essentially its own hilltop park and we didnt' see anything you could walk to from here. There is a shuttle bus, but it never fit into our plans and with just one dropoff/pickup point in the city center, wasn't particularly useful. But I digress. Tthe fitness center was expansive, well-equipped and as good as we have seen in any 5-star hotel. The indoor pool was also large and gorgeous. Everything was quite up-to-date. Try to get a room overlooking the garden, which also gives you a city view of Rome. The staff was very nice, helpful and friendly. There was never the feeling they had their hands out for a tip. Pool staff was equally so. The trick here, especially if you are coming for the pool, is to stay in a room on an Imperial Floor, which will include the cost of sunbeds at the pool plus access to their lovely Imperial Lounge, with views and balcony tables overlooking all of Rome, plus a great place for your breakfast or light snacks/drinks the rest of the day. Cost of internet is high, it's true, but certainly not a deal-breaker. This is not a hotel for those on a tight budget, but if you are willing to pay for a top hotel, you should be quite happy here. Not sure I would stay here in the winter time, however, the courteous service, indoor pool and spa, and excellent accomodations might beckon even in the cooler months. We booked through American Express Platinum travel service and were greeted in our room with a chilled bottle of Proseco and sweets, as well as receiving other special amenities during our stay. Staying at this hotel added greatly to our vacation. After extensive research into where to stay in Rome in August, we were more than pleased we chose the Rome Cavaliere.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Travel4FunVirginia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Cavalieri for four nights during our Rome portion of our first Italy trip. The hotel did not disappoint. We stayed on the executive floor and the executive lounge was wonderful and fully stocked with anything you might want including a terrific breakfast and very accommodating staff. The Cavalieri isn’t in the heart of Rome, but the views overlooking the city are truly great. We ate at the restaurant while staying there and the food was good.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time there”
Reviews.Author: cavershamtraveller1
Reviews.Content: Came to stay for 2 nights with our 8 yr old son back in April 2010. From the outside looked like 70's style block of flats!!Not very pretty. Inside much better but still quite retro. Discovered that we'd been given a twin bedded room deluxe room and not a double as requested. Since double rooms have all be taken up they kindly offered us a room with a Rome view. Fantastic views, could see the Spanish steps (though quite small) , Villa Borghese area, top of the Vatican and many more. Could also see the swimming pool and the beautiful hotel gardens from the balcony. Room was very spacious even after putting a rollaway bed in for our son. Bathroom was huge!! Bed was very comfortable and even had a pillow menu which included some weird and most exotic stuffing. Went for lunch at the restaurant by the pool, their cannelloni was nothing like I've ever tasted before, WOW!!! Breakfast buffett was plentiful. Husband and son used the pool only twice because you had to pay quite a lot for that. Everything is very expensive here at the Cavalieri. A bit out of the way to reach the centre of Rome but could make use of the complimentary hotel bus transport. A very enjoyable stay at the Cavalieri by all.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel -- delivered on all fronts”
Reviews.Author: 6fromW4
Reviews.Content: My wife, 4 children (7, 5, 3 and 1) and i have just returned from a fabulous stay at the Cavalieri. For a family with small children it offers the perfect balance between sightseeing and relaxation by what must be Rome's best outdoor pool. We took advantage of Hilton's little publicised "family promotion" which gave the second (children's) room at half price and included free food and drink for the kids when ordering off the children's menu. A fantastic deal when you have 4 children! We also opted for two Imperial rooms, giving access to the Imperial Club, a very nicely appointed "lounge" with great views over Rome, providing breakfast, a light lunch, afternoon tea, pre and post-dinner snacks and drinks, all complementary and open throughout the day. Again, a great facility when you have small children who need quick snacks and drinks at all hours, particularly on returning from a thirsty morning wandering around the dust of the Colleseum and Forum. The icing on the cake is complementary access to the fantastically equipped gym and pools (beware: "ordinary" room guests must pay a hefty charge to use the pools, which would strike most guests as odd). We ate every night at the poolside Ulvieto Restaurant which combines great cooking with impeccable and friendly service. The 3 Michelin starred rooftop restaurant was closed during our stay but we were more than happy with what its little sister had to offer -- clearly there is some cross-fertilisation between the two kitchens. Throughout the hotel, the service is top notch and genuine, with nothing too much trouble. The warmth and tolerance shown to our children was particularly notable, even by Italian standards. We ended up spending a fair amount on taxis as although the shuttle bus into town is useful, with 2 possible stops (first near Popolo, then near Barbarini), we found the return trip of limited use as invariably we ended the day on the other side of town and didn't want to return by foot to the pick-up point and wait for the shuttle. This is however a small price to pay for the privilege of retreating to the calm of the Cavalieri and a dip in the pool! My only gripe (and it's one I have with many hotels of this type) is the lack of complimentary wifi access for Imperial rooms (with all the other freebies on offer, charging 22 euros a day for something with no marginal cost to the hotel doesn't stack up). As other reviewers have noted, it's certainly not cheap, but this is an outstanding hotel from which to explore Rome. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing (& Expensive) Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nicholasashaw
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for the second time at the Rome Cavalieri, and it didn't disappoint. We stayed in room 711, which had lovely views over Rome and access to the Executive lounge. The Hotel would definitely be in my top ten around the world, with amazing service, great restaurants and fantastic views over Rome. It's a little bit out of Rome (about 20 odd minutes on the once an hour free shuttle) and it's VERY expensive (40 euros for breakfast each), so worth getting breakfast in on your room rate or an Executive room with access to the Club lounge (free drinks all day, breakfast, lunch nibbles etc). As it was a special occassion (engagement) we pushed the boat out and ate at La Pergola restaurant on the roof - one of the best meals we've had, stunning views over the whole of Rome and nice, friendly staff who really made the vening (bill for 2 was 500 euro). For a special weekend / occassion the hotel won't disappoint but you need to start saving !

Reviews.Title: “Luxury - but at a price”
Reviews.Author: FamilyH68
Reviews.Content: This is an expensive hotel, it's certainly worth the extra to get a Rome View room but I could't help but feel that I was viewed as a walking wallet by the Hilton Group during my stay here. I had free access to the pool, but still had to pay 16 Euros for a lounger, and times four people that adds up quickly. Food, drinks and so on are also uber expensive - really nice but expensive all the same. We had no problems with the shuttle bus, and taxis are easy and cheap to use anyway. Rooms are really spacious, well decorated, great bathrooms and beds of the highest standard - although we stayed for four nights and it was pretty dusty towards the end of our stay. The majority of staff were great, as you'd expect, but the reception is frosty at best and the front door is less than welcoming, I guess if I'd hired a Ferrari I'd have been helped with my bags but our hire car was a Ford and we just got a thumb over the shoulder to point us in the direction of the car park (5 Euros a day, almost a bargain) and lugged our own cases into reception (when they were collected and carried all of five feet into a lift for us in return for a tip...) I'd recommend it, but be aware that it really costs far more than any other similar 5* hotel I've stayed at......

Reviews.Title: “Great Fantastic Hotel..If not Hilton Diamond Member Bring PLENTY Euros”
Reviews.Author: SOBE1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights recently. I did EXTENSIVE research on this property and was aware of the obscene a la carte pricing here. Thankfully I am Hilton Diamond member{free much necessary perks at this place} and used points. The hotel was as advertised. Elegant, luxurious and beautiful. Nice pool and grounds.Like other reviewers on here I travel extensively for pleasure and business and this hotel and their pricing scheme is outrageous for those paying a la carte..we had free breakfast buffet which was fabulous {but at 38e p/person,would we have paid nearly $90 each morning for it? NO}..The pool area and spa was great. We had free chairs and umbrellas{ but they even chargenon hilton diamond guests STAYING there 16e p/person just for access} and their vip lounge was excellent. wine, prosecco and very tasty desserts and snacks all day were top notch. We had no problem with the shuttle. We usually took it in the morning and back in the early afternoon after sightseeing and took the last one into the city for dinner and simply took taxi back to hotel at our leisure for no more than 12 or 13e..great stay at this fabulous property, highly recommend it with one caveat, be a hiton gold or diamond member to get the most out of this place or bring PLENTY of Euros

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel......But EXPENSIVE...Less than charming front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: fan-tastic-media
Reviews.Content: I booked 6 nights at the Rome Cavalieri using my Hilton Honors points. This was my first trip to europe. I thought the front desk staff was professional but very cold. It's one of the only Hilton brand hotel's that i've stayed at where I was made to feel less than welcome by the front desk due to booking using points. The clerk was more interested in staring at her shoes than acknowledging me. As a silver member I was given free spa access. The concierges, spa, and fitness center staff were a totally different story. They were fantastic, accommodating and very knowledgable. The room itself was very spacious and clean, but the bed was hard as a rock! My wife and I were hungry by the time we checked in, so we decided to grab a quick bite at the most casual restaurant in the hotel (Pool Bar) I was very surprised to see a 28 Euro Burger! I've stayed at very very elegant hotels around the world...but I wasn't ready for the prices at the hotel. We ended up splitting a veggie pizza 24 Euro and shared a small bottle of water 6 Euro. The meal was less than good, but we were hungry and didn't know the area yet.....Oh yeah 10 Euro for a 12 oz. bottle of beer! Don't plan on sitting in a chair by the pool unless you want to pay 16 Euro per person. I was surprised that a hotel of this caliber would have to nickel and dime their guests to the point of not letting them have a seat at the pool without paying for it! The last little rant I have is with room policy. My brother in law came into Rome from Germany for 3 days to stay with us. When I went down to the front desk to add his name to my account, the front desk told me it would be 55 Euro a night! I asked "why would it cost 55 a night" and they simply replied "it's policy" Nowhere on my voucher did it state a maximum of 2 adults in the room! I went back to my room pretty upset....It wasn't until i talked to a manager that i was able to have my guest stay at no charge. I'm not sure if i'm not a Rome Cavalirii caliber guest, i'm simply cheap, or i've just been spoiled with good ole American customer service, but I was not happy with my stay, and if the room wasn't free using my Hilton Honors Points I would have left after the first few incidents. Oh yeah...They usually only have one shuttle going back and forth to Barberini and it's always packed past capacity leaving guests to take a taxi or wait an hour for the next shuttle to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LaStar1980
Reviews.Content: The Rome Cavalieri is a fantastic Hotel if you have a client who likes to do more then just business meeting after business meeting. It is a absolute fantastic Hotel with a very professional and friendly Staff. The Hotel is a litle out of the City Center, but they provide a free downtown shuttle but the breathtaking view and the very elegant Hotel really pays off !!! So if you have the Budget for a very High Level Client, this is my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in a Beautiful City”
Reviews.Author: Charlie12Melbourne
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Rome Cavalieri and it was perfect. The room was opulent, the service of the staff was excellent and the it was pure luxury. It was expensive but worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Very italian, nice rooms, poor AC in meeting rooms”
Reviews.Author: CTJwo
Reviews.Content: The rooms are beautiful - very well appointed with gorgeous bathrooms. 5 Stars on the rooms. My view was sadly NOT of the city - but rather of a cell tower - 2 star on the view. The staff was very nice and helpful with check in (quick) and dinner recommendations. The artwork in common areas is amazing. The pool looked spectacular as I ate a very pricey lunch next to it. We ordered 2 pizzas - way too much food - and wish the waiter had warned us how big they were. Food and drinks were outrageously expensive. Overalll a very nice hotel experience - with big rooms for Europe - but it felt dated in common areas. It is very expensive - especially for the location - so I'm glad work was paying!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel bad location”
Reviews.Author: jonathonb
Reviews.Content: friendly check in staff and nice comfortable rooms however as a first time visitor to rome was disappointed in the location and shuttle services to the city. had originally chosen the hotel due to the views and had paid to stay in an imperial club room, however we found ourselves on the backside of the hotel looking out at a massive mobile phone/tv tower with no view of central rome whatsoever. gym was first class, room service was ok, however think you can get better for the same money in rome.

Reviews.Title: “Rome from it's best side”
Reviews.Author: Milo_Zurich
Reviews.Content: We spent one night only in the marvelous junior suite of the executive floor. The entrance of the hotel and it's furnishing is as kitchy as you will only accept it being in Rome, but then it's just breathtaking. The room's are big, the bed absolutely fantastic!! The pool area is nicely prepared with the kind of niches but the best was the view from the balcony on the seventh floor. Taking the breakfast and watching all over Rome. We had an absolute fantastic two days journey, the Cavalieri was one of the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “All they have is spacious rooms far from the city....”
Reviews.Author: Onur_Tr
Reviews.Content: As a very frequent traveller, I was expecting more from Waldorf Astoria quality but I must say they have basic hilton quality. First good points, - very big and lovely rooms - good interior decoration with full of art - very good concierge and check in experience - clean rooms - Nice SPa facilities.. However very far from the city. Average taxi ride costs 10 € if you are really like generally costs 20 if you are going to historic areas. Shuttle service not really convenient every hour or half an hour which is really difficult to catch and end up at 20. which means you either have dinner at stupid place near hotel or pay another 25€ to get back to hotel. Rooms , if you staying in the front at least you have a Rome panaromic view but if you are staying at the back all you have is gardener noise. Really annoying. And best part is yet to come. They charge you for everything. Minibar prices are like four star michelin restaurant. You are charged 10 € fro beer which is almost same price in a very poshy italian resturant. Even water is really 2 times more expensive than average cafe. Yet, they have pool and spa if you dare to pay. Otherwise as a guest you can not use these facilities. For example they charge you 8€ per person cushion fee for using the outside pool. Even internet in the business center ( not your room business center !!!) is a rip off can you imagine a hotel without internet or printing services in business center......I will not spend more time on this topic as they have millions of these type of charges. Very cheap shot management All in all, they are charging you four seasons price but delivering you 4 star hotel quality. Very poor... If you are going to rome and want to enjoy Rome, go somewhere city center defintely not this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Over the top”
Reviews.Author: barbeeRx
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights for our honeymoon. Everything about the hotel looked and felt expensive/luxurious. There is a free 'happy hour' if you are a Hilton points member that includes some decadent h'our dourves and good choices on wines. The rooms were very nice with beautiful views and marble. It is quiet and removed, but while we were there, there were several weddings. The restaurant up top is fabulous if you have ~400 Euros to drop on a dinner for 2. I think at the time we went, they had the #1 chef in the world there. Amazing view of St. Peter's basilica at dinner. I feel, as a whole, if you drop as much dough on this place as most people do, you should not have to pay for things like access to the spa. The spa was awesome but you had to pay a stiff daily fee to go and sit in the sauna or turkish baths. They charged you by the minute to use their internet downstairs and we actually had to print something (cost ~7 Euros total for about 5 minutes on the computer and one page printed). I hate places that nickel and dime you. Also, it is far from the city center and secluded and you have to take the crowded (free) shuttle or a cab. Point of advice on a cab. . . negotiate the rate before hand. They sometimes go the long way up there so they can charge you more. The up side is that it is very quiet. I'm used to free breakfast, free spa access, and free wi-fi at 3 and 4 star hotels, but maybe I'm spoiled. I would have felt more comfortable staying at another place that was more cozy and convenient like the Hilton in Paris by the Arch de Triumph. The service was fabulous on all ends, and the grounds were stunning.

Reviews.Title: “Sumptuous Retreat”
Reviews.Author: Sangreer
Reviews.Content: Fantastic spa facilities, the Cavalieri has it's own Turkish baths with warm and cold pools and a huge steam room, this in addition to two outside pools and one indoor. Very relaxing though you do need to pay extra to use any facilities. Our room was clean and quiet and huge - the bed must have been nearly 6" wide and very very comfy. The location isn't great but there is a free shuttle bus which runs between the hotel and Barberini Square every hour until about 7/8pm. The best thing about this hotel is the restaurant - fabulous, although you wouldn't need to stay at the hotel to eat there, it was brilliant knowing we only had to waddle back to our room after all that food. If you're after a romantic break, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Arrogant, Ignorant and Rude!”
Reviews.Author: 4NDude
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a wonderful 3 week vacation from Europe barring our experience at Rome Cavalieri! We arrived at Rome Cavelieri after hiking for last few days in the Swiss Alps and perhaps were not looking quite the hoity toity expected of the Cavalieri crowd, we got the caverlier attidude of the Cavalieri front desk! With two young kids in tow, I was told that I did not read the fine print that room had a restriction on number of guests per room and the manager can make a call on whether she could accomodate us. But this is where Rome Cavaleri showed its true colors! Yes there was a misunderstanding on my part on the number of guests that were allowed in a room since I did not read the fine print. Yes, the manager on duty offered me another room, but it was on a separate floor and I told her that we have small children and we need to be together in the same room or in adjoining rooms. She told me that they were fully booked and there in nothing more she could do. At that point she bluntly said "let me get the bellboy to bring your bags out". Here I am with my family, just arrived in a new country, during peak summer holidays completely dumbfounded with that response! There was absolutely no offer to help us find another hotel, or any other help!! Whatever happened to the Hilton's statement --"Be My Guest" is still the gracious and warm way we want for our guests to feel at Hilton hotels and resorts?!? I very politely asked if as a courtesy I could use their wifi to find ourselves a hotel in Rome. I was asked for my passport information (which I gave) to be able to use the internet and was politely asked for a credit card to pay for the service! For me to spend 12 euros/hour did not pinch but was quite amusing that the "courtesy" meant allowing me to sit in their lobby while I frantically searched for hotels online. I have no arguments with the stated hotel policies of number of people in the room. However when it comes to number of guests per room, I wonder what was meant by the statement by one of the front desk receptionist when she said that it "depends on the manager's decision". What I question is the criteria the manager use to make that decision--did she judge us by the our appearance (hicking gear and all), or some other arbitrary subjective criteria? What are Hilton's policies on this and how can we be assured that I, my family or may staff who travel with me will not be subjected to this humiliating experience in future. As a disclosure, I travel widely and have been to over 60 countries and typically stay at the such 5-star hotels and am a diamond/platinum member for most of the hotel chains. So I view this experience with a combination of askance, humor and pity. SHAME ON YOU-- ROME CAVALIERI!!!

Reviews.Title: “Top rate Hilton”
Reviews.Author: MicSte
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights here purchased as HH rewards. Upgraded to Imperial club which is WELL worth the cost. Probably the best Hilton and best hotel we've ever stayed in. Everything is marble; fantastic artwork throughout; many little touches - roses in fountains , candy trays that showcases the hotel's class and attention to detail. The room was very nice, bed was great. The Imperial lounge is very nice with attentive courteous staff, good appetizer-like portions of very different selections for breakfast, lunch, early desserts then dinner, then deserts again. Drinks selections / availabilty were very varied. The view over the garden /pool and the Rome skyline is sublime, enjoyed it immensely. The pool / garden area is expansive, well kept and adds to the pleasure of basking and relaxing. The internal restaurants are very expensive perhaps a bit beyond the need? The shuttle service is a welcome attraction. They were overcrowded one morning and within 5 minutes either guests were provide free taxis and another bus arrived in another five minutes. This is the place to stay and we would readily return.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking View, Impeccable Service...and some nice Ferraris in the parking lot”
Reviews.Author: NickW724
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent our first three nights of an Italian vacation at the Cavalieri, and were very impressed with both the facilities and service. We had one 'issue' during our stay, but the hotel's response to it only improved our opinion of the place. We arrived via taxi from Rome Termini train station, which cost about 20 Euro. As some reviews have noted, the outside is nothing special...very "1960s" facade, but nothing terrible. The entry way is very nice with excellent doormen. On our arrival there was a Ferrari 458, and Lamborghini Guillardo in the parking lot, so we figured it might be an OK hotel! The lobby is spectacular, with some great artwork all around and a spiral staricase leading down to the lower level where the 'cheaper' restaurant is located. We were fairly early, and our room wasn't ready, but we were given a pass to the Imperial Lounge to wait, and the Concierge took our luggage. As an aside, when booking we HIGHLY recommend getting the Imperial level. The perks include unlimited food and beverages in the Lounge (nothing to go, you must consume in the lounge), as well as admission to the pool and spa, which otherwise costs extra. For the additional cost we felt like we got our money's worth. The view from the balcony tables at the Imperial Lounge is incredible, with the city vista laid out in front of you. Slightly to the right is the Vatican, and the Vittoriano very prominent, with the Colloseum also visible....just a beautiful view (see the pics). Our room was just a few doors from the lounge, so our balcony view was almost identical. We also highly recommend the extra for a city view room. As another reviewer mentioned the view from the other side of the hotel is nowhere near as spectacular. The room itself was a King Deluxe, with a VERY comfortable bed with lots of pillows. The bathroom was huge with a great shower and lots of mirrors. Everything worked, including the AC, which we found can sometimes be a challenge in Italy. One point though, irons are not provided, though the hotel will wash and/or press clothing. Still...when a $49 Super 8 at home has irons you kinda wonder why this place doesnt... In addition to the Imperial Lounge, the amenities include a beautiful pool area with an olympic pool, a kids pool, and an indoor pool. US visitors may find it a bit odd that the pools close early (8pm), but they are very nice, with a bar located by the olympic pool. The indoor pool is adjacent to the olympic pool, and part of the spa complex. We didn't take advantage of the spa services, but did spend a little time in the Amethyst Pool...basicaly a very nice hot tub, and very private. We didn't eat at either of the two restaurants during our stay. We had planned on one night at the rooftop restaurant "Pergola", but a jacket is required for men, and I hadn't packed one. It is supposed to be one of the best in Rome though, so next time I will. Each night after sightseeing we spent some time on the balcony at the Imperial Lounge drinking a glass of wine or champagne and enjoying the late night snacks (which were wonderful). We also had breakfast each day in the lounge. They offer a good selection including bacon and eggs, french toast, a wide variety of fruit, cereal, and pastries. For the more continental tastes there was also prosciutto and a lot of cheeses. Several juices, both fresh and bottles and tea and coffee rounded out the menu. Overall a great breakfast buffet! Lunch and light dinner is also served in the lounge, free of charge for Imperial level guests, and seemed to be sandwiches, pasta salads, fruit, etc. The hotel location is mentioned as a negative by some reviewers, and it is beyond walking distance from the city center, but the hotel has a shuttle which operates to Piazza Barberrini every hour on the :30 mins (9:30, 10:30, etc) and back every hour on the hour. Though we found the hard way that the shuttle takes a little siesta from 1:30-3:30. If the shuttle doesn't fit your plans a taxi is about 12-15 Euro, is safe with no price haggling, and is summoned by the doorman at the push of a button. The shuttle was nice, but we used cabs more frequently for the convenience. The one "issue" mentioned above was on our checkout day. Throughout our stay we noticed that the two elevators were somewhat slow. And as always happens on the last trip down to checkout and make a train reservation our elevator got stuck. We were stuck for over 20 minutes, BUT, stuck with us was the Chief Concierge, Markus. I cannot say enough good about this man. Throughout our time stuck in the elevator he was on his cell phone with the front desk, getting our invoice ready, getting a cab ready, and even gave us his car with instructions to call him if we missed the train and incurred any extra charges to rebook. Once the maintenance man got the doors open on the Third Floor Markus grabbed BOTH of our suitcases and basically ran down the stairs with them. The checkout was VERY fast and apologetic, with an adjustment to the bill for our inconvenience. We were sent on our way with two bottles of water for the cab ride, and their best wishes. We DID make the train with a few minutes to spare, all thanks to the great service from Markus and his staff. Next time we are in Rome we wont hesitate to book into the Cavalieri again, though next time I will pack a jacket.

Reviews.Title: “An absolutely amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: FUNMUM
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights in july after spending a week in tuscany and 3 days in the almafi coast. I have to say that this hotel (despite the extra costs for use of the pool etc.) was a wonderful experience. The staff were extremely friendly, helpful and most spoke English fluently. The food (though pricey) was extremely good. We ate at the Pergola restaurant one night; I had booked this 3 months prior as recommended....an amazing gastonomical experience... Yes, it's a bit of a drag to get to Rome either by Shuttle or by cab, but I appreciated being "out of the thick of things" after spending many hours in 45 degree Centigrade touring Rome. We also booked with the concierge our own tour guide for Vatican...which was fantastic since it gave us automatic admission with no lineups. And the tour guide was extremely knowledgable. I would highly recommend this hotel and hope to return to it again in the future. My only complaint is that I wish we had stayed a week here instead of four days.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful HOTEL, great pool, really pretty view!”
Reviews.Author: Summertraveler74
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Yes you do need a taxi to go into rome, but it is not far, 10-20 Euros each way. Also there is a shuttle you from the hotel that runs quite often that you can use. The breakfast was wonderful. We ate at the restaurant several times and it was very good. The pool is absolutely wonderful, we came back and went swimming every day after touring. Our rooms were beautiful. Be sure and note that Hilton has a family rate, you get the second room half price if you are traveling with kids. Be SURE to ask for it, they do not tell you about it. The rooms were very quiet, they have an inside door you can close. The hotel has great Airconditioning, Important in Rome in the summer! We heard from many friends that they stayed in other hotels where the AC turned off automatically every night at 10pm! So beware of that. It was a great hotel and we would highly recommend it. Our rooms were beautiful. Also it is like any other hotel with a view, if you pay more you get the better view. We chose NOT to pay more, and still had a decent view, just not of the city. We were out touring most of the time anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Just an Upscale Hilton”
Reviews.Author: oslonorwayoslo
Reviews.Content: This is just a modified Hilton. We stayed in two Imperial Rome view rooms and the Imperial Club Lounge is dated like the rest of the hotel and food presentations were of poor quality. Generally food reminded me more of an "Italian" restaurant in the US than Italian dining - except for La Pergola which is of course fabulous and probably the only reason to stay here. The pool and garden area is a nice addition, but are in need of refurbishing like the rest of the hotel. Service is rather poor and it seems the staff members thinks a bit too well of the hotel and themselves.... If you usually stays in Four Seasons Hotels you will be deeply disappointed here - if you ususually stay in Hiltons you will probably be fine...

Reviews.Title: “Great But: Beds too firm, Room had issues”
Reviews.Author: jbhaber
Reviews.Content: I agree with most of the reviews here (first class hotel, great views, expensive extras). I'd also like to add that our room was overlooking the driveway instead of the incredible city of Rome view. We might as well have been staying in an alley way. It was noisy since we hear loud scooters on the road, and the view was ugly as it was directly across the street from a huge communication tower. We NEVER went on the balcony. Thankfully friends of ours invited us to their balcony overlooking the city. But at full price, I feel we did not get our money's worth. The experience was certainly lacking. Also ... The heated towel rack did not work. They explained that since the staff couldn't get in to the rooms directly above and below us, then they couldn't fix it. We also had to call to have our hot water faucet fixed.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: newflyer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is out of the way and a taxi into "town" will cost you about 15-20 euro but it is a beautiful place to stay. My room was really large and very comfy. My terrace didnt have the best view in the world but was really nice none the less. The buffet breakfast, which is included with the room cost, was outstanding, one of the best I have ever experienced. The spa area was beautiful and my masseur really knew what she was doing.

Reviews.Title: “Located Outside of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Anthony03801
Reviews.Content: The hotel is too far from everything in Rome. A taxi or shuttle is needed to do anything. Hotel elevators are not working properly. Very long wait every time. Pool is nice, but extra $. The hotel caters to conventions.

Reviews.Title: “ROME CAVALIERI”
Reviews.Author: petethegreek
Reviews.Content: Amazing Hotel! Great location with views of all of Rome. Service and staff are top notch. Large rooms make it very comfortable. Not in the city center which is very peaceful but only a 10 minute free shuttle ride into city center. Will be back again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!!!”
Reviews.Author: The_good_life048
Reviews.Content: The best hotel I have ever stayed in, perfect and the staff were incredible

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with great view”
Reviews.Author: Jgajk
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel. The rooms and the grounds are perfect and the staff is wonderful. We had a room facing back to the city and the view was incredible. The hotel's shuttle to the downtown area is very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels we've visited. Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: lmg09013
Reviews.Content: Better than photos. Beautiful grounds. Our room was spacious, elegant and comfortable. The view spectacular! A full spa and fitness center. The staff was very friendly. Will stay there again when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “the day it snowed in Rome after 25 years.”
Reviews.Author: ele203
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, fantastic elegant. Great experience staying in cavalieri rome. The dining is fantastic. The breakfast spread great. The rooms are very spacious and you get a great view out of each room. Service is too good. Best collection of fine wine. Although you have to catch a taxi to travel anywhere, but evrything is not too far. Do not miss the true Italian Pizza and wash it down with Grappe. Take your cameras and click the fine paintings and art displayed all over the Hotel and save it for posterity. well in February it is cold , very cold.....but as a bonus we got to see snow in Rome, for the first time in 25 years. Ooooh what an experience staying in the Cavalieri .

Reviews.Title: “Should be in the Top Ten of Hotels in Rome...”
Reviews.Author: grimrater
Reviews.Content: Not sure what I can say that's not already been said. I totally agree with the previous reviewers comments. The Cavalieri is possible the best Hotel I've ever stayed in. We loved coming back to the elegance and comfort of the Hotel after a days sightseeing. We stayed for 5 nights and enjoyed dinner at the Hotel most nights. Our food and wine were always wonderful. We did try to book at the Three Michellin Star restaurant , but had to settle for lovely cocktails and fabulous canapes in the lounge area as the restaurant was fully booked weeks in advance. We hired a car with driver for 5 hours, drove to Tivoli ( there are less expensive ways to get to Tivoli) to visit Hadrian's Villa (Villa Adriana, built AD118) and the famous Tivoli gardens. The visits were fabulous, absolutely worthwhile. We had lunch in Tivoli at a small traditional restaurant, where ' Mama'' made a special pasta dish at my request...never had more beautiful pasta, ever. They have a little Deli next door to their restaurant, you can buy fresh pasta, sauces and cheeses there. I do have one gripe...we hired a car through the Hotel to take us to the Port of Civatavecchia, the price charged was unreasonably high, in fact we paid the same for the one hour drive to the Port as we had done for the 5 hours tour time. We were on our way to board our cruise ship the Azamara Journey, now that's another review...absolutely fantastic 7 night med cruise. Will we be back to the Cavalieri? For sure!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, but not central”
Reviews.Author: Marcia7575
Reviews.Content: The Rome Cavalieri has stunning views (we could see to the Colosseum from our balcony overlooking the Vatican), wonderful rooms, superior dining, and very pleasant staff. However, you cannot walk to anything because it is on the top of a hill. You have to either take a cab or the free shuttle. The shuttle is convenient and takes you to a good location in Rome, but if you have an early morning tour or want a late night in town, you have to take a cab. We thought that since there was nothing close (the hotel is in a residential area) the hotel would have a sundry shop, but no. HOWEVER - the bed was amazing with so many pillows! The rooms had sound and light proofing so we felt we were in our own cocoon! The breakfast was incredible (as Gold members it was our perk and we LOVED it), the grounds are lush and stunning. The bathroom was large and luxurious. Overall a fabulous trip and a wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: pattygoodwoman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this magnificent hotel for 5 nights and it was one of the best, if not the best hotel I have ever visited. The experience at the check in desk was ok but after that it was amazing. Sinicha, the concierge, was extremely pleasant and helpful and quickly arranged the many things we requested from private tours to train tickets. Our room was so comfortable and it took our breath away to walk onto the deck and have room service overlooking the beautiful city of Rome. Nicola, the room service coordinator, was wonderful and made excellent wine suggestions for us. Vincenzo, the bar tender and Guido, were so fun and made us feel welcomed. The breakfast was amazing as they provided everything one could ever want. Their buffet was something I had never seen before. If you want to visit Rome first class, go to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Go First Class”
Reviews.Author: ScottD15
Reviews.Content: The Rome Cavalieri is everything you should expect in a 5 star hotel. Impeccable service, plush rooms, wonderful food and the most spectacular view of Rome you will ever see. The only thing to keep in mind is that its up on a hill (thus the great view) away from everything so be prepared to take a few cabs.

Reviews.Title: “Very Posh and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: NoCompromise
Reviews.Content: Our room was very nice and large. The bathroom was incredible (all marble and we were able to plug in our American electrical devices directly into the outlets). We also had a sitting area and a balcony (which overlooked the cell phone tower -- wasn't expecting that, but then again we didn't pay extra to have a view of the city, so a little disappointed but not surprised either). The best part of our stay was the overall service and access to the Imperial Club lounge. We had breakfast and evening hors d'oevres (lunch was also available, but we were always out sightseeing) sitting out on a terrace that provided breathtaking views of Rome (so, it didn't matter so much that our room overlooked the cell phone tower). There are only 4 tables outside, so you have to be lucky enough to snag one, but the lounge itself is very nice. The staff was friendly and helpful (not snobby at all, which can sometimes be the case at fancier hotels). The biggest negative about this hotel is the location (and that's really depending on whether you want to be away from it all or in the thick of things). It's in a residential area and about a 20-30 minute shuttle ride into town. By the way, we didn't have any issues with the shuttle being overcrowded, but I guess most people go on vacation later in the summer, so I could see how it could be an issue then. For us, it just meant that it was less convenient to go out to dinner in the evening. One night, we went to a local restaurant just down the street and the other nights we just ate at the hotel. Like other reviewers have said: nice, but extremely pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, perfect base after the hussle of Rome”
Reviews.Author: blairk2
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, and my room was large and comfortable. Unfortunately I did not get the Rome view I requested and faced over the main entrance so had a view of a block of flats and a television transmitter! As a Hilton Gold member my wife and I got free breakfast at the restaurant and the range was incredible, one of the best breakfast buffets I have had. We also had access to the lounge on the ground floor. This was light and airy with a selection of food (nothing big but soup and small sandwiches, pastries, etc) and lots of wine, beer and coffee. The lounge also has an outside area so is a good place to have a drink and catch some rays. We were there for four days, and spent most of the time in Rome. We had a couple of tours (booked by the concierge), and they picked us up from the hotel and would drop us in town afterwards. We also took the courtesy bus a couple of times, and when we got a taxi to and from Rome centre it was between 10 and 15 Euros. We did not eat in the hotel but I did not have a bad meal in Rome, and it was not as expensive as I feared (around 12 euro for a plate of pasta) and the house wine was without exception excellent. I used a great place on Via del Lencino at Via del Clementino, the Trattoria del Grotto on Via della Vite (both near Via Conditti, the main shopping street) and a place named ‘La Taverna dei Monti’ on Via del Boschetto. So, in summary, this is a great hotel near the Vatican but which is a short distance outside Rome. This is a good thing to me as it is good to escape the bustle of the City centre. It is expensive, but I managed not to spend money other than cocktails at the bar, which are no dearer than hotels in London. The concierge is happy to help with recommendations and to book tables for you. A great hotel which I will use again.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificant in every way”
Reviews.Author: ATLBob
Reviews.Content: A full review that would adequately do justice to this outstanding property would take several pages to complete. In short, let me just add a few obsevations for your consideration: Breathtaking panomamic views from the private veranda in our room...overlooking romantic Rome, with the Colosseum, Pantheon, Piazza Venezia, and St. Peters Basilica in view. We were fortunate to have captured a rainbow shining down upon the city after a brief shower during our stay--I'll post a picture after I finish downloading the pix from my camera. The beds were comfortable, the bathroom was roomy and well appointed and there was ample closet space. There is an in-room safe. The location is quiet and very private, which is why many athletes/celebrities have chosen to stay here when in the Rome area. We selected this property because it was away from the hustle and bustle of the city, and the hotel shuttle bus provided frequent and convenient drop-off and pickup at centrally located Piazza Barberini, which is only a short walk from the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain. The service was outstanding: At check-in we were escorted to our room so that the hotel could be certain that we were satisfied with the location and view. The conceirge was most helpful with restaurant recommendations and in securing advance reservations to various attractions, like the Vatican museum. Be sure to visit a local neighborhood restaurent/gem--Luciano's (a short walk from the hotel). Enjoy the veal and home made pasta, and tell Antonio that the couple from Atlanta said "hi". Even the doormen provided outstanding service: When the Merdedes-Benz shuttle bus was delayed because it became hopelessly caught in traffic (due to a huge soccer match that night) the hotel paid for individual cabs to take guests to the Piazza Barberini. There is a very convenient Bancomat (ATM Machine) within the hotel, so getting Euros was easy and safe. There is a travel agency office in the hotel: we had them make our train reservations for Florence and Venice. Immaculate grounds, pools, common areas, prompt/polite service and beautiful artwork helped make our stay very special. The daily breakfast buffet was elaborate and delicious---can you ever really have too much cappuccino and Prosecco in the morning? The executive lounge was always well attended and well stocked with terrific beverage selections (did I mention the Prosecco?) and tasty small bites/desserts and a variety of coffee/tea/expresso drinks. Make no mistake, this isn't a 'value' experience: A Waldorf-Astoria hotel provides world class service at a price, but for our 25th anniversary Italian adventure, it was well worth every Euro. We plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Best Ever”
Reviews.Author: ElizaDoolittleADam
Reviews.Content: We spent our Easter Break in Rome and stayed at the Hilton Cavalieri. Since we arranged it by Hilton Club, we stayed at the Imperial floor with a special rate. Breakfast, lunch, light snacks and drinks are served all day in a huge Imperial Club room. The private balconies were overlooking all of Rome and the panoramic view was amazing! The hotel is located a little away from the old town of Rome, closer to Vatican City, but cabs and hotel shuttle service were available.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: CCCCardiff
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything that you could possibly want....it was clean, the rooms were amazing, we had the most beautiful view of Rome, the spa & outside pool were both great, the staff were lovely, it really was a fantastic experience staying there. There was nothing I could fault about the hotel the only things I would keep an eye out for are:- The shuttle bus does not run between about 1pm & 4pm, the nearest tube is only 5 euros is a cab. The hotel is quite a way out of town which is more than compensated for by the views & grounds. Drinking/eating there is very very pricey!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel and View in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Davekate24
Reviews.Content: JUst returned from 5 days at the Hilton Cavalieri. Top of the line, You must have the money to afford the Imperial suites and your breakfast, lunch, light snacks drinks etc are served all day in a huge Imperial room for guests with private balconies overlooking all of Rome. Spectacular. Away from the din of Rome but a short 10 min cab or hotel provided shuttle. The beds and pillows are the best we ever slept in and we thought we owned the best. Measl are expensive but this a a 5 star hotel. Eat at the 3 star La Pergola once for effect or the MIrable ( Hotel Spendid) Plaza Navonna,s side street reastaurant was the best and inexpensive Restaurant Plaza Notte. side street.. Long lines but woth every penny. Best calamari we ever had and we love calamari.

Reviews.Title: “Eternal memories of the Eternal City”
Reviews.Author: cozkitty
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rome Cavalieri in late Nov for 3 nights pre cruise, used our hilton points, we are gold, & were treated to a gorgeous view of the city from our balcony. Teriffic buffet breakfast; the server went out of his way to make us feel welcome, made a special chocolate waffle for me! this is a hotel we will return to, will save our points to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING VIEW and excellent food!”
Reviews.Author: ilvshoeslane
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the highlights of our trip. The breakfast was the best I have ever had a Hilton and the Executive Lounge had great food and wine. Our room had an amazing view of Rome along with a private balcony. This hotel is great for kids and has wonderful pools and spa. The bed was amazing! The service was great and went out of their way to make our stay great. They even helped us find a great local bar when everything was closed on Sunday night. It was perfect!! I cannot wait to stay here again soon. The art within the hotel was very impressive and really set a great stage for visiting historic Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with Bad Manager”
Reviews.Author: jkrums8
Reviews.Content: Manager was very rude when speaking to him about getting services. Almost a sense of entitlement on his part. Wanted to get wifi access that did not cost an arm and a leg and was told that that's too bad and they can not accommodate me at all. Then got a lecture about how that the way things work here. I did not think they cared if I stayed or left... Was there when Football and Tennis stars were guests. I'm sure they did not have the same issues with him. So if you are an international athlete you should have no issues. I would not stay here again. Much better to find a place in Rome and be able to walk every where.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaSweetpea
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Rome Cavalieri for two nights of our honeymoon. The hotel is absolutely amazing! The entire staff was wonderful, the hotel is pristine and the views are breathtaking. Although it is far from the city center, the hotel provides a shuttle with hourly service. I would travel to Rome just to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely interiors but not worth it”
Reviews.Author: horses_and_dogs
Reviews.Content: I had booked a King Deluxe room with a "city/garden view" in Feb for our babymoon holiday in early April. I had booked through hotels.com and got a great rate. As my booking said "city/garden view" and the hotel boasted of acres of mediterranean gardens - I expected just that and would have been happy with either view. I had emailed the hotel a month in advance to inform them of our special occasion and that I wanted a good room as per my booking. However, when we checked in, I found that I had neither a city nor a garden view - I had a view of a residential apartment building and a TV transmission tower (see attached photos). If I had known that while booking the hotel, I would never have done it. When I objected to the view, they said that city view rooms were all booked out and that they had put in a request for a room change the next day for a garden view room. The next day the receptionist told me that my request was tantamount to an upgrade request for which I would have to pay an extra 75 Euros per night - which I was unwilling to do. Rather than start an argument during our Babymoon, I chose to write this review and never to return to that hotel again. Furthermore, as a Hilton Honors member, I had given a preference for a high floor and they told me that they have non-smoking rooms only on the 3rd floor - this is the lowest floor with any rooms on it. So I neither got the view I paid for nor a high floor. Contrary to what the hotel's website says (1400 yards from the Vatican City etc) - the hotel is miles away from everywhere. You will find yourself chasing the shuttle to/from the city all the time. If you want to hang around downtown / in Central Rome after sunset, you would have to get a cab back (approx 20 Euros) as the last shuttle leaves at 8 pm from town. Moreover, the shuttles are popular and even if we queued up 15 mins before departure, we were still not guaranteed a seat - it's cramped, crowded and not frequent enough. I would hate to be there in high season and try to get the shuttle. If you want to enjoy Rome without worrying about logistics to ferry you to/from the centre of town, choose another hotel. The pool closes at 10 pm too - so if you come back after a long day of sight seeing and want to relax after dinner in the sauna etc - you better hurry up as they shut off everything by 10 pm. We could never use our balcony because of the view and had to stand and look at a 70 - 90 degree angle to view any kind of garden. Finally, all prices in the hotel are horrendously expensive even by 5 star standards - and the service levels (especially of the Reception staff) need an overhaul - I say, send them to Asia to understand what true 5 star service levels are like!

Reviews.Title: “VERY VERY NICE INDEED”
Reviews.Author: ChristineGrisel
Reviews.Content: The outside of the hotel isn’t anything special at all but inside it’s quite delightful. Not modern like the Hilton hotels but not as luxurious as the Ritz for example. It was built in the early ‘60’s and doesn’t yet have a “soul” to it. Beautiful statues and paintings everywhere. We stayed for 3 nights at the Imperial Club, on 8th floor (Room 857) with a private lift for the Imperial guests. Throughout our whole stay there, I found the personnel to be most helpful, courteous and friendly. The room was lovely with a magnificent view over Rome and the enormous outdoor swimming pool, from the balcony. The rooms on the other side though only had a view onto the front of the hotel, (nothing special) or else an ugly satellite tower. There were two small complimentary bottles of water each day and a lovely little box of (2) chocolates each evening. The bed and bedding were very comfortable and big. The toiletries were of a high quality and for once, I’m looking to buy the same brand. They were replaced generously everyday The hairdryer actually dried my hair but the weighing scales didn’t work. I didn’t bother to ask for new batteries for them. From 7am to 11pm in the Imperial Lounge there were complimentary light snacks, non alcoholic drinks, desserts, white wine, Beefeater, Vodka and Martini. If you’re a light eater, you won’t need to eat out but if you’re not, you will find this is not enough even though you can serve yourself to as much as you want. It’s not a restaurant. Nevertheless, the food was really delicious and of a high quality. The Imperial Lounge is only for the Imperial Club guests, (special card and lift) which I was rather dreading at first imagining all sorts of old snobs, but it was really wonderful and a huge plus to our stay. It’s rather cozy and never crowded, with comfortable sofas and warmly decorated. Newspapers and magazines are available. At most I saw about over a dozen people at a time. Meals can be taken on the balcony equally. On a warm evening, with Rome all lit up, it’s absolute heaven with a glass of champagne! I felt very special indeed at the Imperial Club. The complimentary shuttle bus left every hour but most of the time, rather than wait, the doorman called us a taxi immediately (about 8 euros into town). It’s true we spent a lot on taxis but rather than wait for the shuttle bus to arrive either at the hotel or from the centre, it was faster to get a taxi. On Easter Sunday, we had beautiful chocolate Easter eggs awaiting us in our room. They were so beautiful we asked for them to be put into a box to take home to the children but unfortunately we had to break them into pieces as the plastic box was too small. I took advantage of this & tasted a piece and the chocolate was really good. The outside swimming pool is gigantic and the inside one is open ‘till quite late. The spa is really good. The gym is quite extraordinary. I’ve never seen one so big with so much equipment. Due to lack of time, we didn’t use the gym or any of the massage treatments. The shuttle runs from 8.30 to the city centre and last pick up from the centre to the hotel is 8pm. We were always tired at the end of the day and preferred to go back to the hotel to the spa, and for a swim rather than eat out late. We probably would have done that if the hotel weren’t so far from the centre (a 40 minute walk downhill) but as we ate in the restaurants at lunchtime every day, we had just a light snack in the evening at the hotel, which sufficed. All in all, a fantastic experience in Rome highlighted by the stay at the Cavalieri hotel, with the Imperial Club.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, loved it, loved it........but you need deep pockets.”
Reviews.Author: Slugnet
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights here just before Easter and we loved it. I was sorry to leave. The staff are not just attentive and efficient but positively charming. That's rare in Rome. Our room was large, clean, nicely decorated with sufficient room for a sofa bed, chair and coffee table. The bed was large, maybe 7ft wide, and comfortable. Bathroom was a good size and covered in marble. All rooms have a good size balcony with chairs. Be aware that views of Rome cost more (extra 75Euro) but the view is amazing - the whole of Rome! Other rooms have views of the car park or hotel grounds. There are no general viewing areas, that we could find, to enjoy the stunning view. The hotel is about a mile from town but the shuttle is good. It stops at Piazza Barberini by the Metro stop. A taxi to St Peters was about 8 Euro's. This hotel can't really be beaten in Rome for it's outside facilities. It has large outdoor swimming pools, attractive grounds, a spa and indoor pool(we didn't use it). Breakfast by the pool was lovely. I have one big gripe about this hotel though. The price of food and drink was expensive. 8euro's for a small bottle of water or coke. 24 euro's for a nicely presented bowl of pasta. There are some shops in the foyer but, you guessed it, no drinks. The mini-bar fridge is too small to put your own bottle in but there is an ice machine on each floor. Breakfast was nice but try and get an inclusive deal otherwise it's 38Euro each. The Sunday brunch looked amazing and was very popular with Italian families. Book in advcance. Despite my price gripe I really loved this place and was very sorry to leave. We also stayed at Hotel 47 for two nights and have reviewed that separately. Both hotels were good within there categories but the Cavalieri is far more luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely one of the best hotel stays we've ever had!”
Reviews.Author: mjonesmaine
Reviews.Content: From the time we checked in until we left, absolutely everything was thought of! The accommodations were beautiful, they presented a special dessert for my wife's birthday, and breakfast was fantastic! The shuttle bus into town was a bit tricky (missed it by 30 seconds one time, saw it drive away, and had to take a taxi - our fault). Other guests told us there is municipal bus service into town, but we never needed to take it. The Executive Lounge offered a good selection of food and beverages.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay. Thoroughly enjoyed this hotel's comforts.”
Reviews.Author: JRDTexas18
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and loved every minute of it. The room and bathroom is spacious and luxurious. Decorated tastefully and immaculately clean. We had a wonderful view of Rome from our balcony and were able to sit out in the evening and enjoy it. The bed was like sleeping on a cloud, slippers and robes for use, chocolates on the pillow every night. A few of the nights we were even left other treats, like a fruit plate and big bottle of still water. My husband is a Hilton diamond member, so those may have been left because of that. There was also a lounge on the first floor for all guests that had complimentary food and drinks, including wine and champagne. The only downside was that the hotel is about 20 min away from the heart of Rome. But don't let that detour you from staying here-they have a complimentary hotel shuttle that drops off and picks up from Barberini Piazza about every hour so it wasn't bad at all.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel...little far from the city...hotel makes up for distance!”
Reviews.Author: PeaceInTraveling
Reviews.Content: All I can say is wow! This hotel is really nice...very $$$ too so be prepared to spend alot of money of you choose to dine here. A cola in the mini bar was 8E...yikes! Overall, this hotel is beautiful. The rooms are huge and decorated very nice. We had a balcony room with a view of the city....was absolutely gorgeous (Room 565). Only problem was that we only had two days to sight see so did not get to spend much time in the hotel. There is an amazing indoor and outdoor pool and the fitness center was really nice. If you have some time to spend in Rome outside of sight-seeing....than this is the place. You could easily spend days at this hotel and not ever see Rome and be happy. But, if you are there to sight-see it is a little distance away. There is a hotel shuttle bus that was pretty easy and uneventful. If you miss the bus there or back don't sweat it...the hotel is an easy cab ride away and was about 10E one way. We walked one day to the Vatican and it took about 45 minutes from the hotel. Bottom line...if you have money to burn and want days of relaxation outside of sight-seeing than stay here. If you are only sight-seeing....and have to pay for your hotel (we used our Hilton points so stayed for free---would do it again even with the distance as the hotel was amazing) maybe not...unless you have money to burn. Don't even think about eating here unless you have ALOT of money to burn. Is very $$$. There is nothing around this hotel as far as restaurants go. It is in a residential neighborhood. So, your eating will take place in Rome. Be sure to bring some 2-liters and snacks with you or else you will be spending a pretty penny at the mini-bar! :):)

Reviews.Title: “La Dolce Vità!!! it starts here, when you smell the Jasmines in February.”
Reviews.Author: Shahbanoe
Reviews.Content: I don't know where to start, but I should better ask you to stop looking for any other hotel for a stay in Rome, the Eternal City, if you happen to stumble upon this hotel and these reviews. I can describe myself as a real seasoned traveller, one with an exceptional taste for luxuary and thurst for anything and everything that is NOT tacky and extra ordinary and always have to find out myself if a place or food etc is good or bad and never pay much of attention to that what other might say.
