I judge things independently and based on factors that might not be important to others. Waldorf Astoria Cavalieri is absolutely a great hotel. One I can best describe as a place woven in the history of the city of Rome, where in its early days of the 60's and 70's many famous celebrities did stay, did hold great parties and sang beautiful songs and still to this day, although this hotel has become old, but still it does feel different and one of those few places that breaths history and has become a landmark on itself, yet capable of holding to its tradition of excellent service and attentiveness towards its guests and people of all ages, degree's and background. I recently stayed here using their January Sale promotion with an upgrade request to a delux or Imperial room with Rome views. 2 hours before my flight departure, I found out that Imperial rooms with Rome view are not available but I could stay at an Imperial room with a residential view. I objected and asked for assistance. The reservation staff (Christine) was very helpful and right before boarding she told me that I will be appointed a delux king room with Rome view which I accepted. The front desk staff were so helpful and so kind and fast. They give each new guest, first visitor a private tour around this hotel personally and once the check-in is proceeded and they do take their job seriously and make sure each guest, no matter how famous or not, feels welcomed and extra ordinary. Once in the room, She told us that since I couldn't have the Imperial room with their Aqua di Parma toiletteries, they have replaced their Evelyn & Crabtree products with Aqua di Parma during my whole stay which was such a pleasant surprise and the views!!! WOW , that is all I can say about that. The rooms are spacious, very quiet, very airy, feels homey and the beds are really heavenly and there is absolutey nothing missed out or left unnoticed except for an iPhone or iPad docking station which should/would be fun to have placed in each room. The bathroom was spacious too and very well equipped and in fact is the most " American" hotel I 've come across during my trips in Europe. Even for women like me who does wear make-up and pay attention to the comfort and fun while putting up make-up, they have special desks available with seats in the bathroom which isn't the case in almost 99% of European hotels. The bell boy, concierges, the front desk staff, the business center, the bars both Imperial lounge with its excellent high tea service at 16:00 PM and the one at the lavish and colorful lobby and everybody else is so attentive, so friendly and most of them just know to call you by name. I called the roomservice and they didn't ask for my name, but spelled and called it correctly and so well done. Room Service was excellent and fast, I ordered hamburgers and one of the best hamburgers and fries I ever ate was at this hotel plus those off course across USA and Canada. The breakfast is legendary. There are more than enough choices and such a variety and everything is really freshly made and really nothing nothing is left out. They even offer Japanese and Chinese goodies for Asian travellers while having their breakfast and for children a large variety of cereals and other goodies are included and all that again included in the price of the hotel room and off course the staff is again so very friendly and remembers each and every guest and greets you personally. I also did eat at the restaurant on my first night and both the quality and service were excellent. I ordered minestrone soup and was suprised to have my very first and only really freshly and home made Minestrone soup in years at an Hotel and as for breakfast I asked whether they had my favorite which wasn't so I decided not to order a dessert but the staff did surprise me with a big smile when I was waiting for my tea as they somehow had managed to prepare my favorite dessert in secret and it felt like a huge victory to them to surprise me with that which it was. My first night did begin so really enjoyable and fun. There is a shop in the hotel where those with a good taste can buy beautiful shoes and Italian designer goodies for discounted prices and if you don't have time to go on shopping or can not take much of luggage with you, don't worry and the shop owner will gladly be there to help you personally with an outfit and all that designer stuff for a very very low price of sometimes up to 80% discount. I even found DeSquared brands in there! You won't be disappointed. This hotel also offers a large collection of paintings and tapistry all around its lobby, the conference center, the lounges and many corridors and hallways you enter which is really fun to just hang around in the hotel and do nothing else but to enjoy. Furthermore, the quality of each and every service is truly unique and so really Italian. Stylish, tasteful and excellent. La Dolca Vita!!! that begins at Cavalieri. This hotel is located on a hiltop close to Vatican city and offers really beautiful amazing vista's and views over the eternal city which is specially so romantic at night. The hotel is surrounded by a large park and many Cypresses and Palm trees and its Swimming pool is of a reasonable and large size and all around the poolside there are different lounges, terraces and cafe's and places to relax and one can also walk around the gardens and smell the jasmines, palm trees, azalia's and enjoy lemon trees with lemons, Olive trees, really many of them all around this hotel full of olives, while looking at Rome in the distant and the Saint Peter basilica very close to the hotel. And when the sun does shine which is almost everyday, this hotel offers the best place to start your relaxing fun day, wake up, enjoy a good tea/coffee with complimantary cookies and home made pastry, soak up sunshine, hear the music and get ready to go out and explore the city in STYLE! They offer a free Shuttle service to Piazza Barberini where the famous statue of Triton by Bernini is located that immediately makes your holiday being one of an exceptional one and if you don't have time to get the shuttle to/from hotel/city, don't worry as a taxi will only cost you € 11,- max to both Piazza del Popolo or Barberini as well as right to the heart of Saint Peter Piazza/Vatican and even less to the enterance of Vatican Museum. So, why take the shuttle when a limousine with handsome helpful experienced taxi drivers can take you anywhere you want! I also enjoyed a relaxing massage at the Spa which offers various treatments and the staff is pro-actievely thinking and helping you with a schedule and treatments. It can be pricey but surely worth trying and value for the money. Don't skip it and otherwise at least try to relax at its Turkish baths and hot/indoor spa facilities. Overal impression: This hotel is absolutely a gem. Each woman will be treated like a Sofia Loren or a GinaloloBrigitta and all men like an Al Bano. ... Don't waste your time looking for a place in the historic center of the city which is also so small and easily accesible on walk and located all close to each other and avoid noise and sleazy hotels and start your visit to this beautiful city in elegance, style and lavish green parks and amazing views of the city that only is laid there in front of you to welcome you into this exciting city! All I can say is again: ... wherever you go and do in and around this hotel, you will only hear music in your head ... Peppino Gagliardi 's " Come le Viole" or " T'ame e T'amero" or Al Bano's " Bianca di Luna" ... is all here and makes you feel " A STAR" ! ENJOY!!!

Reviews.Title: “exquisite place”
Reviews.Author: LilianaN1
Reviews.Content: my best hotel ever. splendid place, top services, pools, SPA perfect imperial breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: nunciano
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was wonderful. On a hill over looking city of Rome. The view in the evening was spectacular!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning views and beautiful gounds, but just outside the city”
Reviews.Author: LA996
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on TA, I ended up staying here while my wife was on a business trip. I have to say that the majority of the negative items written about this hotel seemed like non-issues to me. Of course all the room service and extras are going to be expensive...as long as you know that going into it, then it's not a problem. I just picked up some drinks and snacks just outside the hotel, so it wasn't an issue. Anyone who would complain about not being able to get a table at their highly Michelin rated restaurant must not be familiar with eating at Michelin rated restaurants. The hotel is definitely out of the way, but I used the hotel shuttle service everyday without any problems. Just make sure you get in line 15min early to get a seat. There's even a restaurant in walking distance if you don't want to go into the town. The incredible city view from our balcony made it all worth it. The two red clay tennis courts were fantastic. I booked a hitting partner and as a tennis enthusiast, this was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Imperial Club Clearly The Best In Rome”
Reviews.Author: dsweet
Reviews.Content: While I cannot claim to have stayed in all of the top Rome hotels, business has taken me to many of them over the years - De Russie, Eden, Grand Flora, Excelsior among them. I just completed a two night stay at the Cavlieri on the Imperial Club floor, and believe it to be the best in Rome. The Imperial Club itself is terrific, and I can see why Hilton top stayers complain about the fact that they are no longer upgraded there. On the other hand, this change has corrected one of the two problems in previous Cavalieri stays - the Imperial Club had been too crowded, and the Hotel is not in town. The Imperial Club is no longer overcrowded, and this change has resulted in significant service improvement.Morning coffee is now at your table in an instant. The food was always terrific, and remains incredible. Where else in Rome can you get a toasted bagel, smoked salmon and cream cheese for breakfast? Five food services are presented each day in the club, and I have not seen a rival for the food and service excellence here outside of Asia! My room had an amazing 7 hill view, from a patio which (despite the cold weather) presented the view beautifully. The bed was very comfortable, and a top sheet and face cloths were present without the need for a request (unusual for Rome). Shower and heating/air conditioning worked very well. The room also had a feature that I have not encountered in hundreds, perhaps thousands, of hotel stays. There is a second interior soundproofed mirrored door, between the main door and the bathroom entrance, that can be closed and that completely eliminates hotel corridor noise. Every traveller has been woken at one time or another by early morning door slams. Not on the Imperil floor of the Cavalieri. The location of the facility offers the aforementioned view, but also means that you need to take the shuttle bus or a cab into town. This is inconvenient, but the plusses of the hotel clearly outweigh this 15minute ride. Because I wanted to be near the place of business visited, I also stayed at the De Russie in the same week. It is hard to measure up to the De Russie in terms of the quality of service, but at least for my stay, the Cavalieri did. The pool and spa facilites also appeared to be at a best in rome level.

Reviews.Title: “The Only Place to Stay During a Roman Summer”
Reviews.Author: kiwinick81
Reviews.Content: The Cavalieri in Rome is certainly not the latest and greatest hotel. The lobby looks, on first inspection, rather dated and a little bit like a throwback to the 1970s. The hotel's website really plays up its strengths and the slightly faded glory of the building can come as a bit of a surprise. However, once you get past the first impression the Cavalieri really holds its own as a truly Five star experience. The service was excellent and the rooms are very luxurious, with lovely bedding and Acqua di Parma toiletries. Definitely stay on the Imperial Club floor if you can, the club room and concierge are excellent and a good place to start the day, or to have a drink before you head out at night. The Cavalieri is a little bit further out of town, but the upshot of this location high on a hillside above the city is the beautiful view - it is worth making sure that you request a room that looks out across the city. But clearly if you are just in Rome to shop you might be better at one of the hotels right in the heart of town. The Cavalieri does offer a shuttle which makes the short journey into the city pretty painless. The greatest draw of this hotel is the wonderful outdoor Olympic sized pool, in the middle of summer when the temperatures routinely touch 40 degrees this is the best place in Rome to be. There were many chic Romans and a few well known Hollywood stars lounging by the pool which helps create a very exclusive atmosphere. There is also a wonderful indoor pool, gym, spa complex. The food in the hotel was excellent, the restaurant on the terrace above the pool was really Michelin star quality. Not to be missed are the fabulous buffet breakfasts and the Sunday lunch buffet which was among the best I have seen in many years staying in the world's best hotels. The restaurant service was similarly excellent. If you are price sensitive it is worth noting that all this luxury certainly doesn't come cheap, but its certainly worth it. We had friends who opted to stay at the Westin Excelsior but who ended up at our hotel for the majority of the stay because they were so won over by its charms and facilities. This hotel really does have something a bit magic about it - the bricks and mortar are nothing special but the service and location make for a wonderful, relaxing, decadent Roman experience.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect”
Reviews.Author: AlkiGreece
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights, a family of four with two young kids. We had two interconnecting rooms with city view. We absolutely loved this hotel. The rooms were beautiful, the service great, the breakfast was one of the biggest and with most variety I have ever seen in a hotel. The gym was also one of the best, with great equipment and free fitness classes. The indoor pool tended to get overcrowded but I guess that with warm weather, with the two outdoor pools this will not be an issue. We spent new year's eve there, and the menus were really expensive, so we ate in our rooms, but this was still great cause we had all of Rome in our feet and watched all the amazing fireworks that started from 11pm and the whole spectacle was breathtaking. There's a shuttle bus at the hotel, and this makes really easy reaching the center of the city. Also there's a great tratoria, da Luciano's, ten minutes walking from the hotel, so at night you don"t have to go to the city again. The only slight inconvenience we faced, was that although I was quoted free breaksfast when I booked the rooms, when we went to actually eat we were told that the breakfast was not included. And although I talked to the reservations person that had told me that, she didn't remember it and we would have to pay 75 euros every day to eat breaksfast. Thank God, my husband had his computer with him and I found the e-mail sent to me with the whole offer and after I forwarded it to them the whole thing was cleared. All in all, if you can afford it I absolutely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: JimRD
Reviews.Content: ...but Rome has so much to do we spent very little time at the hotel, just there to sleep. Very convenient to Vatican City. Walk down the hill towards the city and visit the coffee shops (espresso doppio!)

Reviews.Title: “Don't forget your passport on the way out”
Reviews.Author: HopAlot9
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in December 2009. The rooms are fantastic, plush and with a spectacular view of Rome. The "business" internet service was the fastest I have ever used. I liked everything but the checkout process....At check-out they took my passport, but at check-out they didn't remind me to retrieve it. I almost left the hotel leaving it behind.

Reviews.Title: “Nice.”
Reviews.Author: SandraGarcia2009
Reviews.Content: It was nice, elegant and charming. Only the noise was a problem a few times but i think it was because of the groups staying there. I really liked it! The staff was very charming and helpful...!

Reviews.Title: “don't waste your money its a conference centre, typical of city hotels.”
Reviews.Author: yasali
Reviews.Content: We had to wade through hundreds of people to get to the restaurant in the morning where breakfast was being served. We couldn't book the restaurant la peregola in the hotel as there is a MONTH waiting list, personally i think paying guests should have first priority!! We had to pay £20 each to use in indoor swimming pool again should be complementary to all paying guests, nice hotel shame about the service,

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: NagsHeadNcUsaJake
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Pricey. Has all the bells and whistles. The best executive lounge I have ever experienced. A little out of the way, but great views over looking Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TomB10
Reviews.Content: Great hotel...great service. Restaurants are good but fairly expensive in USD$. Shuttle service was on time & convenient to a couple of key drop off points in the city. Beautiful overlook of the city. Ask for the city view vs the radio tower view on the front side of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rome Cavelleri Hilton previously - Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: Rnfoxy1
Reviews.Content: Splurged on this hotel. Good choice after 30 hours enroute. It was beautiful. Staff warm, personable and efficient. Room had sitting area plus balcony with table, chairs with nice view of the city and Vatican dome. Great restaurants. The front of the hotel does not do the interior justice. Large open and inviting lobby with cocktail lounge without walls. with cozy couches and chairs, ideal for mingling surrounded by original art from 16th century. Grounds are impeccable. Hotel is a bit off the beaten path but shuttle service from hotel to palazzio near Spanish Steps and Via Veneto is complimentary. Did not use spa facilities. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quality but slightly overprized”
Reviews.Author: DelanoX
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect but it's extremely expensive. It's a bit far from the center

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay”
Reviews.Author: Parisbound08
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at the Rome Cavalieri the week before Christmas using Hilton Honor rewards. Since we had plenty of time to explore and enjoy the city, we didn't mind the location at all. It was actually pleasant to have a nice quite place to relax away from the pace and noise in the city. If the weather was warm, we would have really enjoyed all of the outdoor seating and facilities. We didn't use the shuttle as often as we probably should have but it is an easy way to get back and forth. Taxi was an average of 10-15 euro each way, depending on the traffic. We were upgraded to a corner suite which was just wonderful. I especially enjoyed the massage chair in the room. The furniture and artwork is beautiful. The rooms are very quiet and they also have electronic shutters that keep the room totally dark. The bed was very nice and they offer a full pillow menu as well. I'm not sure if it was because we are Diamond members, were staying in a suite or because we were celebrating a special occassion but almost every night they would bring either a fruit plate and champagne, a tray of pastry, a "congratulations" torte or bottles of wine. We were treated very well by everyone. We were given access to the Imperial room which we used a couple times each day for morning coffee and breakfast as well as evening cocktails and appetizers. It was quiet and elegant with comfortable seating and balconies overlooking the city below.They also have free internet access in the lounge but you do need to show your passport. They also gave us access to the Spa which was beautiful. A nice way to relax and unwind after walking around the city all day. We did have dinner at the hotel twice, once was at La Pergola. It is considered the finest in Rome. The food, presentation and service was excellent but the prices are over the top. Had it not been a special occassion, I would have never considered it but it was memorable. We have stayed in many fine hotels in Europe and I would say this was one of our favorites.

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Way to Finish Our Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: HLarson3
Reviews.Content: We used my Hilton points to reward ourselves with two nights at the Rome Cavalieri at the end of our honeymoon and are glad we did! Having never stayed at a five-star hotel, we were a bit nervous, but the staff at the Cavalieri made us feel right at home with great service and hospitality. Our room was huge, quiet, well-appointed, comfortable, and we had a beautiful view of the city and the hotel pool from our balcony. After staying the first few days at a Bed and Breakfast, this hotel made our honeymoon feel more luxurious! We were able to access the Colosseo lounge which had a great selection of drinks and a few light snacks at all times, though we were carefully policed that we did not remove any food or drink from the lounge, which was a bit disheartening. We were also given access to the breakfast buffet in the mornings for free, which was the most impressive I have ever seen. The location is a definite “downer” for those that are on a mission to see a lot of the city, since the shuttle bus times aren’t the most convenient, and it is a sold half-hour ride to and from the hotel. Since we had spent the beginning of our honeymoon doing quite a bit of sightseeing, we didn’t mind so much, as this forced us to relax and enjoy our stay a bit more. Being that this is a five-star hotel, expect to be amply charged for any amenities, which is also a complaint, but I am assuming that this is typical for many hotels in the “luxury” range. All in all, we enjoyed our stay and were very comfortable. I can't afford to pay full price for this hotel, and don't know if it is really worth the price, but it’s a great way to use up some of those reward points.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: flashforwardTexas
Reviews.Content: Yes, there's a stunning view and beautiful grounds but there's A LOT to be desired. The building was constructed, I think, in the 70's and completely lacks atmosphere. The staff wasn't welcoming and since the hotel is trapped at the hilltop outside of downtown it's $30 for a horrible fillet-o-fish-like sandwich downstairs or $300 for an exquisite meal upstairs...unless you want to spend all of your time commuting. To add insult to injury they tack on extra charges for EVERYTHING.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but good service and a good view make this a real treat”
Reviews.Author: BrynyJany
Reviews.Content: We booked a deluxe Rome-view room, and prepaid for three nights at 385 euros a night with a buffet breakfast included in the package. We arranged a Mercedes pick-up from the airport, and that was a fantastic way to arrive in Rome. The drive was quick, comfortable and hassle-free. The first thing we noticed about the room was its stunning view over the city of Rome. St. Peter's Basilica was a stretch to the far right of our view, and the rest of the city flowed around to the left. The Colesseum could be spotted in the distance. Sunset was especially nice! The room itself was standard for a five-star hotel - very clean, well-maintained with good equipment. Toiletries were Crabtree & Evelyn. Worth noting was a sound-proof door that you can pull close to keep hallway sound in the hall. The balcony was small and the paint was peeling – the exterior of the hotel is a bit worn. The minibar was extraordinarily expensive, at least compared to our usual experiences in Australian hotels. 12 euros for a beer. 10 euros for a 100gms of nuts. Normally we don’t hesitate cracking open a drink when we arrive at a hotel, but this time we had to pass. There were, though, complimentary small bottles of water. We had room service a number of times during our stay. The service was quick and excellent, and the presentation was immaculate. The food was ok, though food is never quite as good through room service as it is in the restaurant. A real treat, though, were the wonderful petite fours that came with each service. In fact, with all the little extras that come with the room service, while it is quite expensive, it also feels as if they’ve spared no expense. We wanted to book into La pergola, the 3 Michelin star restaurant at the hotel, but it was fully booked. Booking well ahead is probably essential. The buffet breakfast was another real treat. There was a very wide selection of foods and drinks (including champagne) to choose from. The service was also pleasant. We rate the breakfast as one of the best we’ve seen in a long time and were happy that we had included it in our room package. The menu price for the buffet breakfast was 38 euros per person. The hotel is a fair distance from Rome city. We used the shuttle bus to visit Rome on Day 1, and then a taxi to the Vatican on Day 2. The shuttle bus was comfortable and quick (about 15 minutes). It ran every hour to Piazza Barberini in the morning and late afternoon/evening. The taxi to the Vatican Museum cost about 8 euros. As we left the hotel, we noticed that some work was starting. An elevator shaft was closed for renovations, the pool was emptied, and some rooms were being openly renovated on our (fifth) floor. However, this didn’t affect our stay. Finally, it is worth noting that the service was exceptional. We came to Rome after only hearing horror stories about service, but the Cavalieri staff were a wonderful team. We tipped accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel Outside Heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Jammop
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms are amazing. There are several things that stood out: a sound proof door to block out noise from the hallway, automatic shutters on the balcony windows, a heated towel rack and a breathtaking view of Rome. The bathroom is all marble and very spacious--even included a vanity area. The outdoor pool and tennis courts looked great for the summer months. Aside from the rooms, there were a few things that could have improved upon and that I wish I knew about prior to my stay: 1) Space is limited on the shuttle bus to town. It was quite stressful (running / pushing) to get on the bus. Guests start lining up 10 minutes before the departure time. The taxis from the hotel to the city are about 15-20 euros. 2) The conceirge directed us to bars and restaurants that were closed and misinformed us about a taxi stand option. Extremely disappointing. 3) The hotel was undergoing construction that began at 8am each morning. 4) The HHonors lounge provides very limited drinks and snacks. The lounge is heavily monitored and the employees will stop you if you try to take any item out of the lounge--it was pretty annoying and unnecessary. As a Diamond member, you should be able to take a bottle of water or diet coke . This is the first hotel that I have been subject to such a ridiculous policy. 5) If you are arriving from FCO airport, it is much easier to take a cab rather than the train--you will also be closer to the hotel. 6) There is an on-site travel agency that will book and print out Eurail tickets--very convenient! Overall, I definitely recommend the hotel for a relaxing, luxurious stay in Rome, especially if using HHonors points.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tankle1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely - it is outside of Rome, about a 20 minute cab ride. They do have a freee shuttle but it isn't that convenient. the rooms are lovely - be sure to ask to be on the Rome side of the hotel - we had a balcony with a view of Rome. Amazing. The hotel had a great fitness center and monring breakfast. Definitely pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dakota1114
Reviews.Content: This was one of the finest hotels that my wife and I have ever stayed in. Saying it is First class does not do it justice. It is that and more. We took the option of the buffet breakfast each morning and that truly is an event. There is such a variety and the restaurant staff is very attentive. The view from our room was incredible. We ask to have a city view which cost more but was well worth it. We dined one night at La Pergola and had the best meal I have ever had. Expensive, yes and worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the best hotel in Europe.”
Reviews.Author: ynysygwas
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my 50th birthday. Certainly the nicest and most expensive place I've stayed. It's the first hotel that's ever made me wish I was a millionaire just so I could return again and again! The place just oozes top quality. A 'touch of class' certainly applies to the Cavalieri. St Peter's and the Colosseum visible from the room and fantastic night views. Located on a hill overlooking the city. Not in walking distance but there was a free shuttle service provided by the hotel. Unfortunately we did not have access to the executive lounge as some football team was staying there for an European cup tie with Roma. Another reason to hate Man. Utd! But I suppose if it was good enough for Sir Alec Ferguson then it was certainly good enough for poor old me! A very nice touch was finding a birthday cake in my room on the day I was 50. Nothing to do with my wife so obviously someone had noticed my date of birth when we checked in and provided a very nice free treat. It showed fantastic attention to detail. Expensive but if ever the cliche 'you get what you pay for' is applicable then it is here.

Reviews.Title: “Used Points and very happy with Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gogate99PDX
Reviews.Content: I used points for this hotel so cant really comment on the cost. I am a current Diamond member so we had a lot of extras/upgrades. They waived cost for their turkish bath stream room as well as the gym. OUr room was AMAZINg with a great view of St. Peter's and all of rome. We had access to their Coloesso lounge which had a lot of nice snacks and drinks (opened from 11am-11pm). Their breakfast- also free for diamonds- was amazing! So many choices. Their shuttle was ok...we only took it a few times but the cabs were around 15-20 Euro depending on where in Rome we caught it. I thought the hotel was amazing- check out their free art tour available on loaner Ipods- having said that I am super happy I was able to use points and went here as a diamond member.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with a View”
Reviews.Author: Wannatagalong
Reviews.Content: Best view of Rome especially at night. Tucked away from all the hustle and bustle of the main locale but close enough to zip in and out. Excellent pool, restaurant and very cordial and accommodating staff. Suite amenities are superb.

Reviews.Title: “Bank Roll Required”
Reviews.Author: NJGirlSeeingtheWorld
Reviews.Content: The Roma Cavalieri is a very high end hotel (room rate- 270-400 Euro- depending on weeknight or weekend). Be warned- they don't have much tolerance for those who do not have money to burn. As first time travelers to Rome, we decided to indulge in the Roma Cavalieri. The hotel sits outside of the center of Rome on a hilltop overlooking the city. That being said- the hotel is beautiful. The rooms are very large. The furniture and decor have a modern Italian flair. The balcony overlooking the pool and the city make it worth the stay. We stayed on two separate occassions (start and end of trip). We stayed in rooms 363 and 365. NOTE: The higher the floor- the better the view of the city/Vatican. Get a room with a balcony- there is a piano player that plays every night by the pool. The music streams up to the balcony. There are two pools- inside and outside. Warning- A lounge chair at the pool is 20 Euro. The gym was large and was free of charge. The hotel bar will run you 15 Euro per drink. The bar has no atmosphere. Mellow vibe. I can't speak to the food- after the drink tab, we decided against dining in the hotel. As for getting into the city, there is a shuttle bus that drops and picks you up at Plazza Barbieri. The shuttle runs fairly regualrly and we never had a problem getting on it (never full to capacity). On multiple occassions, one of the gentleman at the Concierge's desk was completely useless or incorrect. For example, the hotel rental car office had no cars available. The Concierge directed us to a rental car office several blocks from the hotel. Upon arrival, the office was closed for the MONTH due to holiday. Upon returning to the hotel, the Concierge attempted to redirect us to the SAME office. Long story short- we had to return to the AIRPORT to rent a car. If you do rent a car, you can park the car on the street. The hotel will charge you 5 Euro to park in the outdoor lot and 30 Euro to park in the inside lot. WARNING- Upon retunring with a rental car, they tried to force us to pay the 30 Euro for indoor parking b/c they were working on the outside lot. They refused to drop down the rate, even though it was the hotel's fault we could not park outside. 25 Euro is a BIG difference. My husband had to put up a stink to get the parking for 5 Euro. All in all- it was worth it, if you want to spend the money.

Reviews.Title: “If you got money and time to burn...”
Reviews.Author: 1234Steve
Reviews.Content: The Rome Cavalieri is a beautiful hotel situated on top of one of the hills outside of Rome...way outside of Rome if you want to walk to any of the historic sites. We found the hotel to be a bit snobby. Prices for food were outrageous, on the cheap side of the menu were the 22 Euro turkey sandwich and 45 Euro pizza. Our biggest issue was location. The hotel is not close to anything, so you are either in for a very long hike (this coming from someone who walks everywhere), the shuttle bus (which last runs at 8 PM) or a cab (~15 Euro from downtown to the hotel). Given the location and cost issues, the hotel has stunning grounds and a great view overlooking the city, though I would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay at the Hilton Cavalieri, Rome”
Reviews.Author: petravelinfo
Reviews.Content: As others have said, the Hilton Cavalieri is not in the center of town, however, we loved coming back to this oasis after a day of sighseeing. The gounJds and pools were gorgeous and the food was very good(although Expensive) We used a combination of taxis and the Hotel shuttle to go into the city center. Breakfast is expensive, Just take a right at the strret in front of the hotel and you will find a coffe shop (bar) with pastries. I highly recomment the Hilton Cavalieri. EVerything from the large marble bathroom to comfortable were fantastic. Do Not drive in Rome. We rented a car at the on-site Hertz location inside the hotel, but, would not recommend it. Take a train and pick up the car in another town

Reviews.Title: “Great service in Europe”
Reviews.Author: orsila
Reviews.Content: Rome Cavalieri boast the detail and services I've only seen in Asian & Middle-East hotels. Interrior is elegant and finished to the smallest detail. La Pergola restaurant of the hotel hasn't earned it's 3 Michelin starts for nothing. Pricey but experience worth the money. Hotel has awesome garden and especially Spa with cold war pool within the steam room.

Reviews.Title: “No other place to stay in Rome--Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: JJetson1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simply amazing. Of course it is out of the city and you wouldn't think it convenient, but there is a free shuttle going back and forth to the center of Rome every hour. Be careful, it's such a great resort you won't want to leave and go sightseeing. The service is impeccable and the rooms beautiful. It is older so there are some signs of wear, but it's overlooked because overall it is the best in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A Gorgeous 5* Property w/ Impecable service and Posh Comfortable Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: 4Diamonds2
Reviews.Content: This is a gorgeous property, w/impeccable service and posh, very comfortable rooms! Beautiful views of Rome! It's the perfect place to return to to relax and unwind after touring Rome and the surrounding areas!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: TraceyC6
Reviews.Content: beautiful hotel perfect not one complaint...room was excellent with a fantastic view ,food was great and the staff is number one...

Reviews.Title: “Over Rated, Inconvenient, Tasteless, Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: ThirtyByThirty
Reviews.Content: by far the worst hotel i stayed at while in italy (and I stayed at 4 hotels). over priced and one of the worst value hotels I've ever experienced. thoroughly lacking in italian charm. awful service. the hotel staff was consistently rude and clueless. the location was too far from the city center, and they charge guests extensively for use of the pool (which is the reason to stay here outside the center of rome) so it's not like you'd use it for just a couple of hours per day. our room was fine, but nothing special, and we were on the club floor which apparently has the nicest rooms. and there was constantly a convention at the hotel which took over the lobby and made the cavalieri feel more like an amusement park then a luxury hotel. the main restaurants have awful food and you need to book their best restaurant over a month in advance so unless you plan early, you'll be stuck eating awful, over-priced food. do not stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views”
Reviews.Author: LauraW5661
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was First Class, but is NOT at all convenient to visiting Rome. No way you could walk to sights, shuttle stopped running at 8 PM, and dinner at the hotel was less than great and incredibly overpriced. Just plan on taxi fare if you plan to be out later than 8 (and after all, you're in Rome, why would you be in a hotel by 8???)

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful hotel to help make our honeymoon perfect!”
Reviews.Author: burnmeinthestars
Reviews.Content: Our room was absolutely beautiful, a perfect honeymoon hotel room! Everyone was so helpful and nice. The concierge even let my husband borrow a sport jacket for an unplanned fancy dinner. The only tough part was getting into the downtown of Rome, there was a shuttle bus, but we often missed it. However, we did find it to be a nice walk to the vatican from the hotel, we can officially call ourselves urban hikers!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic--what else is there to say!”
Reviews.Author: NancyKaszyca
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, fabulous room, excellent service. Loved every minute.

Reviews.Title: “Way Overated”
Reviews.Author: Jshafran
Reviews.Content: Don't bother unless you have money to burn. Beautiful vista overlooking Rome but for a "Waldorf" collection property -- not up to standard, pretty tired. Houses La Pergola, Rome's only 3 star Guide Michelin restaurant. If you have to eat here --- take a cab. We stayed only because it was a freebie.

Reviews.Title: “The Cavalieri is beautiful, but not convenient.”
Reviews.Author: CleveTravels
Reviews.Content: The Rome Cavalieri Hilton is a beautiful hotel with amazing amenities. I would recommend it if you are looking to relax and plan to spend the days by the pool or in the spa. But, the hotel is not near the main attractions of Rome. The hotel does have a shuttle that leaves every hour. Or, if you miss the shuttle, it is about a 20 euro taxi ride into the main part of Rome. I would have preferred to stay some where closer to the sites to allow stops back at the hotel throughout the day.

Reviews.Title: “A Must-Stay Luxury Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Kuyakid
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and were given a beautiful room on the 6th floor with an amazing view overlooking the city not just from our window, but from our balcony. Breakfast each day in the hotel was absolutely amazing with a huge variety (including a Japanese selection). We always chose to sit by the pool to enjoy the view, but indoor seating is available. Later in the day we would end up having a light lunch in town, but followed by a nice early dinner before we caught the last shuttle at 8pm back to the hotel. The shuttle is about a 20-25 minute ride. Take the time to explore the hotel inside and out so you can appreciate all the hotel has to offer. For example in the evening you can choose to sit at the bar and listen to some musicians or stroll the beautiful grounds and lounge in the outdoor couches with your beloved. Concierge was very helpful. If you ask them in advance, they can get you complimentary tickets for the Wednesday only General Audience reception at 10:30 – 11:30am with the Pope. For this I recommend you leave the hotel via taxi no later than 9am to secure your admission because the line is long. The concierge also assisted us in getting reservations for the Vatican Museum to avoid having to wait on line. It’s worth the extra 4 Euros/ticket to do this online. At the end of the day, after a long day of walking, it was absolutely therapeutic to use the hotel’s top notch health club (for a fee). Relaxing in the hot tub, steam room, and indoor pool was perfect right before going to bed. I did this every night! Their workout facility is huge and state of the art, but I was on vacation!

Reviews.Title: “The view was fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: nagabi
Reviews.Content: I think that this hotel is fantastic for its view...in fact, if you ask a room with rome-view, you can have Rome in front of you, when you open the window and exit on the terrace!!! The room is big and clean, not very new, but comfortable. The food in hotel is the good quality and if you want taste maybe the best italian cuisine, you can eat (and pay) at La Pergola, that is situated on the terrace of the hotel. The only thing that I found not good is the fee for the internet: 20 minutes:10 euro!!! Very expensive!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: frannick
Reviews.Content: It's taken a while to write a review for this hotel but since I was writing reviews recently for other hotels, thought I'd do so. We stayed here just at the end of the first week of January so being that time of year, we got a good deal which included the most amazing buffet breakfast. We so looked forward to breakfast time ! This hotel is located away from the city on a hill however since the hotel provides a regular shuttle service, which only takes 15-20mins, it was no problem. The room was very spacious, including a balcony. The service was excellent and the grounds and gardens of the hotel are superb with the most incredible views. It was our first time to this most wonderful city and this hotel helped to make it even more wonderful. Just one other thing, my sister and nephew wanted to use the indoor pool (since it was January and the outdoor one would have been a tad chilly!) however they would have had to have paid for a spa package in order to do so, which they didn't do. Might be nice for guests to have the use of the indoor pool only at no extra cost when the weather dictates this. On a slightly different note, we kept hearing birds in the grounds of the hotel and upon further exploration, came across many parrots in separate aviaries around to the side of the hotel, tucked out of the way. I do not know how they all came to be there and although strictly speaking, they are cared for and maintained in terms of adequate food, water etc.....we could not help but notice that many seemed either stressed or bored due to lack of stimulation, toys etc. On our departing guest comment card, we did mention that we would love to see some stimulating toys provided however whether this kind of comment is ever taken onboard is another thing. If the parrots are still there and anyone else notices this too, do take the time to mention this to management and they need to be made aware of this.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Roman experience -- divine property and staff”
Reviews.Author: John-Six
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights with my husband on my first trip to Rome, despite having lived in Europe for almost nine years. When we finally made it to this wonderful city, this hotel made the experience perfect. The hotel is located on a hill overlooking Rome and the thus instead of being in the heart of the tourist center, you are located in a fine neighborhood with incredible views of the city. My one piece of advice: make certain you get a view room as the views of Rome in the morning and at sunset and night are spectacular. The hotel has a free shuttle to the center, but taxis are cheap and plentiful and we used those. The spa is lovely and the gym is top notch. There are also three outdoor pools and one indoor, so if you like to swim, you're set. Many Romans have weddings and parties here so you get a real feel for the people of Rome. I particularly enjoyed the staff -- always helpful, quick and nice. Room service is pricy, so consider walking around the corner to the local shopping square and buying some breakfast provisions there. Or splurge and see how quickly and cheerfully the staff bring you your coffee. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: moosez3
Reviews.Content: Everybody at the hotel was super nice, they gave us our own private area to stay and wait while we checked in. We got a tour of the Hotel which included the roof top restaurant which was closed at the time. We got tickets to the fashion show they were holding in the hotel and the after party. We got access to all the lounges. The hotel itself is beautiful inside, like a museum. We had beautiful views of the Roma skyline, the vatican and the colosseum. Everybody was really great. You really do have to pay for service now a days, but it is worth it!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull”
Reviews.Author: lnd85266
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel, I would recommend staying on a higher floor, we stayed on the sixth with a city view thanks to the reviews I read previously...thanks for the tip! Because of the location it is very quiet, took taxi's everytime we left the hotel, just didn't feel like waiting around for the shuttle (that adds up). Everything is expensive but as long as you know that going in then you'll be fine. Not one complaint about this hotel or the staff, everyone we encountered was nothing but helpful and kind.

Reviews.Title: “True 5 star”
Reviews.Author: lmgreen
Reviews.Content: I just spent 4 nights at the Cavalieri. Yes it is expensive but well worth it but be sure to get a room with a view. Hard to describe the majesty of looking over the city of Rome and seeing the Vatican as well. All the rooms are a large 500 square feet which is unusual for Rome. The service was top notch and with access to the Imperial Lounge everything was perfect. The shuttle was useful and if necessary a taxi into town was about 12 euros. The hotel is perched high on a hill and away from the bustle that is Rome. We enjoyed our time at this hotel immensely.

Reviews.Title: “What a huge disappointment :(”
Reviews.Author: WorldSlacker
Reviews.Content: We were so looking forward to staying three nights at the Rome Cavalieri. We were celebrating our honeymoon and were so disappointed in the service level at this supposed 4 star hotel. Is it gorgeous? Yes, but most of the staff, and I am mainly speaking of the reception and management levels, were poor at best. We are diamond members, meaning we stay at the company's hotels on a very regular basis and are usually taken care of well above the necessary. Not this time though. When we arrived, we waited at the front desk for about five minutes while about 6 people joked around amongst each other about 10 feet away from us. I finally said I would like to check in and they said one moment. After a few more laughs together a woman checked us in. She forgot to give us our pool card (which we found out later, when we almost loudly got kicked out of the pool) and did not put us on the executive floor, as she were supposed to under our reservation. When we asked about it we were told rudely we did not qualify for that floor. But, being diamond members (yeah I know, it's silly but still) we are supposed to have access to that floor and the lounge on it. Being our honeymoon one day we ordered champagne, and it arrived while we were out in town with NO ice. So we called down for some and they said it will be there in about 5 minutes. Well an hour goes by and were are about to head out for dinner so we call down again and they apologize and say it will be there soon. We get back from dinner about 3 hours later and still no ice..... there is no ice machine for you to get it yourself so we personally went down to the front desk and asked. Ugh There were many little things that happened throughout our stay that were just not 4 star quality in our minds. The housekeeping service was fabulous and the maids very friendly, but they and the doorman were the only ones!

Reviews.Title: “On top and over the top”
Reviews.Author: ny501
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night in a cityview club floor room on the highest (8th) floor and my stay included access to the executive floor lounge. I had been to the hotel before when it was a Hilton and remembered the hotel was an ugly structure on a fabulous location. The lobby seemed to be in the same decor but the rooms, club floor and other facilities like gym, healthclub and pool complex are all updated in a sumptuous and total glamorous style. The club lounge is absolutely stunning, with different seating areas and beautiful outdoor seating overlooking all of Rome and the hotel grounds. The room is equally gorgeous and spacious and over the top in finishing and furnishing. Our balcony was spacious and offers full privacy. We found the hotel staff lovely. From check in to house keeping and lounge staff, everyone seemed to be genuinely kind. The lounge offers five f&b servings a day, and all day wine and Prosecco. Food was of good quality and continuously replenished. This weekend the lounge seemed quiet and the guest who were there were classy. Our stay also included the use of the health club and pool. It;s quite remarkable that regular guests have to pay to use these facilities including a pool bed. Since this hotel is extremely expensive I would feel that that is not right. The pool is gorgeous, large and very deep which keeps children away. There is another pool that is more suitable for them, so the main pool keeps nice and quiet even when all beds are taken. I hate children, especially those staying at exclusive hotels, they can ruin your experience with their obnoxious behavior. This pool is also used by local members and this certainly is a glamorous crowd that ads to the feeling of being at a very exclusive resort. The fact that they reserve their beds and don't show up until late in the afternoon is a concept that is plain tacky. Pool staff is not good. Any question asked was answered with 'room number?'. I had the impression they have the feeling they are more security than pool attendant. i have no idea why, you have to pass at least three security points to get to the pool, so if you are there, you have the right to be there. The weather was absolutely fantastic and we did not leave the hotel grounds until check out. We took a hotel limo back to the airport, the driver seemed very tired and drove exceptionally fast which got us to the airport in no time, but I would recommend to keep the speed limit and observe some safety in driving. This hotel is fantastic but only when staying on the club floor. That delivers the real value. This is a perfect hotel for staying in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: mankubus
Reviews.Content: good: 1. a lot of room in ordinary apartments. 2. the hotel is located within the town area in a quiet place. 3. a large swimming pool. bad: 1. there is an ugly communication tower in front of the hotel that totally ruins the view and another half of the town view is shadowed by another hotel in front. 2. be attentive as you book via booking.com: breakfasts and access to the swimming pool is not included, so you will have to pay 36 euro each time for it. 3. internet price is 27 euro per day :)

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable experience, an oasis in the hills of Rome”
Reviews.Author: UNOWHO_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed August 20-23 using Hilton Honors points. This hotel is unbelievably nice! Our room had a king bed (a true king, not two twins pushed together like many European hotels do) and a seating area with a couch, coffee table, and desk. The room overlooked the gardens and pool. All of the common areas were top notch, but the best of all was the spa area. As Hilton Gold members, we had free use of the spa that included a built in jacuzzi, a large aromatic steam room with cold pool in the middle, and a relaxation room, etc. There was a large workout center and both indoor and outdoor pools. The service was unmatched. While the hotel is not in the heart of Rome, we had no troubles using the shuttle that drops off and picks up at Piazza Barberini on the hour up until 8 pm. We stayed later in Rome one of the nights and took a taxi back for only 10 Euro. But most nights we wanted to come back to the hotel by 8 pm so we could use the spa. Some may find the hotel expensive, but we used points so that was less of an issue. We also stayed at the Marriott Flora on Via Veneto in Rome a few days later and found the Cavalieri to be priced equivalently on amenities such as drinks at the bar, yet the Cavalieri seemed so much more inviting and tranquil.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: cammelview
Reviews.Content: The Rome Cavalieri was very nice. The staff was nice and helpful and the rooms are very large and very comfortable! They have a beautiful art collection displayed all over the hotel. We enjoyed the service we got from the reception and concierge, however the service at the spa was terrible. The spa receptionists were rude and snooty. The condition of the spa was disgusting. Paint was chipping off the walls and decoration, the Jacuzzi had a layer of film/ dirt at the bottom. It was unsanitary. So if you are not interested in going to the spa, this is a beautiful hotel on a hilltop looking over Rome! The hotel is located outside the center of Rome. There is no access to public transportation near the hotel. You can only take a taxi into the city or the hotel shuttle that runs until 8:00pm. I would not recommend this hotel to someone who is going to be doing a lot of sight seeing because you have to plan your day around the limited hours of the shuttle or pay a lot for taxi trips. Also, there are no restaurants near the hotel. So again you have to plan around this. Otherwise if you eat at the hotel be prepared to pay a lot for your meal and fourteen euros for a Coca-Cola!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: trap1
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to stay in this hotel last week,and I think it is one of the best hotels I have stayed in.We were picked up by Rome cabs with a fixed fair of 50 euro to the hotel which I think is very good value.On arrival at the hotel the bell boy opened our car door an moved smartly to the boot of the car for the cases which were delivered to our room before we got there no tip expected.We were booked into our 6 floor room with a fantastic view of Rome.We had paid extra for this and to upgrade to the executive lounge and I would suggest if you can do it do.first thing after unpacking we went to the lounge for some lunch with a few glasses of bubbles for my wife both were excellent.1 hour later felling rested, downstairs for the shuttle bus which travels back and forward every half hour.On returning back to the hotel down stair for a sauna which was part of the upgrade.then back to the ex lounge for some of the nice food and drink.It was 4 days of pure luxa ry.I read a lot of reviews of this hotel some good some bad so I will give you my thoughts.First it is not cheap but I have stayed in more expensive hotels in the world. Value for money I would ask you to look at the number of staff at you call in the front hall alone there were over 14 . Down in the swimming pool area again I counted 8. the ex lounge had a other 5. then you have the cleaners gardeners cooks washers waiters the list goes on and on. Some one said it was 10 euro to have a shirt ironed in fact you can take your shirt to the ironing room and do it yourself for free the 10 euros is for laundry service.Some other people said that all you need to do is tip and you get good service again this is more a American thing although they will not reject your tip there is no need to. I did not tip and still found the level of service very good.some people think the shuttle bus stops to early again it is only 10 or 12 euro back at night and again if you cant afford it there are a lot of very good hotels in Rome at the same price.It is very opulent, very grand and you fell a bit important staying there but i would go back in a shot

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: cdjWashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: I just returned from the Rome Cavalieri. The decor is a little over the top at first, but after a while you get used to all of the art work in the lobby. The hotel is situated on a hill overlooking the city. We stayed on the 3rd floor, but we had a great view. definitely splurge and get a city view room. The room itself is huge and well appointed. The breakfast was included and it was first class. The concierge is definitely very professional. They arranged for a private tour of Rome and the Vatican. Also, their recommendations for dining were not run of the mill tourist joints. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but a few rough spots”
Reviews.Author: Stockteach
Reviews.Content: Location was out of the way but the shuttle bus made things easy to get to . Housekeeping was a bit lacking and the turn down service was fair at best. Cafe staff did what they wanted when they wanted to do it and that was in 2 of their 4 cafes. was a great hotel but needs to fine tune to be a Waldorf Astoria Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very nice honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: SuzieQNewYork
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks lackluster from the outside and be prepared to pay about 60 euro for a taxi from the airport. It is true that the hotel is far from the city center, but they do provide a free shuttle every hour. Travellers beware: the shuttle does not run during siesta and the last shuttle for Piazza Barberini leaves at about 7:30pm. Additionally, the shuttle runs even less frequently on Sundays. Don't plan on eating anything at the hotel; a burger and coca-cola will run you about 35 euros. We had access to the executive lounge and this was really a help, they had very few snacks but a great wealth of drinks. Now, for the good parts.... The inside of the Cavalieri is quite impressive!!! Our room was on the 3rd floor in an executive room and our view of the city was great, just a few trees in the way. Since we were on our honeymoon, they sent up a complimentary bottle of prosecco (very nice!). The room was beautiful and clean. The room also had a lovely balcony with table and chairs, so we could enjoy the view when we liked. The room also had blackout shutters that could be operated by bedside, as well as heavy drapes. We slept like babies. I've read reviews that claimed the hotel was noisy, however, we never even knew we had neighbors. This is a great hotel because sightseeing in Rome is tiring and it is very nice to go back to a clean and quiet hotel to recharge one's batteries. It was perfect for a honeymoon because there were mostly couples and very few families with children, so it made for a romantic holiday. Other incentives: The gym was also unbelievably stocked and practically empty, we went everyday. The spa was beautiful. The pool was fantastic. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Super Buffet Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: m0mwith2kids
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights. We booked the buy one night get one night free promotion with complimentary breakfast. We had the corner room on the 5th floor with partly good view of Rome.. not so bad. We got everything that we had hoped: spacious room for 3 persons, balcony, big bathroom and very comfortable beds. The breakfast buffet was excellent with so many selections, including a Japanese corner. The service was excellent, we had a problem with the aircondition and it was fixed within minutes. We like the location, a nice and quiet retreat surrounded by trees.. a park like. However the down side of our stay was the dinner at the Giardino dell'Uliveto restaurant, we knew that it was costly so we anticipated excellent food and service. The service was fine but we were extremely disappointed with the quality of the food, our beef steak and grilled tuna steak were cold and overcooked, although we had asked for medium. Overall it was a great vacation, but we would definitely not pay a full price to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, good service, but not all rooms have a view”
Reviews.Author: Marie_TM
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights, using HHonors points, at the end of July while watching the FINA championships. The hotel is beautiful, as noted in other reviews. There is marble throughout the hotel, including in the rooms and bathrooms. The lobby area and lower level have a lot of paintings and other artforms, giving guests their own art museum. Being a HHonors Diamond member, we had access to the Colosseo Lounge, which served complimentary wine, beer, snacks, and other non-alcoholic beverages starting at 11:00 a.m. The service was great. The only annoying thing was watching some of the guests sneak beverages out of the lounge when the staff were not looking (how cheap can you get?). The people at the front-desk when checking in were very friendly and efficient. We arrived about 10:30 a.m., and had to wait about 20 minutes until the room was ready, but they were very apologetic (even though we were clearly there before the hotel's check-in time). The hotel is not in a convenient location, but it offers a free shuttle service to the guests throughout the day. The shuttle service was excellent and right on time, both when leaving the hotel and for being picked up in the city (note: arrive about 10-15 minutes early for pick-up in Rome if the hotel is busy, as the shuttle can fill up). Some of the shuttle drivers were very friendly and pleasant, while others were just as efficient but did not make an effort to smile. We were given complimentary breakfast (including sparkling wine) during our stay, which is one of the best buffet breakfasts we have had (and we've had many). In addition to standard breakfast buffet items, it also had a decent Japanese breakfast selection. Despite the hotel being crowded (peak season plus the FINA event), we did not have to wait to be seated at breakfast. We ordered room service one night, and it was fast and very good (a sampler of grilled mediterranean fish plus a pasta dish). What made it expensive is that we ordered a bottle of wine (which alone was 35 euros (yet one of the cheapest on the menu)). The room service charge alone was what appeared to be a flat-rate of 10 euros. We felt it was worth the expense once, but would not have done that every night. In-room internet access was very expensive (as noted by others on this site), but I have seen it just as expensive at other major hotels throughout Europe. Overall, we were pleased with the hotel, but there were a couple of negatives. First, not all rooms have a view (as someone else claimed on this forum). We had a beautiful room with a great balcony, but it overlooked some type of radio tower (the room faced the opposite direction of Rome). As noted, we checked in early, and the hotel was full, which is probably why we were given a room without a view. Our room did NOT have a coffee/tea maker, which surprised us. Finally, when we checked out (around 9:30 a.m.) there was only one person at the check-out desk, such that there was a relatively long line. There were three people at the check-in desk who were not waiting on anyone. It did not seem like an efficient use of staff, since the check-in and check-out desks are right by each other. In sum, I would stay there again if the price is right. It is not only expensive in terms of the actual rates, but also in terms of HHonors points. But it is a beautiful hotel, and it is fun to splurge once in awhile.

Reviews.Title: “Id give it 3 "verys"”
Reviews.Author: ChiefGnome
Reviews.Content: 1. Very expensive bedroom for a nights sleep but nice. 2. Food and drinks are very expensive. A dinner will set you back a weeks wages. 3. Very nice shuttle service into Rome. We stayed her several times, always on HH points. We've also been to many other Conrad Hilton's around the world. This was clearly the most "out of the way", expensive and crowded (neighborhood) facility we've experienced. The only food outside of the hotel is a pizza place about 2 blocks right of the hotel. It is a classic "rip off" establishment. The specialize in over-charging tourists in a big way. It took us 3 months to get the "extra charges" removed from our credit card bill. This is clearly affordable only to people of means or on a business expense account.

Reviews.Title: “A reminiscene of times past”
Reviews.Author: roycharles
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to Rome for a special birthday and selected the Rome Cavalieri based on a deep experience with the Hilton brand and exhaustive search of previously written reviews by other travelers. I find it absolutely fascinating how different our experience was with the hotel than that of the previous reviewer. The previous statement is made knowing that happenstance often determines the quality of one's stay at any property. Because of Hilton Diamond membership, we were placed in a 6th floor room with a Rome view, including complimentary breakfast buffet and use of the "Colisseo Lounge', which may or may not be the same as the executive lounge but in any case is a nice benefit.....refreshments from 11AM until 11PM daily, on the Lobby level....very nice. The guest room was spacious, immaculate and comfortable. The A/C worked extremely well, sheltering us from the sweltering Rome summer when we returned from outings. We enjoyed a spectacular view of the city of Rome, and the pool area, with forested surroundings. The hotel is a great refuge from the bustle of the city....about a 20-30 minute, 12 Euro cab ride from Piazza Navonna. The frequent free shuttle to the city (except Sundays) is also helpful in defraying cost. This property reminds us of the way great resorts were a half century ago. Perhaps the best buffet breakfast spread I've seen anywhere in decades. An Olympic Pool. A classic bath house/spa. People leisurely swimming laps while breakfast eaters are enjoying their food alongside the pool. A country, exclusive setting. Spacious and elegant hall and stairways. Great art throughout. A Concierge operation that's run like an army; any request greeted by a prompt and enthusiastic "subito, Signore"....."Right away, Sir". It's very hard to hear the word "no" from that crew. One of the Concierge team that we met had been at the hotel since it opened in '63. The pool is lighted at night and there is live entertainment along side it, with a pianist and a vocalist....until late in the evening. The one problem I encountered was a "flakey" internet situation, which seems endemic (perhaps epidemic) in Europe. In fact the first time I tried to write this review (last night), when I had completed it, the connection just died on me....and I lost my work. Once I phoned the vendor (Swiss) and their "help" desk person was terribly rude and not very helpful. She was almost shocking in her sarcasm. Yes! The hotel is expensive. Five Star Hotels are expensive. It costs a great deal to run a business like that and they have to make money. I wanted a memorable experience and I got one. We even lucked into a spectacular fireworks display on our last evening; I suspect it had been arranged for a party that was going on at one of the swimming pools on the property. One note about our sightseeing in Rome. We got off the beaten track and went to Villa Torlonia.....a two centuries old public park (since 1977), which had been owned by a noble family; Benito Mussolini and family lived in the main house from the late 20s until 1943. The estate was occupied by Allied forces in 1943 or 44 and they just about ruined it. It has been undergoing extensive restoration for some 15 years and is an extremely worthwhile and educational attraction. The main house is close to exquisite....much memorabilia from the Mussolini era.....photos....displays....a film with home movies from the M. era.....there are a number of other buildings inside the Villa in various states of restoration. La Casa delle Civette (The Owl House) has some wonderful Art Nouveau windows.....at least one of them original from the early 20th century. The Limonaia (The Lemon Grove) has been reconstructed into a very nice refreshment and restaurant area, with a pizza oven and very reasonable prices....remarkable my Rome standards. This entire site was notable for its low quantity of foreign visitors.....I would recommend this attraction to anyone interested in Roman history of the past 200 years....and in particular of the WWII years. The Hotel Roma Cavalieri is a taste of century old life. It's expensive for most budgets, but worth it if you value the sense of history, class and professional service that it offers.

Reviews.Title: “5* rip off - don't bother!”
Reviews.Author: NorthantsTravellers
Reviews.Content: 'Garden View' room was - car park, main road, block of flats with dog barking, commercial building with enormous metal tower/phone mast?? over a strip of grass. Directly under room was a place ( underneath hotel) where workmen were drilling/banging talking in loud voices, using mobile phones starting before 8 in morning. It went on for 3days almost our entire stay. Rude person on front desk when we asked for an iron! Irons not allowed - health and safety??!! almost £10 to iron 1 shirt from their laundry! Now I see why irons are not allowed! sun bed by pool cost 16 euros, 30 euros for fitness room. At 5* prices should be included as they are all over the world!! We did not spend a single penny in this hotel as a protest.

Reviews.Title: “very very luxuries”
Reviews.Author: AYFERS
Reviews.Content: it is the best hotel in Rome but a bit out of city center but you can stay there because easy shuttle service between city center and hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Great 5 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lakwatsera74
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week and had a great time with my family. They have huge rooms and nicely furnished with a big Balcony with a nice view... Executive Lounge was the best one we've been so far. The hotel is indeed expensive but if you get an access to the Executive Lounge you'll save a lot of money on food and drinks.. Location is not the best but there's a free shuttle to the city center...

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: andrenovak
Reviews.Content: The only problem with this hotel is the price of the non included amenities. Everithing from the bar to room service and pool is very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: foody1000
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful - comparable, if not better than the Bellagio in Vegas. Definitely one of the nicest hotels I have stay at. The hotel is located about 10 to 15 minutes outside of Rome. They do have a shuttle that drops off in two place in the center of Rome every 30 minutes (not 24hrs) so the location really isn't that big of an issue. Cab rides to the hotel will run you 15 euros max. The location is actually kind of nice cause it allows you to retreat from the busy city when you want some quiet time. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with amazing amendities”
Reviews.Author: dededa80
Reviews.Content: We are Hilton Gold VIP members and stayed 3 nights at the Rome Cavalieri hotel. I must stay this is an absolutely stunning hotel all 5 star qualities. The hotel is located high up on a hill and approximtaely 15 minutes outside of the busy Rome. The hotel provides a shuttle service daily that takes you to the Barberini Square every hour. The rooms at his hotel is HUGE and all the rooms have a balcony with a beautiful view of Rome, including the Vatican City. The hotel has 2+ pools (in door/outdoor), restaurants, VIP lounge areas, spa, gym, hot tub, drinks, shops, and all the necessities that you might possibily need. The only set back might be the cost of the hotel. We used our points and as Gold VIP, we also get unlimited snacks/drinks from 11am - 11pm and free breakfast by the pool every morning. if cost is not an issue to you, then this is DEFINITELY the hotel to stay in. You can go out during the day and come back to a peaceful night of sleep/rest at the beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The great Hiltons of Italy”
Reviews.Author: OregonBigsky
Reviews.Content: This is a belated review of a wonderful vacation. My wife and I are planning another trip to Europe, and once again Trip Advisor is proving invaluable. As such, I feel obligated to balance all my "taking" with a little "give". We spent four nights at the Cavalieri last May, and it was unbelievable. Had we not been using Hilton Honors points, we never would have stayed at such an expensive hotel. Boy am I glad we did! Hooray for the Hilton Honors program, and maybe all that business travel wasn't so bad after all. :>) Rome was the first stop on an 18-day Italy visit, my first to Europe. We got off the plane typically frazzled after a trip across the pond, and proceeded to suffer a clueless cabdriver who got hopelessly lost in the middle of the night looking for the hotel. It is rather "out there". It wasn't until we finally checked into our room that we discovered how lucky we were. Wow! Big closets, a plush (if somewhat small and dated) gold and marble bathroom, a luxurious sleeping area as well as a sitting area with desk, and to top it all off a balcony with a spectacular view of the Vatican! There was even a box of chocolates left as a gift. We ordered a bottle of wine, a salad, a pizza, and a gelato, sat on the balcony at midnight, and pinched ourselves to confirm we were really in a place this plush! This small meal was about 100 Euros, but it was convenient and it was the only meal we had at the hotel (other than the free breakfast). The pizza and salad were pretty mediocre, but the wine and gelato hit the spot. We were not told about the executive lounge, by the way. Our impression was only enhanced the next morning, when we went down to the breakfast buffet (free for Hilton Honors gold VIPs). We sat under a beautiful shade tree by their inviting pool, surrounded by the well-manicured grounds. Unlimited fresh-squeezed orange juice and espressos (we were pretty wired that first day!), and a buffet that went on for miles. What a selection! Much better than the Hilton Molino Stucky in Venice. We later spent an afternoon swimming and sunning by the pool, and felt totally "hollywood". We took advantage of the shuttle each morning, but typically came home at night by taxi. Other than that first driver, everyone else seemed to know where the hotel was located. Yes, it cost more than we would have spent on a ride home to a downtown hotel, but when we're staying for free we don't mind. Like the Molino Stucky, where we stayed for six nights later in our trip, this Hilton gets lots of conference business. The chain-smoking, frenetic italians in business suits clogging the lobby diminsh the otherwise idylic vibe of the hotel, but it's a small complaint about an otherwise perfect setting. I don't know if this is the best Rome has to offer, nor do I know if it is worth the price, but it was the best hotel we visited in Italy, and one of the best hotels we've stayed in around the world. It was the balcony view from our room, the breakfast, the pool and the grounds that really made this place stand out. Thank you Hilton Honors!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but Obscene Restaurant Prices”
Reviews.Author: imcarthur
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers point out this hotel is great. Great rooms, great grounds, great views. But . . . the restaurant prices were absolutely absurd. 28€ for a hamburger. 46€ for veal saltimbocca. 12€ for French fries. Also 16€ for a lounge bed by the pool. We were here on points but the hotel just stopped 7th floor lounge access for HH members & switched to a main floor lounge that opened at 11am. So . . . we had to go to Rome for an affordable breakfast. The hotel wanted 30€ for this . . . So if you stay here ask the consierge for the map of the limited area restaurants & plan to do your eating in the city. I would recommend it as long as you can afford the food.

Reviews.Title: “Do yourself an favor,....don't book this hotel”
Reviews.Author: zandkreek
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really a rip off and the service which shout be in place at this price level is an understatement. All extra's which normally shout be included are additional such us a mattress on the bed by the swimming pool for 16 euros each,....... cheeseburger for top dollars (28 euros) which honest was a really bad experience,........never eat such disgusting burger as that one,....... on top I also had to pay an extra charge of 5 euros because I ordered it into my room. PLease,....please do yourself an favor and just do not book a room in this hotel. For restaurant La Pergola I only can say the opposite this was a beautiful treatment of luxury, service and tasteful food. When you want to stay in a luxury hotel in Rome I will recommend The Hassler Hotel just next to the Spanish steps, this is a hotel as it shout be.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: notrevo
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. BUT it was way too expensive 11 euro's for a bottle of beer wow! Luckily I was staying on points and was treated like royalty. Access to the HHonors lounge (although nobody check if you are entitled to enter and it is not locked) We simply could not afford to eat there in the evenings we had to go into the city, getting the shuttle in eating in a local restaurant and getting a cab back still saved us 60% of the cost of eating in the "international restaurant"! No complaints re the hotel the room the service just too costly

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite part of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Sc0ttW
Reviews.Content: I carefully read the reviews of this hotel before our trip, and once armed with knowledge we had a fantastic time. We got the city view each time (we had two different stays)--imagine seeing all of Rome from a balcony on a hill! The view at sunset and sunrise, the view of the grounds, the incredible breakfast buffet, the snappy and helpful service made this a great honeymoon spot. We actually liked the fact that it was far from the city--downtown Rome is very noisy, busy, and very dirty. Plus, the people are not exactly charming.
