We also took full advantage of the Colosseo lounge (the free VIP lounge) and so rarely paid for lunch and afternoon drinks. We did notice most tourists did not tip the lounge staff--that is shameful :( Now to address some of the complaints by reviewers. The staff is excellent if you tip like you are staying at a 5 star hotel--don't stay at such a place if you don't know how to tip. The place IS expensive, but it is a 5 star destination hotel. While we were there, we saw athletes, celebrities (as well as the dogged paparazzi), and many weddings and special events. It is an LA kind of scene--this is what I liked least about the place, actually. The gym was full of local women looking to be someone's trophy wife...though that will make some readers more inclined to go. The bottom line is that the critics got a bad room (one with no view) and didn't spread around the wealth. With that said, how to save money: take the shuttle--though taxis are cheap and fast (10-15 euros), and eat out. Many reviewers have vaguely referred to a Sicilian trattoria down the street. It is cheap and wonderful and will save you from spending an enormous amount of money at the hotel on food. The trattoria is called "Ai Vespri Siciliani"--turn right out of the hotel and walk five minutes down Alberto Cadlolo way--it will run into Medaglione d'Oro as a T. Turn left, walk 50 meters and there it is. There are also other places to eat on the same street.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Lobby and Extra Comfortable Bed”
Reviews.Author: jmewantstotravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at here for 2 nights. We arrived very late and checked in. Think they may have given our smoke-free rooms away but were too tired to complain. The room was very impressive and luxurious. The bed was just amazing, slept very well that night! I expect the view would have been awesome if we had been on the other side of the hotel, but we had a view of a big phone tower on the front side of hotel. The breakfast had a ton of options and was pretty good. The lobby is really beautiful and decorated very elegantly. The shuttle was great, but if you plan on taking it get there early because it did fill up. Overall, it was a very nice hotel but you could tell on our floor that the hallway's carpet and wallpaper needed some attention.

Reviews.Title: “Great view but horrible customer service & inconvenient location”
Reviews.Author: readyforrome
Reviews.Content: This is a very beautiful hotel with a fantastic view of Rome, but the customer service was very disappointing. For example, on the day we checked in we arrived at the Cavalieri at 12:15 extremely tired after our flight. We were told our room was not ready, but that they would get it ready as soon as possible. The Diamond Desk person then escorted us to the Colesseo lounge and told us that she would come and get us as soon as the room was ready. At 2 pm no one had come to inform us that our room was ready, so I went to the front desk and inquired. As it turns out, our room key was just sitting there and our room was ready, but no one had informed us. We went up to our room to discover that they had put someone else's luggage in our room. Our luggage was no where to be found. I went down to the front desk and was taken to the luggage storage area to look for our luggage. When it did not turn up, a bellhop escorted me to another guest's room where our luggage had been taken (we had his luggage). The bellhop sheepishly apologized, but then added "anyone can make a mistake." Which is true, but not the attitude I wanted to hear when I was exhausted and just wanted my luggage and to take a nap. We never received an apology from anyone else other than the one bellhop, and the front desk took a very nonchalant attitude. There are other examples of poor customer service, but the experience above and the attitude adopted proved typical. Additionally, as written elsewhere the location is not convenient to the tourist spots and the last shuttle back to the hotel is at 8pm, so unless you wish to end your night very early you are likely to be taking a ~ 15 Euro cab ride back to the hotel. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best of the best!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cabo321
Reviews.Content: You certainly expect a lot from a Waldorf hotel and the Rome Cavalieri definitely did not disappoint. My wife and I stayed at the Cavalieri to end our honeymoon and what an ending it was. First and foremost, we want to thank Markus, the chief concierge, who did everything he could to make our stay top notch. From making dinner reservations, private sight seeing tours, Papal audience and even helping with a problem from another hotel, Markus is by far the best concierge we've had the pleasure of staying with. The hotel itself is beautiful and offers the best views of Rome. We could see the Vatican and all of Rome from our room. The meals were also outstanding. It was certainly the best breakfast we had during our entire trip and dinner the last night at La Pergola was one of the best dinners we've had EVER. Expensive, but worth every bite. Plus the views from La Pergola were unbelievable. The only negative was the doormen out front. When we arrived, they didn't offer to help with the bags, never opened the doors for us the whole time and weren't very helpful in general. You are not in the center of Rome, which we liked and the hotel offers a shuttle throughout the day. We typically took a cab back to the hotel, so plan on spending 10-15 euro per trip if you do the same. There were also some great little bakeries and pizzerias around the corner from the hotel. It was about a 10 minute walk, but was worth it - YUM.

Reviews.Title: “No sleep - paper thin walls”
Reviews.Author: tollestrup
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and the view is amazing but the walls are paper thin. We must have had a honeymooning couple next door because they did not sleep ALL night and we heard EVERYTHING. We could even hear them when they were talking and what they were saying not to mention other things. My husband and I could not sleep the entire night. I even took some Tylenol PM to knock me out but it was too loud and I am a pretty deep sleeper. The food was also awful. We ordered lasagna and got something aobut 1/2 inch high for $25 dollars. We literally thought they were kidding and bringing us an appetizer. They also got our reservation wrong and then wouldn't let us book with the rate of the conference we were attending. We arrived at 11:30 at night and were too tired to get another hotel so we were stuck with full price even though we had books months before - but no reservation showed up. We were originally going to stay the whole week but checked out after 2 days. Beautiful hotel with great potential but they need to work on customer service and insulating the walls.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: nolarose9
Reviews.Content: From the warm welcome when we got there to the gracious, early morning farewell, everyone at this hotel was exceptionally friendly and helpful. And, the hotel, it is absolutely amazing!!! We were so impressed with the public restroom on the 1st floor that we have pictures of it and explain it in our photo albums from this trip!! Gorgeous!! An elderly couple that was staying there at the same time, said it best in their summation, "this hotel is like a museum!" Appreciated the complimentary shuttle into town!! Breakfast buffet has more to offer than I've ever seen!

Reviews.Title: “A little bit of heaven in Rome”
Reviews.Author: kpark714
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful and has wonderful service as you would expect from this level of hotel. The views of Rome at night are breath taking and the beds are incredibly comfortable. The location of the hotel is far from sights so it's likely that you'll need to take a cab down to the Vatican or a shuttle to the city center, but it's nice and quiet up on the hill. The restaurants are very expensive, I think the one downstairs is down right over priced for what you get so you need to factor that in since it's not exactly easy to run out and eat off the property. The other plus is that they have a Hertz in the hotel so it was super easy to ditch our car.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Merlin0202
Reviews.Content: The service at our recent stay was extraordinary. When we arrived late and the shuttle downtown was full, the concierge paid for our taxi! When we were sunburned, the conceirge offered to get us sunscreen from the Pharmacy - free of charge. It was above and beyond anything we had ever experienced. The view is spectacular from the hotel, the pool is nice and deep and the rooms are very luxurious. The hotel is by far the best we have stayed at. The only negative is that it is far from the landmarks and the free shuttle ends at 8pm which is before dinner. Althought a cab ride from Piazza Barberini is only about 15 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel; inconvenient location”
Reviews.Author: summa70
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough great things about this hotel. Every employee I interacted with was polite and helpful. The restaurants and room service were top notch. The pool area was nicely done. The room was very large by European standards and beautifully furnished. The only downside was the location. You really can't walk to any of the major sites. They do have a shuttle that takes you to a central location, but it doesn't depart early enough to get you to many of the day tours, and it stops running for a few hours in the early afternoon. However, taking a few $10 cab rides is worth it to stay in such an elegant hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel away from the hustle & bustle!”
Reviews.Author: Tystephens
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel to stay in Rome if you are seeking a quiet refuge from the fast pace of Roma! There is a shuttle bus that takes you to the heart of the tourist attractions, and will pick you back up at several appointed times. This hotel is just a few minutes away, but upon entereing, you are immediately swept away by the pure opulence of the hotel. The rooms were spacious & beautifully decorated. Room service was swift and accurate. The pool area was nice & cozy. The prices are a bit steep, but as an American traveler, I felt very comfortable with the Hilton name & would recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “The beauty is all on the surface....”
Reviews.Author: dvf_personal_shopper
Reviews.Content: Yes, rooms are large&plush and available amenities (pools, spa) are what you'd expect from a Waldorf property, but all other 5-star features are missing. First, this hotel is located so far from anything you'd visit in Rome that you'll end up spending a bundle on taxis or limit yourself to the hours dictated by the hotel shuttle to downtown. But I give them points for at least having a shuttle. The punctual and safe drivers were probably the best staff we came across at this hotel. The valet and bellhops outside were useless. I show up with luggage and a cane, and no one even open the DOOR for me, much less take my luggage. The front desk was not too friendly and I was not treated like a VIP guest (I am "only" HHonors Gold and used points for my stay, but I still expect courtesy). I was not given my choice of room upgrade vs. access to executive lounge, which would have been appreciated since the Internet point was $0.50 a minute! Each time I sought to speak with the concierge, I waited at least 15-20 minutes. We had 2 people in my room but they only provided 1 robe, no slippers, and 1 loofah to share (gross!), despite repeated requests to housekeeping to rectify these shortcomings. We'd come back from sightseeing around 8pm and room would not be turned down. We'd request turn-down and it would not be done until about an hour later, an hour in which we were exhausted and wanted to go to bed! We'd go to the included breakfast buffet and, while the labels indicated a sumptuous assortment of goodies, the platters and chafing dishes were almost always empty and we would have to ask multiple time (3 on average) for a simple a cappuccino or a glass of prosecco. Who would actually PAY $60USD a person for that sort of breakfast experience?!?!? Luckily, not I. I always brought tips for the waitstaff, but they most certainly did not deserve any of it. The little boutiques in the Cavalieri were so sad -- small and either empty or out-of-date (very 1960s feel). In any case, I left all except the last comment for the manager, and of course I have not heard back a single word. The contrast between my most recent Hilton Stays -- a $89 room at the Hilton Washington versus this $1250/night room in Rome -- showed me that you cannot beat plain and simple CUSTOMER SERVICE! Plush as the Cavalieri is, the beauty is all just skin-deep. I would tell people to NEVER pay to stay here. On this trip to Italy, we also spent some nights at the Marriott Grand Flora in Rome and, in comparison, the location and staff at the Grand Flora beat the heck out the Cavalieri, even if the rooms were a lot less fancy and a lot smaller. Overall, big thumbs down.

Reviews.Title: “A classic Waldorf Astoria - great”
Reviews.Author: robyw
Reviews.Content: We have to expect a certain level from the hotels in the WA Collection and this one hasn't disappointed either. A grand hotel with all the service, amenities, niceties you should have. The location can be the onlz drawback depending on what zou are looking for - it is not in the historic center (though not out of town either) but there is a shuttle bus, there are taxis and even buses that you can take. We love staying here, having the calm (and the pool!) after the bustle of th etown. The area is residential and offers many simple but nice dining choices, too, you will be away from the tourist crowds and eat nice. Not to forget the Pergola, Italy's best restaurant, situated in the top level of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Most INCREDIBLE hotel I have EVER stayed in! Queen for the weekend!!!”
Reviews.Author: littlegirl1971
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Cavalieri during Easter weekend this past April 2009. I would consider my self a seasoned traveler & have got to say that this is the BEST hotel thus far! Treatment was truly 5 stars+!!! The hotel is situated on a hill- away from the hustle of the City Center with peace & quiet at night! The complimentary shuttle drops & picks you up from Piazza Barbierini-convenient to all areas. I booked through Expedia & was able to get an Imperial Club Room with complimentary access to the Imperial club lounge. I would pay the extra bucks to have this type of room in a heartbeat as the hotel food & drinks are VERY pricey! Since it was our anniversary, at turn down service, we received a bottle of champagne & chocolates from the manger! On Easter Sunday, we had a huge chocolate egg placed in our sitting area with scrupulous chocolates flowing out from the big egg!!! Buffet changes every 2-3 hours & you can drink whatever you little heart desires! GRATIS!!! Have you ever had eel for breakfast! Also included is complimentary internet access & entrance to the Pool areas (indoor & outdoor) & Grand Spa. I have never experienced a Turkish bath before!!! When I return to Rome, I will definably start looking for deals on this hotel, they don't come very often. If you want rest & relaxation before venturing out into Rome, this is the PLACE!!! You will get MORE than what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, excellent service and unforgettable views of Roma”
Reviews.Author: porscheduo
Reviews.Content: This was the single best hotel stay of my life. While some travelers ding this hotel for its distance from the City Center, we felt we had the best of both worlds--to be in Roma enjoying her attractions, then leaving the hustle and bustle behind to quietly enjoy the sunset over Roma, glass of wine in hand. Make sure to get a room on the side with city views, you will never tire of it. The Cavalieri has its own complimentary shuttle buses, it's a 20 minute ride to Roma, and very convenient. The rooms are beautifully appointed, the food on the Club floor great ( the Club Room has incredible views), the service thoughtful (rare in a big hotel). I cannot say enough good things about this place. If there was one criticism, it would be the price of things. We thought 38 Euros was a lot for a bowl of minestrone in the Piano Bar, but there is a good non-pretentious restaurant and a couple of GREAT delis in walking distance. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Out of this world”
Reviews.Author: Lisa011
Reviews.Content: A most beautiful hotel, quite different from what you would expect from the exterior. Rooms are luxurious and very clean. The buffet breakfast is like nothing on earth, you could stay there all day. Pool area lovely and free shuttle bus to and from centre of Rome as the hotel is situated outside of the city by 20 mins. Drawbacks - you have to pay if you want a mattress buy the pool, towels are free and also pay for the Spa. I would have thought this should be complimentary to hotel guests. Check hotel website for deals and book direct

Reviews.Title: “Wow...this place is unreal, in a GREAT way!”
Reviews.Author: gardenia06
Reviews.Content: The Cavalieri Hilton is phenomenal. I can't comment on its pricing, as I booked through Hilton Diamond Rewards, but it would be worth a lot. The incredible staff will go out of their way to welcome you, and it seemed like they had staff members who spoke every language! Stay on the Executive Floor if you can! The luxury of going into the Executive Lounge for snacks and drinks whenever you like is a HUGE perk. The rooms are large and beautiful. One of my favorite things about the room was the automatic shade that closed almost like a garage door over the balcony windows. The room got very dark, which I loved because I slept like a baby with the combination of that and the VERY comfortable bed. Check out the pool--it is big and beautiful just like the rest of the hotel and has plenty of lounge chairs. When I went in May it was a bit too cold to swim in the outdoor pool (I tried, and it took my breath away!), but the small indoor pool and hot tub are also available. The free shuttle service to town is nice, but be sure to arrive early--the bus is small and if you miss it, you'll either need to wait another hour or take a taxi. Expect to pay at least 40 Euro for a taxi to the airport. I could only be so lucky to stay here again--what a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: traveller_Mia
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very great, GREAT breakfast, great fresh morning juice, great helping staff, good location. You can take a taxi for 10-15 euro to termini or take the shuttle buss. the staff was very professional and the put/add that little extra thing for your comfort. I liked it very much. The only thing i did´nt like is they made a reservation shop to my account, for something i have already paied for.

Reviews.Title: “Secluded from busy crowds of Rome, with easy access”
Reviews.Author: BARON27
Reviews.Content: Upscale, but not snoby. Modern, but with traditional hospitality. Expansive, but reasonably justified. Overall: very good memories about Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, But Should be Better”
Reviews.Author: DiggityDave3
Reviews.Content: First off let me say that the Cavalieri was beautiful and we had a great time in Rome. That said I would never stay there if I had to pay. We used Hilton points to stay and it was well worth it, but we also locked in the old rates by booking before it became a Waldorf. Service was mediocre at best and obviously the location isn't great. When we arrived and tried to check-in the computers were down and no rooms were ready yet. Not a huge deal since it wasn't even noon yet, but they basically just waved us away. I wanted to at least visit the Colosseo Lounge which at the time was suppossed to have been open to us as Hilton Honors Gold members, but they said no to that since they couldn't even look us up in the computer. The Colosseo Lounge was a waste anyways, I thought it was worse than any of the Hilton Lounges I had been to in the States. Once we did get settled in the room was incredible. No city view unfortunately, but we didn't mind lookin at the notorious radio tower after days of taking in the Roman sights up close. The room was massive and beautiful. Breakfast was probably the high point., I am not a breakfast person but I have never seen a more varied, delicious, and impressive breakfast. The shuttle into the center of Rome was OK, but we had to plan around it sometimes. Catching a cab was OK too, beware you will pay much more if you have the bell man grab one for you. We didn't try this, but there were always at least a few cabs right outside the gates so maybe you could walk out and grab them on your own. There was a nice little commercial area down the hill outside of the hotel. Just head to the right out of the gate. Wish we had found this earlier in our stay. Everything at the hotel is very overpriced so I thought it was worth the nice 10 minute stroll through a quiet residential neighborhood. The pool and grounds looked great, but we were there in December and to see Rome, so didn't use those facilities. Would be great in the Summer, but are you going to go to Rome for that kind of stuff? Overall a nice place, but for the money I think we would have preferred a nice hotel in the city center. For Hilton regulars it works as a base to explore Rome though and it is an experience to remember.

Reviews.Title: “One of the most amazing hotels I've EVER stayed in...”
Reviews.Author: HockeyJoc3
Reviews.Content: I like to think I've stayed in a lot of nice hotels over the years but the Hilton Cavalieri has got to be one of the very best in every way. I used points to stay here - it took me a long time to earn those points and I earned Diamond Status along the way and that whole journey was well-worth the effort to be able to stay here. It is hard for me to compare our experience to a dollar value because of my points but we were very fortunate to have a room on the 6th floor overlooking Rome. The room was beautiful, the view was like a postcard, and the bed has to be the most comfortable bed I think I've ever slept in. If you do have the chance to chose a Rome view DO IT! Everyone was so friendly - it doesn't matter who you were talking to - and if they didn't speak perfect English they tried their best and were very nice about it. Lynne at the Diamond Check-in desk is amazing - and not only explained the hotel amenities but really made sure our questions about Rome itself, tipping customs, how taxis worked, ect., were all answered. If I had to pick ANYTHING at all constructive it has to be the location - a bit far out of town - but if it wasn't for the location I wouldn't have had the view - so pick your battles! Nice scheduled shuttle transportation to the city and back. On the ocassions where we had to take a cab we paid about 12 - 15 Euro depending on where we were going. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends/family and will try everything I can to return here again someday. Five stars - YES.

Reviews.Title: “The awsome service and rooms that you would expect”
Reviews.Author: akentmm
Reviews.Content: As 5 star hotels go the service was absolutely exemplary with great rooms. Food was excellent if a little expensive. The pool and spa is are beautiful and a great way to relax at the end of a days serious walking around Rome. Location wise great location for getting a little out of the city and looking out over the city but it does take some time to get in to the centre. Make sure you have taken good instructions or a GPS to find it. We found it a bit of a struggle without a map and not many people were able to say where it was. Although the grounds and inside are beautiful the building is not the most attractive from the outside (pretty old, but not in a nice way).

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic hotel.....you need to experience this”
Reviews.Author: skiingtoots
Reviews.Content: As regular visitors to Rome I had always said that I wanted to stay in this hotel and eat in the Pergola restaurant....well my hubby had booked this hotel and made a reservation in the restuarant for my birthday treat....what a present!!!! The hotel is lovely, huge reception area with bar/lounge overlooking the pool and gardens. We had a deluxe room which had views overlooking the rome skyline which were absolutely amazing...it was worth the trip just for the view! The room was large, huge bed, good bathroom, chocs in the room every night.... But the best part of this hote is La Pergola restaurant situated at the top of the hotel, which also has the views across Rome city, stunning. We dressed for dinner, men have to wear jackets, and had pre dinner drinks in the bar....dinner was amazing, best food I have ever eaten, the service fantastic. Yes it was pricey but it was worth every penny. Ok so the hotel is out of town a wee bit, but when we walked into town every day it took about 30-40 mins to get to the Vatican, all downhill, once you are there, have a coffee and then carry on....we did walk back a couple of times but also decided on a taxi back which only cost 10 euros, well worth it for the stay in the hotel. One of the evenings we had a pizza/pasta in a restaurant near the hotel, 5/10 min walk so you dont always need to be in town for dinner...it was lovely! The concierge shows you the way on a little map, and one of the bar men knows the owner so put in a good word! We used the fitness centre (the gym) a couple of times and it is state of the art, all new machines etc - brilliant. Didn't use the pool or the sauna etc but they looked amazing. Don't let other reviewers put you off with the location of the hotel, as long as you are aware it is not in town, it is well worth the stay...I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Grand luxury 'over the top' hotel laden with gold furnishings , great views but poor location”
Reviews.Author: NICK
Reviews.Content: Not one of my favorites to be honest , the decor is a bit over the top for my taste , gold and marble everywhere you look . Also when i arrived I found that my reservation had been cancelled by Hilton 'head office' and i despite showing them my reservation I was told that they were full and was given the impression that i was supposed to leave and go elsewhere , given that it was after 10pm and raining i was no mood so quickly requested to see the manager who amazingly found me a room . Also despite the luxury trappings in the room the shower produced no hot water whatsoever which is unacceptable . The rooms have great balconys , comfortable beds , 42 inch flat screen TV and amazing views across Rome but was a 25 Euro taxi to the sights , I would not stay here again because the hotel is just not to my taste and because of the out of town location .

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly the best hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: bobd72
Reviews.Content: I have visited Rome many times and stayed at many of the top hotel (Excedra, Hassler, Westin Excelsior) but there is not better hotel in Rome then the Cavalieri...The hotel is located about a 10 minute cab ride from the center of the city but the distance allows you to have an amazing view of the city below you as the hotel is built on one of the hills surrounding Rome...The grounds, the spa and the pool are spectacular...The pool scene is hilarious (feels like a Felini movie)...You hardly realize that you are in a croweded city...There is a shuttle bus that runs throughout the day that takes you to the center of town...A cab is about 10 EUR and since Rome is a pretty spread out city, you end up taking cabs if you stay in the center of town...The decor is a bit OTT; a bit too many OGed (over golded) and faux Roman accents but is not offensive...The rooms are comfortable and some have amazing views of Rome from the balconies...Make sure you book one of the rooms with views of the city...You will be looking down at the dome of St. Peter's...The restaurant on the top floor, La Pergola, has three Michelin stars...We had dinner there and I thought it was the best meal I have had in Italy and one of the top meals I have ever had...The Cavalieri has some flaws but, as a package, is the best hotel in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel of Extremes..”
Reviews.Author: melbournetraveller99
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a medical conference. I got a room on the 6th floor with spectacular views of the city and the Vatican. The room was clean, comfortable and spacious, furniture ok, but the common areas (corridors and its furniture) so run down it's hard to believe it's a five star in Rome. What really got on my nerves is that they don't provide iron and ironing board in rooms, as there has been some "accident" a few years back. And they break the news to you in quite an arrogant manner. Alternative is to pay 7 euros if you can wait 24 hours, and 10.5 if you happen to have a meeting next morning to have a single shirt pressed. You have to pay 20 euros to use the gym which is absurd. Best thing was the room service: excellent food. Good shuttle service to city centre. Concierge information regarding where to eat outside of hotel can be quite misleading.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel. Terrible Location.”
Reviews.Author: CAK9230
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this lovely, but grossly overpriced hotel. The view from the room was lovely. Unfortunately, the hotel is poorly located on a hill that is pretty far from the city. A cab ride each way costs 20 Euros to go into town. There was a shuttle bus, but it is small and was often filled to capacity. It also ran on the hour and didn't run for 3 hours in the afternoon. The last bus is at 8 PM. So must go to hotel for dinner. Hotel food was was dried out and very expensive. It was 10 Euros for a diet coke and 30+ Euros for an entree. The only consolation was the hotel room cost was paid by the company. I would not stay here again. The staff were top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Pricy Luxory”
Reviews.Author: MisterCoconut
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Cavalieri Hilton several times, and this time brought along family for a week end in Rome. The hotel's location is not particularly good for tourists and short stays, but its other qualities outweigh this. If pressed for time, take a taxi, you can afford it. The view from rooms on the Vatican side is stunning. Roomy furnished balconies makes it tempting to simply sit there and watch. The rooms are luxurious in every detail, absolute bliss after a long day sight seeing. We only ate breakfast, since the hotel restaurants seem very expencive, and its more fun to eat down town anyway. Breakfast, especially if you grab a table by the pool, is excellent. Also, the terrace is great for afternoon drinks or coffee. We took advantage of the hotel's limousine service to the airport, and actually saved money! Alternatively one can take a taxi to Termini Central Station, and then the airport express train, but for a party of 4, that was more expencive. I really like this hotel, highly recommended, but the price stings.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Amazing”
Reviews.Author: dougbunger
Reviews.Content: The single most opulent hotel room I have ever stayed. The marble bathroom was spectacular. And the breakfast! I'm Hilton Gold VIP, so the breakfast was complementary, but it was unbelievable... there was a pastry room: there was one table just for the dozen different honeys. As many of the reviews will say, the Cavalieri is not convenient to the sights-- it is a destination in and of itself. But, there is the shuttle bus to take you into town, and if you need to get a taxi back all you have to say is "Cavalieri".

Reviews.Title: “Plush elegance”
Reviews.Author: Land2Sea
Reviews.Content: We converted our Amex points to Hilton rewards. We stayed here with our children in two adjoining rooms. This luxurious hotel is one of the better in Rome, it's a bit out of the way but the shuttle outside takes you to the various points in the city where most tourists visit. Comfortable elegance at the end of a long sightseeing day is exactly what I wanted. The Evelyn and Crabtree products that smelled heavenly combined with a deep tub took all the cities grime away. This is a hotel with a pool and that's fairly rare in Rome. The hotel will charge extortionist fees for towels and chair pads. These items should be a given. You can walk down the block to a wonderful small restaurant that had fresh fish and menu changes daily. The breakfast is another treat with it's extensive buffet layout and silver service, perfect way to start the day! We did not get the side of the hotel that has the Vatican views but given that we needed the two attached rooms we couldn't complain. Check out the Gucci boutique, when in Rome.......

Reviews.Title: “A shame there were problems”
Reviews.Author: dk011
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night for a meeting having pre booked and pre paid through the Hilton website. On arrival I was upgraded to a suite because the hotel was full, which I thought was great. The suite was like two hotel rooms (I think its a corner suite on the site) - a bedroom and bathroom on one side and a lounge on the other. It was cold in the rooms when I arrived because the a/c was on in the lounge (it was around 10 C outside). I changed it to heat but the lounge never warmed up. Worse, the heating in the bedroom did not work at all. I called down twice about the heating but no-one came to check/fix it. I spent a cold night in the bed room and in the morning found that there was a leak in the bathroom sink. I found this when my feet got wet while I was shaving! I mentioned this on check out and was told that they were sorry. No more. I gave some feedback about this on the Hilton website the following day and got a request for more info a week later. Since then, nothing, despite a reminder. I have stayed at the hotel a few times in the past and always found it to be great but I suspect that on this visit I was given a room with known problems under the guise of an 'upgrade'. I would rather have had a fully operational standard room...

Reviews.Title: “Cavalieri Hilton continues to exceed expectations”
Reviews.Author: janehyde
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned to the Cavalieri Hilton for a holiday break (Christmas through New Year's). The hotel somehow continues to improve on its already extraordinarily high performance. The staff is exceedingly courteous and helpful. Old world service in a modern (though classically elegant) setting. The spa and exercise facilities are top notch. The food is superb. And of course to view is the best in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience, WOW!”
Reviews.Author: addies
Reviews.Content: Amazing stay and staff. So so friendly. Everyone from the front desk to the restaurant staff was excellent and so helpful when we needed anything. The hotel itself is fabulous as well. The breakfast buffet is real high quality. We didn't want to leave our room it was so wonderful. And the shuttle was not inconvenient at all. With no traffic it is just a 15 minute ride down into the city. Our a 8 minute ride to the Vatican. And if you're staying out late past the pickup time, just take a cab for 15 euros back to the hotel. Just a tip. If you arrive at FCO airport, I would recommend just paying for a shutdown. We paid 20 euros per person. But it only took us 30-35 minutes to get to the hotel. Had we tried to take public transportation, we still would have had to find Rome Cavalieri shuttle dropoff or taken a cab from the metro station. I think we saved about an hour or so but taking the shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like royalty”
Reviews.Author: Mission_world
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at the front door to the day we left we could not find a single fault with the service and standards of this hotel. Admittedly, being a diamond VIP meant that we had a more personal service when checking in, but thereafter, as far as the hotel staff were concerned, we were normal guests. However, the service was second to none, whether it was being seated at the breakfast table for the seemingly endless buffet, or asking for advice on the sites of Rome, even when passing the housekeeping staff in the corridors, everyone was friendly and courteous. There was a free shuttle bus into the city every hour, but failing that the taxis were only about EUR10 to EUR12 for the journey. Overall experience - unbeatable!

Reviews.Title: “One of the very best. But very expensive.”
Reviews.Author: SiddMoras
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cavalieri for 2 nights. As I am a gold member I could use my points and enjoyed every bit of it. The lounge was great and we didint have to pay for any food, drinks or internet. The hotel was awesome. (I have been to several fine hotels worldwide). The staff was very helpful. Tips Do visit the Turkish bath if you can. Quite good. To save money, you can have light dinners (sandwiches, lasagna etc) in the Colloseum lounge. But you might want to consider the following. 1. Everything in the hotel is very expensive. 2. Its out on top of a hill (Use the shuttle as much as you can) 3. Very residential area. So no other restaurants or bars nearby. 4. I wasnt given a Vatican view room even though I was a Gold member. Unless you want to spend a lot of time within the hotel to enjoy its fine comforts, I would not suggest this expensive hotel

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: LindsSweet
Reviews.Content: This hotel was incredible. When we arrived, they upgraded us to the executive suite. Excellent service and great food (especially the margherita pizza!). Breathtaking views of the Vatican City from our room. The most comfortable beds ever! Turn-down service with delicious chocolates. Shuttle service to downtown area well worth it. Nice pool and spa area. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Cruzaholic
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Cavalieri three nights prior to a cruise. Having never been to Italy, or Europe for that matter, I was nervous since I was exiting my "comfort zone." Well, that nervousness went away the second I walked through those front doors. The concierge greeted my wife and I with a welcoming smile, and the service never declined from there. The ladies at the front desk all spoke English, so language was no barrier. The room was one of the nicest hotel rooms I have ever seen. The all marble bathroom was spectacular. The room was equipped with additional privacy doors. A second, heavy door could be closed inside the main door that blocked out all hallway noise. This was handy because the locals tend to be lively at night. Also, there was an electric shutter that closed over the balcony doors to block out all light. Being from the Florida Keys, it was great to see a hurricane shutter used for another purpose. The single greatest part of this room was the view. Do not book this hotel without securing a City View Room!!! This hotel is perched on a hill overlooking all of downtown Rome. The view actually took my breath away. Seeing the Colloseum, Pantheon, Spanish Steps, etc for the first time from that balcony was simply awesome! Beware, you may have a hard time getting up in the morning. The beds are almost too comfortable. The only down side is that the hotel is not downtown. However, there is a free shuttle that runs downtown on the hour. It returns from downtown on the half hour. Although, I must say that the drop-off location is not very good. It is several blocks behind the top of Spanish Steps and it is very difficult to get your bearings the first time. They should find a more central location.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: Rucky.England
Reviews.Content: I feel extremely fortunate that I have stayed at the Rome Cavalieri and at a very reasonanable price due to family connections. It is the most amazing hotel I have ever stayed in. The room was beautiful and we were fortunate to be upgraded to the Rome View which was breathtaking. Breakfast - which we had included - was fantastic and the setting by the pool was brilliant. We had no problems with the shuttlebus and the friendly driver crammed us in a couple of times to make sure we could get on. The drop off points were perfect and very central to Rome - you expect to walk a lot in a city so had no problem getting to where we wanted from the locations. It's a shame the hotel isn't more central as I don't like working to a (bus) timescale when I'm away but that is the only downside there is. The fact there was a free shuttle was a great service. There is a fantastic restaurant within walking distance from the hotel which was very reasonable, head back towards the main road and then at the junction head up a long road (only a 5-10 min walk) it has brilliant views of Rome and great food for about £10 a main course. Overall an amazing hotel and wonderful break though it is expensive on a full rate!!

Reviews.Title: “awesome!”
Reviews.Author: sarperozge
Reviews.Content: We stayed there only one day but it was awesome. The hotel was really nice and luxurious, the room was perfect, it's the best I've ever seen. The bed was really comfortable. Altough it wasnt at all close to the city center, I loved the hotel. As the price was quite high but it's normal for this hotel. The only thing we didnt like was that they asked money for pool towel and pool chair. After paying that much money to the hotel, we were shocked to hear that we had to pay for towel and chair. It was a bit to much! We had lunch at the restaurant near to the pool, it was expensive compared to the restaurants in the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible... if you are using HHpoints”
Reviews.Author: MarkRT
Reviews.Content: Maybe it was a combination of things - it was late May, the weather was perfect, we were HH Diamond so, there was no charge for anything... I guess, if money is no object, this place was incredible. The beds were the most comfortable I ever experienced. The lounge for Diamond members was unbelievable... espressos with breakfast, chocolate and cognac later in the day.. views of the Vatican, and basically all of Rome from the balcony....it was all just beautiful.. that said.... bear in mind, I busted my behind for two years on the road for business racking up points etc.. We flew 1st class RT from Chicago on Luftansa, and toured Italy.....Yes, this was the finest hotel experience I ever had... I found out our room would have cost $900+ per night and God knows what the drinks and festivities at the lounge would have racked up... but again, if you are in that bracket, you will love the attention, the views, the rooms etc.. we never ate there (truly, it's Italy!.. get out and enjoy!). Our cost on check-out (we still laugh) was a comment from the front desk.... "no charge.. "atsa nice eh??" So, spend the money if you have it to burn... for us, honestly, we were using points so it was a "now or never" situation more-so than a requirement but we will never forget it.

Reviews.Title: “How to get around the high $$$$”
Reviews.Author: sfuji1
Reviews.Content: I share the same opinions as everyone here, but enjoyed Hotel de' Ripoff's review with a smile. Therefore, will write about the other 'stuff'. Food: First of all, I overheard complaints that dinner was running about $350.00USD so we opted to walk down the street instead. If you make a right and head towards the main intersection, (do not cross) turn left, you will find a wonderful Sicilian restaurant. Dinner for 2, (food only, salad, main, dessert) 27euros!!! Breakfast buffet was 38 euros per person, and well worth it. The selections were vast: 12 types of granola, 25+ jams, 5 types of milk, 9+ juices, seperate juice bar with blender and protein powder. All sorts of fruits, oatmeals, cheeses, antipastos, breads, organic offerings and more. Once again, 'breakfast' only, so if you want brunch, you won't find it at this AM buffet. Transportation: I would skip the hotel shuttle to town. It drops you off in a busy part of the city and you have to walk blocks to get to any of the sights. Since the hotel is used for trades/conventions, the shuttle is always full. Therefore, take a taxi to the Cipro Station (10Euros) and then take the train(s) to many of the sites. (you may have to transfer one or two times depending on your destination) When you return from town, find the train(s) that will take you towards Baste, get off at Cipro and taxi it back to the hotel. (11Euros). Mid-city to hotel was about 20 minutes or less. Trains were either 1 or 2 Euros depending upon destination. As for the pool area, we did not use it, however, we were 'followed' while meandering through the beautiful grounds. We laughed because it's just as everyone described here on Tripadvisor. The view from the room was absolutely spectacular, and we used points, and did not have a view of the 'tower.' If staying over a weekend, sit out on your balcony at night, and listen to the beautiful music from below piano bar below. (Sorry, but not sure about the tower-view side of the hotel) Late check out was denied, because the hotel was fully booked, which is quite often due to conventions. Beautiful hotel, although not sure that I would pay more than $500.00/night to stay here. I much prefer the Four Seasons chain, and would not consider this an 'official' Waldorf, yet. ALSO WATCH FOR PICKPOCKETS IN TOWN. THEY WANT YOUR PASSPORT!

Reviews.Title: “the dogs pollux”
Reviews.Author: masspecguy
Reviews.Content: I quite liked the caveleri but I couldnt give it the full 5 excellent rating The gym look’s state of the art and the shuttle was a ¾ length coach which means there’s about 30 seats –room enough for everyone while I was there. Did phone the “action line” line once for some advice -no one answered maybe they should call it the "in-action line" Now a Waldorf Astoria, the best rooms overlook the pools at the back, breakfast is a fine affair but as everyone queue’s for the “cook while you wait eggs” from the chef nobody can get to the pre cooked stuff!!! Out of the city this is an oasis of calm As diamond member I was upgraded to a better room and given full access to the lounge and spa But I can fully understand people’s frustration of paying top dollar to find no extras included

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Cavalieri was a great stay on points”
Reviews.Author: Gymgirltravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Cavalieri in Rome for 4 nights, total. We stayed on points and they have a policy that they will only allow so many points' stays/night. So, we stayed one night, then had to leave and stay somewhere else for 2 nights and then come back for 3 nights. The first night we were on the Executive Level with access to the Executive Suite, complete with complimentary snacks, wine, and coffee/espresso. Plus the patio overlooks the city and there are views of St. Peter's. Very nice. When we came back, we were not booked on the Executive Level, but did have a balcony which again faced St. Peter's. The rooms were well-appointed, clean, and had most of the comforts that Americans are used to (a safe, English-speaking TV). I only have 3 complaints: 1) the Hiltons love to use the 1/2 shower door in their European showers. This means that typically there's water on the shower floor when you get out...so be careful. And 2) no one at the front desk told us that the VERY elaborate breakfast was included in our stay. So, we figured that out on the last day. 3) Lastly, as most everyone has commented, this hotel is quite removed from the city center. While they do provide a shuttle to/from Piazza Barberini, it stops running at 8 pm. So, you must take a taxi back if you stay out. On the upside, there are several excellent local restaurant options within walking distance of the hotel - AND they were cheaper than being in the center of town. Overall, the staff spoke excellent English and were quite helpful. However, I'm not sure we would have paid the money had we not been staying on points.

Reviews.Title: “First a nickel, then a dime”
Reviews.Author: Hymanez
Reviews.Content: Cost to logon to the internet for 24 hours? 27 Euros Cost for one bowl of soup? 28 Euros Cost to sit by the pool? 16 Euros Cost for the bottle of water to accompany your tennis lesson? 5 Euros Your stay at the Cavalieri Hilton? A nickel and dime experience. Yes, the hotel is beautiful, the rooms elegant, the location serene, but when one is spending north of $400 a night for a room, can't the hotel throw in a little something. We stayed here as part of a conference held at the hotel. If we had been here for a vacation, maybe I'd have a felt a little less nickel and dimed, because we would've opted out of extras - like the internet. Also, if you're really there to see Rome, the remote location is frustrating, because the shuttle is just hourly with a four-hour break midday and an early end at 8pm. Also, every time I got on the shuttle it was full - requiring those, not there 15 minutes early to wait in line, to stand for the 20 minute trip, get off and pay for a taxi, or to wait an hour for the next shuttle. Would not stay here again for these reasons, though it's a great place for those seeking romance and a spa experience and with less time and monetary hangups.

Reviews.Title: “A change of Name”
Reviews.Author: NorGib
Reviews.Content: The old Hilton Cavalieri...now part of the Waldorf Astoria Group. 420 Euros a night Executive Floor room..upgraded to Rome view. Have stayed here 4 times before. I f you are staying there the Executive floor is a must. Otherwise you will have to eat & drink out. Two small Italian beers 20 Euros, Scotch and a Boody Mary came in at 33 Euros. All free in the exec lounge. The staff in the Exec lounge are a treasure..you want for nothing. Lounge meals have gone down slightly....repeats of pasta and rice keeping the costs down but not enhancing such a prestige hotel. Changed some of the bathroom accessories to rather naff cheap items you would more than likely see in a Holiday Inn. Rooms excellent and to a high standard but damp stains on coving ...not what you expect for 4w20 Euros a night. The hotel is a high standard but is starting to look its 30+ years in places. Little chips and knocks here and there that haven't been repaired soon add up and take the exclusivness and elegance away from the building.

Reviews.Title: “GReat Hotel- but Location was a real CON along with HOTEL Food prices!”
Reviews.Author: BellinaRaffy
Reviews.Content: I was here for six days working at a work conference so I personally did not pick the hotel. I have stayed at many fine hotels in my life and yes, I would say that this hotel really is a special gem and quite nice. The PROS: Really nice pool, fitness center, Very Comfortable rooms- especially the bed Great cleaning of rooms and overall clienliness Staff was polite and very efficent CONS: LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION... this is what really put a damper in my stay. You simply cannot just walk outside and see places, dine nor stroll. There really is not much in this area and this really was quite frustrating. The hotel has a free shuttle into town but if you must base your day around a shuttle. Taxi's are plenty but 15euros into town is anoying too. FOOD PRICES- Again, I have stayed in many nice places in my life and have no issue paying for good food... BUT 11EUROS a soda is a CRIME! My dinners were about 70-100 euros each night without any STEAK or FISH! Overall.. the hotel is great but bc of location and exagerated food prices, I would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: illini1797
Reviews.Content: Most of the other reviews sum up the hotel very well. This truly is one of the finest Hilton properties around, nicer than the Waldorf. My wife and I stayed for three nights in August, it was our second stay there. If you can stay using points, the costs of the incidentals is more than worth it. Yes, everything there is very expensive, but if you have use of the club level the lounge is excellent offers food throughout the entire day and free drinks including alcohol. All of the staff was extremely helpful with reservations or any other questions that we had, and everyone spoke excellent English.

Reviews.Title: “...not up to par for 850$ a night”
Reviews.Author: smsbnyc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fabulous if you stay on Hilton points and do not care about good service. Even better if you stay on the executive floor on points and your room faces the Vatican. However, if you pay cash for your room, this is not the place for you. Stay in downtown Rome at a five star hotel that has great service-something more personal and elegant. 21 euros for a bowl of minestrone soup. 35 euros for a cheeseburger. We paid 495 euros for dinner for 4 for a casual night on our first night at the hotel (we were tired). 3 hours for a marginal dinner. It was awful. It's a big convention hotel (Hess Oil and YPO were there when we were- fabulous place for them to hold a convention) and if you stayed for free, you would love it! (except the 20 euro cab ride into the city center) 15 euros for a chaise lounge by the pool. We didn't have to pay that fee, but they will chase you down to tell you that you need to pay it, and then say,"ok- well go find an empty chair". For those of you who have stayed at Hotel Prince de Galles in Paris (next to Georges V), it is a similar experience. Except location is worse in Rome. If you have Hilton points, you should absolutely use them to stay here. It is a fantastic deal. Rome is beautiful and can't wait to return. It will just be to somewhere more central, more highly rated and with better service.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel di Rip-Off”
Reviews.Author: Rome94
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beyond totally over-priced: In fact they should renameit, The Hotel di Rip-Off. The location is poor, because it is about 30 minutes from the center of Rome. The hotel stops taking you to the Via Venato stop at 7:30 PM and pick ups from there stop at 8:00. So, if you want to have a late dinner you can pay 50.00 American dollars in a round trip cab fare. This hotel tries to be classy, but their cheapness makes them anything but that. Aside from paying a minimum of 400.00 per night, they also charge you 16 Euros per day almost 25.00 dollars to use the pool. In fact they nickel and dime you for everything. Don't buy anything or eat in the hotel unless you want to get charged 3-4 times what you should be charged. A sandwich cost almost 40.00 dollars, average wine at best 14.00 American dollars a glass. The front desk people are rude and very unhelpful and act as though they are doing you a favor by answering simple questions. The rooms are nice and the pool is fine, but for the price you pay they should be. By the way we had to ask them to heat the pool. The pool staff is at time rude, especially if you don't tip them or give them less than they feel entitled. This hotel is all about how much money they can squeeze out of you. Corn flakes cost $20.00, if you can imagine that? There are much better hotels and hotel values in Rome with a far superior location.

Reviews.Title: “50 Euros Per Ice Cube???”
Reviews.Author: Dizzle56
Reviews.Content: OK, they did not charge you for ice cubes, but when I was told they charged 30-50 Euro just to use the pool, my jaw hit the floor. I was told that if I wanted to come down, and jump in, I wouldn't be charged, but if I wanted a towel and chair, then I had to pay. Unreal for a 5-star hotel! ONLY use this hotel if you are using points, DO NOT PAY A PENNY FOR THIS PLACE! It was out of the way and while they did have a free shuttle to take you into the city, if you stayed out past 8:00 or 9:00, expect to pay a good amount for a cab back. The concierge was rude, not very helpful, and pretty arrogant. Nearby is the Zodiac, which actually has the best view of the city, good food (although they did mess up our order 3 times) it is about a 5 minute walk. Ask for directions, its well worth it for the veiw and a drink! The rooms were nice and clean, but if you are using points, expect a beautiful parking lot view. They claimed the hotel was sold out when I asked for a nice view, but it was clearly empty. Certainly it was b/c I used points,. Overall, the hotel was not even that nice for the point value. 5 Star hotels are all about service and quality, using that logic, this was a 3-star at best. Room service was very expensive and not good. I would barely reccomend this hotel even with the use of points.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent stay.”
Reviews.Author: yorkie39
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently completed a 6 night stay at the hotel and were impressed by the quality of the establishment and the level of service we received.We were allocated a king executive plus room on the sixth floor with views over Rome. We could even hear the bells of St Peters.So many things about this hotel impressed us both and they have all been outlined by previous reviews. We had access to the club lounge, which was outstanding. I have stayed at numerous quality hotels around the world, and this lounge surpassed any in the hilton family chain, including the Waldorf Towers. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff, especially Eva, Ester and Biutti. There are five servings of food throughout the day, accompanied by whatever drinks you want, I advise anyone to book this level of room.The pool service and spa facilities were again outstanding. I could go and on, but as I said earlier previous reviews all cover the points. All I will add is book a few nights there and you will not be disapointed. Initially I found the general prices in the hotel very expensive, but having explored Rome for 6 days, this is a very expensive city, just bite the bullet and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Great place with bad location”
Reviews.Author: wavy0_0
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights over the Easter holiday (checked in on the Easter Friday and checked out on Easter Monday) with my parents, and it was a great place to stay. As I booked the hotel as a reward stay using my Hilton points, I got upgraded to a luxury twin room with Rome view (as a gold member). The room was fabulous! We got a balcony in the room, the view was fantastic! It was overlooking Rome! I love their soap menu, pillow menu in the room! That's a really 5 stars hotel!!! The chocolates they sent me to welcome my arrival was excellent! On Easter Sunday, they also sent an Easter egg to our room, and it was really really lovely and nice! The staffs speaks good English and very helpful! The breakfast was fantastic with many many many many many choices! The hotel itself was so grand and with many brilliant decoration, such as great paintings. The only worst bit about the hotel was the location, it was too far away from the Rome city centre, eventhough they got shuttle bus for the guest, it's not very frequent and need to queue up quite early for the last bus back to the hotel in case it was full.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place for a family in Rome during the summer”
Reviews.Author: Emma011
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect place to stay if you are in Rome during the Summer. The rooms are large and very comfortable. The pools and gardens are unique in Rome. It is like being in a fabulous resort ... in Rome... the best of all worlds!!! We were staying on the executive floors. They have the best executive lounge we had ever experienced. We can not wait to go back next summer!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely out of this world”
Reviews.Author: trishg1972
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights recently using our Hilton points. At 40,000 points per night it is a lot of points to spend but it is so worth it. For the entire stay we were treated unbelievably well. On check in we were ushered to the VIP check in area where we were told we had been upgraded to the executive floors (Diamond membership is so worth it!). We were taken to our room and showed the exec lounge on the way through. The upgrade saved us an absolute fortune during our stay. You get your breakfast for free, drinks all day from 7am until 11pm and snacks, cakes and biscuits all day too. A couple of nights we actually ate in the lounge in the evening - saved us a fortune. Staying on the Exec floor also gives you free access to the gym, outdoor and indoor pools and spa saving you the £16 or so per person they charge you each day for this service. On our last night we treated ourselves to a meal in La Pergola - amazing food, amazing service but accompanied by a bill of £300 - for 2! Mind you, we worked out we have probably saved this with the room upgrade anyway. This is a top notch hotel - best Hilton I have ever stayed in by far. It is certainly not cheap but worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: GenW
Reviews.Content: I stayed during a conference and this was one of the most magnificent hotels I have ever stayed in. I was upgraded to an executive suite overlooking Rome - each room has an individual balcony and the view is sensational on that side of the hotel, even from the standard rooms. The beds were really comfortable, all the furniture and fittings were in good condition - everything I would expect from a 5-star hotel. The only negative was to use the hotel facilities including pool, gym etc, this was not included in the conference rate and they wanted to charge 20 euros each time! I thought this was quite unreasonable for paying guests. Of course the mini-bar prices were also outrageous but then I expect that in a place like this - a 5 star hotel with breathtaking views over Rome. An unforgettable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: laujac
Reviews.Content: I must first say that my husband is a Hilton Diamond Member which may contribute to exceptional service that we received. Upon arrival until we check out, we were treated like royalty. While checking in my 9 year old son mentioned to the woman at the Diamond desk that the next day was his birthday. She smiled at him and wished a nice birthday. We were given our keys to adjoining, spacious, plush and beautifully decorated rooms. The baths were marble and fully stocked with Hermes bath supplies. The next day when we returned to our room there was a large raspberry torte with "Happy Birthday" written across it... there was also a tray of beverages with a birthday card addressed to my son. We did not request these things... this was purely done by the woman at the desk on her own. It made my son's day. The executive lounge was wonderful. Food was changed on the hour... all kinds of meats, cheeses, salads... all day long and a full bar was offered... free of charge. We were given cards for the pool and were not charged a fee to sit down by it. I did, however, notice the expense of the drink and the food if ordered poolside... but I quickly realized that ALL of Rome is extremely expensive so this is to be expected when staying at a five star hotel in this city. If you are a Diamond Member... do not pass on the opportunity to stay at this grand hotel. It is truly spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “They don't like Americans”
Reviews.Author: hcastro500
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin. Travelling as part of a very large group composed of families and married couples . We were traveling with our sons ages 14 and 19. Only three people are allowed in a room, although the rooms were quite large by american standards. The sofa bed was purposefully small to accommodate only one person. Our youngest son stayed with friends. One week prior my family stayed in a different hotel in Rome. The rooms were smaller and all four of us slept in one room. Back to the Hilton. Our second night we returned late in the evening to find the sofabed was not set up and there were no sheets. So we had to wait for housekeeping. They also failed to set up the sofabed in our friends room. There was a bar well stocked with all sorts of glasses which they failed to clean up and replace. Also one of the maids called the front dest to complain that there were four people staying in our room. Naturally, during the day my sons spent their time with us. There was a 16 euro fee to sit around the pool. A hamburger by the pool cost $50. It was brutally hot in Rome and no one was enjoying the the pool. We spent our last day in Rome sitting in our room because we refused on principal to pay money to use the pool. Later at the airport friends shared similar stories about the rude treatment they recieved from different members of the staff. One overheard a maid complaining about "the Americans." To add insult to injury, an evening taxi ride for four from the center of Rome to the hotel is around 11euro. We were charged 25euro's the first night. Enough said.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a bad location”
Reviews.Author: gizzardd
Reviews.Content: This is a huge sprawling mega-resort (similar to something you would see at Disney) with beautiful landscaped gardens and pool area. But, it is not in Rome. You can not walk anywhere from here. We typically walk 2-4 miles/day on vacation to explore cities and assumed we could walk from this hotel - it's not the distance but you'd have to cross highways and climb over hills and winding roads and busy streets - you can not walk in to historic Rome or the Vatican from here. I guess if you have spent 3 nights in Rome and want to relax by the pool, this hotel is perfect. The beds are very comforatable. The bathrooms are huge with great towels and showers. The view is nice. But the prices are really expensive (both for the rooms and the food and drink once you arrive) and for the same money, you can stay in someplace like the St. Regis right in the heart of Rome. AND, the car rental desk is no longer on this hotel. Despite what Auto Europe tells you, the desk is now closed. Just FYI.

Reviews.Title: “Luxuary Plus!!!”
Reviews.Author: RMDRJD
Reviews.Content: I was fortunate enough for my brother in law to book this hotel with his Hilton Points. This was my first hotel stay in a series of seven hotels. It was down hill after staying at the Cavaliere Hilton. The rooms were beautiful, clean and spacious. The executive lounge staff was always receptive and the buffet of snacks were plentiful. The breakfast presentation was always welcoming with a breathtaking view of the City . You can park your car for 5 Euros day. To venture into town is only a short cab ride or their shuttle will take you there. It was the best hotel stay of my 17 days in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, we will definitely return”
Reviews.Author: denisetraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from the Cavalieri and we had a wonderful stay. The hotel is NOT downtown so if you are the kind of traveler who wants to be right in the city at the heart of the action, then this hotel is not for you. The hotel is located in the hills above the Vatican so it is like a refuge from the hussle and bussle of the city at the end of the day and the views of the city are spectacular. The hotel runs a shuttle every hour to and from downtown so you don't have to spend a lot of money on taxis. (If you stay in town for dinner you will have to taxi back since the last shuttle returns from downtown at 8PM). Our routine was to shuttle into town for the day to see the sites and come back to the room about 4 or 5PM to take a shower, relax a bit and enjoy some air conditioning (it is VERY hot in Rome during the summer months and the restaurants do not believe in air conditioning). Then we'd shuttle back into town around 7ish for dinner and taxi home. It was perfect. The room is very large, with a sitting area as well as a nice balcony. Be sure to request a room with a view. It is worth it. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “It doesn't get much better!”
Reviews.Author: fassio
Reviews.Content: Our first stay at this magnificient hotel. The location leaves something to be desired, but they routinely bus you downtown. That being said, this hotel is wonderful in every respect! First, and foremost, the staff is exceptional, well trained and professional. The spa is great, the executive lounge the best I've seen and I am a regular with Hilton. My sons and their wives (late twenties, early thirties) loved it every bit as much and the only other downside is that it is so relaxing that you may be tempted to spend more time at the hotel than you were planning. We stayed at the Hilton Stucky in Venice and the difference between these two hotels is night and day.

Reviews.Title: “Very Swanky but not priced for the average to above average traveler”
Reviews.Author: sharonAnnapolis
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveler both for business & pleasure and this hotel certainly stands alone. It is a hotel for the rich with amenties that you will not see at other Hilton properties including those in the Waldorf Astoria collection in the States. The extra touches including heated towel racks in the rooms and a sunglass cleaning station at the entrance to the pool are special treats. The pool is gorgeous and the pool boys are at your service with padded terrycloth covered cushions for your lounge chairs and fresh towels whcih are brought to you at your chair. Depending on your Hilton Honor status, you may have to pay an extra fee. We did not. The service is top notch throughout the hotel although they are used to catering to folks with unlimited cash flow. If you ask for the best transportation options, the first suggestion will be a private car & driver. Our room was oversized with a king bed and a sleeper sofa which was perfect for my husband and I and our teenage son. The appointments in the room are quite elegant. You do have a sound proof door to close off hall noise in the evenings and an electronic shade that blocks out all light from your balcony. The bathroom is large and luxurious. We did utilize the hotel shuttle in and out of the city. Once in the city, you are close to sites such as the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain but will need additional transportation to the Colisseum and Vatican. We took the subway which was easy once you figured out how to get tickets. Be sure to have coins available to use the automated ticket machines. It is smart to be in line for the hotel shuttle early. If the shuttle becomes full, you are out of luck and must wait for the next one an hour later or take a cab which is expensive. We did walk from the hotel to the Vatican one morning. It is about a forty minute walk but pleasant, safe and all downhill. We did not buy one extra item at the hotel. The food was ultra expensive. As Americans with the current exchange rate, a hamburger and a beverage would be over $50. I think the hotel should rethink this since many travelers to the hotel do not have that in the budget. We met several families that went elsewhere for ALL meals. A bottle of water or can of soda was not even affordable. We bought a supply at a nearby store and brought them into the hotel. Overall, our stay was worthwhile and it was fun to experience the opulence.

Reviews.Title: “Would give it a 6-star rating! - Really in a class of its own”
Reviews.Author: ottwatrvlr
Reviews.Content: The Rome Hilton Cavalieri has to be one of the top Hilton hotel in the world! If you are not on an award stay, this is a very expensive place to stay but the amenities, the staff and everything else about this hotel is world-class. When staying at this hotel, your room will usually have one of two views: Premium rooms have a view of the city and the Vatican whereas regular rooms and some executive rooms have a view toward the front of the property and a communication tower. During my stay, I was upgraded to an executive room with the "communication tower" view. The room featured a balcony, marble bathroom and was of a very decent size. The room contained many premium bathroom amenities (not available at other Hilton properties) and most were branded Hermes-Paris. There was a double-door/miror that can be closed at night providing more privacy/reducing noise. The executive lounge was also a great experience with the best food assortment of food of all any Hilton I've been to so far. If one is not too hungry, they can actually "dine" in the lounge. The lounge has 4 mini-balconies with lovely views of the Vatican and the city. The hotel has a nice spa and outside pool, music at night outside,... I did not dine at the Pergola but it is one of the top-rated restaurant in Rome. One thing to note: As wonderful as this hotel is, it is not in the main "tourist" area of Rome. The hotel offers an hourly shuttle service between the hotel and the city. This service stops rather early so one may have to take a taxi between the city and the hotel atr night or using public transit. While in Rome, I had a Roma pass and regularly took public transit between the hotel and the city. The nearest bus stop is about 5-10 minutes away and it is a 10 minutes ride to the nearest subway station.

Reviews.Title: “A" hotel in a "B" location”
Reviews.Author: WereFromTheBronx
Reviews.Content: Luxury resort overlooking Rome. The hotel has a grand lobby and perfectly landscaped grounds. It sits on a hill with an incredible view of Rome and absolutely perfect sunsets. Location: not walkable to the center of the city - must take a short cab ride. Limited local restaurants and shops a short walk down the street. Amenities: Upscale (expensive) restaurant and luxury shopping in hotel. Outdoor pool and parking on site. Rooms: Very well appointed - marble bathrooms, pot lighting and large balconies. Highly recommended for meetings, conferences, and a "get-away" from the hustle of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Pretentious, over-priced. Hotel bling.”
Reviews.Author: Arncliffegirl
Reviews.Content: We really didn’t enjoy our stay in this over-priced, over-blown hotel (we were there for a conference). Everything looks “luxurious” on the surface, and there is that level of obsequious service (every member of staff greets you EVERY time you walk down a corridor, even if only 5 seconds earlier!). There are pool attendants in crisp white uniforms, and many of the guests have deep tans and lots of gold bling. Surface sophistication is a good summary of this place. There is “free” use of the hotel pool for guests (and it is a good pool, big enough for real exercise), BUT just try to sit anywhere, or even put your book and towel down, and you’ll be pounced upon and told you must pay a 16 Euro sun lounge fee. Although swimming laps during opening hours, I was tapped on the hand and told I was swimming "contrary to regulations". I never found out which regulation, but assume it may have been because it was cloudy? Or perhaps because I put my towel down on a chair undercover? I said that if a manager cared to come and explain the regulation to me perhaps we would have something to discuss, but no-one appeared, of course. Perhaps that explains why there is rarely anyone IN the pool, merely adorning the edges? The pool doesn't open until 9am, so if you are there for a conference, don't think about a pre-breakfast swim for exercise. Guests are not allowed to iron clothes. The excuse given is “European fire regulations”. Strange, I’ve never encountered that regulation in other, lowlier hotels in Europe! Might it have anything to do with the exorbitant prices they charge for the hotel laundry to iron clothes? I did see one guest scuttling down a corridor with a contraband iron! It was cheaper to buy one new and smuggle it in than pay ironing prices (eg 11 Euros per shirt, 3 per pair of nickers, for those so inclined) Be prepared to bring your money with you, not only for laundry....a coffee costs 8 Euros, a small coke from the minibar the same. A hamburger is 25 Euros. Check your bill on the TV regularly - we found mysterious minibar charges appeared which we had to query. They were politely amended. The hotel has a shuttle bus which operates a few times a day to Piazza Barberini in Rome; be sure to queue at least 10 minutes before departure to get a place; otherwise it is a taxi ride, or there are public buses from nearby, but you won’t be volunteered that information by hotel staff. You pay the same whether you have a view over Rome or not. The "other" side where we were has a splendid view of an enormous communcations tower and the hotel driveway. There is no need to pay the hyper-inflated food prices at the hotel as there are some terrific restaurants nearby for those who venture out of the “compound”. Turn right out of the hotel and walk about 10 minutes to Piazza delle Medaglie d’Oro and you will find some good options, including a Sicilian restaurant . A bit further on, in via Prisciano, da Luciano can be recommended. Good local fare in a middle-class neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Highlight of our Trip”
Reviews.Author: bemison
Reviews.Content: My wife and I ended our honeymoon in Rome at the Hitlon Cavalieri -- what a way to end our trip!! We stayed using Hilton points and received a Diamond member upgrade to the executive floor. Our private balcony had amazing views of the city and we ate breakfast overlook the city, including the Colosseum and St. Peter's. The executive lounge had a large selection of wines, liquors, juice and soft drinks. There was also plenty of food throughout the day. The amenity of the hotel were wonderful (although quite expensive if not included with your room stay on the executive level). The hotel is located outside of the city center, but the free shuttle ride (or 10 Euro cab fare) is a small price ot pay for the many many other benefits of this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Experience - Class Act”
Reviews.Author: venturagm
Reviews.Content: We started our tour of Italy with a 5 night stay at the Cavalieri in Rome. The hotel was luxurious, the grounds impeccable, and the rooms strikingly elegant. There were a bit too many stone lions dotted around the grounds. It appeared as if the hotel stumbled on a warehouse of them and tried to use every single one. After spending a week at a rugby tournament in Dublin, I was really looking forward to this hotel to refresh the batteries and relax. The rooms were stunning, the A/C worked like a champ, and the patio black-out, roll-down door was a huge surprise! When this door came down and you used the sound proof door, the room became the ideal sleeping space. You could sleep for 24 hours in this room. There was one day where some contractors started to do some major work in a mechanical space directly beneath our room at 8am. We contacted the front desk, which was completely unaware of any scheduled work. I was able to guide one of the assistant managers to the work site, which he promptly stopped. We had no further issues. The Managing Director sent up some champagne as an apology for the interruption, a thorough class act. Now be aware that like all luxury hotels, this place is not cheap. There are fees for everything. A burger from the pool bar cost 22 Euros (about $30), and from what I saw from those that ordered one, it wasn't anything particularly special. If you are using points to stay here and are on a tight budget, plan on eating at the restaurants a 5 minute walk from the hotel. The shuttle runs to the AV Venezia where you will find a subway and bus stop and a tourist bus stop. The shuttle pauses from noon to 3pm and finishes at 7:30pm. Taxis back to the hotel run around 15 Euros. I highly recommend this hotel and wish the other Hiltons in Italy were so well run and maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, but only use HH points”
