Reviews.Author: jayhawkinden
Reviews.Content: We drove down from Siena to Rome for a 3 night stay. It was nice to drop our Hertz car at the hotel. We used our Hilton points to stay there, just like everyone else. Frankly it is the only reason to stay here, don't pay for it unless money is no object to you. ROOM: Amazing room, there really is no comparison. Huge room, huge bathroom, robes, privacy sound proof door to keep hallway noise out, automatic metal shutter blinds to keep light out of room from balcony, large balcony, pillow menu, soap menu, soft bed, tons of pillows. HOTEL: The prices are unbelievable! The food prices are really high, appetizers (primas) start at 20 E, and entrees are 40 E. Didn't eat there. The pool looks amazing but it costs 18E per person for a towel and lounge chair! You would think for the price of the hotel the pool would be included! The SPA looks very nice, but didn't use it. The good thing is the shuttle that runs in the morning/evening. It drops you off in downtown Rome, after about a 20 minute drive. The shuttle runs every hour, with the last pick up at 8:30 pm in town, that means you will be taking a taxi back to the hotel every night, which is about 15 E. The bus is very prompt, so don't ask the driver to wait, he won't! OVERALL: Great place to stay if you are using points. I would never pay to stay here, even if I could. The place in just a little too upscale for my taste, I never thought I would EVER say that! If you are spending money, stay a great hotel closer to town.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: cosmicroy
Reviews.Content: This location was booked last minute as we were meant to go to St Tropez but reconsidered and chose Rome instead ! Plus points - Location - awesome view of Rome Rooms, clean and tidy, nice touch of Hermes toiletries Restaurants - the very high standards Pool - spacious and clean, well attended by staff Free regular shuttle to centre of Rome but we didn't use, stupid us! Executive lounge - refreshments on tap, watch the peasants eat and drink like it was free ! Staff - just fantastic Bad points - Live music until midnight outside Ajoining room door paper thin so noisy neighbours will be heard Staying on 8th floor has the La Pergola restaurant above, so late at night you will hear movement above. No dress code for the executive lounge, you will see people in shorts, dressing gowns and probably the worst dressed tourists in town ! In summary a top hotel with great service.

Reviews.Title: “Unparalleled Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Rhodes461
Reviews.Content: We could never have afforded to stay here without using Hilton points but that said, am I ever glad we used them here. The property was wonderful with the exception of the giant microwave relay tower on the front lawn. When you book, ask for a room with a view of the city. it must be one of the nicest views of Rome from anywhere. The room was wonderful. The amenities were extraordinary. As a Diamond VIP member I was given access to the Grand Spa and it was a wonderful respite after a day of hoofing it all over Rome's cobblestone streets. The executive lounge was open from 6am to 11pm with complimentary drinks and an ever changing array of food choices. The shuttle bus from the hotel ran like clockwork and was convenient in the drop off spots. The hotel is expensive for anything. The bar drinks were outrageous and a burger by the pool will set you back about $30 USD.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest Hotel in Rome by Far!!!”
Reviews.Author: pope1228
Reviews.Content: We used our HH points, much like all of our American counterparts at the hotel. It exceeded our expectations! Service was amazing. The view overlooking Rome is something you will never forget. Free Shuttle brings within walking distance to everything in Rome. If you are Gold or Diamond, use the lounge which has a great breakfast in the morning and cocktails through the evening. On a side note, do yourself a favor and buy a Roma Pass. It helps with all the attractions as well as subway and bus rides. Do be careful of taxi drivers that will attempt to take you for a ride around town. A ride should not cost more than 15-20 euro to the hotel. Overall and amazing stay, I really hope to return to Rome...we made sure to toss our coins into the Trevi Fountain!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel to go with a great city”
Reviews.Author: rcallahan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cavalieri on a friends recommendation. I stayed 5 nights using all my Hilton points. I sent emails directly to the hotel and made arrangements for roses for my wife for our anniversary. When we checked in we were whisked over to the Diamond check-in area. We didn't get the Vatican view room but we were on the far end away from the antenna and it was on the executive floor. We could see it from the corner of our room. I was pretty upset about this but as it turned out it didn't really matter. When we weren't in Rome we were in the great executive lounge. What I didn't expect was there was a very large conference in the hotel and I'm sure they got the bulk of the view rooms. The executive lounge Iis the best i've been in. To save money we had breakfast in the lounge and snacks. We'd get a late large lunch in Rome and finish up with snacks, drinks and espresso back in the lounge. When was the last time you were in an executive lounge that made espresso and lattes? We didnt get the room we wanted but when we got into the room not only did I have the roses I ordered but they gave me and extra dozen roses, a bottle of champagne, a great chocolate cake. We were also give free passes to gym and pool area. The staff were all great. Be advised, unless you have a lot of extra money don't expect to eat or use room service. two small pizzas will run you around 60 euro. No drinks, no salad, just pizza. If you have access to the executive lounge that should be enough (don't mind the extra calories from all the goodies). We used the shuttle all mornings except the one day we were going to the train station early. Taxis can be a challenge sometimes in Rome, if you do get one make sure it is a registered taxi, at least you have a fighting chance. The shuttle drops you off right next to a subway stop. Great hotel, great time.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mxxh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Cavalieri Hilton following a week in Sicily and it was outstanding. I booked an upgraded room on the Executive floor with access to the Executive lounge. This was a very good choice because you get access to snacks, soft drinks, wine, etc and you can eat and drink throughout the day. It is one of the nicest Executive lounges I have ever been to. I had breakfast in the buffet area on the ground floor and it was great. Reminded me of some excellent buffets I have been to back home. I had eggs there each day cooked perfectly as requested. They also had fruits, cereals, breads, and breakfast meats, a real cornucopia! My room was spacious and elegant with a view of the Vatican and Rome. The bed was wonderful with lots of pillows. The room also had a large modern bathroom. First class all the way. I almost did not stay at this hotel because of where it is. The hotel is in a rather remote corner of Rome and you will need to use the hotel's shuttle or hire a taxi to get you to the city. Boy was I glad I went ahead and stayed at this hotel! The shuttle they provide is excellent. I would take the shuttle into town and get a taxi back each day. One day I simply took a taxi into town. The rides in and back actually let you see a lot of other neighborhoods you would never see otherwise. The taxi rides were always short and the fare reasonable. The location is great in one respect; it is very peaceful at night. I plan on staying at the Cavalieri next time I am in Rome. An excellent choice!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Cavalieri Hilton”
Reviews.Author: thebabies
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous resort hotel. We used our Hilton Honors Diamond reward. My husband, teenage daughter and I throughly enjoyed our stay for 10 days. Had a lovely room overlooking the lawn grounds and the heavely pool. The extensive buffet breakfast daily was the most impressive I have ever experience throughout Europe and America. Nice way to start each day. Yes the hotel is remote atop the hill, but this ensured quite and peaceful nights compared to those hotels around the circles. The shuttle and drivers were great. Our own private tour guides for tips and info. There is a nice area within walking distance that has nice local restaurants, gelato, and a high end shopping area. So although remote, there is a chance to venture out with the locals. Service at the hotel by all levels of staff was impeccable. I would stay again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “The Cavalieri lives up to its reputation”
Reviews.Author: locarnelo
Reviews.Content: As we are quite the spoiled travellers we were very eager to explore this hotel. IT DIDNT DISAPPOINT but truelly exceeded our expectations! The service was top notch 5 star and we enjoyed the exec. lounge with the amazing views of Rome. Pay the extra bit to get a room on the right side of the building (the rome side that is!) Room service was great with very attentive staff. The only true flaw we could find was the ticket we had to sign whenever we borrowed an umbrella....a little silly when you charge 800 dollar per room. Overall a Great stay and a amazing getaway from the hustle and bustle in inner Rome! Highly recommended...

Reviews.Title: “True Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Pov333
Reviews.Content: What an amazing hotel, decorated with full Italian splendor. The constantly changing views of Rome where a wonderful backdrop to our visit. The indoor swimming pool is a revelation - a marble pool with a huge fireplace - it was a perfect refuge for chilled bones from waiting outside the Vatican on a very cold and wet Rome day in March. It is almost worth staying just to see breakfast - 11 different types of milk alone not to mention the array of cakes, organic selection, Japanese selection. The service is amazing, as were the little touches like the box of delicious chocolates in our room. One word of warning, food is expensive here (£50 for a salad and coca cola for two) but they do provide a free bus into town. Sadly the last bus is a 8pm which is very inconvenient, so you either have to grab an early dinner (not very Italian), get a taxi back or face a steep bill for a meal in the hotel. Most evenings of our stay did entail us running for the last bus on a full stomach along with other residents! One thing did bemuse us - the hotel is stunningly decorated with expensive antiques in every corner but the top floor/roof, where you would expect the best views, has not been refurbished yet. It seemed such a shame. A truly lovely hotel though with wonderful and friendly staff, one of the best Hilton's I've stayed at. We had a truly magical stay.

Reviews.Title: “The most fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: HeavyTravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hilton Cavalieri for 3 nights in April and experienced exellent services and great hospitality. It was my 3rd stay in the hotel, and it gets better for each stay. We got an upgrade to executive floor due to my HHonors Diamond status. The executive lounge is the best we have ever visited in any Hilton hotel. The executive lounge staff provides first class service as the rest of the employers like concierge and bell boys. Joy by the pool provided matresses, towels and weatherforecast and made our day by the poolside very joyful. We will be happy to return any time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, although impersonal”
Reviews.Author: TravelFan099
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Cavalieri for a business conference in January; I have stayed in many 5* hotels for similar purposes and this has to be the best. The rooms were excellent, although mine overlooked the road and therefore a huge pylon type structure, but still had a little bit of view over the city. The terrace has stunning views and would be great for a romantic meal overlooking the vatican. Service was impeccable and the staff coped tremendously with our 350 or so delegates. The food was very good, served in the restaurant, which we only ate in at breakfast and lunch as we went out for dinner. I liked the soundproof doors in the rooms which made it seem smaller and cosier and blocked excess noise from the corridor - a very nice touch indeed. The hotel is not very central which I was disappointed in; you needed a taxi to get into the town, and there were not really any restaurants or points of interest nearby. You are therefore pretty much stuck in the hotel unless you get a taxi to somewhere. In summary, the hotel is excellent although I would not pay that amount of money myself to stay there for leisure, I would prefer a more intimate, personal hotel, but that is just my preference.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel away from all the hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: lfisgd746
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a perfect choice if you want to get away from all the hustle and bustle at the end of the day. It is about a 30-45min ride from the Rome FCO airport and is only a 10-15 minute cab/shuttle ride in to the heart of all there is to see and do. If you are a Hilton Diamond member, you have your own special check in area that they will whisk you away to. We used our Hilton Honor points for the stay and were treated superbly. The rooms are luxurious and over the top with rich Italian decor and beautiful marble bathrooms. The Executive lounge is the most extensive we have ever experienced. They have a buffet with an abundance of food and drink that is changed out about 6 times a day. They even set up a martini and scotch bar in the evenings. You could easily eat and drink here and be satisfied. The only draw back is if you get a drink, you have to consume it in the lounge you can't take it back to your room. The views of the city are gorgeous from both the executive lounge and the rooftop seating area. If you do not have a city view, the "antenna" view isn't bad. See pics. The shuttle was prompt the whole time we were here. The spa was a bit of a let down as they did not have robes, shampoo, soap, or any other toiletries or amenities we are used to here in the states. The gym was huge with all the modern facilities and exercise rooms for the various classes offered. Room service is wonderful and they provide a wonderful spread that is equivalent to what you would expect in an actual restaurant. We did not dine here (due to my lack of planning we were unable to score a reservation) but their restaurant La Pergola is supposed to be the top restaurant in Rome. With all the chaos in Rome, it was nice to retreat to the Cavalieri in the evenings to get away from it all and relax. Note about visiting the Vatican- Don't let the line intimidate you. Even if it is wrapped all the way around to the Sistine chapel, the wait will only be between 1 1/2 - 2 hrs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience and service.”
Reviews.Author: JAMc42
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cavalieri Hilton for our 10th anniversary in March 2008. I cannot emphasize how excellent the service was. Sinisa, the concierge is the most professional, compassionate, and all-around excellent concierge we have ever worked with. He arranged everything we could possibly have wanted (restaurant reservations and recommendations, private tours of the Roman ruins and the Vatican), car service, etc. etc.) and also dealt with some last minute changes in our schedule, AND got my husband a wonderful doctor to come to the room and treat his rather worrisome and unexpected ear infection. We dined at La Pergola, which was excellent, although far more expensive than we had thought (we had the tasting menu for 195 euro a piece, but were shocked when the wine flights were an additional 242 euro). Still, the experience was extraordinary, and we are thrilled that we could celebrate our anniversary there. The smaller restaurant downstairs was also lovely, and Marco, our waiter was especially professional, fun, and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “very average”
Reviews.Author: jmh180304
Reviews.Content: Arrived here with my wife about 1am to find the front door chained shut (odd) , rang the bell and waited about 10 minutes before anyone came to let us in. Got checked in only to find the key would not work in the door so had to trumble back along to reception where we waited a further 10 minutes. eventially got to our room which was situated on a lower floor with no view what so ever. Had breakfast the next day which was very nice but very confused at the same time and later to find out that we had been charge for it even hough we where on bed & brek rate. All in all very average and over rated hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Harryheklebar
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Rome Cavalieri Hilton! My wife and I took my mother to Italy last September and chose this hotel for our first 4 nights. I read the negative reviews before we stayed there and just read some more negative reviews today. I am not sure what people expect when traveling to Europe and staying at a nice hotel. It is expensive. Most hotels in Rome have limited air conditioning and services. This hotel is amazing! One of the best dinners we had in Rome (and we did eat at Alfredo's) was a short walk from the hotel and through a nice neigborhood. (for a 1/4 of the price of eating down town) The spa and Turkish bath was definitely welcome after fighting the crowds downtown. The hotel is removed from the city and set up on a hill overlooking Rome and the Vatican. Rome is a a remarkable city with historical sights that rival anywhere. That being said it is dirty with the most rude angry cab drivers i have ever seen. The Cavaileri Hilton was an welcome oasis at the end of a long day. I am a Diamond member and have not experienced an Executive floor like this anywhere i've traveled. One review called them snacks.....HARDLY! The food types were changed four times a day with unlimited champagne and top shelf drinks at night. You just had to ask. As nice of a hotel this is, skip Rome and go straight to Florence and the Tuscany region. Much more relaxing!

Reviews.Title: “Can we give it 6 stars?”
Reviews.Author: aopa6
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights using Hilton points. At 40,000 points/night it is quite a bargain. As a Hilton Diamond VIP, we were upgraded to the Executive Floor, which had a fantastic lounge with a complimentary gourmet buffet and liquor from 7 am to 11 pm. I bet we ate and drank about $300 worth each day. Our room was fantastic, with an outstanding view of Rome from the 8th floor (the hotel is high on a hill). The staff was tremendous. The only down side is that it is located somewhat remote. We usually walked 4 blocks, then took a bus to connect with the Metro. The hotel runs a shuttle to a certain part of town (Barberini), but it stops at 8 pm.

Reviews.Title: “Caveat Emptor: Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: CMP-TRIP
Reviews.Content: We had read al the reviews of this hotel but we were still shocked by the indifferent treatment we received at this hotel. One of the main reasons we wanted to stay at the hotel was the indoor pool. This was closed along with almost all the outside grounds. The concierge gave wrong information multiple times including leaving us stranded for an hour waiting for a nonexistant taxi. When we called the concierge (thank god we had taken the direct number to the hotel with us) at first they said too bad. When we told them we had two children with us they finally sent a cab and mumbled in insincere apology. When I complained to the front desk, they merely walked me back to the concierge and said they had nothing to do with it, Shuttle bus schedules changed,,, need I say more.... The only interesting part of the hotel was walking around the Monte Mario neighborhood. It was nice to be out in a real Roman neighborhood. However, the hotel itself really felt more like a prison.....The Hilton chain has installed mini refrigerators and if you move anything for longer than 30 seconds, they charge you for it

Reviews.Title: “we got married from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: CHEESECAKEYUMYUM
Reviews.Content: we booked in to this hotel on the monday and on friday we got married in a chapel close to the vatican, when we got back to the hotel ( at about 4 in the morning) we found the managment had left a bottle of champers and some sugar fruit sweets! they organised the transport in to the city for my family to the service although we were 20 mins late! they dont understand the importance of timetables!. we loved the breakfast on the terrace in the sunshine lots of choice however we did not eat there for dinner or tea as it is very expencive! the drinks for example in the minibar were on average 10 euros for a water! the rooms were amazing however the view of a block of flats and a telecommunications tower was not really worth the 350 pound per night that we paid for the time there. the walk in to town (vatican city) was only about 15mins however dont bother go to Rome in august, nothing is open!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute gem!”
Reviews.Author: nashvillbnd
Reviews.Content: We traveled through Italy, and had the pleasure to end our trip at the Rome Cavalieri Hilton. It was amazing. A beautiful hotel with charming guests. As a Diamond member, you are treated with great respect, great accomodations, and wonderful amenities. We were given free food, drinks, spa, and shuttles the whole time we stayed there. Our only dislike was that the staff in the executive lounge rushed us quite a bit, and you could tell they did not want to be there after 9pm (younger folks wanting to go out probably).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marino22
Reviews.Content: What a Hotel! We stayed as a Diamond member on the 7th floor of the hotel. For the 7th floor to the 9th there is a free lounge with snacks and drinks from 0700-2300 which is a real benifit considering everything in the hotel is expensive. You can see the entire city and all the sites while sipping your wine. There is a free shuttle that takes you right downtown from 0830 to 2000 and you can walk or take the subway just about anywhere you would like to go. You can walk about 3 blocks down the street from the hotel to 3 resturaunts and some shopping. Great place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms, but distant from central Rome”
Reviews.Author: kridot
Reviews.Content: This was a great getaway "outside" of central Rome. The hotel has a shuttle bus running to Bernini from 8:30am to 8pm, but this can be very crowded at times. The hotel is not close to a metro, so a cab will cost you 7-15 euro to get you back in town. The rooms (with city view) were beautiful, spacious and a great relaxation point to come back to after a full day in Rome. However, if you are looking to be in the "thick of it", try a hotel closer to the monuments. We'd stay here again if using points, but it is a lot of money to pay for a location that isn't within walking distance of major monuments/etc.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TRANSATLANTIC GUY
Reviews.Content: We booked a non refundable booking on hilton.com. in an Executive Plus room with breakfast included. It is important to get an inclusive rate as an a la carte breakfast will set you back € 80 for two. The Club lounge breakfast was adequate even though cooked items particularly watery scrambled eggs were limited. A good supply of complimentary snacks, soft and alcoholic drinks (e.g. beers, wine) were available from 7am to 11pm. The rooms are beautiful and this is the most stylish Hilton where we have stayed. We had a wonderful view of St Peters and the city of Rome. Service was good and friendly: everyone we dealt with was kind and helpful. Sunday Brunch at the ground floor restaurant at € 70 per head was excellent. The only one arguably better I have had was at The Phoneican in Phoenix AZ. Desserts were out of this world. Lunch, particularly the buffet and dinner served there were high quality, if expensive. Although as Diamond VIPs we were not given a room upgrade this is probably the best Hilton we have been to on vacation. The rates unfortunately make London and Manhattan hotels look reasonably priced. Stay here and enjoy, but make sure you are not on a tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel with amazing views”
Reviews.Author: KLT74
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a room overlooking Rome, which was amazing. As mentioned in lots of other reviews, everything in this hotel was really expensive - a coke in the restaurant was 10 euros! Concierge told us about a nice little restaurant about 5 minutes walk away, in the Piazza Medaglie D'oro, it looked quite basic from the outside, but the food was really good and great service - cost about 30 Euros for 2 of us. Apart from that there really isn't much else near to the hotel. If you are going to use the shuttle bus at the hotel, get there early, as it is always full!

Reviews.Title: “wish i had had more time to enjoy this”
Reviews.Author: cavallino
Reviews.Content: I loved the hotel beautiful view of rome also from the terrace where there is the breakfast room. breakfast was ample, the bed was ultra soft. there is a shuttle bus into the city and a taxi to the train station is around 13 euros, you can get there pretty fast since the taxis go through the villa borghese where no other cars are allowed through. The service was also wonderful

Reviews.Title: “Great Luxury Base for a Short Stayin Rome”
Reviews.Author: Leicestershirebloke
Reviews.Content: This is a luxury Hotel with impeccable staff. It's in a great location overlooking the City. I would echo all the positive comments made in other reviews. The health club was of a high standard for hotel. We never had to wait for a taxi, and the shuttle bus was on time and very handy. Taxi prices were reasonable for a big city - 15 euros took us to the Spanish Steps on a Sunday. We didn't eat at the hotel except the excellent buffet in the exec lounge, but the food and drink there was plentiful and high quality and staff waited on us as we sat and relaxed. In all, we were treated very well by friendly staff - sadly I have to say that hasn't always been m experience at Hilton properties in the UK.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Don64
Reviews.Content: We had a great time staying here, lovely gardens and pool, excellent room, short cab ride or hotel bus into centre of rome could not have asked for more!

Reviews.Title: “Petronius Suite is the sweet life !!”
Reviews.Author: AmidaBuddha
Reviews.Content: Wanting to surprise my wife for her 32nd birthday, I booked a room at the Rome Cavalieri Hilton through American Express. I choose this hotel due to the reputation and the perks promised by AMEX as part of the "Fine Hotels and Resorts Program". Little did I expect the very positive surprise. Upon arrival we were most cordially greeted and told that we had been upgraded to the Royal Petronius Suite. This is a 250m2 suite which has a normal price will above EUR 5000 per night. It is luxury pure above the city of Rome. Nothing could have been nicer. From the beautiful funiture, the wine cellar, the fire place and three plasma screens. Pillow menus and soap menus aside, this was the most comfortable weekend ever. The staff and the food were excellent, well beyond anything in most places. I can only recommed this hotel to anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Vathy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in September 2007. I can honestly say this was the best hotel experience I've ever had. From our exclusive check-in as Hilton Honor members, to the wonderful poolside dinner for my birthday, to our late check out, it was a truly memorable time. Our room on the 7th Floor was palatial - unfortunately we overlooked the telecommunication tower and not the City, but as the room was on our points, that was okay. It also meant we had the setting sun on our balcony which was a bonus. The pool was large but unheated and the sun fell behind the hotel by late afternoon, thus making my evening swims very bracing. Drinks are expensive but this is a 5 star hotel and you get what you pay for. The service was impeccable. Each evening there was some form of entertainment by the pool, either a singer or pianist. The lobby bar also had a pianist playing. We tried to get into La Pergola but it was full so we ate outside by the pool in the "Giardino dell'Uliveto" Terrace restaurant and had a marvellous meal. The shuttle into the City was extremely useful although we had to take taxis back. They were not expensive - 10 Euro including tip. I would recommend this hotel for the following reaons:- the staff were very polite and attentive, the ambiance, the food, the location and the room were all exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I've stayed at”
Reviews.Author: ready2gonow
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic. Being a Hilton Gold member (I usually bounce between Gold and Diamond) probably helped but this is a fantastic resort in Rome. My only complaint is the hotel is a bit long in the tooth but everything is still outstanding. The rooms are great. We were just on a regular floor (not club level) but the beds were Hilton-tastic. There are 3 pillows so you and your Goldilocks can pick the one that is "just right". The shower has great pressure. The TV has 40+ channels although the only english-speaking channel from the states was Fox News (all election, all the time). The view overlooks the city-- St Peters and the Victor Emmanuel II Monument are clearly visible. The breakfast was outstanding. Multiple cheeses, thin sliced meets (plenty of dry-cured ham plus beef and lamb on one of the days). They didn't have bacon, they had Pancetta. They had swordfish and salmon. The fruits were awesomely diced, not the simple big melon ball cubes like other restaurants. The shuttle (while I wish it ran more often) got us into the city on most days. And a cab to the Vatican Museum was 8 euros. Taxis from the city were 12 euro. I don't know what people were doing getting E50 cabs. Maybe it was midnight or maybe they were getting some crazy luggage surcharge. Over New Years, it was anarchy for cabs and cabbies were gouging. And there are also some "Mercedes cabs" or something like that where they charge extremely high rates. But regular cabs are around 10 euros. Again, I don't know what people were doing to get ripped off but I don't see how that is the hotel's fault. Cab transfers from the airport were around 40-45 Euro. We usually just tipped the driver up to a 50. The hotel has a full spa with Turkish bath and all the rest. I didn't have space in the luggage to pack a suit and tie so we didn't go to La Pergola. But if it is even better than the regular dining experience (awesome chololate mousse, egg+cheese finger sandwiches, etc.) then I can see why it is so hyped. The only possible cons are the prices. But #1 you are in Rome so nothing is cheap and #2 this is a resort hotel and not a hostel. I definitely hope to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great/Decent Stay”
Reviews.Author: L0vet0Vacati0n
Reviews.Content: First of all, let me begin by saying that I am 17 years old. So, this review may or may not help you. I stayed at the Hilton Cavalieri for three nights in June of '07 before we boarded a mediterranean cruise. Positives: The hotel was truly amazing! It was just above the city of Rome so it had amazing views from the room, and it was away from the noise etc. The pool area was beautiful, the rooms are modern with flat screens and beautifully decorated. Shops line the hallways of the lobby (everything from Gucci to souvenirs!). The concierge is very friendly with any questions. Also, as you walk down the halls, EVERY staff member greets you with a "bonjourno," nice touch. The shuttle to the city center is convenient. Negatives: The first night we were in Rome, we decided to eat at the hotel at the poolside Terrazza Dell'Uliveto...BIG MISTAKE! While the candles, white linens, and surroundings were beautiful, the food was terrible and overpriced. It was just my Mom and I (others were sleeping) we ordered a ceaser salad to share and two plates of pasta. The cost was well over 150 euro and not worth it. Eat in town. In all, the stay was wonderful and a great way to start an Italian adventure

Reviews.Title: “Excellent but expensive”
Reviews.Author: seagull69
Reviews.Content: We treated 2 of our son's to a trip to Rome for the sites and the football. We chose this hotel as we thought it was near the stadio Olympico. We were picked up at the airport by a hotel car which we had arranged with the hotel. The hotel itself is wonderfull. The staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms we had booked had balconies overlooking Rome and the rooms were clean comfortable and luxurios. The food and drink in the hotel though is very expensive and you also had to pay to use the ameneties available. which we found quite shocking. The hotel is a long way from the city cehtre but there is a free coach service from the hotel which drops you off at dertaun locations but it was easier to get a taxis back. The hotel isn't convienent for the football either as we had to get a taxis there and had a long walk back.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious with a bad location”
Reviews.Author: michaelmelton1
Reviews.Content: After a long trip through Italy, you realize one thing...if you want to stay at a nice hotel, you will pay for it. After many nights on small and uncomfortable beds, we decided to splurge in Rome for three nights at the Hilton. The hotel is beautifully luxurious. The hallways are covered in marble, the chandeliers are magnificent, and the views of Rome are amazing. However, there are a few things we did not enjoy about this hotel. First of all, they make you pay for the gym facilities. We were very excited to lift weights and perhaps use the treadmill after weeks of carbs....but once we found out that the gym cost 25 euros a day, we decided to ignore the urge to exercise. Also, the hotel is quite far from the city centre. The hotel does have a shuttle, but it is generally full...and it does not operate late enough to catch a ride after dinner and drinks. So, expect to drop some cab money. One day, we decided to ride the bus to the train station, then ride the train to the city centre...but it took some time to walk to the bus stop, wait for the bus, ride the bus to the train station, wait for the train, and ride the train all the way to the city. Though we really enjoyed the beds, we also would have enjoyed the beds at the St. Regis, which is right inside the town. I'd definitely recommend getting a nice hotel in the city centre...since they are no more expensive than the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hiltons”
Reviews.Author: asn82
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 2 day stay .Very hospitable and courteous staff .Excellent view of the city from the hotel. .Great sumptuos breakfast .Maybe shuttle hours could be extended.

Reviews.Title: “Great but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: ltpt
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights during our 9 day stay in Rome. Because everyone in the world seemed to be in Rome during the 9 days we had to stay at 4 hotels. This was the 3rd one. The room was beautiful! The bed was to die for! The room was HUGE. I am comparing this from the other 2 hotels we had just stayed at. We got the room on Hilton points, which saved us over $700.00 per night! Ouch! I wouldn't have paid that. The room was so nice you didn't want to leave it, but I wasn't in Rome to enjoy a nice hotel room. Nice balcony, view ok, it was hazy. refridgerator had sensors, the cokes (Japanese size) 12.00. So had to make do with ice in bucket. The taxi from our other hotel at the Pantheon was $50.00. The shuttle bus into town everyday was small, most times everyone did not get on. Then you had to wait an hour for the next one. Getting the shuttle back was the same way. Who wants to wait an hour, but who wants to pay 50.00! We tried to make reservations at their restaurant La Pergolia, had read one the best restaurants in Italy. They were booked months in advance. When we checked in at almost 5pm the restaurant called and said they could accomodate us for dinner that night at 7:30. Coat for men, no iron in the room (yes, I did read to bring), had to have the suit pressed so my husband wouldn't be embarrassed! That was al least $30.00! The dinner, was the most expensive we have ever had, but we knew that before we went. But then pizza and wine was 100.00 in a piazza. The dinner was well worth every penny! It will be one we remember forever- it was out 27th anniversary. Leaving were staying at the airport Hilton as our plane left early in the morning. 50.00 to the airport. The concierge was not very helpful on anything we asked. Found out later, the bell guys were SO nice! The concierge said to take a cab to the airport when we asked in the morning. When we left late that afternoon the bell manager said - let me get you a car, it will be cheaper or about the same as a cab. Then came back and said they were all gone. If the concierge had told us that in the morning we would have reserved one. We would recommend this hotel if you can stay on points and stay on the club floor. Our room didn't come with breakfast and the restaurants and bar were SO expensive we stayed clear!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cmfairygodmother
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel overlooking St. Peter's and the Vatican. It is outside of the immeadiate city area, but close enough to be there by cab in 5 minutes. Room was clean and because we are Hitlon Honors Gold VIP members, we got our breakfast for free and a room facing Rome. Staff was lovely. The breakfast had more food that was delicious that we could ever eat. Actually it had two rooms of food! The hotel restaurant The "Olive..." was well priced and the food and ambience was great. What a wonderful hotel to come home to after a busy day sight seeing. It made our stay! We would not think of staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “nice bed but rude front desk, jack hammer noise, usurious prices”
Reviews.Author: Tranquila
Reviews.Content: there were some nice things about the hotel: very nice beds with down comforters and a selection of pillows, good use of space and layout of the room (gives you a feeling of being in a junior suite although not quite as large). however, i was flabbergasted by the rudeness of the female "manager" at the front desk who spoke to us in the most insolent manner i've ever encountered at any hotel. the other negatives: no heating, even when temperatures went down to 40-ish. i called the front desk and was told that they had not yet turned on the central heating. mini-bar items were outrageously expensive: try 8-9 euros each for small bottles of soft drinks or water! a small container of pringles is also 9 euros. room service is also equally expensive: 26 euros for a cheeseburger, 25 euros for a chicken salad, 16 euros for a side order of vegetables! in addition they charge you 5 euros per person as service charge. breakfast was plentiful but heavy on sweets and lacked a salad section (other european hiltons have this) and served basmati rice in the japanese breakfast section (a big no no!). the smoked salmon seemed a little "off" --so freshness is questionable. "internet point" at the lobby was out of order as was the only pay phone in the lobby. we also heard jack hammers from nearby rooms--they must have been renovating. altogether unsatisfying experience, considering the prices.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JamesBChicago
Reviews.Content: This was the final stop on our 16 day trip in Italy and it was perfect. We arrived at the hotel at 9:00 PM and everything was ready for us at check-in. The hotel was clean, the staff extremely helpful and the beds extremely comfortable. This was the perfect place to stay before heading back to home. I might add the pool was a fantastic way to relax after a great day touring Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Comfortable Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MichWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: Our final stop of our honeymoon, and after some great hotels in Venice and Florence, we couldn't have imagined any place being nicer than those we'd already visited...WE WERE IMPRESSED! One of the top 5 hotels I've stayed in (and I've stayed in a lot around the world). The room was large and gorgeous--well appointed, modern but classic, and the balcony was great for sitting and taking in the view (we were 'upgraded' to a city view room), where we could see St. Peter's Basilica and most of Rome. The breakfast was the best we'd had the entire trip...Included in the rate (I think because I'm Hilton Gold). HUGE selection--especially for my new wife who is has a gluten allergy--they actually had a 'gluten free station'. We had dinner in the hotel our first night--it was nice, but WAY overpriced. The hotel is out of the main area of Rome--which was fine, the hotel's shuttle to City Center was convenient...Despite it being in a neighborhood, there were some good restaurants nearby--Il Baggito (or something like that, you pass it on the drive up to the hotel) was VERY good despite a limited menu--the cost was about the same as the Cavalieri, but there we had 2 bottles of wine, appetizers and dessert (try the orange rizzoto and the 'cutted' steak with balalmic vinegar). Overall, we were very impressed with the Hilton Cavalieri Rome and would certainly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Wow, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: fly23
Reviews.Content: Everything was great about this place. We had our young son with us, and the staff had our crib in the room and gave him a rubber duck at check in. The kids pool was perfect to wade around in. As Honors gold members, this was the best breakfast we have seen. They had an omelette station and a spread with everything you could ask for. The gym was huge and had everything for a workout. The shuttle was easy to use and the Hilton beds make it easy to get a good night sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great for HHonors Gold or Diamond members”
Reviews.Author: Resglad
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at the Cavaleri Hilton for our weekend trip to Rome and I thought I'd take the time to straighten out some of the things I have seen in previous reviews here. Rooms, as it seems HH diamond members get the upgrade to executive floor with lounge access. I have no clue how the lounge is since I'm only a gold member. Gold members get a room with a view, free breakfast and free spa, gym and pool access. I recommend people that aren't HH members to book a room with a view if you want one. The rooms are spacious with a nice balcony and if you are on the side facing the pool you can sit outside with a bottle of wine enjoying the live music in the evenings Prices, everything is extremly overpriced. 8€ for the 20 cl coke, 10€ for a glass of wine in the lobby bar, 16€ for a sunbed and a towel. If you are on a small budget and not at least a HH gold member this isn't the place for you. The neighbourhood, is a quiet residencial area. If you need to get something like water, a bottle of wine, snacks etc you exit the hotel and turn right, just follow the street for a 5 minute walk and you are at a small square with grocery store, icecream parlour, cheese store and a great Sicillian restaurant that I absolutly recommend. The shuttle, during our stay we had two drivers for the shuttle. I'd say that the first driver was a bit more service minded. But in general I think the service was great. If you asked they did a stop at the Vatican on the way downtown. I reccomend to be in good time for the shuttle especially some of the departures are more popular. Be out by the bus 15 minutes before departure and you have no problem getting a seat. Going back I'd go for a taxi. We took taxi from downtown Rome two times and it's a 10 - 15€ trip Getting there, one of the official white taxi's from the airport is 45 - 50€ depending on trafic. In general I would say that taxi's was inexpensive I would absolutly go back as long as I'm a HH gold member

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for the right people”
Reviews.Author: TravelGal415
Reviews.Content: I would recommended the hotel for the following reasons: 1. If you are a Hilton Diamonds member, the club lounge is great- packed with snacks, beverages, and an awesome view 2. great place to relax- far away from the fast pace of the city center 3. large hotel rooms and bathrooms nicely appointed with down everything, hermes bath products, etc. 4. easily accessible if you have limited mobility I wouldn't book the hotel for the following reasons: 1. far away from the city action- you have to take a shuttle or cab if you want to leave the hotel 2. shuttle only runs once an hour and last pick-up in city center is at 8pm 3. not a true "Rome" experience... doesn't feel like an Italian hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: JWPMIT
Reviews.Content: My wife and I refer to this hotel as very Disney-esque. We stayed here at the end of a 2 week stay in various locations in Italy. The hotel was fantastic in all respects, the rooms, the service and the location was a shuttle bus away from downtown. The hotel even has a Michelin rated restaurant that we did not get the chance to eat at. The restaurant on the ground level, near the pool, served simple Roman fare but far too expensive. Our recommendation - go downtown. Overall, a great place, a haven from the dusty, noisy city of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Rob CC
Reviews.Content: If you can afford it, I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel. My wife and I stayed here for our first anniversary trip and loved it. We moved here from Florence and a very bad hotel. Upon arrival in Rome it was like we had arrived at a palace. The room was wonderful and overlooked the city of Rome. Try you hardest to get one facing the City and hotel pool - the view from the other side wasn't anywhere as good. Rooms were LARGE and very clean. The hotel IS a bit of a hike from the city, though - too far to walk. However, you can take a hotel shuttle that runs every hour - the only minus is that it only runs until 8:00 p.m. Taxicabs back to the hotel are about 10 EURO, depending on where you are coming from. The only minus - they don't have iron boards or irons for the rooms. AND, they won't give them to you either, so make sure that you have your clothes pressed before going! We used HiltonHonors points to stay here which made it worth it. Not sure if we could afford it otherwise (rooms are a bit expensive), but if you have the means I'd highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel away from the city centre”
Reviews.Author: peds8045
Reviews.Content: We (my wife and I) booked the hotel for four nights in order to have a comfortable place to stay during our first trip to Rome which coincided with our 25th Wedding anniversary. We had read the reviews prior to booking so we new exactly what we were letting ourselves in for...namely the high prices charged for everything outside your room, i.e. can of soft drinks or meals in one of the hotels restaurants. Because of this factor we opted for the Executive Floor option which includes an ever changing array of snacks and drink options throughout the day in the very comfortable lounge, this is open from 0700 to 2300hrs every day. On entering the hotel the doorman took our bags which were promptly delivered to our room. At reception i requested a 'city facing' room as per the recommendations on this site but was informed that there were none available unless of course i wanted to change from a room with a Kingsize bed to a twin room instead...oh and that would cost an extra 75 Euros .... i declined. I should hasten to add that i was a full paying customer, and not one of the many Hilton Honors awards customers who, according to the reviews on here seem to get the good rooms and the free upgrades! As it was, the room was tidy and comfortable and the view of the RAI TV mast was superb. There were 40+ channels on the TV with the typical five or so English speaking news channels, any extra movie channels would cost you either 20 Euros for a single play or 40 Euros for the entire selection for the length of the stay. Rooms were cleaned daily, i think the sheets were changed daily also (nice touch) and there was a turn down service in the evening. We made good use of the Executive lounge and the free 15 minutes of internet access (you need to provide passport before internet use), the staff were excellent and spoke good English. When ordering alcohol, be warned that they do not use standard measures as in the UK so you may get an occaisional G & T that is 'extra strong' , this is not a bad thing :) If you get to the lounge early enough you can get one of the outside balcony tables which provide you with 'the city view' and a degree of privacy. Apart from one meal in the poolside restaurant, we opted to eat away from the hotel, in the city centre, which we travelled to in the free shuttle bus. The shuttle is a great service but you need to get to the bus stop at least five minutes prior to departure time to guarantee a seat. It takes around 20 minutes to get to the centre. On occaisions we used the Metro from the city back to the Vatican stop (1 Euro each) and then got a 6 Euro taxi ride back to the hotel rather than have to wait for the shuttle bus to return. The Metro is very easy to use and appears to be clean and safe. If we returned to Rome we would probably use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “The most beautiful room I ever had!!!”
Reviews.Author: philc128
Reviews.Content: Spectacular room with an incredible balcony and view of Rome! The nicest room I ever stayed in...anywhere! Staff was wonderful, great restaurants, courteous shuttle drivers. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, beautiful, can't wait to go back....”
Reviews.Author: Shezza77
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent 3 wonderful nights at this hotel in June 07. We came from 2 nights in central Rome and were looking forward to luxury, peace, relaxation, great service...all of which we got in spades. Through my job back in the UK I have a corporate relationship with the Hilton, so one of my contacts there booked the hotel for me. I wouldn't otherwise have considered staying at a Hilton as I prefer "Boutique" hotels, but tripadvisor had good reports & my contact got me a great rate so we gave it a go. My friend and I arrived hot and tired after little sleep in the B&B Best Vatican in Rome. The cool, spacious lobby of the Hilton Cavalieri was a dream and the porters and check in team got us quickly and easily ushered up to our room in the 5th floor. The room had a balcony overlooking the pool....and an unbelieable vista across the Eternal City. Breathtaking. I've attached some photos but they just don't do it justice. We spent hours on that balcony morning and night, taking in the view and celebrating life and our ability to enjoy such an experience. The room was gorgeous, the comfiest bed I have ever had in a hotel, not to mention the "pillow menu" so you can order different types! Big mirrored bathroom with fab power shower and marble tops. Seating area in the room where we enjoyed afternoon tea and wine in the early eve. Service was fabulous throughout, other than one particular receptionist in the spa area who sadly ruined the 100% success rate. Shame on her and her miserable ways. We assumed she was having a bad day and didn't hold it against the hotel. Big thank you to the team around the pool and pool bar who always have a smile and treat you like old friends. It is rather naughty of the hotel to charge residents extra for access to the Spa and to the pool area. I understand that those on the upper floors get it all inclusive, but my friend and I did think it rather strange to keep being charged extra on top of our bill. I would much rather pay a higher room rate and get all amenities included than keep having to sign additional things off. On our last night we dined al fresco in the Giardino dell'Uliveto restaurant by the pool. This was again fab, service, food, setting, all amazing. sadly we could not get reservations for La Pergola, we would certainly have taken opportunity otherwise. We popped up there and the views were phenomenal. We also got the shuttle bus a few times into Rome, and had a meal before getting a cab back. We found this no hassle at all. Indeed, having spent our previous 2 nights near the Vatican, it took us just as long to walk from Vatican area into central Rome as to get the CAvalieri shuttle bus in. Don't let this put you off. On the contrary, its great to relax away from the hustle of the Rome but still get in quickly when you wish. The spa was BRILLIANT and so relaxing. We didn't have treatments as no spaces free, however we spent happy hours in the sauna, steam room, whirlpool, and then relaxing on the day beds listening to the music and just drifting off in the big fluffy bathrobes. Bliss. We also enjoyed having cocktails in the lobby bar and the pianist/singer was fabulous. Service again great. Some minor points to note - I believe that the rooms with views make a big difference and are worth the extra euros. I would'nt have enjoyed my visit as much if I had a room facing the front of the hotel. - We did miss tea and coffee in our room and the room service prices are extortionate. I think it was £5 for a tea or something silly. - you have a sound excluder door in the room, use it! we only discovered ours on our last night unfort, but once in place you cannot hear a thing from the corridors. Mammoth review sorry about that. I love this hotel. Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “roma caput mundi”
Reviews.Author: catozzo123
Reviews.Content: Simply fantastic, if you manage to have a panoramic view room you will be shoked by what you will see, absolutely magnificent view ! we booked a suite and the room was clean, spacious, modern (a 42HD v set on the wall in a painting frame showing famous italian paintings (screensaver mode) the restaurants are rated within the 10 best of Italy (can you imagine ?!) the service perfect and just a few steps from St Peter and Vatican City Of course the bad part is when you will pay the bill, quite pricy ! but if compare it with other hotels does not seem so bad....

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, if it fits your needs.”
Reviews.Author: WynneWoody
Reviews.Content: This certainly has to be one of the nicest properties in the Hilton chain. Of course, Hilton has some other nice properties, but this may be the nicest of the nice Hiltons. It is a great hotel, with beautiful rooms, balconies and service, as described in the other reviews. If you don't want to stay in the city center, it may just be perfect for you. As noted in other reviews, only one side has the great views of the city, while the other side overlooks a residential area and a large phone tower. I've had rooms on both sides, at various times, and although the ones with the city view are definitely better (and more expensive, of course), I don't really think there is a bad room in the place. One word of caution -- The hotel is located outside the center and is a 15 - 30 minute (depending on traffic) taxi ride into the city, and taxis in Rome are not cheap. Aside from the hotel, pool and grounds (Did someone mention the great views?), there is not a lot to do in the vicinity of the hotel. If you are one of those who doesn't like to spend the money on taxis, you may find yourself at the mercy of the free hotel shuttle. On some days, the shuttle may be fine, but whenever we've been there, it always seemed to be the busy season, and the shuttle was always loaded to maximum capacity, with people lining up well in advance to make sure they got a seat, thereby having to stand in the hot sun or sit inside the hot shuttle bus, waiting to take off. Because of that, we actually never used the shuttle. Even though the taxis were expensive, they were well worth the cost, to avoid all that. But I know that some folks just have an aversion to paying for expensive taxis, so be warned -- it may come down to a choice betwen an expensive taxi and sharing a crowded bus with a lot of hot, sweaty, cranky people. That said, though, I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who doesn't mind the taxis, or who just wants to hang around the hotel and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Treatment”
Reviews.Author: closecover
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during a visit to Rome in late June of this year, using HHonors Award certificate. Not only did the hotel upgrade us to an executive floor suite, but we were also given the full VIP treatment from check-in to our departure. The rooms are well appointed, quiet, and supplied with Hermes bath products. The executive lounge is large and comfortable with many examples of the hotel's extensive original art collection and provided a wonderful view of the Vatican from the outdoor terrace. The staff in the Executive Lounge worked long and hard to attend to the needs of the guests and were conversant in several languages besides Italian and English. Yes, we did have a room facing the main entrance and the telecommunications tower, but it was more than we expected for a free stay. The location away from the center makes it a nice retreat to escape from the crowds around the major tourist attractions, a factor which greatly added to our enjoyment of the visit to Rome. We look forward to staying here again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “the best place I've ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: TravelerFever
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the best hotel and country club rolled into one. The staff attended to every need. The pools and spas were perfect as were the sunbeds and outdoor bars. Rooms were large, spacious, and well appointed with large bathrooms. The fluffly bathrobes and slippers were another great feature. The highlights were the balconies and executive lounges featuring gourmet foods from 7 in the morning to 11 at night. Beverage selection included a large variety of liquers and non- alcoholic beverages. We were able to sit on our balcony at night and watch fireworks and listen to live entertainment by the pool. This hotel was a welcome and refreshing place to return to after a long day in the city.

Reviews.Title: “HIlton Great, But Only on One Side with View”
Reviews.Author: RagtopGirl
Reviews.Content: The Hilton is beautiful with wonderful, large modern rooms. I would reccomend the hotel only if you can be guaranteed a room on the side that faces the city with a view. Our room was on the back side (which half are) and we had a glorious view of a very large cell phone tower. The hotel is not in town, which we did not like because we enjoy wandering around town for short trips. There is a free shutttle several times a day but not always convenient. Internet access was expensive - to use a computer to check email was either two or three euros a minute. When booking ask what all is included - if not the outdoor pool costs about 18 euro just to sit beside. Again, it's lovely and elegant and one of the nicest Hiltons I've been in.

Reviews.Title: “I have experience none better!”
Reviews.Author: MBrennanATL
Reviews.Content: I've traveled a lot, personal and business, stayed in hostels and Four Seasons. This is probably the best hotel experience I've ever had. Beautifully decorated LARGE rooms, very romantic, wonderful grounds, impeccable service, I WANT TO GO BACK!!! I think what made this experience was the ability to enjoy the Hilton Honors lounge, the Executive lounge I think they call it. If you're already spending the money to stay here, you might want to consider trying to get upgraded or pay to have access to this area. Free drinks of any kind, always a spread of food and deserts, martini hours, wonderful balconies wtih views, people watching. We had a 7 month old baby with us and so this was the perfect area to let her practice standing while we 'refreshed' ourselves after hours in the city streets.Can't recommend it enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great for HH VIPs...bad for your wallet!”
Reviews.Author: jcstone47
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a class of it's own. For a European hotel...it far will surpass your expectations. The staff are pleasant and helpful. The location is horrid, but the views are to die for, and there is a free shuttle into central Rome. (Although it doesn't run late, we found it to be just enough after a long day...and a cab ride back cost about 10euro....depending on your cabbie of course..and the time of day. ) As Hilton Diamond members we received a plush room, private check in, and all the other "free" perks. This includes access to the lounge, and it is probably one of the best Hilton executive lounges I have ever been in. They actually have food! And lots of it in great variety! They continually change the menu all day long too...and it's all free. Now...for those that aren't VIPs of Hilton, look out. I can see this place costing you a fortune....as a can of Coke is like 8euro. And no...there is NO place within walking distance to get anything. And watch out it you get placed on the side without the view....you will have to look at the most hideous antenna tower.

Reviews.Title: “Service Service Service”
Reviews.Author: PumpDesigner
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic. The level of service is of the highest order. Every need is taken care of with a smile. As with any top class hotel this level of service and luxury comes at a cost but it is easily worth the expense. Be aware that it even costs 16 euro to sit by the outdoor pool. We ate in the ground floor hotel restaurant a number of times and the quality of food is outstanding. The roof top restaurant is rated as the best in Italy and is booked months in advance, reserve you table months before you arrive or you will not get in the door. You need a jacket for the roof top restaurant so dont forget to bring one along. The hotel is situated a 20min taxi ride from Rome, if you want to be in the city this hotel is not for you. If you want an oasis close to the thrills of Rome this hotel is perfect. The hotel offers a free shuttle to Rome centre and this is a great facility. Rome's traffic is so unpredicatable that a taxi cost 8 euro at quiet times and 24 euro in busy periods. This hotel is not pretty from the outside but dont be put off. The inside is beautiful. The rooms are very large by European standards and are very comfortable. Only one side of the hotel has views over Rome. The other side has no view at all. Again the view comes at a cost. Overall Expensive but wonderful and worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Plush but Expensive”
Reviews.Author: LeaHJ
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 day trip to Rome where we stayed at the Hilton Cavalieri. The Hotel is by far one of the nicest Hilton's I have stayed in, very plush marble foyier, fantastic indoor and outdoor swimming pools and excellent restaurants. The rooms are very opulent in their decoration and consist of Superking size bed, with a small living area and balcony and a fully marbled bathroom with 4 piece suite and dressing table. We were unfortunately, not able to get a City view room, so we overlooked the Hotel entrance. Quite a pleasant outlook, however, the view was somewhat spoilt by the enormous satellite tower which was directly outside the Hotel! The Hotel is situated on the Vatican side of Rome and is located at the top of the hill. This means that if you wish to visit Rome or eat outside of the hotel you have to go by Taxi/mini-bus. The Hotel does provide a free shuttle service to the city centre which runs all day, with the last bus leaving at 1730. This means that if you wish to eat in the City at one of the many Restaurants, or see the sights at night, you either have to leave early to catch the last free shuttle, or pay for a taxi. Taxi to the city centre is approx 20 - 25 euros (one way!). The Hotel is very expensive once you are in. * Very small bottle of water from the Mini-Bar - 8 Euros (£6). * The Restaurants are lovely, but again very expensive. Pool side Restaurant - 2 course meal with 1 bottle of wine 170 Euros. * If you need to iron your clothes - you can only do it via the pressing service. They do not supply Irons or Ironing Boards. * 50% extra charge to Press or Clean on a Sunday! * No Tea or Coffee facilities in your room so you have to order via Room Service - 5 Euro charge per person for delivery. * 30 Euro entry fee to use the Swimming Pool - even though you're a guest of the hotel - thats shocking! In summary, a very plush hotel, with fantastic pool and Restaurants. Everything they can charge additionally for, they will do. Not close to the sights (20 min Shuttle Ride) and you feel a little out of the way from the real Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: NYCtraveler100
Reviews.Content: As others have said, the hotel is not located near the center of Rome. If you want that, try the Intercontinental. There is a free shuttle bus running to and from downtown every hour but not on Sundays. The bus only has seats for 29 people, so make sure you get on the line early enough or you're going to pay 10 euros for a cab. A couple of observations. First, we found the service in the restaurant near the pool spotty during breakfast. We had to ask for coffee and orange juice several times before we got them. Perhaps this was simply the Roman service we were warned about, but we found it frustrating. Second, the concierge staff gave us two different prices to take a private car from the hotel to FCO airport: 85 euros and 50 euros. I have no idea which one is correct. We took a taxi and it cost us 40 euros. Therefore, if you're going on your own dime, I would suggest taking a taxi. Non-guests can access the pool for a fee. During our stay, this made the pool area more crowded, with lots of locals wearing their Speedos.

Reviews.Title: “Simply amazing!”
Reviews.Author: MrHiltonFan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simply amazing. Since I am a HHonors Gold member, we have been upgraded to a executive plus room. The view is magnificent, the room is amazingly big. The executive lounge is the best of all hiltons I have ever stayed at. The food served is great quality. Overal it is a pricey hotel, but if you are in for a unique experience, this is your perfect place.

Reviews.Title: “A Truly Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JoeMSP_MD
Reviews.Content: This is probably the nicest hotel I've ever stayed at. The rooms were elegant and spacious, the grounds were beautiful, and the hotel staff were very helpful and attentive. I also appreciated the complimentary champagne in our room (I had mentioned it was our wedding anniversary) and the complimentary breakfast and spa admission (which I assume had to do with my Hilton Gold member status). A few things to watch for. Food is horribly expensive at the hotel, so you should probably look to eat elsewhere most of the time. Also, the shuttle was generally convenient, but doesn't operate for a few hours in the middle of the day, which is frequently when I needed it. In general, taxis are the easist way to get around.

Reviews.Title: “perfect venue for citybreak with kids”
Reviews.Author: genevieve_7
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as it had a pool and we were travelling with 5 children aged between 13 years and 5 months. In fact it had a huge main pool (very deep and very cool) and also possibly the best baby and toddlers pool area I have encountered. The rooms were large and beautiful with a stunning view over the city. The staff simply couldn't have been more helpful with the children and our many and various requirements (cots, sterilisers, interconnecting rooms, kids entertainment at the sunday brunch, car seats etc). It is a 20 minute ride on the half hourly shuttle into the city so if you need to be central, this is probably not for you, but for any family with young children I don't think you could pick a better hotel in Rome.The downside....the bill!

Reviews.Title: “World-class hotel!”
Reviews.Author: judithal
Reviews.Content: The Rome Cavalieri Hilton was our first stop on a whirlwind trip of Italy's high points. The hotel stands out as one of those high points! As our driver from the airport wound around narrow city streets to finally arrive at the hotel in a hilltop neighborhood, we wondered what was in store. We joked that the Hilton had to look long and hard to find a random hilltop to build this hotel with the spectacular view. As Diamond members we reveled in the view from the club room, arguably one of the best club rooms that exists. With binoculars we found the Vatican and Colesseum and other notable landmarks. If you don't have club room privieges, I'm not sure how to access this same view. My best advice: work hard to become a Diamond member because this club room was amazing. The complimentary high quality food and beverages were gorgeously displayed, the service was first-rate and we had 15 minutes of free internet per day. Wandering the hotel interiors and exteriors is quite another peak experience. The owners art collection makes the hotel another Roman museum piece. Exquisite! We found the shuttle service easy, friendly and reliable and were able to make full days of the sites and look forward to the club morning and evening views. Our room, though not city-view was a superb accomodation. This hotel surely is a showpiece of the Hilton chain and a grand and pleasurable life experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fab but rude front desk”
Reviews.Author: MATTH
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best I have stayed at but you do need to know a few things before you book: The front desk staff can be VERY rude in terms of what and how they speak to you. This is not reflected in the rest of the staff at the hotel. The hotel is very expensive - however all of the rooms are more like suites and to a very high standard. Realisticly you do need a room with a city view. These are a lot more expensive but you just need to do it if your staying here as; the hotle is not in the centre of Rome and is situated in the hills so the main attraction is the view. If you cough up even more you can get an executive room with access to a club lounge which is just fabulous. Everything at this hotel is expensive although you don't get any riff raff here and everything is top class - (apart from front desk service) I would give this the full rating as it is so good apart from some problems with very rude staff which is a big negative when you are in this hotel's catagory rating and price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: adriNorthport
Reviews.Content: Although outside of town well worth the additional cab fare to stay in spacious luxury. Very pricey but the hotel is more like a Four Seasons than a Hilton. Beautiul room,clean,well appointed,luxurious. The dining room is top notch.I've travelled the world and this is close to the top of my list.

Reviews.Title: “Beatiful, expensive, and worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: HonorsKing
Reviews.Content: We just completed a 3 night stay at the Rome Cavalieri Hilton on June 19th. The hotel is absolutely beautiful. Set on a hillside above the city, in a quite residential area, this hotel is amazing inside and out. It is a bit of a distance to the city itself, but the hotel provides an hourly shuttle to a good central point where walking and the metro are easily accessible. The shuttle stop is within walking distance of almost all the major attractions in Rome. The Coliseum was the furtherst, at about 30 minutes. For us, seeing the Rome is what we were there for, so the walk was never an issue. The rooms were very spacious and reminded us of the Venetian in Las Vegas. The staff were very responsive. The interior is almost completely marble. The hallway walls were even marble! As with other hotels in Italy, familes of 4 need 2 rooms or a suite. For some reason, these rooms that could easily accommodate 4-5 people have a 3 person limit. Otherwise, we were simply amazed.

Reviews.Title: “As Advertised”
Reviews.Author: simonwmich
Reviews.Content: My wife and I started our 2 week Italian vacation with a 4 night stay at the Hilton Cavalieri. I'm a Hilton Diamond member and used points for the stay. The Cavalieri is definitely one of the most beautiful hotels in the world. We were lucky enough to get a top floor room with unbelievable view of the entire city. Waking up to that view never got old. The free food and drinks in the executive lounge were fantastic. Everyone at the hotel was so nice and we were treated like royaty. We were not able to get a reservation at La Pergola, but ate al fresco at the poolside restaurant which was unbelievable. The pool, gym, spa, and resort grounds are very nice. The weather was 80-90 degrees everyday, so we enjoyed a daily cool dip in the pool. We found the shuttle service easy to use, but also didn't mind at all spending 8euro for a cab. I laugh when I read reviews of people complaining about the hotel's location. Did you not look at a map or read any reviews before booking? The hotel is off the beaten path, but it is a resort and that's exactly what we wanted. Everything is very expensive at the hotel. Luckily we didn't pay for any food or drink because of lounge access. It's 25euro for a burger and fries! No hotels in Italy have irons or ironing boards. I would suggest bringing an iron or buying one on arrival. It costs 3euro to have one shirt pressed at the hotel. We booked a Mercedes through the hotel to pick us up from FCO for 85euro. That is way overpriced. You should be able to get the same service for 50euro. Lastly, if you have Hilton pts to burn, do it here. If you have Diamond status, even better. You get everything for free. You do not get executive lounge access at Gold level. You only get free gym and spa access. I've read past reviews of Diamond and Gold members being charged 30euro/day for gym/spa/pool access. This is definitely not the case now. We got everything for free and every staff member bent over backwards to make our stay perfect. Thank you Hilton Cavalieri!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: dilzio
Reviews.Content: We love Hilton Hotels outside the US - they have beautiful spaces and great service. The Cavalieri is slightly far from Rome's main attractions, but the shuttle bus was easy to take and it was nice to come home to a less touristy location. Unfortunately, because it was not in the city center, it was hard to find places to eat outside the hotel. And the hotel's restaurants were certainly not cheap. Overall, a beautiful hotel, away from tourist hayhem, but certainly not for anyone who is budget conscious.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven”
Reviews.Author: saxonsm
Reviews.Content: If you are Hilton HHonors Diamond level and don"t stay here, there's something wrong. It is a bit off the beaten bath, which can be nice, but more than worth it. The Club level rooms and service can't be compared. They basically supply you with food and drink from 7AM until 11PM, and it's good food and drink. Pros *Rooms - lavish with privacy noise reducing doors at the entrance and that drop down on the terrace * Service - Staff, especially on club level. * Ambiance *The view Cons * You have to take taxis or the shuttle everywhere. There are no trattorias to walk to for a light snak, etc My wife and I traveled to Italy to celebrate her birthday. She requested to be treated like a princess, and she was. We booked on HHonors points. If you are lucky to stay at the club level you will undoubtedly meet a lot of Americans becasue of the Hilton affiliation. We met great people that gave us tons of tips and tricks to getting around. The only thing that didn't go well was a tour they booked for us through Veratour, which was OK at best, and a dinner suggestion (former chef from La Pergola that recently left) Which was overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Room, Average Service...”
Reviews.Author: dukehalll
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights using my points. I am only a GOLD member and it showed when we checked in. They gave us a "city view" room. When we looked out our room it was on the 3rd floor looking into shrubs also they would not give us access to the executive lounge nor move us up to a higher floor as we were on our honeymoon. Over all a good hotel, but not worth $450.00 US. Thank god we used points. Don't stay here if you want to stay out in the downtown area after 8. Over all - over rated...

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING - Absolutely adored this resort with great views and spa!”
Reviews.Author: SKYtrip
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at the Cavalieri Hilton and thoroughly enjoyed my stay here. I wished I had booked this hotel for my entire visit. When I was initially booking, I was thrown off by its location description – it’s on top of a hill away from the busy city center. But with that you get this terrific view of the city and resort feel. Not to mention they have shuttles that take you to the city every hour. The shuttle is new and clean and takes no more than 15 minutes to get you into the city. Also, it’s a cheap taxi ride to the Vatican. They have a couple pools – one indoors. The pool area is manned by two pool attendants that service your every needs (plush pillows beds, towels, umbrellas, etc) and wait staff to provide you with refreshments. Also, the turkish bath in the spa is wonderful after a long day of sightseeing. Simply the best hotel and spa in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed luxury in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Kiki_LeMonde
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights and while it is not located in central Rome, the Cavalieri is a wonderful place to stay. It feels like a resort, which is a real treat after spending long, rather hot days, seeing the sites of Rome. The service is exactly what you would expect from a hotel that caters largely to Americans and Italian business travelers: professional, multi-lingual, efficient staff (all very friendly); our room was beautiful and well-appointed; the Executive Floor Lounge was a terrific place to relax and enjoy the endless selection of snacks and drinks and the hotel shuttle was a great way to get into the city. If you are looking for the experience of having Rome right outside the doors of your hotel, you won't find that here. But we had already spent 10 days travelling through Sicily and the Abruzzi, staying in many charming inns, so our final nights here were a welcome bit of luxury...

Reviews.Title: “A FairyTale”
Reviews.Author: Travel2SanAntonio
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Hotel Cavalieri was like a fairytale. Our limo driver told us that the Hotel Cavalieri is the number one hotel in Rome. Set in beautiful, lush surroundings our room overlooked the entire city of Rome. As you looked over our balcony, the pool was to the left and directly below were huge stone lions scattered throughout the garden. The day we arrived, there was a bottle of champagne and a spectacular setting of miniature fruit tarts, grapes, etc., waiting for us as we entered our room. The weather in June was perfect! The hotel staff was extremely helpful and courteous, accommodating our every request. We regret not being able to book dining at their fabulous rooftop restaurant...one of a handful of michelin-rated restaurants in the world. We were told they book 3 - 6 months in advance. We did dine at the pool level restaurant and found it to be superb and romantic. High tea at 4p.m. every day was a treat.
