It was our first time to Rome and we got married in a little village just outside of Rome, called Sacrofano. We were the first American couple married in the village. The mayor married us. It took us 6 months to complete all the required paperwork in the United States and then three days of paperwork and appointments when we got to Rome...it was worth the time and effort. I felt like Cinderella the morning of our wedding as I floated through the grand hotel with it's thick carpet and wide staircases in my wedding dress. The subsequent 2-week cruise of the Med on Oceania Cruiselines was the icing on the cake! You will enjoy every moment. The Italians' zest for life was evident the day of our wedding...everywhere we went for photos, the Italians would stop and shout and clap...men, women, and children...waving and clapping...marriage is a huge event for them. It was truly a fairytale. There is no question where we will stay on our next trip to Rome...The Cavalieri!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HelenSurrey
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous hotel, with wonderful staff, fantastic views and amazing amenities including a 3 michelin starred restaurant overlooking Rome. The executive rooms are better value for money, however if you have booked a standard room be prepared to pay through the nose for everything. There are no tea/coffee facilities in the room, nor an iron and ironing board. We were initially told that due to a health and safety issue we could not have one delivered to our room and would have to pay for a pressing service! You have to pay for all sunbeds next to the pool and extra for a towel for the sunbed and if you want to use the gym or indoor pool etc etc. These are not nominal amounts - by the time a couple have paid for 2 sunbeds, 2 towels and 2 beers you would be looking at approx £40. Just make sure you take a credit card, but it is a fantastic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent hotel but expensive”
Reviews.Author: MrsBerry
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Rome Cavalieri Hilton April 5-7, 2007. We used a Hilton Reward stay. The hotel is magnificent. Everything about it is 5 star. The service is impeccable and the room is beautiful. The room is very large, especially by European standards. The marble bathroom is amazing! There are two vanities and nice amenities. There is beautiful artwork throughout the hotel with lovely views of Vatican City from the hillside. We are seasoned travelers and have stayed in 5 star hotels in the US. This hotel surpasses most all other hotels. That said, it is very expensive for everything. Perhaps if we paid 700 euro/night the 40 euro continental breakfast wouldn't be too bad, but $50US for a croissant & coffee seems a bit excessive. The room service was at least 3 times more expensive than other comparable hotels. It was a wonderful experience and worth it if you can use Hilton points.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: MJBH
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was great. If you need anything they will bring it to your room within 5 minutes. Be sure and ask for a view room. I almost cried when I stepped out on our balcony and saw the view. We overlooked Rome and The Vatican. Beautiful. One night the hotel had a firework show. Amazing. The staff was great. By far the nicest people in all of Italy. It felt so good to come back to the hotel every night and be greeted by the wonderful staff. Another great feature of the room was the window darking shade and the extra sound proof door. WIth a touch of a button the room was totally dark and sound proof. There were a few negatives. One, the price of the food. Breakfast was 45Euros. We only ate at the hotel a few times. If you walk down to the local square there is two places to eat that is affordable. Two, they charged me 70Euros a night for a roll away bed for my teenager. As much as the room was there should not have been a charge for the bed,

Reviews.Title: “Rome Cavalieri Hilton - Absolutely Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Julie1022
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights using our points (Diamond). We were treated like VIPs from the moment we set foot inside; we were taken to the VIP area for a private check in, got great advice about what sites to visit, where to eat and how to get around, then we were given a private tour and then taken up to our room from the VIP representative (she would absolutely not accept a tip). We stayed on 5th floor (515) with a fantastic view of the city. We also had access to Executive Lounge (7am - 11pm with free food and drinks). If we didn't have this luxury we would have spent an enormous amount of $ on food, as the hotel is VERY expensive (30E for a cheeseburger and 18 E to go to the pool for the day). We ate at La Pergola for dinner and spent over 1000E for 4 people (cocktails, food and 2 bottles of wine)!! The service, ambiance and food was so impressive I felt like we were celebrities getting 5 star treatment. One of the best beds I've ever slept in with lots of big luxurous pillows and 100% cotton sheets (everything white). Huge, marbled bathroom with excellent water pressure and amenities. There is no iron so make sure to bring wrinkle free clothes or hang them in the bathroom to steam when you shower (they charge 6 E for pressing). Even though the hotel is located outside the Rome city center, it's easy to get there using their free shuttle which leaves every 30 mins. although it shuts down at 8pm, so will have to take a taxi back to the Hotel. It only costs 10-15 E to get to city center or the Termini train station; don't let anyone one tell you otherwise; if you get quoted more than 15 E you are being taken advantage of. Overall this is an amazing hotel - the staff bent over backwards and we were spoiled like crazy. Would defintely go back if my husband would let me!!!! Yea Hilton Points!!!

Reviews.Title: “It's all true....Beautiful, Great and Expensive”
Reviews.Author: ToddParis
Reviews.Content: The best way to enjoy this hotel is if you are a wealthy individual, and therefore the $13 minibar beers won't detract from what is a fantastic hotel in an unsurpassed location. If those sort of prices are going to make you feel like you're getting ripped off, it will take the fun out of the experience. You pay a lot here. Frequently. But it is awesome. It is a very popular hotel with locals, business groups, and tourists alike. Even Romans flock here for the spa facilities, which are excellent. Like many Hilton's, this was designed in stunning concrete monolithic bunker style (from Budapest to Sydney, they really have scarred the face of most cities they were built in. They must have had a very big chequebook as they roamed the world in the 60's convincing people to let them build horrible structures in places where it was totally inappropriate). In Rome, however they do a very good job obscuring it on the outside with plants, and inside, well, it's so damn nice you soon forget. I stayed in a city-view room on the executive level, which I guess is about as good as it gets without going for a suite. The private terrace is large and deep, easily sitting four. The view is sublime, with St Peters just over a mile away in the valley of Rome below. Everything has been very very well thought-out, including the very large mirrors flanking either side of the deep terrace to create an even greater impression of the view. Did I mention it is fantastic? It is. Don't even think about not getting a city view, it undoubtedly costs more but it is so exceptional there would be no comparison to a room that does not have this. The spa is very nice, if expensive. The outdoor pool is also great, filled with seemingly endless numbers of stunning italian mothers with young children. I would recommend this hotel for people who have done the tourist thing in Rome before and want a resort-type experience with the ability to get access to all Rome has to offer. If it's your first time in Rome, I would suggest trying something in the heart, as you will be up for frequent taxis or not-too-convenient shuttle buses to get you to the sights otherwise. My last tip: To the airport, use the Hilton's car service, very nice late model Mercedes sedans, basically the same price (50euros) as a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: rowly91
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the train station in Rome and took a taxi to the Hotel. We stayed at the hotel with Hilton points. I had requested a room that faced the city and booked the property several months in advance and was told that request should not be a problem. When we arrived at the property we were given "the last room" in the hotel and it did not face the city. The front desk staff was insulting, we were not "paying" customers in their opinion. We found the rest of the staff ,save the concierge, to be rude, unhelpful and unfriendly. It is true that the rooms are large and nice, but do not ask for an iron, they will not provide one. They will however charge $6 to press your t-shirts. The hotel has a complimentary shuttle that runs once per hour into the city and back. The trip takes 15-20 minutes depending on traffic. We found that being so far outside the city was a disadvantage, we did not come to Rome to swim or go to the spa. The area where the hotel is located has about 3 restaurants and 1 gelato place and is not good for pretty walks. I would not reccomend this hotel to anyone, save your Hilton points and stay somewhere closer to the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Easter weekend in Rome”
Reviews.Author: colonia2007
Reviews.Content: Arriving on April 5th at Fiumicino Airport we took the train to Termini Central Station (22 Euro for two ). As last time we stayed in Rome the taxi was stuck in a traffic jam, the train connection seemed to be faster. But actually it wasn`t . Although the train doesn`t stop in between, it is very slow. From Termini to the hotel we got a taxi for around 23 Euro. On the way back to the airport we took a taxi directly from the Hilton for around 45 Euro. This is definitely the better choice. We were greeted very friendly by the staff and assigned to a room on the 8th floor with Executive Lounge access. The lobby and most aisles were decorated with antiques and temporarily with huge chocolate Easter eggs. Our room was very nicely designed, spacious and spotless clean. There was a large flat screen TV, a working area and next to the balcony comfortable lounge chairs with a table. The bed itself is equipped with all kinds of cushions and high quality linen. You have a pillow menu you can choose from. The balcony was quite large and even facing to the back side of the hotel it had a nice view over a residential area. There were two chairs and a table. There is enough space to take breakfast or dinner outside. The bathroom was in perfect condition. Clean, spacious, smelling freshly. They offer Hermes “Eau d`orange verte” toiletries. There is a soap menu you could choose from, too. On the 7th floor you will find the Executive Lounge. From there you have a wonderful view over Rome while consuming one of the always available delicious raspberry cakes or canapés. There are four outside tables with the best view. A really romantic place to have a drink before dinner. The lounge opens at 7 in the morning and closes at 11 in the evening. They start with breakfast in the morning, serve light lunch, then high tea ,cocktails and pre-dinner snacks to after dinner sweets. It is more or less self service, but if you need help the always very attentive staff is bringing you everything. They cared for the older guests and gave them a hand whenever needed. Because of Easter there were a lot children too, that were treated always very nicely. Everything we tasted was of excellent quality. All kinds of soft drinks, fresh juice, beer, a nice Italian red wine, white wine, sparkling wine, coffee and tea, cocktails in the evening and all the snacks are complimentary. In the morning you will find Bagels and salmon, fresh fruit juices (pineapple was great), cold cuts, cheese, eggs, cappuccino and a lot more. One day we had breakfast downstairs in the restaurant . We were sitting outside next to the olive trees and the outdoor pool. A beautiful place. Prices are quite high (76 Euro for us two/ Continental only), but they have all kinds of food there and some fancy stuff too, like protein shakes, they mix. We didn`t try this one. On the top floor of the hotel there is a “3 star Michelin” gourmet Restaurant, called La Pergola. It is not easy to get a reservation there. We called them 2 weeks in advance and were on the waiting list. But we were lucky and got a nice table there. By the way, jacket and tie are required. The view from the terrace is overwhelming. Even from the indoor tables (it is still too cold for the terrace) you have a fantastic view. The 9 course menu was 198 Euro per person and featured an amuse geules, caramelized duck liver escalope on lemon foam with mint ice-crush ( delicious), scampi and caviar cannolo, tortellini with seafood, a porcini mushroom soup, fillet of red mullet, lamb sweetbreads, fillet of veal with black truffle and apple puree, cheese and dessert after dessert (at least 6). Food was, like expected, very good and the service great. You could study the wine menu for days, so we asked for a recommendation and we got an excellent Castello di Monsanto , Il Poggio 2001. They have a mineral water menu, that offers water from every place in the world with an exact description of the ingredients (minerals) and the location and depths of the source. This was a fun thing to read. Two other nights we tried the Restaurant Il Giardino Dell´Uliveto and had Pasta with Lobster (28 Euro per person). There was not much lobster in it, but the taste was very good. The salad was fresh , the steak with stuffed zucchini flowers (55 Euro) good, too. Staff efficient and friendly. There is an outdoor pool which hotel guest can use free of charge. Sun beds are comfortable and clean. Pool was opened on Easter Sunday and was still cold, but refreshing. For the indoor pool and spa they charge 31 Euro per person. It is very good too. The hotel runs a shuttle bus to Piazza Barberini at 8.30 and then every hour till 12.30 and from 15.30 to 19.30. (Sundays the schedule differs). After breakfast everybody wants to go downtown, make sure to line up early for the 10.30 and 11.30 bus . As there is a limited capacity. One day we walked to the Vatican. It is not too far. You leave the hotel at the main entrance. Turn left and follow the road through a residential area (safe) down to Via Trionfale A little later you cross Via Andrea Doria. There are markets there, where the locals buy their food. Very interesting. Three more blocks and you reach the Vaticano. On this side of the Vatican there are many cheap, simple but good restaurants. A 3 course lunch for about 9 to 12 Euro is quite common. We had a pizza with fungi porcini for 7.50 euro in “La Gondola” in Via degli Scipioni. House wine was not bad too. You can sit outside there. We didn´t want to climb the hill on our way back, so we took a taxi from the foot of the hill at Piazale Clodio to the hotel (about 5 Euro) . Try to book the Executive level room, as 31 Euro entrance fee per person for the spa , breakfast, all drinks and snacks are included. Really nice lounge with a great view. What we liked: This Hilton has a special atmosphere of relaxed luxury. Friendly staff everywhere and every time from room maids, concierge, check-inn staff, waiters and lounge personnel to pool staff. Although this was a very busy Easter weekend and they had long shifts they gave everybody the feeling to be always welcome. The location in the beautiful park, a little away from all the noise and traffic and crowded streets you explore the whole day.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MichelleMH
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here the first week of April. He is a Hilton Honors Diamond member and we were upgraded to the Executive level. Like most people here, that is a wonderful perk. The food is good and there is always something out. It is open from 7 am until 11:30 pm. You also have access to the pools, spa, and fitness center when you have the Executive Card Pass. Upon arriving we were greeded warmly and shown right to our room (even though we had arrived 3 hours before check in). Everyone on the staff was very pleasant and helpful. My husband and I took a walk around the grounds and found them to be beautiful. We also walked around the neighborhood and found some food nearby (turn right from the hotel). I agree that it was nice to have the hotel slightly away from the city center. It was very nice to get out of the city. We did find a downside, and that was that there was not an iron and ironing board in the room. When I looked in the service guide, it said was a "fire hazard" and that you could use the on site cleaning service. When I looked at the prices, it was 8.00 or 9.00 Euro to get one shirt pressed. We ended up hanging our clothes in the bathroom when we took our showers and let the steam get the wrinkles out each day. Also, there wasn't an alarm clock in the room. This really isn't a big deal, but you don't realize how often you look at it until one isn't there. Overall, a great experience with a helpful staff. If you ask the shuttle driver to drop you offf at places along his route, he will gladly do so. We asked to be dropped near Vatican City and the Villa Borghese. The afternoon driver was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DanielSE
Reviews.Content: Stayed here using rewards points for 4 nights in march. The hotel is for sure one of the best Hiltons I have stayed at, and we stayed in a ordinary room with city view, the executive floor was full. The ordinary room is better than the rooms on the executive floors on most Hiltons. The view over the city is magnificent. I stayed with my wife and daughter (9 months), the staff was really friendly and helpful, and they love children.. We never tried the La Pergola restaurant which is said to be excellent, but we thought it might not be a good idea with young children. The Giardino dell'Uliveto restaurant is really good too, they are very good with children and the food is excellent, both dinner and breakfast. Room service is really nice too, the food is brought from the Giardino restaurant. We liked alot that the hotel is not in the city center, it doesnt take long to get there and there is always a cab waiting, or wait for the shuttle which worked very nicely.

Reviews.Title: “Late review but still think about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: SouthwesternNative
Reviews.Content: After a terrible train ride form Paris to Rome (don't recommend it) the Cavalieri Hilton was a life rejuvenating oasis for us. By far one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. We had planned to pay extra to upgrade to the executive floor once we got there but being a Hilton Diamond member they had already given us a complimentary upgrade. After our experience I would have paid for it anyway! Best Hilton Exec lounge I have ever seen. The grounds were peaceful and the staff was both professional and courteous. We were concerned about its local away form the city at first, but we quickly found that it gave us spectacular views of the city and a nice break from the bustle of downtown. There were shuttles and taxis readily available so it was never an issue getting into town. I would recommend this hotel for anyone and I cannot wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “First Class Luxury”
Reviews.Author: kitpat
Reviews.Content: If you like luxurious rooms and decor away from the tourist hustle and bustle this hotel is for you! The location of the hotel is at the top of a hill in a quiet neighborhood near the Vatican area. My husband, son and I just returned from a 5 night stay at this beautiful place. We booked the room using our Hilton Reward points and upgraded to a room with a city view and daily breakfast included. As you may know already the hotel is quite expensive and they charge very high prices at the mini bar in your room, the lounge and the restaurants. There are plenty of neighborhood shops and restaurants within walking distance of the hotel that we frequented instead. We ate breakfast at the hotel everyday (nice breakfast buffet) and then took the free hotel shuttle downtown or took a taxi to the St. Peter's square, or wherever we were going that day. We spent most of our time during the day sight seeing downtown and returned to the hotel for rest and relaxation. The room was beautiful, the view was magnificent, and the beds and linens were first rate. There is twice daily maid service. The staff were all very friendly and helpful without exception.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Dicky49
Reviews.Content: I booked this on Hilton Honour points. 40,000 per night. We arrived at the Termini station and then took the metro to ottivano near the vatican, we then took a cab which cost 6 euros, not bad as the hotel is out a bit up a small mountain. Should have got off at Barberini and got the free hotel shuttle bus, which is excellent and runs from 09.30 until 20.00 but beware it breaks for lunch between 12 and 15.30 ish. Our room was fantastic and the bed was the biggest i have ever slept in. The spa and gym was also very plush. Now the downfall, the prices of the food and drink are exorbitant if you are an average tourist, a beer is 12 euros, breakfast is 35 euros, cup of tea 8 euros. We ate in the ground floor restaraunt and it was very nice, 3 courses a couple of vodkas and a bottle of wine 180 euros, not to bad as it was excellent.Tip of the day turn right as you leave the hotel and walk for approx 300 yards and you will arrive at a small shopping street where there are cafes and a couple of restaraunts. two coffess and 2 croissants under 4 euros, large beer 3 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back again, and again, and again... for free”
Reviews.Author: munchee13
Reviews.Content: As many have said, the hotel is pricey and it is not in downtown Rome. However, for our trip, it was great! My wife and I used a Hilton Reward (6 night global) and were treated as if we were paying full price. Now, let me clarify, I am also a Hilton Diamond member, so I'm sure that has a bit to do with our great experience, but I think it's important to know what you're getting into. We would not have stayed at this hotel, if not for the Diamond status. So, with that said... The executive level is top notch. It's really embarrassing how bad the stateside executive levels are when compared to this one. The Cavalieri just gets it -- I wish the CEO of Hilton would make them a beacon for "doing it right" everywhere else. The food and drink was incredible and constantly flowing. The staff was helpful and always eager to please. The room we had was a city view, and for those complaining about the location, you can't have this view from downtown. It was splendid and breathtaking. We arrived to champagne and special desert. On one night, they cut off the water for "normal maintenance" (not sure why this wasn't done during the day), so we were kept up by constant banging on the pipes for a couple of hours. I made one 20 second phone call downstairs to ask them to stop -- they didn't, but the gentleman at the desk apparently made note of my displeasure. We had fresh fruit baskets, drink, and an appology note the next day (and for the rest of our stay) -- we were happy again. The shuttle service is excellent, and if you don't want to take the shuttle, just drop the 10 Euro for a cab. We were conveniently dropped off to see pretty much all of Rome by short walks or taking the metro from shuttle drop off. All in all, our visit to Rome was a great experience, and the time at the Cavalieri was a big reason why.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing panorama”
Reviews.Author: misdirected_baggage
Reviews.Content: I booked a room on the executive floor and had a lovely stay. Evening snacks included shrimp, sparkling wines, various cheeses, and a glorious buffet. Breakfast included pasteries, cereals, meats and, best of all, cappucino made by a barista who had worked there for 17 years. She was only too happy to share the secrets of great Italian coffee. The room was large and well appointed with Hermes toiletries. The views of the city and Vatican were simply magical. Waking up to a panorama of Rome with beams of sunlight reflecting off ancient landmarks is breathtaking and sipping wine on the balcony watching the city light up in the evening was incredibly romantic. The rooftop restaurant, La Pergola served the best meal I've ever eaten (it easily trumps every other 3 star establishment including Paris, NY, etc). The water list, alone, is 3 pages long and a hoot to read! Reserve a table well in advance because it is very small and the top restaurant in Rome by several measures. Downsides: This is a convention facility so it's busy, doormen are indifferent, the concierge and desk staff are harried, the building is a bit worn and major Roman sites are best visited by the free shuttle bus (runs hourly, or a 10 Euro cab ride). Despite the negatives, this is a wonderful and elegant facility. But you must stay on the executive floor and pre-book a city view room (the other view is dreary).

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculous hotel...”
Reviews.Author: newuser
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 3 nights, and while it is very beautiful, clean, and has every indulgence known to man, I will never stay here again. It is way out of the city center, and is not convenient to anything. There is a commuter shuttle which drops you off at Piazza Barberini, but that only runs every hour during the day, so if you want to enjoy dinner somewhere else, you'll have to pay for a taxi. Since the hotel is so remote, they price gouge everything. I had to pay 9 euro for a can of minute maid soda! While I understand coca cola products are generally more expensive outside the US, you can get the same can in the city center for < 1 euro! I also had to pay 27 euro for a 24 hour internet connection! Unbelievable... If you want to see Rome, and you want to indulge yourself at a 5 star hotel, stay on Via Veneto at the Westin, or another one of the many 5 star hotels. The Cavalieri is not worth it...

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!!”
Reviews.Author: shauny-marfy
Reviews.Content: Bit late in writing this reviiew but better late than never eh??! In August 06 we went to Rome and unfortunately the original hotel my boyfriend booked wasn't great, we were both so disappointed that we decided after one night to move ...... After looking on the internet from Hotel 1, the hilton we decided it was to be.... and boy did we make the right choice.... from the moment we arrived it was bliss. It was exactly how we hoped our trip away would be from the start... but as I've already said better late than never. The Hilton personnel, surroundings, rooms, everything was superb, couldn't fault it, yes it was pricey but worth the money. The bed was so comfy, the bathrooms luxurious and the evening drinks in the "club" level were great. I would definitely recommend upgrading. If you want something special go for this hotel, if you want something local to sites, a bed to crash out for and something cheap this is not a hotel to choose. It is a distance away from the centre of town but the hotel/staff make up for this one and only negative.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious decadence, not for the ordinary mortal.”
Reviews.Author: Susan66
Reviews.Content: From the outside, this hotel is not special at all. A 50's monolith located on a hill way outside the city center (about twenty minutes by taxi). However, once inside, you are struck by the quality of the art collection as well as a general atmosphere of decadent luxury. The grounds are beautifully kept and have great views of Rome and the Vatican. The rooms are spacious and generously appointed. Bathrooms are huge and clad in marble with Hermes toiletries. The overall look is a very non-minimalist mix of Mediterranean colours and English chintzy country style. We had lunch in the downstairs restaurant on several occasions and were surprised about the prices. However outstanding the food (it was), the price level seems to be extraordinarily high even for a 5 star hotel (I've stayed in many 5 star hotels all over the world). Unfortunately, because of the remote location of the hotel, there were not many alternatives around. We were in fact a captive audience because the congress we attended was held at the Cavalieri. A small bottle of Pellegrino is EUR 8 from the minibar. Expect a similar price level in the lobby bar. This is a hotel for those who want to push the boat out and expect to pay dearly for the pleasure of doing so. I felt uncomfortable about the expenditure although my company paid for the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hmgharley
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Probably one of the most expensive in Rome, but well worth the money. Couldn't find a fault with it. Will be saving up for our next trip there.

Reviews.Title: “Top 5 Luxury Hotel Worldwide”
Reviews.Author: apspartan
Reviews.Content: I recently enjoyed several days of our honeymoon at the Cavalieri Hilton Rome. The Cavalieri Hilton has everything you could ever want in a hotel. Hotel: The Hotel itself is not much to look at from the exterior, however once you walk in, you will find a beautiful interior full of 19th century original art work, antiques and plenty of marble. The hotel has 8 floors of rooms, the top 2 being reserverd for executive and suite rooms. The hotel sits on its own park and overlooks all of Rome. The property includes indoor/outdoor pools, outdoor dining, tennis courts, rooftop bar and restaurant, spa, and of course a helicopter pad. For those who don't speak Italian, the staff is fluent in English too. Note: It is rumored that this property will be added to the Hilton Waldorf Astoria collection. This mean during high season HH rewards will be 60k/night and low season will be 40k/night. Today, it is a category 6 property and only requires 40k/night all year. Rooms: I stayed on the 7 & 8th floor which housed the executive rooms. For my first stay, I stayed on the 7th floor with a room that overlooked Rome from the private balcony. That was a great room!! The Hotel uses Hermes of Paris for its toiletries which is also a nice touch (opposed to the normal Crabtree and Evelyn). Rooms come with both a pillow and soap menu. House keeping is twice a day. An executive room with a Rome view is a MUST in this hotel. The lougne which is one of the largest executive lounges I have seen is stocked with food and drink all day. Since food and drink are very expensive in the hotel (10 euros for a beer, 24 euros for pizza), the executive lougne is a savior. For my second stay, I was in room on the 8th fllor. This room, which was apart of the executive floor, was very nice however the view was not of Rome, but of buildings across the street from the hotel. Spa: The spa is terrific. Although, as a Hilton Diamond I received free access, I believe the daily rate is 30 euros. The spa has a great Turkish bath, large indoor pool and huge workout facility. The Turkish bath is definitely worth using. After a long day of sightseeing, you will feel great relaxing their. I really could go on forever about this hotel. The staff was always every helpful. We were welcomed with a cake and a bottle of champagne in our room. We also enjoyed New Year's Eve there and were able to watch the fireworks across all of Rome. The Cavalieri also puts on their own fireworks show which is one of the largest in the city. There are a couple of cautions I must note, however they do not really take away from the class and level of this property. The Cavalieri Hilton is outside the city and will cost about 20 euros one way to the Termini (rail station) and average of 12 euros to go the city center. You cannot walk to the city center from the Hotel. Taxi rides are required unless you utilize the hotel shuttle service and runs every hour with the exception of 12:30-2pm. Beware that this shuttle can fill up quickly, so get their early. Lastly, everything costs in this Hotel. Please do not go there and not think you have been warned. With that being said, I would go again in a heartbeat. I have traveled across the world and would be hard pressed to believe that Cavalieri Hilton is not one of the top 5 hotels in the world.

Reviews.Title: “New Pope”
Reviews.Author: truemanxman
Reviews.Content: Absolutely stunning rooms with breathtaking views. Staff fantastic,food exquisite. Pricey, but for that little something special, very definately worth it

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place”
Reviews.Author: Hambagahle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cavalieri Hilton for two nights in early November prior to embarking on a cruise. We had a good rate which included breakfast - it was about 350 Euros a night and was their weekend rate. We expected a "normal" size room. When we checked in I inquired whether we could upgrade to a room with a view of Rome - this would have cost us an additional 70 Euros/night and did not seem worth it. When we reached our room - with a view of the local neighbourhood - we were amazed. It was huge, and beautiful with a terrific large balcony. We wished we had been there at a warmer time of the year because it would have been perfect for breakfast! (or cocktails!) The room was beautifully furnished, with a comfortable sitting area. It certainly would have been termed a Junior Suite at another hotel - and remember this was the cheapest room I could book! We ate dinner both nights at their garden level restaurant. It was expensive, but the food was terrific. The included breakfast was buffet, and vast! Just about everything and anything you could think of. We took their free shuttle bus down and back to the city. Because we had to go to Civitavecchia (at least an hour's drive away) to board our ship I thought we would be safer in getting the concierge to book us a car. This cost 240 Euros. A taxi would have been a lot cheaper, but we felt unreliable. The driver was quite good and got us there in just over an hour. I thoroughly recommend this hotel because it is quiet, has every facilty you need - a lovely outdoor pool for the summer and even an indoor one as well - the staff are great and the food is good.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: wareagle77
Reviews.Content: Speechless is the word to describe this hotel. We had a city view and were upgraded to the executive level. It was a breathtaking view that is worth the extra money if you have to pay for it (thanks Hilton Honors). Executive level allowed free food and drink throughout the day. I would have even considered paying 200 bucks more out of pocket for each of these amenities as they more than pay for themself. The view of St. Peter's and the city skyline has WOW factor all over it. WOW, WOW, WOW!! At first, we were a little skeptical at staying "away from it all", but this allowed us to enjoy the city and still manage to have a relaxing vacation. Each day we took the shuttle to the city center and typically caught a cab home. November was the perfect time of year to visit as the temp. was perfect and the crowds were minimal. I could not imaging going in mid summer and have to deal with the heat and crowds. Hilton Cavalieri was primo and one of the finest hotels my wife and I have visited.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but they charge for everything!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lyndy-Lou2
Reviews.Content: We recently had a weekend in Rome. My husband had some Hilton points to use so we treated ourselves to this 5* hotel. The hotel itself was fine and if you are lucky enough to be on a higher floor facing the city the views would be fantastic (unfortunately, we were on a low floor and overlooked the rear). If you want a breakfast you need to add around £20 each and when my husband wanted to check our flight details on the internet, we were told that you also needed to pay for this. The pool looked great, but again there was a charge to use this facility. I think when you are paying nearly £1000 for 2 nights that some of these things should be included. Although you get lovely views from the hotel, this is because it is situated at the top of a hill overlooking Rome and so you can expect a 25 minute walk down (and then up on the way back) to the City. You can get a taxi (cost around 10euros) although we did try the complimentaty bus one morning - be warned get there early, there was a mad dash to get on and a very cramped ride in to the city. Rome itself was FANTASTIC, you can walk around and see most of the sites, don't miss the Sistin Chapel - absolutely beautiful!!

Reviews.Title: “Boringly average, and badly situated”
Reviews.Author: unclejames
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the middle of nowhere, not to put too finer point on it. It may have a good view of the city (my view was of a television transmitter), but the view comes with a price of being in the middle of a residential area with nothing close-by. Every single trip away from the hotel will need a taxi, and in Rome, taxi drivers rather enjoy ripping you off. The hotel doesn't do a bad job of ripping you off, either. If you want a dip in the swimming pool, residents have to pay. If you want internet access, that'll cost you a staggering 27 euro a day, and you only get 400MB of downloads, which many users, especially if stocking up on video podcasts, will easily use. The internet access is also poor - so poor, in fact, that I found it unusable. The rooms are quite nice, if hideously chintzy. The television has a wide variety of English-language channels on it, including CNN, Fox News, Sky News and BBC World. The outside bar is quite nice in the lobby - I couldn't get to the top bar, I don't earn enough. Overwhelmingly, this hotel suffers from Hilton Syndrome: once within its boring, corporate walls, you could be in Rome, Paris, Slough or Birmingham Alabama. If you're coming for a lovely holiday to Rome, make sure you find somewhere lovely to do it. Avoid this corporate monolith in the middle-of-nowhere like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “The views are breathtaking”
Reviews.Author: tciarleglio
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I, along with my 24 year old son stayed for 1-night and the Rome Cavalieri Hilton at the end of a 12-night Meditteranean Cruise. The hotel is absolutely beautiful with its views of the city and beautiful artwork. This was a perfect way to end our vacation. The front desk representatives were very friendly, attentive and informative at check-in. We checked in quite early, so our room was not ready. That was not a problem as we had set up a Private Vatican Tour-I highly recommend this. It is very informative and gets you through the line very quickly. When we arrived back to the hotel later in the day all of our luggage was in our room. We did not even have to request it. The room was beautiful. Nice king size bed with opulent bedding and lots of pillows. There was also a sofa sleeper in the bedroom. We were on the 6th floor and our room had a balcony that faced the city of Rome and the Vatican. It was evening when we returned to the hotel, so the view was absolutely amazing with the lights of Rome and St. Peter's Basilica. The bathroom was quite large and very clean. They use Crabtree and Evelyn bath products, so that was also a very nice treat. We took a taxi to the Vatican and that cost approximately 9 Euro. We also took one back from Piazza Navona and the cost was approximately 15 Euro. We were prepared in advance and it was cold, so the cost was well worth it. The food is very expensive. I had room service of just some hot tea and the cost was 8Euro. You are a captive audience at this hotel, so be prepared in advance if you plan to eat or drink there. We had a very early wake-up call and we awoke to the sun rising over the city of Rome, The Vatican and St. Peters Basilica. It was amazing and was the perfect way to end our stay! I would definately stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious grand hotel; smart service; outlandish food prices”
Reviews.Author: ZinGasm
Reviews.Content: I take my father every year on a trip to a European city and this year’s destination was Rome. Having accumulated a heap of HHonors points, I booked a free 5 night stay at the Cavalieri Hilton for our time in the eternal city. From the outside, the hotel is a rather unimpressive vine-covered rectangular monolith located on a hill northwest of the city center. The outside decks, pool and gardens are beautiful and inviting. Inside, there is a sophisticated opulence reminiscent of properties you would find on the Riviera or similar coastal locations. Numerous artifacts and art adorn the public spaces. Being a free stay, we were given a room on the non-view side of the hotel. If you can get a view side, by all means do it since you have the splendor of Rome and St. Peters to gaze upon. The rooms are large and generously appointed. All have a balcony of some sort. Bathrooms are spacious and completely done in marble. Maid service is impeccable and twice daily. Broadband internet access, like many European hotels, is extremely pricey. If you are going to be there for more than one day, consider the multi-day price schedules since it may come out cheaper than paying for each day. We ate in the downstairs restaurant our first night and were stunned at the prices. Two pasta dishes, a bottle of water, and a 10 euro bottled beer set my account back nearly US$100. We had read about the steep prices earlier and it is absolutely true. We did not eat again in the hotel, preferring instead to hit spots in central Rome that we’d been told about. The food was nothing worthwhile to justify such prices and I would recommend you avoid eating here if you can. I was so numbed by the ‘regular’ restaurant prices that I did not bother to see what the Michelin-starred restaurant “La Pergola” on the rooftop were. I workout when I travel so I intended to use the fitness center during our stay. At the very well equipped health club in the basement I was told that my Hilton Gold status did not apply, the daily fee being 31 euros (!!), despite my having received an email reservation confirmation signed by the Hotel GM indicating that my status qualified me to use the fitness center “at facilities operated by Hilton”. Apparently, this was not one of them which made getting a personal email from the GM a bit misleading in this regard. I brought this to the attention of the hotel staff and they politely removed one day’s charge from my account and sent a complimentary bottle of wine to our room. I had to pay for the other days that I used the facility, which remains irksome. There is a regular shuttle bus that takes you into central Rome. We found this to be quite reliable and the driver, Pierro, simply a delight. Your alternative, if you do not take the bus, is to take a taxi for approximately 15 euro each way. This can add up quickly. The bus stops running at 8p, requiring you to taxi back if you have dinner in town. The concierge desk is staffed by a number of very helpful and courteous agents. They assisted us with dinner and tour reservations and offered suggestions for the order in which to see the big sights in Rome. All told, we were very pleased with the property, service, facilities and staff. This is a very expensive hotel, however, and it may not be the best choice if you can find something closer to the city center of similar quality and service. But for our needs, it fit the bill very well and we would be happy to return on a future trip.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury - What a View”
Reviews.Author: WhenAreWeThere!
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 6 night holiday to Italy - 3 night in Rome and 3 nights in Sorrento - this was to celebrate my 40th Birthday. As a Hilton Hhonors Diamond Member we used my well earned points for this holiday. First impression of the hotel is amasing, with the water fountain, top hatted doorman and the smell of lilly flowers - the check in was fantastic as they took us to a "special" sitting area away from the main check-in. The receptionist explained everything about the hotel and then took us up to the 7th floor for a tour of the Executive Lounge and then up to our 8th floor room. What can I say about the room view - looking out over the pool, gardens and the WHOLE of Rome City - Awesome. The hotel and rooms are very clean with a VAST amount of gold, loads of marble and fine roman art. The bed was vast with crisp white sheets, loads of pillows and also a pillow & soap menu. The wall mounted plasma TV was amasing. Pool/Spa - Outside pool was VERY cold, but it was October. Inside pool was nice, but you need to visit the Spa and experience the biggest steam room I have ever been in - then relax on one of the beds with your white dressing gown and a warm blanket - this was so peaceful and relaxing. On the morning of my birthday we had breakfast on the room balcany, although it was 150euros - the champagne, caviar & salmon was worth every cent. Later that day, a cake, chocolates and champagne was delivered to the room - compliments of the hotel - NICE TOUCH! We could not get into the roof top resturant - even through my wife tried to book it 4 weeks in advance - stressing it was for my birthday - but then the hotel booked another resturant in the centre of Rome, closer to St Peters with a fantastic view of the doom from their roof top balcany. The meal was 370euros but the whole setting was so romantic. We found the hotel shuttle bus to be a good service and dropped us off close to the vatican one morning. The last bus back is at 8.30, but it was nice to sit and have a drink in one of the bars waiting for the bus to depart. If you are out flate the taxi back will be between 10 and 15 euros. The best part of the hotel is the 7th floor executive club - this is the best hilton we have experienced - the furnishing was top quality. There was also a good selection of beer and wine throughout the day. Excellent breakfast in the morning. Good selection of spirits in the evening. Nibbles were ok, with soup served in the evening. Nothing better than a large glass of italian wine sitting on the Executive Club Balcany, with the wall heater on and looking out across Rome. WE WILL BE BACK.

Reviews.Title: “A Queen at the Cavalieri”
Reviews.Author: fiorentini
Reviews.Content: just returned from Rome's Hilton Cavalieri and it was wonderful - The bed and linens were exquisite. My husband 's affiliation with Hiltion hotels allowed us the priviledge of the executive lounge - which was fabulous. From 7AM to 11PM the club was open with lovely selections of light fare and cocktails. There were 4 or 5 terraces that we were successful in obtaining a few nights - the view is memeorable and the ambiance delightful. I had a wonderful stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but classy”
Reviews.Author: cuddly
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days after a Mediterranean cruise. As mentioned in previous reviews, it's certainly expensive but well-worth the price. We stayed in an executive room on the 8th floor, which cost nearly 900 Euro a night, but received first class service with access to the executive lounge where 5 small meals and drinks (including sparking wine and liquers) were served a day -- all complementary, and got free internet use for 15 minutes. I have never seen so much marble in a hotel (apart from Burj Arab in Dubai): floor laid with marble, reception and concierge areas made of marble, the whole bathroom complete with marble. Being on top of a hill, the view over Rome is fantastic; only 10 minutes taxi ride into central Rome (about 10 Euro each way). It's certainly much quieter to stay here, as Rome is notorious for its noise. Having said that my only criticism of the rooms is poor noise insulation -- as most rooms are interconnecting, you can hear literally everything in the next room (conversation, TV, music). Use of the spa, gym and swimming pool costs 32 Euro, even for hotel residents. Perhaps that's why the gym was empty. Penny pinching considering the hotel's obvious aspirations. Lying on a sunlounge with umbrella and beach towels will cost another 16 Euro. I had to say that the spa and pool lacked the wow factor(certainly didn't look as spectacular as the hotel's website photos). The topfloor (9th) restaurant, La Pergola, recently received 3 Michelin stars which it definitely deserved. Lovely view over Rome, cosy atmosphere with lots of table candles, attentive service from the waiters, and last but not least, the most imaginative and delicate cooking. And they had an extensive wine list as well as special coffees and teas menu. Certainly it did not come cheap, as the 6 course tasting menu cost 170 Euro (there is also a 9 course tasting menu). The "grand dessert" which consisted of 7 small portions of desserts, was a must, and the souffle was out of this world!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: MZ-TarvelGuy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 7 days as part of a company conference. Cityview room was great (tall trees in the way so dont pay a premium for it) - all the luxuries of home, large (esp by european standards). Rate if we wanted to stay on after past the conference was euro 369 which sounds like a lot but is typical for a 4-5 star hotel in a European city like Rome. Service of concierge, front desk, shuttle, bar, etc was excellent. No issues. What people have said about the prices is true - restaurant, mini-bar, room service etc are OUTRAGEOUS. We were on a conference so we were not paying. When we were on our own we never ate at the hotel - why go to Rome and eat at the hotel !? And just buy some water / snacks on the way home and you don't need the mini bar ! Avoid the spa. Looks nice, prices a bit high, service was lousy - wife didnt like it at all. Didnt use the pool so can't comment - but yes you have to pay for towel service, even use of the gym etc !!! Yes, hotel is far from downtown but shuttle was convenient and always timely. Stops at one location downtown - so ok for a tourist - you can walk / metro from there. Taxi was about euro 15 to / from downtown - not too bad. Hotel says you can walk - LOL ! Don't even think about it - steep hills, traffic, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Very luxurious”
Reviews.Author: Georgia-USA
Reviews.Content: Incredible hotel! Beautiful outside and inside. Probably the best hotel in Rome. We used our Hilton HHonors points and have Diamond status. Diamond status is a definite plus here! We have never been treated so well as we were at this Hilton. As Diamond members, we checked in at a special desk and were given top service from the conceirge. Our first night was on the Executive Level. What a room! Huge, beautiful, plasma TV, robe, slippers, candies, champagne, soap menu, pillow menu, Hermes toiletries, the list goes on! We did not have a room with a view of the city but the view of the grounds was very nice. Very nice to have the Executive Lounge for light food and drinks and view of the city. Our second night was on the fifth floor but with a great view of the city. No issue not being on the Executive Floor since room key permitted access to Executive Floor. Room was very nice (no quite as luxurious as Exec. level). Shuttle to City Center was great. It was not an issue not staying in City Center. We highly recommend this hotel especially if you are a Diamond member.

Reviews.Title: “Regular client, but now not returning anymore”
Reviews.Author: delpreted
Reviews.Content: This past September was my fourth stay at the Cavalieri Hilton. I adored this hotel, and up until now could not imagine staying elsewhere in Rome. This time everything changed....for the worse. I had a room (actually two rooms - one was for my kids) with a parking lot view (after requesting a view of the city), the wall next to the bed was dirty, the bathroom toilet needed repair, the shuttle bus left early from the city and we were left waiting for 25 minutes (with an active 5 yr. old) thinking it was just late. Plus, the prices in the hotel have gotten OUTRAGEOUS. Six euros for a small bottle of water, and 3 euros for a towel to lay on lounge chair. The pool was FREEZING, and my kids could not even swim on a beautiful summer day. Apparently they changed general managers, and it surely showed. Also, they had a convention that weekend, so we (the faithful, recurrent guests) got stuck with the worst room. And my family had just stayed their a month earlier for 3 nights, and 4 rooms on the Executive level. Also, AVOID THEIR RESTAURANT. It is absolutely not worth the $600 you will spend on dinner for two. Get the upgraded room and enjoy the view from there. Sorry to say that I will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: jfehrenb
Reviews.Content: Best in class Hilton property. Fantastic service. I would have liked it to be closer to the action in Rome, but the shuttle takes you where you need to go as a tourist. Best Hilton I have ever stayed in. Rooms are fantastic..

Reviews.Title: “A little too expensive”
Reviews.Author: Todnick
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome early in the morning exhausted from flying all night. The Hilton was well aware of our travel plans as I had been in contact with the concierge on several occasions prior to the trip to arrange for transportation. When we got to the hotel our room was not ready. I was very disappointed and expected better service considering the price per night. We went out onto the veranda to get some coffee and wait for our room. We waited for over half an hour with staff constantly walking by us and were never waited on. We finally made our way back into the hotel and sat at the bar for service. The drinks were delicious, but incredibly overpriced. The room itself was very pretty, although the view of the huge antenna outside didn't help. I will say that the bathroom had great water pressure and was nicely appointed in marble. We ate all of our meals out of the hotel for a couple of reasons: first because we wanted to see as much of Rome as possible before going on to the next part of our trip. Second, the prices on the menu were truly discouraging. We could eat 3 times as much in the heart of Rome as we could get at the hotel. The day we were leaving I wanted to get some water for the trip. When we have stayed at other 5-star resorts, they would usually get bottles of water and give them to you. I was directed down to the spa where I was charged 5 Euro per bottle of water. And on that note....we left the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and very expensive”
Reviews.Author: rpalmer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed the Hilton as our homebase in Rome for 3 terrific nights. The property is immaculately maintained and staffed by friendly employees willing to assist with reasonable requests. The hotel is often cited for being well outside of central Rome, which it is, but many of the rooms provide a spectacular view of the city. Some of the rooms, however, provide a view of a giant TV/radio tower, so be sure to ask whether there’s anything on the city side available. A shuttle bus provides hourly service to central Rome, but as so many reviewers have noted, you’ll likely need to take a taxi back if you plan to enjoy any Roman nightlife as the last departure for the hotel is at 8:00 p.m. A taxi from Termini station is about 12 euros. The rooms are large, all with balconies and sitting areas. The bathrooms surfaces are covered in marble and the shower has terrific water pressure. English language cable channels include CNN International, CNBC Europe, BBC World, and EuroSport. As Hilton Gold Members we were offered a city view and a complimentary beverage (beer, wine, champagne, or soft drink) in the Lobby Bar each night of our stay. Be advised that a Coke will cost you 9 euros and a wine a minimum of 10 euros if you don’t have this coupon. The desk reported that the hotel was full and that no upgrade to the executive level was available, although based on past reviews I’m skeptical that this was the reason. Nevertheless, we felt we were treated fairly and we enjoyed our time at the hotel. As you leave the hotel, take a right and continue until you reach a small commercial district. There you’ll find a small café with good food, excellent gelato, and great wine, all for a very reasonable price – especially in comparison to what’s offered onsite.

Reviews.Title: “Rome with a view?”
Reviews.Author: pert2
Reviews.Content: We stayed August bank holiday in brief: Rooms spacious and clean except for Patio doors If you don't pay for the room with a view you do end up with view of telephone mast and bins (guess they have to go somewhere?) Lounge room very busy for breakfast self service token gesture plenty of champagne and wine on tap view from Lounge room v.nice but very small 3 tables on balcony Sun terrace and lobby v.nice Personally I thought the hotel was starting to show its age however it was a lovely experience staff courteous beautiful spa.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been anywhere”
Reviews.Author: SevernaParkGal
Reviews.Content: This hotel felt like...nothing. In my opinion it just didn't have much personality. During our stay there was a huge meeting going on and I swear I could have been in any convention hotel in any city. My father-in-law, who is a corporate executive, booked the hotel and I can see why he liked it--it is a comfortable place for someone working away from their home/office. It was a drive to Rome city center but it could have been an overseas plane flight. I can't tell you how disappointed I was at the lack of ambiance. Now the rooms were certainly comfortable, and my son enjoyed the pool but I would never, ever go back.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive Hilton”
Reviews.Author: relax4evr22
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a beautiful room, and if you are on the right side of the building, a beautiful view. I have been to to this hotel about 5 times and have recommened this to people who spent a lot there. It is overly expensive. 150 euros for a massage and a 3 euros for a towel! I got a bottle of water at the pooside bar and it was 6 euros. On the bottle it said .50 euros! We ordered lunch one day and it cost 70 euros. Guess what we get? Two granitas, one hamburger, one starberry shake, a bottle of water, and yogurt with fruit. And it wasn't big the portions. My sister&brother-in-law ate at the pergola (the resturant above the hotel) and spent 700 euros on food. And they told me the food was horrible. The hotel is a little place on this hill, so the noise of urban rome doesn't bother you, but then that forces you to buy a bottle of water way overpriced when you can get it at a sidemarket for a lot less. They have a pool, but it is freezing. You would think that they would give more consideration for someone that rcommened this hotel to people (when it was cheaper) and goes there every year. So that is why i hav to rate it average when I would like to rate it above average, i am sorta stuck in the middle. Finto.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: BHM_Traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here July 15-19, 2006 and had a memorable experience. First, our room on the Club Level had a fabulous view. We frequently found ourselves gazing out the window, sitting on the balcony, etc., taking in the scenery of the dome of St. Peters, the Vatican, and trying to spot other landmarks, like the Colisseum, wedding cake, etc. We paid an extra 50 euro/night for the club level, but you will burn through that if you drink 5 cokes a day out of the honor bar in a regular room. The food presentations in the Club lounge were nice, but not overly kid friendly. The staff in the lounge were excellent! Like everything else here, restaurants at the hotel are very pricey. We had a meal at the downstairs restaurant (can't recall the name), and the food was OK; there are several good (less expensive) restaurants within walking distance. Our meal at La Pergola, however, was perhaps one of the best dinners we have ever had...VERY expensive, but worth every euro. While we were in Rome, the taxi drivers were on strike, so we had to hire drivers through the hotel (which was very expensive). This was more of a problem given the location of the Hilton (would be a VERY long walk down to the center of town), but we managed OK with the help of the concierge. Next time we will probably stay a little closer to the center of town for more walking from the hotel, but we really enjoyed our hilltop garden oasis at the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Just a great experience”
Reviews.Author: AirPizz1
Reviews.Content: Toured Italy last October. Should have posted then - but never got the time. Contacted HiltonHonors during the early spring. Wanted to burn some points. Asked for 3 nights at the Sorrento Palace and 6 nights at the Cavalieri in October - didn't care when or which order - just had to be consecutive. And was accommodated. As it turned out, the Cavalieri was the last 6 nights of our tour. Arrived by rental car - after a long drive from the Amalfi Coast - and finding the property exceeded my abilities. Stopped and asked directions twice. It was great to see Via Alberto Cadlolo on a street sign. Pulled into the property - and was promptly greeted - but just as promptly asked to hide the rental. Admittedly the Opel minivan didn't mix well with the 3 MB S500 limos sitting there. No problem. Had selected a rental company with outlets at Malpensa (our starting point) and the Cavalieri. The turn-in area was in a catacomb across the street. Scary. Next time - no rental car. That done - on to check -in. Very prompt again. Assigned to the Executive Floor. Agent showed us to the special elevator, a walk through of the room and then to the Executive Lounge. Tipped the Bellman when he arrived with the bags - and except for an occasional tip at the Executive Lounge, we did not spend another Euro at the hotel until we departed - took one of those S500's to Fiumicino. For 6 nights only 2 negatives - didn't get a room with a city view, but spent just as much time in the Executive Lounge, which did - AC had been shut off for the season, and it was a bit warm especially after the long drive. Housekeeping delivered a fan which handled it well. Everything else absolutely first class. Room was very plush, very clean and very quiet. Fresh fruit and wine, etc. Executive Lounge is the one of the best we have seen. Snacks the second night - lamb chops! Really?? After 5 of those and a few glasses of merlot certainly didn't need or want dinner. That was typical of the week. Yes, the Cavalieri is not centrally located - but the shuttle was just fine. And went nearly everywhere via the Metro. Just do your homework before you get there. We have many places still on our 'to see' list - but when we do return to Rome, the Cavalieri will be where we stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: ReviewerCB
Reviews.Content: I can only agree with comments made earlier that the Cavalieri is a fabulous hotel IF you stay on the executive floor. This gives access to the Executive Lounge and all that entails as far as food and beverages are concerned. It also allows entry to the gym and indoor pool with no extra charge and means you avoid the charge for sun-bed hire! Our holiday was a very happy one - Rome is amazing, but hot and busy, and the pool area was a welcome relief at the end of the day. However, if I was faced with paying the hotels very high charges for almost everything, ( drinks, entrance to spa, sunbeds etc ) I do believe my review would not have been so rosy and I can appreciate the gripes of others. We ate in the hotel on three nights and were delighted - lovely menu and fantastic staff - and as you would expect from Italians, SO happy to accommodate children. We found the staff faultless throughout our entire stay, very pleasant and discreet. Room was good but there is building work going on at the rear of the hotel at the moment so it may be worthwhile checking your room's location. View of Rome - if you can afford it - wonderful! If not, then the Executive Lounge gives you the view whenever you so desire. Shuttle service was super-reliable and took approx. 20 mins to get us into Rome. We were delighted by the number of taxis and their tarrifs - we paid around 10 Euros including tip on most occassions to get us into or out of Rome. No complaints there. All in all an excellent stay. Just be aware that it's not in the centre of Rome - but that does have its benefits - and that if you opt for a standard room your stay could become a very expensive one. However, we will definitely be returning and you can't give a higher recommendation than that.

Reviews.Title: “Beware - Classic Room Experience”
Reviews.Author: david_x
Reviews.Content: We reserved a room from June 29 to July 3. Included in reservation was fact we would arrive around 6 am 30/6 after a 24 hour plane trip from Australia... Confirmed in writing twice and phone 3 times. Arrived 6am 30/6 and told booking was from 30/6 not 29/6 as on two email confirmations. Price also increased by 30 euros and no breakfast included even though confirmed However we were"' lucky". One room was left and we could have it. Shown to room 602.... totally non standard due to stairs at end of corridor cutting into room area.. dirty ,no sitting area,electric plugs off wall, shower falling off wall. Back at front desk agreed was not a standard room and we could have a normal room 5 hours later and suggested we take a trip into Rome to fill in the time after 24 hours on an aircraft. I found the attitude insulting and rude at best. Interesting to note that a standard room a week or so before was selling for 745 odd euros.... our rate was 300... I wonder why the room was sold... you be the judge. On check out they still tried to charge 330 per night despite being given the written confirmation. NEVER AGAIN

Reviews.Title: “Cavalieri Hilton an Oasis overlooking Rome!”
Reviews.Author: tagor
Reviews.Content: I would like to start my review of the Rome Cavalieri Hilton by saying that we thoroughly enjoyed our stay, and were very happy with our decision to stay here. Having said that, I can understand that this hotel may not be for everyone and I will try and be as honest and objective as possible in my review. To fully understand the advantages of staying at the Cavalieri Hilton, you must realise that Rome is a VERY hot, busy, noisy, somewhat dirty city known for small, expensive, often run down hotel rooms with poor, or no air-conditioning. We found the Cavalieri Hilton to be an oasis removed from the heat and craziness of Rome, that we could escape to after wonderful, but tiring days of sightseeing. The hotel is a modern building, sitting on top of a hill overlooking the Vatican. It is a true 5 star property in every way. It is a large hotel, with a multi-level lobby, many restaurant and dining options, indoor and outdoor pools, extensive fitness facility, large hotel rooms even by North American standards, 400+ sq ft, with VERY comfortable beds, and wonderfully cool air-conditioning. The location is removed from the centre of Rome, and that may be a negative for some. However remember that Rome is a very big and spread out city, and staying near the Spanish steps still means you are far from the Vatican etc.. We found the complimentary shuttle service offered on the hour to a central location in Rome to be very convenient. It does stop a little early at 8pm, but taxies are plentiful in Rome, and are also very convenient. They can be hailed easily on the street, found at taxi stands, and instantly appear when called by the doorman. Most locations are aprox. 10-15 euro by cab, which I found reasonable. While in a mostly residential area, there is a small square within easy walking distance that has banks, restaurants, grocery stores, gelato, and shopping. The Cavalieri Hilton is not cheap. As many reviewers have noted EVERYTHING is expensive. We decided to stay at this hotel knowing this fact and were prepared for it. If you are on a budget or will be annoyed by some of the high charges, this may not be a good choice for you. We did our research and decided to book an Executive room with a City view and were not disappointed. I would highly recommend this approach, because most of the extra charges that the hotel is fond of charging are included. Although the room was 100-150 euro a night more, we found it worth the extra cost. We were able to access all of the hotels facilities, and were never charged anything extra, which took away the feeling of being "nickel and dimed to death". The Executive floors (7th & 8th) have spectacular views of Rome. We paid extra for a city view room overlooking the Vatican, however even if you don't you can enjoy the views from the executive room on the 7th floor. We could see all of Rome spread out below, sitting on our balcony at night. With a full moon, St. Peters below, and with the breathtaking terracotta colours of all the buildings; it was magical. Having access to the executive room was fantastic. From morning to night free food and drink were available. The room is VERY comfortable and enjoyable to relax in. Breakfast consists of hot food, bacon, eggs, toast, bagels, as well as a large supply of fresh fruits, cereal, and juice of every description. Free drinks, including soda, juice, water, wine, and liquor are available all day until 11pm. Light snacks, and Hors D’oeuvres are served throughout the day as well, but would not be enough to substitute for lunch or dinner food. When you consider the cost of Breakfast (something like 50 euro each), and even the price of a soda (aprox 8-10 euro) you can see how this can quickly become a reasonable option. Other things like free internet access, officially limited to 15 minutes at a time, but I found if no one was waiting, longer periods were never a problem, are included free. And one of the nicest benefits was being able to use both the indoor and outdoor pools at any time without any extra charge. If not staying in an executive room the outdoor pool is free, however you do not get a towel, or lounger unless you pay 16 euro each. The outdoor pool is large cold and deep, with no shallow end, so it is not really suitable for relaxing in. This fact makes you want to use the indoor pool (especially if you like to relax in the water, or have children). The indoor pool is warm, shallow, and very relaxing, with attached hot tub, and waterfall. However there is an additional charge of aprox 33 euros each. Being able to come and go as we pleased, never worrying about extra charges made it enjoyable instead of annoying. And in July we REALLY appreciated the pools! Our 10 year old son was loving it. This was our second week of a three week vacation, and our first hotel with a pool. We spent an entire afternoon relaxing and rejuvenating poolside, and we really needed this rest. I can't think of any other hotel in Rome where this would be possible. My advice is if you are looking for a "reasonably priced" hotel, a hotel "close to the action", a hotel with a distinct Roman ambiance or feel, you might be wise to look elsewhere. If you don't mind paying a little extra for a modern oasis, complete with great service, food, and views, sitting on a hill slightly removed from all the hustle and bustle of Rome, I would highly recommend the Cavalieri Hilton. We will definitely return. Just remember to do you research, understand what the hotel offers and what it does not, be prepared for the charges such as they are, and enjoy. I would also strongly recommend staying in an executive room, we feel the benefits are worth the extra cost, and not having all the extra charges on the bill allows you to just relax and enjoy the hotel rather than worrying about being "nickel and dimed" to death.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth It!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: blumoon76
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews about this hotel before we left for our trip. I was very excited and looking forward to our stay but was sadly disappointed. Don't get me wrong the hotel is beautiful and the rooms are great but the hotel is completely out of the way. You have to take taxi rides to get everywhere which cost 15-20 Euros each way! The shuttle only drops in one place, not a real central location and stops at 8pm. Also, I kepted seeing pictures of this beautiful pool and it is! However, what they don't tell you is that you get charged 16 Euros to use it! It is also crowded with all the local Italians who buy passes to use it. It was very hard to get a seat and when we did we were packed in and surrounded by topless women and chain smokers on all sides. The pool is very deep so everybody hangs on the side which also makes it hard to get in and out. Don't even think about bringing your own towels, we saw a family get chased out for that! The food was extremely overpriced but you don't have a choice because you are so far away from everything (2 pasta lunches-89Euros, a coke was 12Euros!) Also our room did not have a view, when I asked if i could have access to upstairs restaurant or executive floor for a picture I was told no. We are Hilton members but in the future would stay at something a lot closer to the city.

Reviews.Title: “A true 5 star”
Reviews.Author: djrruns26m
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cavalieri for 6 nights for a meeting. The service, rooms and facilities were first class. Although the room rates were what you would expect for a high quality hotel, the nickel and diming was somewhat offensive: $36/day to use the internet, $13 dollars for coke or a beer, $ 23 for a simple sandwich etc. These charges can be avoided simply by walking a few blocks to the square where there are many shops and restuarants. Overall we really enjoyed the hotel and it's wonderful views. Unfortunately there was a cab strike during our stay which made the location a bit inconvenient. The hotel did a good job of running extra shuttle service. The concierge was also extremely helpful with dining and travel arrangements.

Reviews.Title: “I hate to sound like a broken record; however...”
Reviews.Author: Jackson071004
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for the first three days of our 10 day stay in Italy. Rooms: I echo the sentiments of the previous reviewers. The rooms at this hotel are very nice, particularly when compared to most other standard hotel rooms in Europe which are typically very small. Be sure to ask for a room with a view of the city, otherwise, you will see a very large antenna tower. Also, we were awakened every morning around 2:30 am by the workers spraying for bugs in the front of the hotel. Staff/Service: The staff was very friendly and very adept at saying "no". We arrived early in the morning, around 9:00 am. To our surprise, our room was ready. After being told about the 7:00-10:30 buffet breakfast that was included in our stay, my husband and I thought we would go grab a quick bite to eat after checking in. We were told (with a smile), that our complimentary breakfast did not start until the following morning and they would charge us for anything we took from the buffet. Immediately after arriving to our room and realizing we had the view of the antenna tower, and after noticing the MANY rooms on the other side of the hotel that were being serviced by housekeeping, I asked if we could be moved to the other side. I was told, in a nice way, no. Hotel Offerings: Again, I echo previous reviewers. This hotel is extremely overpriced. 28 euros for a hamburger and fries. 30 euros a day for the spa with the gym and indoor pool. 5 euros for 15 minutes of internet use. The shuttle takes you downtown, which is nice, however, it stops at 8:00 pm when most restaurants start serving dinner and most taxi services start the evening surcharge. I would not stay here again. It's overpriced for what you get in return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but too far from city center.”
Reviews.Author: Mauka
Reviews.Content: Read reviews and booked the RCH after spending three nights in the country near Aprilia. We loved the rooms, executive floor drinks and snacks, breakfast, views of Rome, were terrific. I would agree with other reviews that the high prices of extras such as room service, sodas in the minibar, extra charges for using the pool, 3 euro for a towel, is pretty pathetic considering the nightly room rates. Room service food was just ok but very expensive. However, being 20-25 minutes away from Rome city center becomes very inconvenient, ESPECIALLY when there was a TAXI strike throughout the country for four days during our stay. Turns out the taxi strikes have been fairly routine lately, and when that happens guests at the RCH are screwed. The smallish shuttle bus becomes jammed beyond capacity, and the hours become inconvient. Due to the taxi strike we missed a Vatican tour we had paid for, and lost approximately one day's worth of time we could have spent touring the city. Not sure I will return to Rome, but if I do, I would select a hotel in the city.

Reviews.Title: “In a class of its own, But...”
Reviews.Author: TravelinTwins
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many 5 star hotels and the Hilton Cavalieri takes the cake. The quality of service, the details of the hotel, the PILLOWS, etc, etc, etc are nothing but high class. I spent 7 days at this hotel for my honeymoon and the only issues I had were the REDICULOUS prices. Here are some examples (all dollar amounts are in Euros): 1) $12/day/person to use the pool 2) $36 to have 3 shirts dry cleaned. $7 for socks (I think I just bought a new pair) 3) $22 for a Crown Royal and a water at the bar

Reviews.Title: “Great physical facility, marginal staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm a Diamond member at hilton and stayed free. This was the most luxurious hotel I have ever stayed in. Elegant and refined. Great city views from concierge level. Soundproof door in rooms. Concierge offers free wine and food virtually non stop all day. Complaints-Diamond customers should get a city view. Instead I had a view of a cell phone tower. Also, hotel staff set us up on a tour with their own recommended company, which turned out horrible. After numerous calls to the concierge, in which i asked for some kind of adjustment, I finally went on to the guest TV billing channel to find out we hadn't been charged for the tour. that's nice, but was it too much to ask for a call to let us know that?

Reviews.Title: “Not sure will stay there again...”
Reviews.Author: WestOfMA
Reviews.Content: After reviewing all comments on the Rome Hitons, we booked the Rome Cavalieri Hilton on our way in to our June Italy trip and Rome Airport Hilton on our way back for ease of taking early morning flight back to the US. Well, the rooms at the Cavalieri Hilton are truly nice and comfortable, but, not as good as we've expected. We are Hilton Grand Vacation Club member and exchanged our HGVClub points for the Rome Hilton stays. Both the Cavalieri and Airport Hiltons are OK comparing to most of the US Hilton Club resort rooms. Beds, pillows, bathrooms,...etc. as described on the reviews are truly nice, but, they are still 'hotels', didn't give guests any 'homey feelings'. They are both a little pricy on the food and facility usages. As far as the transportations, they both have shuttles going into town every hour. To our surprise, both takes about the same amount of time to go in and out of town ~ approximately 25 minutes.
