The Airport Hilton will run the last shuttle from Rome around 11pm which is very convenient. Though the Cavalieri has a smaller shuttle bus which serves like a personal limo services. In all, either one of the Hilton is ok to stay while visiting Rome. I probably will try somewhere else next time just to be near the city and save some transportation time.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: IrishFan-80
Reviews.Content: As most reviewers state the rooms & most facilities are fantastic. Expensive but fantastic. The problem we have is that they charge exorbitant rates for the rooms and then proceed to charge for everything else too! We were so glad we negotiated that breakfast was included or we would never have eaten a meal at the Hilton. Not because we could not afford to but simply because they are outrageous prices compared to so many other options. Every piazza in Rome or along Via Venoto has wonderful outdoor dining options at half the prices. Make sure the breakfast buffet is included if you stay here. Also we did not elect the Club room charge and were very glad we did not. We were not at the hotel enough during the day to come close to making it worth the price. Others who had told us their breakfast was not as good as the il Giardino buffet either. Only if you plan much time at the hotel and drink alot would this make any sense. There is simply no reason to charge the way they do. Fitness and pool service should be standard with every room. To top it off the concierge arranged tours of Rome for us and then with no disclosure to us charged a commission!? The doorman could not even locate an adequate taxi to the airport with 24 hours notice. The shuttle needs to go by the Vatican too. When we go back to Rome we will stay along Via Veneto at another 5 star hotel-not the Hilton. Only one side of the Hilton has a great view-the other looks at a HUGE antenna tower.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Taunton
Reviews.Content: We are just back from spending five nights at this fantastic hotel. My husband is a gold card holder and we were upgraded on arrival to a city view room and given complimentary breakfasts (not bad when you consider they cost £30 each time). It appears in this hotel that only Diamond holders get Executive rooms, but we weren't complaining the view was fantastic and it would be well worth the extra cost to upgrade to this room type. The room itself (as were all the rooms) was very big with a seperate sitting area and a wonderful balcony. The bed was so comfortable and yes there is a pillow and soap menu although you have to pay for the soaps 9 euros. You are also given a box of lovely chocolates on arrival and sweets are left on your pillow each night together with a nightly poem. It was my husbands 60th birthday while we were there and we came back from a day out to a chilled bottle of complimentary champagne and a card signed by the Managing Director it was a lovely touch. The breakfast buffet was amazing I counted 37 different types of jam, there was something to suit everyone the best Hilton breakfast we have ever had and we have had a few. Ask for a table outside on the terrance it was lovely to start the day sipping our coffee in the morning sunshine. We didn't eat at the hotel as another reviewer mentioned earlier there is a restaurant down the road from the hotel called I Vespri Siciliani which was excellant and was full of Hilton guests when we were there, to get there turn right out of hotel continue down the Via Cadlolo then turn left into Piazzale Medaglie D'Oro. There is also another one if you walk back the way the bus comes up we didn't try this but it appeared to have a terrace which overlooked Rome. I cannot recommend this hotel enough and yes it is expensive £12 for a sunbed but we paid £12 for two beers on arrival and to be honest we paid the same in some parts of Rome. It was just wonderful to come back to peace and calm after a day's sight seeing and to sit on the balcony and listen to the birds. I would say save up and really enjoy this fantastic hotel we wouldn't stay anywhere else in Rome after this.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: McLeanTraveler
Reviews.Content: We ended up at the Cavalieri Hilton by mistake (our original hotel, whose name I won't mention) messed up our reservation. I consider ourselves very fortunate. The Rome Hilton was simply magnificent. The rooms are luxurious and quite spacious. The setting, set high above the city, offers great views. We arrived when every balcony was covered with blooming honeysuckle. The aroma alone was heavenly. Our rate included breakfast which was a fantastic buffet located poolside. The only drawback is probably the location. Although not centrally located, the hotel does offer an hourly shuttle during the day and cab rides are only 10-12 away from downtown Rome. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “All Around 5 Star Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: J-Niz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I ended our 3 1/2 week honeymoon here, and it was spectacular! This hotel goes with the addage - you get what you pay for! The room and ALL service was excellent! The Sunday Brunch was the best brunch my wife and I ever had - all fresh and fantastic! Our room was a true 5 Star location - turn down service with chocolates, private balcony, big king bed (unusual in Europe), spacious bathroom and to top it off a view of Rome's City Lights!!! The shuttle to Downtown Rome bridged the gap for this paradise not being located in the city of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Kathyspencer
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 4 nights at the Hilton Cavalieri and it rates a 10 out of 10. The welcome (at 11:00 pm) was warm and personalized. Clerk walked us to our room and returned all the completed paperwork a few minutes later. Quick visit to downstairs bar area for food after missing dinner resulted in the kitchen staying open late to prepare sandwich plates for us. Beautiful large king bedded room, excellent linens/pillows. All rooms have balconies (city side is spectacular) with jasmine covering the walls which constantly give a beautiful aroma. Chilled champagne awaited us from the hotel manager to recognize celebrating our 30th anniversary. Executive Club outdoes Ritz-Carlton on food presentations throughout the day -- constant changeouts with more than sufficient/pleasant staff to serve your needs. Concierge, checkout, spa and pool service are all extremely well run. After the hustle and noise of touring Rome each day, it was a truly peaceful oasis when we returned to the hotel. I would not consider staying elsewhere else in the city. No wonder I'm a Diamond Club Member -- why stay anywhere else when you can stay at extremely well Hilton hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: JeniG
Reviews.Content: I normally only write reviews for hotels which I have stayed in recently. However, the Cavalieri will stick in my mind for years to come. The rooms are large and luxurious, with comfortable beds, and great little patios. I was particularly impressed with the pillow menu! The grounds are beauiful and you feel along way from the big bustling city that Rome is. While we did not eat at La Pergola, my now husband and I shared a wonderful bottle of wine there and were given a little tower of desserts as an accompaniment. The view is stunning. It was the little extras like this and the excellent canapes served with cocktails in the bar downstairs which made the stay. Yes, you pay for it, but everything you get is exceptional quality. The breakfast, which we were fortunately comped as my husband is a Diamond member was amazing. Hot breakfast items, pastries, cookies, many types of cereal and beautiful fresh juice, great cappucino and attentive service from the staff. Champagne is included and flowed and each morning I would finish breakfast feeling very full, pampered and slightly tipsy. :) We ate at the restaurant by the pool and the food was pretty good, although pricy. I loved the Cavalieri and hope one day to return.

Reviews.Title: “Panoramic Vista of Rome from a Luxurious and Secluded Enclave”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Cavalieri Hilton is a wonderful retreat in a special city. My wife and I had a farewell trip from Europe after living in Spain and Germany the past nine years. Most of our adult lives we have worked and traveled overseas. We have been grateful to have been guests of a number of nice properties around the world over the years to include the Oriental in Bangkok on the river, the Grande Bretagne in Athens facing the Acropolis (great at night when the Acropolis is lit up) and other great spots to include the quaint Bavarian hotels like the lone hotel on Lake Ebsee. Thus, we were surprised when this visit to Rome and the Cavalieri ended up being the most memorable and best experience and adventure we have had. The hotel is set off by itself on a hill overlooking the City. From the balconies on the city side of the hotel one can view this magnificent city. The Vatican is on the right and a pleasant walk down the tree lined streets to the old neighborhood around the Vatican. We spent 3 nights on award points. I am a Hilton Diamond and we were upgraded to an absolutely beautiful suite on an exec. floor. Fine art, large flat screen TV to include the bathroom, classic Italian furniture and space to roam. An entrance to the room through two pillars and the most romantic balcony with a view. This is the lap of luxury. We arrived from the airport a few hours before the normal check in time and the hotel desk person told us we would need to wait about an hour for the room to be prepared but they thought we would like it. My wife was elated at being in the city she adored, and in a fantasy hotel suite for 3 days. We ate breakfast in the exec. club each day, which happened to be the best I have seen of the Hilton exec. floor clubs. Lots of wine, champagne and foods and plenty of hideaway spots and balconies in the club to take in the view while sipping a cool drink. In the morning we took the hotel transportation to the middle of town and got off and walked to the historic sites of the city. One evening we went downstairs to the restaurant "Giardino "Dell'uliveto" and my wife had the sea bass and I tried the choice of Sicilian cuisine and wine. Impeccable service and very good food. I asked for a sherry and realized I didn't request my favorite, which is Tio Pepe from Jerez. I was brought another brand which was known as a premium sherry but I wanted Tio Pepe if I could. I mentioned it, and It was no problem and my heart went out to the poor waiter who was lambasted by the wine steward for not insuring I received my favorite in the first place. There is a high level of service at the Cavalieri Hilton. I noticed that treating the staff with respect and admiration of their knowledge of their profession seems too enhance the experience. Our three days went quickly and it was time to go all to soon. The Coliseum and the Sistine Chapel are well complimented by a night view from the balcony of our suite at the Hilton after a day of exploring. My only regret is that we didn't have more time and days at the hotel so we could dine at the La Pergola at the Hilton which is a world class roof top restaurant with a top notch reputation. Our visit to Rome was absolutely fabulous. Rome and the Cavalieri Hilton have something in common, they are both extraordinary. We returned to Germany and have now moved to Hawaii. We spent the first two months here in the Hilton Hawaiian Village which has a Garden of Eden setting. Rome and our nights at the Cavalieri Hilton will always be very special memories for us. Best wishes to all in their adventures.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding, amazing and fabulous”
Reviews.Author: labelleg
Reviews.Content: I stay at hilton hotels almost 300 nights per year. We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and it's one of the best on the planet. From the moment we got inside the hotel, we felt like royalty. The checkin was very professional, they have a special office for honors members. The manager even escorted us to our room and made sure everything was perfect. She even showed us how things were working inside the room. A bottle of wine and some fresh deserts were waiting for us in the room. That was a pleasant surprise. The room was amazing. Perfectly clean, fresh and the bed, bed sheets... were amazing. The bathroom was so clean, I could have eaten off the floor. The lounge was amazing with an amazing view of rome. The breakfast and snacks were amazing, very fresh and the staff, what can I say about the staff, absolutely helpful. The staff from the front desk to the telephone operator was friendly and knew almost everything about rome. The gym was better than a professional gym and the property had it's own running trails. A shuttle bus can take you to the center of the city for free and is always on time. There's absolutly nothing I could find that was wrong with this hotel. It was so great, we will be going back there again next year.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: AnEN
Reviews.Content: This is really a great hotel. Spent two nights here recently and we were very impressed with the facilities as well as the staff. The hotel is located above all the filth and mass of humanity that makes Rome such a joy to visit. Many of the other reviewers were right on with respect to this hotel so I'll just add my two cents ( which is about all they are worth). Positives: 1. Location- great views from the balconies over looking St. Peters and the city 2. Quiet- at night we slept with the windows open and enjoyed the cool breezes. 3. Bathrooms- large with really good lighting and if you forget your favorite soap well just consult their soap menu and choose from over 6 special types of soap. 4. Beds- comfortable with lots of down pillows - don't like down well they have a pillow menu ( yes- a pillow menu!) so if foam or horse hair are to liking they have it. 5. Rooms - ready when we arrived in the morning after our flight and much larger than most european hotels I've stayed in- oh and plenty of closet space 6. Pools- large outdoor pool plus an indoor pool and tennis courts 7. Restaurants- they have one of the best restaurants in Italy on the top floor (was not able to dine there though) and their main restaurant located just off the pool was excelllent both for breakfast and lunch. 8. Buffet breakfast was included in the room price was amazing in the selection and quality of the food available 9. Staff- the staff are simply charming and were able to accommodate all are requests Negatives: 1. All this luxury does't come cheap- but they do have specials (check out their web site) 2. If you travel with kids- seal off the mini bar - those 8 euro cokes in really small bottles (6 oz.) will really p--- you off 3. Room service- again if you don't mind paying 26 euros for a cheese pizza- go for it, although I must say it was a really good pizza. Overall we left with a good feeling about this place and would not consider staying anywhere else in Rome. Don't be put off by the hilton name as if you are like me I wouldn't normally use the words luxury and hilton in the same sentence. Really just go see for yourself- this place is special.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: Theholidaymakers
Reviews.Content: We are just back from an Easter break In Rome staying at this amazing hotel on the hills outside of Rome. Yes it is a bit away from the hustle and bustle of the city, but to go back to the luxurious hotel for some rest after a busy days sightseeing was a luxury worth the taxi ride. We stayed on the executive level worth the extra cost. The executive lounge is staffed by wonderful girls who look after your every need. The lounge serves breakfast snacks, afternoon tea,pre dinner nibbles and lovely wines and coffee. A good place to share stories with your fellow travellers. The bedrooms on this level are simply beautiful, we had plenty room for 3. The spa was amazing, again free of charge ( with our hilton loyalty card ) and if you are lucky with the weather relax at the outdoor pool. The hotel restaurants we did not try but i hear they are marvellous if a bit pricy. The hotel supplies a courtesy coach, but do not worry taxi fares are no more than 10 euros. Would we go back to Rome .. for sure and back to the cavalieri absolutely.well done hilton the best hotel we have visited in your group by miles !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven in Rome”
Reviews.Author: globalgirl1
Reviews.Content: W-O-W! This hotel was amazing. Beautiful clean rooms with amazing views. Only complaint is that a Pina Colada in the bar was 18 euros (over $20) so be prepared to bust out your platinum card during your stay. EXCELLENT HOTEL! If you ever get a chance to stay here - do it!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon at the Hilton Cavalieri”
Reviews.Author: Maryland_USATraveler
Reviews.Content: After spending eight rainy days in Rome's historic center, we were reinvigorated at this very special hotel. We stayed on the Executive Level where we had a stupendous view of Rome, delectable food and drink from morning til night, and use of their elegant spa, including turkish bath and inddor pool. We think it was well worth the extra expense staying on the Executive Level because hotel charges for food, beverages, and the spa are quite steep. We also had dinner at La Pergola, certainly one of the highest-rated restaurants in Italy. The hotel grounds are beautiful and include two clay tennis courts. Although the hotel is located away from downtown, there is a shuttle service or you can take a taxi for $10 to the Vatican or most any popular tourist destination in town. Besides, being away from downtown has its advantages, including the view and quiet. We've stayed at nice hotels before, but this was perhaps the nicest.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Hilton on our honeymoon. My father, a diamond Hilton Honor's member, gave us his points for the room. We were amazed, given their price per night rooms, that we had enough points for 3 nights. This is the best hotel we've ever stayed in, or probably will ever stay in! It was amazing. Our room overlooked Rome- it must be the best view anywhere in the city! The service upon check-in was stellar; she was incredibly formal and polite and walked us up to our room. The only service in the hotel we used (or could afford) was the free shuttlebus. It brings you to Piazza Barberini, which is a great starting point to hop on the Metro or walk to many famous sites. The only problem with the shuttle is that the last one runs at 8 p.m., which cancels out an opportunity to have a nice Roman dinner without the extra cost of cabfare. Granted, the Hilton reportedly has the best restaurant in town. Our only other complaint, which just may be something we're unaccustomed to, is the exorbitant charge for everything: internet connection, pool use, phone calls, and minibar (9 euro for a mini can of pringles!). Of course, this probably won't matter to the vast majority of guests who can afford to stay there. All in all, this hotel is incredibly luxurious (although it does not look it from the outside) and a definite treat for those who can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent We stayed for three nights – a pleasant surprise at check-in when we were upgraded to a city view room. The room was very nice with nothing to fault. The house keeping team were great with the room being cleaned twice a day. The food was amazing. Breakfast was amazing – the spread was just fantastic and the quality was second to none. We had dinner one night at the main restaurant – the food was great quality and very generous quantities. The service was very attentive. The best was dinner at the La Pergola restaurant on the ninth floor. From the moment we entered the restaurant we were looked after and treated with great attention and care. The food was the best we have had. All the staff were great and ready to give you suggestions and answer any questions we had. A meal at this restaurant is a must – though it will set you back minimum $400. Getting to and from the hotel is no problem. The shuttle bus is great. If you miss the bus then you can get a tube and metro ticket for Euro 1. Take the metro (Line A) to Lepanto,from where you may take the bus nr.913 to P.le Medaglie d’Oro. There are six stops at P.le Medaglie d’Oro – get off at the last one. As you get of the bus walk left and take the first right up the hill and you at the hotel. Take the same bus to go the Vatican Museums – get off at the first Metro stop (sorry I forgot the name) and from there you can walk it to St Peters and the museum. We found this to be quicker than taking the shuttle and then taking a metro to the Vatican. One last thing – take an iron with you to this hotel. We were surprised when told that they do not give out irons to guests for “security” reasons. But they will happily press your clothes for you at a cost.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, lush, but...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Cavalieri is located on one of Rome's famous hills and has breathtaking views of the city. The acres the hotel sits on has lush plants, flowers, sculptures, and many aviaries. The rooms are large with luxurious accomodations. They provide a wonderful, free shuttle bus to the center of Bernini Piazza, which is near many attractions--Via Veneto, the Trevi Fountain, the mall, Via Condotti, Spanish Steps, etc. It should be noted that the air conditioning was shut off during our very hot time in Rome in early November. They either cannot or would not turn it on for the comfort of their guests. Many hotels do this in Europe, so it is wise to check with individual hotels and ask for the cut-off date. Other service was over the top! We wanted to eat at the famous La Pergola rooftop restaurant, but the e360 prix fixe without drinks scared us away! We bought pastries and bananas near the Trevi for breakfasts and ate very late lunches at the many little bistros on the Via Veneto or Trevi.

Reviews.Title: “Great Atmosphere, Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Cavilieri on a business trip to Rome. Although my suite was beautiful, and so was the location, I was very disappointed with the service. I was at the hotel for two weeks, and I quickly learned not to ask the concierge for anything. I asked for directions to a nearby store, and his response was not only rude, but also wrong. I won't bore anyone with a litany of complaints, but when I go back to Rome, I will stay in a hotel that is perhaps less luxurious but more accomodating. I did not think the Cavalieri was worth the expense.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: BermudaTraveler1
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a great 2 week trip to Italy. We stayed at the Hilton for 6 nights using points. We are Gold members. We did not get access to the executive lounge. We were told only Diamond members get that - is this a new Hilton policy as the same thing just happened to us in NYC? We did get a wonderful free buffet breakfast in the downstairs restaurant. The buffet was huge! With the Hilton's insane prices, this was a great deal. Prices for drinks, food, etc. are very high. We had massages which were reasonable though (100 Euros each) and included access to the indoor pool facilities. Note that there is a rule that you have to wear a bathing cap - unusual for us. They provide clean ones for you to use. We walked to the Vatican (about 30 minutes for us - we are fast walkers). We also took the bus - it is very good although it does not run that late. Overall the room was lovely and large, very clean, great soft bed and linens. No Hermes bath products though as another person mentioned.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Cavalieri Hilton with three girlfriends for four nights oct-nov. It was a fabolous stay! We had two connecting doublerooms, with Rome-view. Paying the extra cost for the view is really worth it if you want to enjoy the view over the Vatican city instead of the view of a giant TV antenna. We also had booked the executive level, which meant we had access to the club room. That was simply great! This was an all-inclusive room, with a buffé changed five times a day. Great breakfast, lovely afternoon tea with sandwiches and cakes, little pies in the evening and snacks and drinks at night. Since a coke costed 8 Euro in the hotel bar (yes, it's true. Ridiculous, but true) it felt good to relax in the club room with free drinks... The executive level also gave us access to the Spa, wich was lovely. Swimming pool, jacuzzi, turkish bath, sauna... The hotel is about 15 minutes outside the city with car, up on a hill. That meant that the view was spectacular, but that walking down town was out of the qustion. The hotel, however, provided a free shuttlebus every hour until 8 pm. A cab was 10-20 Euro. All in all, I would really recommend this hotel to anyone who doesn't care about the costs... or anyone who's been saving up the money to make a special trip!

Reviews.Title: “nice room, indifferent service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For the decor and presentation of the room, I would give a 5* rating, however my overall rating is knocked down by the poor service. We stayed at the hotel using points and we were upgraded to a beautiful suite. However, the suite was located on the 5th floor underneath the club room. Furniture was constantly being pushed around, even up until midnight when we went to bed. On the second night, we were woken up by moving funiture at 5 am! Although this stopped after I called the concierge to complain, it started up again at 7 and woke us up. When were reported this to the front desk in the morning, they were completely indifferent to our concerns. I asked the concierge regarding train schedules to the airport and whether any shops were open on Sundays. He did not bother looking up the timetable, gave us the wrong train times and informed us that absolutely everything was shut on Sunday in the centre of town. When we did go in, it turned out that in the main shopping area, almost all of the shops were open. In general, although noone was downright rude, I felt the service was very cold and indifferent and I was more than a bit disappointed. Although the building itself was nice, I'd rather stay somewhere less opulent, but more welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous but bring some extra cash”
Reviews.Author: jackcoles
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first two nights of our honeymoon. We used Hilton Honors points to pay for the room (otherwise we wouldn't be staying there). Of course the resort is fabulous, staff were polite, communal areas were sumptuous, very nice pool and gym. When we arrived we were given a room overlooking the park but managed (with much effort) to change to a room overlooking the city of Rome which is a must. Everything in the rooms is as you would expect from a 5 star hotel. The bathroom was fabulous, as was the balcony with the view. In the evenings there would be live music from a pianist and singer who were down by the pool - we felt like we were being serenaded! The downside is the cost of everything - the restaurant has a Michelin star so you expect it to be a little pricey but €42 for breakfast!!!!! That's a little much. We ended up walking down the road to an Italian plaza and people watching at the local coffee bar - much more interesting. There are also a couple of other nice eating places near the hotel if you don't want to eat in central Rome or the hotel restaraunt. WE removed the little juice bottles from our fridge and replaced it with our own bottle of champagne; we put the juice bottles back into the fridge before we checked out but they still tried to charge us €92 - for 8 small juices which we never even touched!!! Final comment on prices is you have to pay MORE cash to use towels and loungers by the pool and there is no getting round this unless you bring towels from your room (which we did) and sit on the grass. The hotel is a short cab ride from the Vatican. You can walk it but it's quite a hike, especially in the heat of the day. We'd definitely go back there but hopefully on a business trip or when i've made enough $ not to be bothered by the cost of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel a little outside of Rome. Stay at the club level if you choose this hotel. Because everything you drink/ eat here is overpriced. Some of the rooms have a fantatistic view over ROme. It is perfect to do sightseeing in Rome and than relay at the big size pool.

Reviews.Title: “Best American style hotel in Rome even has a Pool”
Reviews.Author: LotsATravels
Reviews.Content: A group of five of us stayed for 12 nights and loved the rooms, service and pool. We are Hilton Honors Gold members and were treated very well. Staff was friendly and helpful, even had a van to pick us up at the airport. The girls loved the evening turndown service. Although the hotel is located up on a hill over looking the city the free shuttle service was very convenient to a central area downtown. After a full day of sightseeing the pool was a wonderful place to be in the hot afternoons. There is an ATM on site and a rental car service. I do not recommend driving in Rome, its worse than New York or Los Angeles. The public transportation and taxi service is the way to go. The hotel restaurants were wonderful with great food and service but a little pricey. It is a hike to walk anywhere around the hotel and not really too much to see or do. The grounds around the hotel are beautifully maintained and relaxing to stroll through. We all would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “A Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are Hilton Gold members and used points for two nights' and paid (320 e) for two additional nights. Made the mistake of requesting a pick up from the hotel (105 e). It was an SUV and driver spoke no English. We later learned that a cab would have cost about 35 e). Arrived at 7:30, and desk clerk, including supervisor, refused to honor our gold status stating that the executive floor was reserved for diamond members only. After about l0 minutes, where I adamately insisted that this was against Hilton policy, they agreed to give us the executive lounge access, but not a room update. They acted as if they were really doing us a favor. It was really embarrassing because there were other people trying to register and we were made to feel like bag people. Keep in mind that we were smartly dressed, worldly-traveled, mature adults. Of course, the room was not available, (I think they said there was no room available for spite) so we went into town on the shuttle and returned at 4 p m. The room was lovely, but there was no air conditioning, although we complained about it every day. The lounge was exceptional--one of the best we've ever been in. We had breakfast there every morning and visited it at different times during the day, but we ate dinner every night out. The shuttle stops running at 7:30, so it's of no use if someone wants to eat in town. We ended up taking cabs back and forth--a costly experience. We found the staff to be unfriendly. I was especially annoyed at the door men. There were always two or three of them at the door talking and laughting, but never once did they open the door for us, or open the door for us when we got out of the cab. Of course, when they got a cab for us they opened the door with their hand out for a tip. We've stayed at Hilton Hotels throughout the world. And we selected this hotel partly because it is part of the Hilton chain and also because of the many glowing comments we read on this site. Sadly this was an anniversary celebration that began on a sour note and whenever we rememberRome we'll recall this poor experience.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend away”
Reviews.Author: Berkshire_UK
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Hilton Cavalieri. I had informed them on the booking that it was our wedding anniversary and got not only an upgrade to a suite, but free champagne (actually sparkling wine) and chocolates and a personalised card from the manager. The rooms are superb, although we didn't look out over the garden, but the radio mast at the front of the hotel, so didn't have a view of the city. Reception staff were very friendly, but the bar service was slow even when they weren't busy. It is possible to walk from the hotel into Rome, but the hotel is on a hill so, walking shoes are a must. The hotel runs a shuttle bus into Rome, which is efficient, but gets full, so some people were disappointed. It also drops off in central Rome, but a fair walk from the major sites. Food was quite expensive in the hotel, but we tended to eat out so this wasn't a problem. The instructions for driving to the hotel are not straight forward, so drive only if you have to. There are no signposts, so getting lost is easy. Overall a lovely hotel, and we would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “It's high up there...”
Reviews.Author: MikeMoss
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hilton Cavalieri, Rome, for two nights in the middle of October 2005. As we were there over a weekend, we got what was probably a reduced rate on one of the executive rooms (approx. €400/night). The rate may seem a little high, but in fact we had access to the Club Room on the Executive Floor, where complimentary food and drink are served from 7 a.m. to 11 p.m., which was quite a big plus, so in the end I feel the value for money wasn’t bad. The hotel is located on a hill (Monte Mario), about 10-20 minutes (depending on how far you are going) away from the sights in a car. We took taxis into the city, which cost between €10 and €20 depending on the time/traffic/day. However, we sometimes had to queue for a taxi (for as long as half-an-hour on Sunday) and it wasn’t easy to hail a taxi in the streets of Rome. There is also an hourly hotel shuttle bus to Piazza Barberini, but we didn’t use it. I say hourly, but in reality there was a three-hour (four-hour on Sundays) gap between 12.30 (11.30) and 15.30, perhaps for the driver to have lunch and/or a siesta. The last shuttle was early in the evening, meaning a compulsory taxi ride back (the hotel isn’t accessible by public transport). On balance, I liked staying slightly out of the centre – it was nice to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city, as well as the traffic pollution, after a tiring day’s sightseeing. The hotel’s hilltop location means great views of Rome (from one side of the hotel). The hotel is quite ugly from the outside (though efforts have been made to disguise this with ivy), but quite grand on the inside (e.g. large tapestries on the walls of the lobby, mosaic floors outside). There is also a big swimming pool and a spa, although we didn’t have time to use them. Our room was large and tastefully furnished, with a sofa and a writing desk. The balcony looked out over Rome. Rather than seeing the sun set from our room, we enjoyed some lovely sunrises. The marble bathroom was beautiful and quite large and the toiletries were by Hermès. The only problem with the bathroom was a rather unpleasant smell emanating from the toilet. I was surprised that the TV reception was very poor and the choice of channels was very limited (the hotel probably tries to encourage you to use pay-per-view). On the positive side, our room was serviced twice daily. We only ate in the hotel’s Executive Club Room during our stay as it was the most convenient (only a minute from our room). We had breakfast there, which was incredibly good, and had a few snacks and drinks in between meals, again of very high quality. We didn’t eat in the hotel’s “La Pergola” restaurant, but it’s reportedly the fanciest in town with two Michelin stars. It is on the roof of the hotel and probably has a view over nearby St. Peter’s and the Vatican. The staff at the front desk were accommodating, helpful and efficient, but the waitresses in the Club Room looked miserable and weren’t very friendly. I really liked this hotel – it’s the best Hilton I have stayed in (though admittedly I haven’t stayed in that many).

Reviews.Title: “One of the most spectacular Hilton resorts in Europe!”
Reviews.Author: CS-London
Reviews.Content: If it was to value all the Hilton Hotels in Europe I would say that the Rome Cavalieri Hilton is the best and second follows the Athens Hilton. Last June we have booked an executive room for four nights at this hotel, part of our two weeks holidays in Rome, Capri and Sorrento. When we arrived as Gold VIP Honours members they upgraded our room to an executive plus, at the seventh floor. The room was large, elegant with spectacular views of the Eternal City and the Dome of St Peters. The executive lounge at our floor was one of the most spectacular in the world. The staff here were very friendly and helpfull. Complementary drinks and food were more than what we were expected. The Cavalieri on the executive floors and in all the public areas, is housing a large private antique collection of furniture, paintings, tapestries and statues. It also has two good restaurants. One of them La Pergola roof-garden restaurant with its breathtaking views is one of the finest in Rome. We loved it! We also had dinner at the Giardino dell'Uliveto restaurant, which in summer has a terrace next to the swimming pool with live music, creating a magical atmosphere. Every day after our visits to Rome we made use of the internal and external swimming pools. The internal pool has a very nice waterfall flowing into it. We used it few times but mainly we used the external large pool which is not heated but is very, very, nice to lay around and enjoy the sun with few drinks. As executive floor guests we didn't have to pay. When we left for Capri we have promised to ourselves that soon we shall come back to this spectacular Hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worth 5 star rating but take note of a few things”
Reviews.Author: BB21
Reviews.Content: Definitely worth the price and 5 star rating. Spacious and comfortable room, decent bathroom and high speed internet access from room (not cheap - 10 euros per hour and 22 euros per day). Excellent buffet breakfast and poolside tables available. Pool was nice too though I didn't actually use it. Poolside restaurant at night a bit expensive and the food was not impressive at all. Didn't get the chance to try the rooftop fine-dining place but heard the view was impressive, not sure about the food. Up the hills so prepare to pay 6-10 euros to and from city. For those we need to go back to the hotel to take a break in the afternoon or want to get home without hassle late night, this is probably not a very ideal place. Free hotel shuttle runs every hour to/from Barenini (near Spanish steps) but the last one leaves at 8pm from there. I had the experience of arriving 5 min before 7pm and couldn't find the shuttle. I called the hotel and was asked to wait there for a few minutes. I ended up waiting there for 25 min then to find out the shuttle was already gone the first time I called. I took a taxi and complained to the front desk. They reimbursed me the taxi fares and I did push for further explanations as the driver was very nice guy and I don't want to get him into trouble. Hope they communicate better through mobile phones going forward! Staff service was professional but not warm/friendly. Overall, not the most convenient location but the hotel was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: travelsmart
Reviews.Content: I am a diamond member with Hilton and have thus stayed at many. Many aspects of this Hilton was the best tht I have experienced. Regarding the earlier review that totally bashed this facility, I have to say that I agree the prices are ridiculously high, but this hotel deserves to be noted for the positives as well - There are many. We were on the executive floor, so we didn't get nickle and dimed the way others do, so please keep that in mind. When we first arrived, we were escorted to the executive lounge and then given a full tour of the facilities. The executive lounge is the best you will ever see in any hotel. It is comfortable, offers a wonderful view overlooking the city (probably the best in Rome) and offers spectacular food and service all day long. The rooms are fantastic. You will not believe how comfortable the beds are (however, the top sheet was quite rough, we kept taking it off at night). There are automatic blings with a switch next to the bed so if you want to sleep in or take a nap you can close out every bit of light. The rooms are quite large and in comparison of other hotels we stayed at in Italy, they were very large. The spa does cost extra unless you are on the executive floor, but the facilities are wonderful. There is a wonderful pool with a whirlpool that has a nice waterfall flowing into it. The saunas and hottup area is just great. There's a cold (and I mean cold) plunge pool right inside the steam room. It take some nerve to take the plunge, but what a great feeling when you do and then lie back in the steam. The hotel will arrange anything you need, from tours, dinner reservations, transportation or any type of travel - there is an onsite travel agent that can book trains or anything you need. The professionalism of the staff was bar none. You will have a difficult time finding a hotel with a better staff. I guess that I should finish by saying that I am not an easy critic - I usually find something to complain about. I really cannot find anything wrong with the Cavalieri Hilton. I would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel in Rome. Sure, it's not cheap, but it isn't a travelodge either. It was worth the expense for the standard of service alone. The suite we had overlooked Rome and was of a high standard, as was the totally marble bathroom. Maid service was excellent. Dining was good in the downstairs restaurant, and breakfast was excellent. The La Pergola restaurant is certainly worth its Michelin stars and again, the service was sublime, with the staff attentive but not intimidating. The bottom line is, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel with an ouch!”
Reviews.Author: Sayer
Reviews.Content: This is an opulent, luxury hotel with fantastic views nestling in the hills above Rome. Child-friendly including have inter-connecting rooms. The free-shuttle bus into Rome is a great boon, however it can get busy, so turn up for the bus early to avoid being left off. Unfortunately the last bus leaves central Rome at 2000 in the evening - far too early. The outdoor swimming pool is large and unheated, so it can be a bit of a shock when you get in, even in August. However it is nice to be able to come back from a hot day in Rome and being able to have a swim. The breakfast buffet is fantastic. The range of options is very extensive, including a sushi option. The ouch? Everything other than the room rate (inclusive of breakfast), is outrageously over-priced. This starts with the towels by the pool, the umbrella charge and extends to the food and drinks such as coffee and bar snacks. Once they have you with a good rate at the hotel their goal is to make their profits from you through the extras. Would I stay there again? Absolutely, but I wouldn't eat or drink there, there are far more fairly priced places in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel with the wow factor”
Reviews.Author: kat067
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a fantastic hotel. From the moment we pulled up outside we knew we had made the right choice. The entrance/reception area is so opulent and the Reception staff very polite and helpful. Although we had only booked a standard room, I e-mailed a couple of days prior and asked if they would put us in a room with a view over Rome as it was a very special occasion. This was done at no extra charge. The room was beautiful, a huge queen size bed and pillows that you just sank into. There is a seating area and desk with mirrors everywhere. A television at the end of the bed and lots of wardrobe space. The bathroom was marble with a fantastic shower as well as a bath. The towels were changed twice a day and were soft and fluffy. The only thing missing from the room was tea/coffee making facilities, so take a travel kettle and a couple of cups. There was a very well stocked but very expensive mini-bar, but beware as if you lift anything out for more than 30 seconds it will be automatically be charged to your account. There are plenty of glasses and a bottle opener, but there isn’t a corkscrew. The balcony was huge with iron furniture and padded cushions. The breakfast can only be described as unbelieveable – no less than 32 different preserves, fruits, breads, cakes, pastries, different fruit juices, different milks, yogurts, cereals, seeds, meats, cheeses, potatoes, tuna, swordfish, sturgeon, eel, eggs, waffles, omelettes – the list is endless. We were even served our tea in silver teapots with tassels – just exquisite! Other than breakfast we didn’t eat in the hotel as it was very expensive, we ate in Rome and used the courtesy bus to and from the hotel. On the odd occasion we did get a taxi it was 8 euros. Can’t wait to stay at the Cavalieri Hilton again. We have never stayed at such a wonderful hotel and I don’t think any other hotel could match this one.

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: this is by far the most beautiful hotel in rome. do not listen to any bad reviews about this hotel, this takes the word luxury to a whole new level. the service, rooms and food was wonderful. our room had the most amazing view where we could see the collesium, i would recommend that if you go to rome and want to be in comfort and luxury this is the hotel for you. its was a wonderful experience and has made me look forward to going back. it really made my holiday perfect. there are a number of swimming pools and a spa and fitness centre, the flooring is all marble and the rooms are huge with a king size bed that could fit roughly four people on it, the bathroom is very spacious. for me ROME = CAVALIERI

Reviews.Title: “NOT a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: With the notable exception of one concierge this hotel was a major disappointment. The internet ads are HIGHLY misleading! The Cavalieri gives the impression of all-inclusive service for many items and when you arrive you find very little is not astronomically priced. If 5 star means let us milk the poor unsuspecting rich of every Euro we can than the Cavalieri was 5 star. In order to use the facilities you had to fork over money at every turn, 31 Euros to use the inside pool, 31 Euros a day for the spa, 12 Euros for each use of a lounge chair by the outside pool. The electricity was sporadice at best, and only half the ice machines worked. La Pergola was ridiculously priced for the quality. You could walk just a few blocks away for better food, better view, better service at 1/10 the price! Having stayed at numerous Hiltons I would say this was the worst Hilton experience I have ever had! I would recommend that you stay at a hostel before I would recommend Cavalieri. I do not mind spending money when the product is worth it, Cavalieri needs to improve the product delivery!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we stayed the last week of july and had a wonderful time!! the rooms were very comfy, the beds exquisite(where do they get those big down pillows?). the breakfast in the morning was the best i,ve ever had and i've stayed in many 5 star hotels/breakfast. we would dream of the breakfast at noc. the only downside is they charge you for everything-when you use the pool outside they charge for towels/covers-and the chairs are for the people who pay for them. the concierge was extremely helpful-giving us a great tip on bus #110 for a city tour(only 13 euros), and can get on and off for the entire day. not much outside of the hotel for eating and very expensive at the hotel. we just would take the shuttle down into town and find a nice trattoria and cab it back. overall it was one of the best 6 days we ever spent in europe.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel...location..not great”
Reviews.Author: Frozenrose
Reviews.Content: Other than the location of this hotel it is fabulous! The rooms are beautiful and we had a Rome view which was stunning. Our room was not ready yet when we arrived, which we expected, and they were unable to upgrade us to the executive floor as they were fully booked but they provided us with a lovely breakfast the morning we arrived (without the room yet) and the next morning as well. The full breakfast buffet was simply outstanding. The food excellent, coffee fabulous and the orange juice was spectacular. Sitting on the patio enjoying breakfast on the first day of a long delayed honeymoon (12 years) was simply a superb way to begin our holiday. The only negative I would give it is the location. If the hotel was in the middle of the city I would most definately stay again. As such, the shuttle bus was often full and we ended up sharing a taxi into town with another fellow. We are walkers and prefer our hotels to be more central. The only time we took a taxi in Rome and did not walk was when we stayed here. Otherwise. Beautiful hotel, fabulous food. If you don't mind taxi's definately worth the stay. We stayed on points so that was even more of a bonus!

Reviews.Title: “The second best hotel of my life as a 5 star traveller”
Reviews.Author: ONEILLCHRIS
Reviews.Content: This hotel, especially the executive floor was the most sumptuous luxury hotel I have ever stayed at. The rooms were huge and marble everywhere, the view was worth the price alone. The staff in the exec lobby was par excellence, If your on a budget stay away from luxury hotels, this is where I often see bad reviews, but if you have a champagne budget and are a luxury hound like we are you will love this hotel. The restaurant was also exceptional too. OK its not next to the vatican or the trevi fountain but they have a shuttle every 1/2 hour to piazza barberini and taxis in rome are dirt cheap it cost us 8E from the colloseum which was across town. When I die and go to heaven I hope its the cavalieri.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the Best!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There is no better hotel in Rome of which I know! You pay for it; but, you get it! All. Service, food, ambiance, courtesy (the staff do not behave like most hotel staff in Italy, they are truly giving their best), luxury, marble, cleanliness, comfort, etc., etc.. The views are absolutely beautiful, esp. overlooking the city. No more needs to be said; just stay there and you'll find out for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Did not have my Reservation!”
Reviews.Author: Jo.Green
Reviews.Content: I spent six months at least researching hotels in Rome, 4-5 star quality, it was for my first anniversary and partners 30th birthday - very special occassion. Finally I settle on the Hilton it looked perfect, reviews fantastic, and couldn't wait for the suprise for my partner. Arrived at hotel, stunning place, very excited, got to reception, got taken away from main check in, only to be told they had no room for us, the guests that were in our room, had extended their stay and would not leave the hotel. So we had no room. They said they had found an alternative, but imagine how disappointed I was and devasated at having spent all my time researching to be thrown away by the Hilton. What more can I say. I had even confirmed the booking to them twice! The day before travelling and a month before. It should not be allowed.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in the world !!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: russbrand
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for a long weekend at the start of July 2005. This is a excellent hotel, there are two levels for the hotel executive and normal, on the executive you get free food and booze, and normal where it is very very expensive 4 euros for a glass of water at the pool. £10 for a ice cream. How ever dont let that put you off, The restaurant on the roof has 2 michelin stars and was the best night of my life. You have to try it if you go ! However the chaps in charge of the sun beds, have let the power goto there head a bit, for example they reserve all the best beds for nobody in particular, I saw one of them throwing the drummer from Duran Duran on the day of live 8 out as he wasnt staying there. The rooms in the hotel again are on two levels one with a fantastic view of rome and one with a view of the little village behind the hotel, always go with the view rooms as they are excellent. Avoid the pool bar as very expensive. The shuttle into Rome is excellent they will drop you off anywhere you like on route. Overall excellent stay, I liked it that much im going back next week.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome in 1970, awsome in 2005”
Reviews.Author: Goblu
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Cavalieri Hilton with my parents when I was 11 years old in 1969, and it was one of the most memorable hotel experiences I had ever had (and I had, at the time, stayed at a lot of exceptional hotels around the world). Fast forward 35 years, to my 25th wedding anniversary trip, and I stayed there again, based on my fond memories. My wife and I were certainly not disappointed! The hotel has retained its top-of-the-line service and ambience, and has updated the decore and amenities of the hotel to 2005 5-star standards. From the moment we arrived, the friendly staff ensured our stay was memorable. We were upgraded to a "city" view (This is a "must" if you stay here...even if you have to pay extra) where each morning we were treated to the Roman sunrise overlooking St. Peters/Vatican City, with the Spanish Steps in the far distance. From the top of one of the hills surronding Rome, this is truly the most breathtaking view I have ever had from a hotel room. The spacious rooms were richly decorated, and had separate sleeping and sitting areas. The room actually reminded me of the rooms at the "Venetian" in Las Vegas, which may have taken some cues from the Cavalieri. A wonderfully comfortable bed, complete marble bath, and a roomy balcony made for an exceptional setting for our Anniversary (we stayed 4 nights). In the evenings a piano played in the pool patio bar below our room and keeping the patio door open to enjoy the sounds was enchanting (not so loud, though, that you couldn't shut most of the music out with the door closed, however). The grounds are a joy to walk around, and the pool is relaxing and refreshing. Be forewarned that the pool is "free" but the chairs/umbrellas have a fee. Also, the spa, which is very nice, is not "free" to Hilton Gold members, as it is in many locations. One of the special delights of the hotel was the free breakfast, courtesy of our Gold membership. Although we were not upgraded to the Executive Floor, as the hotel was sold out during our stay, the Hilton provided us with thier morning buffet. This was absolutely the best hotel breakfast buffet I have ever seen. It took us actually three days before we found all the different tables and "stations" with various foods. They have a selection of about 8 fresh juices, all made on-site, including home-made tomato juice. They have the obligitory "traditional" eggs/bacon/sausage/omlet bar. Then there is the meat/smoked fish/cheese bar, with no less than six different varieties of smoked fish every morning, including salmon, swordfish and tuna. Also a wide selection of fresh Italian cheeses, and the best Buffalo mozzerella I've ever had. If you like natural foods, they have a specific table with probably 30 "all-natural" items from cookies to breads. And their pastry table is--you guessed it--unbelievable (don't miss the apple strudle-like pastry with vanilla sauce!). For the work-out crowd, there is a smoothie bar, where you can blend your own shakes, complete with all the protien powders, and a bowl of egg whites. A desert bar is set up with a plethora of fresh fruit tortes, cakes and pies. Additionally, the desert bar also features home-made jams, jellies and preserves of every conceivable variety--I counted at least 40 jars. A piece of plain toast becomes an adventure whith these spreads. It is true that the hotel is out of the city proper, but the complimentary bus service is very reliable. Additionally, if you are in the city and need to get back after the service is ended, or don't feel like going back to the stop (Barbarini Square), a cab is about 10 Euros from most parts of the city. Barbarini is right on the subway line, so you can get to most places of interest fairly easily via the sub or walking from Barbarini. Additionally, one day I took the public bus from the square about 1/2 kilometer from the hotel, and this was cheap and easy...just ask the concierege for information/directions. Frankly, it was nice to come back to this hotel after a hot day of touring in the city, kind of like a cool retreat in the hills (actually about 2 km or so behind Vatican City). As alternatives to the very pricey hotel restaurants, there are at least tow nearby alternatives (which we tried): a nice pizzaria and a spendid Ristorante in the square down the street...these are where the locals eat so you get a nice "taste" of typical Roman eateries here, out of the hubub of the city down below. Of course, the main parts of the city are chock-full of great places to eat, too. If you really want to live it up at the Hilton (and in Rome), I would highly recommend dining one evening at La Pergola, the rooftop restaurant. The reviews in Zagat/Fodors etc. are not kidding when they say this is one of the best (if not the best) restaurant in Rome (throw away your stereotype thoughts of a hotel restaurant). La Pergola was truly the finest restaurant I have ever eaten at (and I do a lot of "expense account" eating at fine restaurants). Make sure you arrive early to have cocktails in the lounge or patio (a nice experience in itself). The personal service was exceptional--very attentive but not overbearing. The "extras" and "surprises" that are included make for a memorable experience. The food was the best, perfect to celebrate our anniversary. The chef, Heinz Beck, personally said goodbye to us and queried us on our meal. You will pay a lot for your this wonderful experience, but if you are looking for that one very special dining experience, I guarantee La Pergola will not disappoint. The hotel manager sent a personal note and gifts on our anniversary which was a nice surprise. Go to the Cavalieri...you will be amazed.

Reviews.Title: “Rome Cavalieri Hilton”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: exceptional rooms, service, food, ambience, spa, health center, staff, walking trail, tennis court .... a truly delightful experience. One we will enjoy again. The best and very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Even the air was delicious...wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: lmew
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights in this amazing hotel above the hot and crowded city- an absolute oasis! The most comfortable bed and an amazing view of Rome to wake up to. If you are staying here you MUST have a view of the city as the opposite side of the hotel faces a huge TV/telephone mast... I have to admit I know little of the costs as the Firm lifted the tab; however I never used the pool as it was €30 a dip- a little excessive I thought. All of the rooms have a balcony and the hotel is covered in the most fragrant flowers that fill the hotel with a wonderful sweet aroma. I loved this hotel...would honeymoon here.

Reviews.Title: “The Cavalieri Hilton - enhanced a great weekend in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The moment the car turned into the grounds of the hotel we knew we had made the right choice – our welcome was warm, friendly, and efficient. Our immediate impression was ‘this looks good’ and it was. Our deluxe rooms were beautifully prepared, cool and luxurious; each had a small sitting area as well as a balcony with table and chairs. The selection of pillows was a lovely touch as were the window shutters, which could make the room pitch black. If you don’t get a sound sleep here you won’t sleep anywhere. This hotel is not cheap but well worth the money. Try and get a deal with breakfast included, it is a must; sit on the pool terrace and savour the civilised calm before the storm that is sightseeing in Rome – a sheer delight. The hotel is located on a hill over 2 miles from the centre so the rooms overlooking the pool are the best, as you will have a view of the whole city. For us this location was a plus as we could return to an oasis of calm and relax on a settee under a parasol on the terrace. There is a free hotel shuttle bus and taxis are relatively cheap and plentiful. We booked the hotel car to pick us up at the airport but we need not have bothered as there were plenty of taxis around and they turned out to be reasonably priced – we paid E40 back to Ciampino in the rush hour including tip. Ok so nothing is that perfect; in the rooms we would like to have had an ironing table, tea and coffee and it would have been better if the shuttle bus had made a circular trip with several stops. But so what, for us the Cavalieri enhanced a great weekend in Rome. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “2 day stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 days, free with our Hilton points, we were quite shocked when we got to the hotel (prices) but ended up having the best time. We have stayed at some great hotels around the world, this is even better than Moon Palace Cancun, and that takes some beating. We will be going back as soon as we can. Everything was great, the staff, food, the pool area is very good, lots of different places to eat, but you need lots of money. Great free shuttle bus into Rome that runs every hour until 20.00 Taxi back was only €12.00

Reviews.Title: “Best Hilton there is...”
Reviews.Author: NeilofMarlow
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many Hilton hotels and some are truly dreadful (Leeds Garforth/Bristol to name but 2) But, this one is excellent. We have stayed twice now. Fantastic views of Rome, particulary from the Executive floors which we were lucky enough to get upgraded to. Rooms are brilliant. Well decorated and spotless with comfortable furniture and a fantastic huge bed. Staff freindly and helpful. Bar is a bit pricey - well so is the whole hotel, but worth it. Rome is such a fantastic city that we ate out every day, so this time we were not able to judge the hotel food. Could not afford the posh restaraunt with awards but I heard great stories about it. There is another restaraunt downstairs which we did use on a previous visit which was very good. Courtesy bus into the city is good, but does not run late. It is worth staying in the city late (eat in piaza narvona) and get a taxi back. Just great. Probably the best hotel I have stayed in and that includes the NY Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “A refreshing retreat from the city”
Reviews.Author: cattrav
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights in June. My favorite part was the constant scent of the millions of tiny white flowers blooming on every balcony of the hotel. The previous reviewers are correct about the expense of the hotel, and using the executive level supplement as a way to keep from feeling nickel and dimed (or should it be five and ten'd?) The club room at this hotel might not be for everyone, though - the wee little elegant snacks and the constantly hovering and helpful attendants might have you feeling like a show poodle after awhile. If you want to take care of your own creature comforts, walk out the front door of the hotel and go past the fountain to the street (Via Alberto Cadlolo). Turn right and walk about 300 yards to a sort of a town square, which abuts a main commercial street that winds up the mountain (I think both the square and the commercial street are called Medaglie d'Oro). There is a supermarket, produce stand, tobacco shop for stamps etc, restaurants, gelato stand, beauty shop, bakery, and on and on. Pretty much everything you would need. On the opposite side of the square there seemed to be a funfair area on the hill that little children might enjoy. Folks here seemed a little more glad and amused to talk to me then shopkeepers in Central Rome, who probably see a tourist with limited Italian about four times a minute. Also, the bus stop for the 907 bus that runs to the Cipro Metro station is on this main street, at the shop marked "libreria." It is true that this hotel is sort of distant from the "sights" (although the view of Rome from here is quite a sight in its own right) but it's not to hard to cross the distance. (I didn't try it, but the map says that this street also has the 991 and 999 to the Lepanto Metro stop, the 990 to Piazza Cavour, and the 913 to Imperatore) The bus you want going into Rome will be headed downhill. Coming back, there are about five stops that say "Medaglie d'Oro" but with the name of another street underneath. You are looking for the one that says "Medaglie d'Oro: Prisciano." To be honest, the 990 was crowded and was a long wait, but the hotel minibus wasn't running the first day we were there, because it was a holiday. The minibus also doesn't run after eight p.m. or for about three hours in the afternoon. There are also taxis that are waiting for customers on the street outside the hotel. The hotel minibus, called the navetta, is a big silver contraption that can seat at least 30 people. It has soft jazz music and wonderful air conditioning. It make a trip, about 20 minutes long, down the hill, through the neighborhood north of the Vatican, across the Tiber and through the Borghese park. Although technically it only makes two stops, one at the Via Veneto and the other at Piazza Barberini, I saw the very kind driver let one person out at a different stop (it was clear they had arranged it beforehand). From the Piazza Barberini, you can walk or take the Metro pretty much anywhere you want to go. The shuttle leaves the hotel promptly once every hour in the morning from 8:30 to 12:30 and in the afternoon from 2:30 to 7:30. The shuttle leaves Piazza Barberini once every hour in the morning from 9 a.m. to 1 p.m. and in the afternoon from 3 .m. to 8 p.m. At Piazza Barberini, the driver often waited a couple of extra minutes to make sure there were no stragglers. If you missed it, it would be perfectly easy to grab a drink or a snack at an outdoor cafe and wait for the next one. Also, a final word about the hotel pool. In hot weather, it alone would be reason to come to this hotel. It was deep. It was wide. It was cold. It was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing but can be pricey!”
Reviews.Author: ScottdaleATL
Reviews.Content: First of all, I'm a diamond member of HHonors and used points for this hotel. This is the only way we could have afforded it and I have to say this hotel has two different levels of service: Executive and other. If you pay for an executive suite or are a diamond member then you'll love this hotel: Free lounge with food and drink (alcohol too) from 7am to 11pm; Free Pool and Gym access; Free champagne and chocolates on arrival etc. If you're in the "other" category then prepare to get nickel and dimed! (10E for a coke, 18E for a non-alchololic mixer, 30E for the pool etc.) From what we experienced we had amazing service with hostesses who went out of their way to make you comfortable. Even the cleaning staff helped out tremendously - they saw us coming back from the pool and intercepted us to give us extra towels for the room! Many people have said that you need the Rome view, i somewhat disagree (although the Rome view *is* amazing) - we did not have the city view but we were the last room on the hallway so the TV tower was way off to the left and we had a nice view of Monte Mario - the small village behind the hotel. Again, if you're going to this hotel, do it right and get upgraded to the executive levels - it will completely change your experience of this place! Oh and finally - if you're coming from the airport take a taxi with a meter - it is only about E50 and if there's 2 or more of you in your party it's about the same as the train (E10 each) to Rome + taxi to the hotel (E20)... It will save you time and money!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on the last 2 nights on our honeymoon while in Italy and we were very impressed. Everything about this hotel was amazing and perfect. The staff was very courteous and helpful. This hotel was so nice that I didn't want to leave it and finish sightseeing Rome. We got upgraded to the Executive Floor and we really got the royal treatment. Marble bathroom, plush bathrobes, heated towel bars, private balcony overlooking Rome, king size bed with crisp white linens and tons of down pillows, seperate seating area and couch in our room, champagne upon checkin, candy goodies left for us everyday and not to mention the lounge. The lounge had snack food all day long and all you can drink wine, soda, beer, ect... The lounge even had servers getting you whatever you wanted. They really treated us nice and it was a perfect way to end our honeymoon in Rome. The pools, spa, and fitness center were extraordinary. The grounds of the hotel were immaculate and gorgeous. The hotel offered a free shuttle to Piazza de Barberini which is walking distance to many of the sights. The shuttle runs every hour and worked out perfectly. I would highly recommend this hotel and feel its worth every penny. (although the room service prices were outrageous)

Reviews.Title: “over priced”
Reviews.Author: sightseeing
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so expensive and so large and impersonal, the staff were rude and they even tried to charged us for pool towels. Instead my husband took towels from the room and they even came and questioned us on that. After a day of walking we came back with out kids to swim and they closed the pool. Such a disappointment. This was 2 years ago however, I just viewed earlier reviews and was so mad I had to write this review. The surronding area did not offer any great dining either. You can do better

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: AnnieChris
Reviews.Content: This was the most beautiful hotel I have ever stayed in! Just perfect. Service was also perfect. We stayed here our only night in Rome, when we flew in from the states, before heading to Tuscany. The room was so lovely, I hardly wanted to leave to see the city. The executive lounge was amazing...we had a small snack there for lunch that we delightful. The view from our room was breathtaking. The hotel recommended a little restaurant within walking distance that was inexpensive and casual, but one of the best meals we had in Italy! Our bill (with wine) was less than fifty dollars! We were exhausted, and for nightlife we stayed in and enjoyed a (complimentary) bottle of wine at one of the balcony tables in the executive lounge, while playing cards and enjoying the Rome night view - we could see most of the lit monuments! Oh - the bed was so comfortable...much better than all the heavenly beds I've slept in!!

Reviews.Title: “The Money is worth it for the great memories!”
Reviews.Author: katlewa
Reviews.Content: This was an incredible honeymoon stay! I am a diamond member, so we used points for our stay, but I would pay the money to stay here. It is such an incredible retreat after busy days in Rome, with service that cannot be topped. The exercise facility is incredible with a wide range of equipement, and the executive lounge is one of the finest I have been in with the friendliest staff. I would prefer if the shuttle ran a little later, however, it is a short cab ride back to the hotel if the shuttle was missed. Highly recommend a stay, we will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - at a price!”
Reviews.Author: Mackay8
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel where we could get really nice family accommodation with the kind of facilities that our kids would want eg a pool etc. This is an upmarket conference type hotel.Got a great value deal on two adjoining rooms on a B&B basis from Hilton. The hotel is located a bit out of town but taxis are cheap and a courtesy bus runs frequently so don't let that put you off. The rooms were beautiful!! Marble bathrooms, gorgeous decor, bed turning service etc. The hotel breakfast is truly spectacular!! - make sure you get a B&B basis as its 40 euros otherwise but it could be your main meal for the day - the restaurant has amazing views over the Vatican. On the downside - this place is so expensive we didn't even buy a coffee and I can't cope with 15 euros for a drink!! A rip off is a rip off in any currency. We ate in town or at local trattorias a few minutes away for next to nothing. You pay extra for a view ( worth doing) - but the biggest rip off is the SPA. It cost us 60euros just to take the kids for a swim. Excuse me??? If you like a luxury crash pad and can get a deal - go for it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Top notch”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights during the week following the Pope's death. Things were a little crazy due to the large number of people but the hotel was excellent and had very friendly staff. We were on a business trip so even though things were expensive (as mentioned in other reviews) it didn't really matter. I did not mind being away from the city center at all...very quiet and not a long taxi ride. Stayed on one of the executive floors so took advantage of the free food and drinks throughout the day. If you can manage it, its a great way to avoid the 10 Euro cokes, etc. in the hotel. Room was large and well appointed. The only thing I dislike about Italian hotels is that you can't get an iron in your room...something about a law. Due to the timing, actually got to see several noted media personalities in the reception area on the executive floor...Cokie Roberts, George Stephanopoulos, etc. Great hotel if you can manage it...

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful 4 day stay at the Cavalieri Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: fortwaynemom
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful stay at the Hilton Cavalieri. Yes, the hotel is a bit out of the way, but they do provide a shuttle service into town hourly. Its location on top of a hill allows for a magnificent view of the city. As we are Hilton Diamond members, we were upgraded to the executive floor. The Executive Club room was fantastic...a great breakfast spread (eggs, bacon, meats, cheese, cereals, yogurt with fruit, breads, etc.) snacks throughout the day and desserts at night. You can eat breakfast outside on the balcony overlooking the city....a great way to start the day. We had a beautiful, spacious room with a balcony. The bathrooms are lovely...marble and well-appointed. The bed was extremely comfortable. We were welcomed to our room with champagne as we were celebrating our 15th anniversary. The service was akin to that at a Ritz or Four Seasons in the US. The concierge was extremely helpful. The driver, Claudio, picked us up at the airport. He was prompt and very outgoing. We found it to be our little haven away from the hustle and bustle of the central city...very peaceful and quiet with a lovely pool and gardens. The workout room was one of the best that we've ever encountered in a hotel. We got to use it for free due to the diamond membership, I believe that there is a daily fee to use it, otherwise. Not to be overly gushing, on the negative side...it is very expensive as others have noted. There are not a lot of restaurants in the area, but the nicest restaurant in the city is on the top floor of the hotel if you are looking for a very expensive splurge. We did not because we packed lightly and didn't have appropriate dress for a restaurant like that. We will be staying there again the next time we are in Rome. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for about a week at this hotel. The prior reviews are very accurate. It is not in the center of Rome, but I also found this to be a plus. It was very serene and great to come back to such a luxurious place. The rooms are decorated lovely - ours was yellow and blue. The prices are very expensive (mini-bar Coke was 10 Euro or $13). The breakfast buffet was about $40 - but it was some spread - we really enjoyed it - try it at least once. Staff was friendly and helpful. But the very best thing about this hotel is their bed pillows! Wow! They give you about 6 pillows on the king-sized, very comfortable bed and they are wonderful. We slept great every night. Also, they treat their customers well. We checked out for a trip to Amalfi that didn't turn out too well. When we called to see if they had a room for us if we returned to Rome, they accommodated us (even though they were quite full and we didn't give any advance notice). Would I stay here again? Absolutely. The best of both worlds - like staying at a resort, with a 10 minute ride into Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Loved every minute”
Reviews.Author: Momee2Twins
Reviews.Content: Absolutely ADORED our time at the hotel. Wonderful service, fabulous view of the city, great room. Little pricey, but definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jesselodge
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 6 nights at this hotel by redeeming my hilton honor points. The hotel staff went out of their way to be helpful which was much appreciated. This hotel is truly a luxory hotel as can be seen by just walking all around the inside and outside. The gym & pool was very nice and the hotel has a nice view of the Vatican. My only complaint was that it was not really within walking distance of anything besides the Vatican (which is still a long walk). However, the hotel provides shuttles that run to downtown rome every hour which saves time and money. The room was very nice as we got upgraded. My wife and I would recommend this hotel to anyone as it is worth its advertised cost. Just remember it is not extremely close to anything so be prepared to take the shuttle for most of your site visits.

Reviews.Title: “A Hilton with a view”
Reviews.Author: Tendons
Reviews.Content: This appears to be a big conference hotel, and offers the same extremely professional service as every other Hilton - I found the staff a little offhand and impersonal on occasion though. Don't come here expecting your typical Roman hotel, it's a high-standard Hilton but with little character. Lots of nice touches, like a band playing soft jazz in the evening, which you can watch from your room (providing it's at the front of the hotel, overlooking the city). I'd spend the extra $20-30 to get a city view - the alternative is a massive tv/radio mast out the back which isn't particularly attractive. Try not to buy anything in the hotel, as the prices are seriously inflated. I wrote this on my comment card, and got a nice letter from the manager who felt this was appropriate for the type of hotel, and it's location. At least they're honest. You've got to go to the restaurant on the roof - 3 star Michelin and worth every penny. I had a great time in this hotel, and still think of the warm evenings, sitting on our balcony watching the sun set, drinking champagne to the sounds of the band. It's very romantic (or could that just be Rome in general?),.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and expensive!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, wow! marble bathrooms, great service, fantastic breakfast! Good restaurant. It is also very, very expensive and a bit far from the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wenluvstravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Cavalieri for my honeymoon (HHonors diamond member; used points). The area around the hotel was a bit scary but the hotel was beautiful. Our room was beautiful with a wonderful view of Rome. We stayed on the Executive floor - executive floor guest receive free drinks and food until 11 p.m. Yes, it is not located near the city center but the hotel offers a very prompt and reliable complimentary shuttle service. It's about a 10 minute ride to the city. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you're looking for a relaxing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculous amount of money for an average hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Cavalieri for three days on business, and I can't think of any other reason to get stuck in this place. The prices are outrageous, it is nowhere near Rome (although there is a courtesy bus to the city), and it has no personality at all. Why go to Italy and stay in some hideously sterile fake piece of America. It has a nice pool, but even though you pay a king's ransom to say there, you get charged extra to use the pool, or even to sit next to it. We moved out once the conference was over, and went the dei Borgognoni in the centre of Rome, which was lovely, and a fractionof the price of the Cavalieri.

Reviews.Title: “Unacceptable charges make any stay here very expensive”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location on a hill overlooking the Vatican, the service was excellent and the rooms were good. But - the mark up that this hotel charges on prices is unacceptable. For example, 15 euros (US12) for an ice cream by the pool. 100 euros (US120) for a meal at the Lebanese restaurant for two, which was little more than a mixed grill. The hotel also charges you to use their health club (indoor pool, whirpools, gym). In theory the outdoor pool is complimentary. Assuming you don't want to sit down or dry off that is! A 13 euro charge is made for a lounger and a 3 euro charge for a towel. The first hotel I have ever been in that does this, and an outrage. The michelin star rated restaurant, La Pergola, is as you might expect outstanding, but make sure you get a table outside if you eat here. If money is no object, then the Hilton Cavalieri is probably a great place to stay. Having said that if you really can afford to stay anywhere in Rome, you will probably end up staying somewhere else.
